text: Highlight of Singapore Airlines - Good flight and great service My Husband and I have always enjoyed Singapore Airlines good service. Airline crew are diligent and ready to assist. Clean and comfortable seats, inflight entertainment was of quality as well.
label: positive

text: Perfect Service Headphone on seat not working but staff did everthing to fix it + offered different seat and ask other guest to change so we could change together. Overall meals can be rated as good. Bit strange just socks and no amenity kit in prem. eco. but sleeping mask and ear butts been available on request (thanks to staff again). THis was needed due to 2 chinese ladys which had just to much red wine during flight
label: positive

text: Highly overrated and overpriced airline I recently flew Singapore. It is not my preferred airline but have to fly them sometimes. I have had four bad experiences in around 15 round trip business class flights in asia pacific over the past 3 years with them, which is roughly 1 in 4 flights. In flight service is getting worse and I think some of their flight attendants need to be grounded and sent to training again. Given they are ranked number 1, their custormer service too is so stuffed up with bloated egos and doesnt listen whether it be to do with poor inflight service, poor quality of food, some basic common sense or bags not being delivered. What they dont realise is that is how the best and the might fall. When one stops listening.
label: negative

text: Lackluster Premium Economy & Service Similar to the outbound flight from SIN to DUS, I found the seat to be quite dirty. On the outgoing flight, there were lots of breadcrumbs on the seat and I have to sweep it off with my bare hands. On the returning flight, there are chocolate ice cream stains on the seat belt. The A350 also seems like a a very narrow aircraft and every time when the stewardess push her trolley and enter the Premium Economy cabin from Economy Cabin, it almost certainly hit my seat (being seated in the last row, middle aisle of the cabin). Service, probably the worst I have experienced taking SIA flights. The stewardess serving my cabin/row seems almost uninterested and have a forceful smile on most occasion. She certainly doesn't seem like she wants to be on the flight and working. Another leading stewardess was also quite rude when I was asking for drinks while she was 'clearing', citing to me that she was clearing and in the end I told her, never mind, I will just walk back to get it myself. Do remember the galley is at the end of the plane and Premium Economy passengers literally have to walk all the way to use toilet, get things etc. as there are no galley and toilets in this A350 aircraft in the middle (excluding business class). Catering was also less than impressive. The portion was also very small, and served in disposable plastic ware. The menu selection are also very similar or almost identical to the several flights I have taken the past one year with SIA. The only difference for Premium Economy for this leg is you get a croissant instead of a roll, and Ben & Jerry ice cream. Unless you need to get off the plane real quick (but yet unable to afford business), or must really love croissant and Ben and Jerry ice cream, then I don't think Premium Economy is necessary. There are also more competitive Premium Economy out there with some airlines offering lounge access, amenity kit, glassware dining etc. I certainly do not see the value proposition and added comfort for this product on SIA and particularly on this route. I would still recommend SIA though, but just maybe not Premium Economy on this route.
label: neutral

text: Aswm Flight Experiecnce It was really awesome experience. Best economy class. As it was long flight really in flight services were good. I can say great experience due to great team.
label: positive

text: Average for me Check-in Service was good, In flight entertainment was really good, Air crew service was excellent, in flight meal was average. The only thing that was bad was, I bought 2 new luggage both costing over $300 NZD, and this was the first time i was using it and when we arrived at Singapore both of them was broken.
label: neutral

text: Service with a smile This was the first time we have flown business class and we were very happy with the flights and service on each plane we flew on
label: positive

text: The best, even in coach I first flew Singapore Airlines in 1994, Business Class, from Los Angeles to Hanoi. It never got any better than that. They now fly from Houston to Singapore, by way of Manchester, a flight I took on my way to Aberdeen but this time in Coach. The flight was great. The equipment in excellent condition, the service superb, even the food was good and a step above anything I've had in coach anywhere else. Very highly recomended!
label: positive

text: First time First time we used SA. Probably best airline I’ve ever used. Staff unbelievably helpful and friendly, especially with kids, wanting to know age and first names etc. Airbus (sorry but it’s the single storey wide body) was new and spotless. Food reasonable as it was principally aimed at final destination it filled a void. Good choice of in flight entertainment for such a long flight (12 hours). Attendants couldn’t do enough for you.
label: positive

text: My daughter and I flew Singapore Airlines on our trip to Khao Lak in Thailand. We decided to go for what we thought was a reputable airline so we could have an enjoyable journey. We booked early and selected our seats, as we both had mild anxiety and medical conditions which necessitated a seat near the bathrooms. On our return flight there was a delay with flights which resulted in missing our flight from Singapore to Melbourne. We were placed on the next available flight, which was about 3 hours later. There were about 60 people in the same situation I was told, so there was a lot of chaos in getting new boarding passes, etc. We had no say in the seats which we placed in and of course they ended up being in the middle seat of the middle aisle. My daughter was extremely stressed as she was placed between two elderly people with mobility issues, and was not easily able to access the bathroom. The flight was initially very hot until they eventually managed to adjust the air conditioning. We were entitled to have an evening meal, but the only food we received was a pizza slice and breakfast. We ended up paying for a service which we didn't receive. I did write to Singapore Airlines and received the usual spiel about caring about customers
label: negative

text: Excellent Smooth journey from start to finish. As a nervous passenger I felt quite at ease. Takeoff and Landing relaxation music and safety video are really nice touches to put nervous passengers at ease. Thanks Singapore will be sure to fly again with this company.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Impressed with the service by 3 lovely Japanese stewardess on flight sq11 on 11th Dec led by a Singaporean chief stewardess Evon. They were very alert and always service with a big bright smile. So courteous and polite. Could also pre amp what we would like, e.g. refills, blankets, cuppa tea etc. It's been a long while since I've been impressed by this airline and this trip made the difference. Keep up the good work SIA.
label: positive

text: Long flight down under I flew recently to Sydney from Manchester! It involves 2 flights, first into Singapore then from Singapore to Sydney! The aircraft was on time, clean which was Good. The staff however were wonderful, they were attentive throughout both flights, nothing was too much trouble, they were lovely!! Food was great much better than some airlines I have travelled !! The only negative I have and out of 4 flight(!2 there and 2 back) was on the flight from Manchester to Singapore the cabin was too cold, I had to ask stewardess if had some socks and the lady requested a second blanket, so I would advise to make sure you have socks in your bag if you are travelling barefoot, but to be fair this is tiny negative!! I would highly recommend SingaporeAirlines as they are amazing, only wished had more time in Singapore as departure lounge was amazing and so easy to transit onto next flight . I would of loved to of seen the city, next time for sure !!
label: positive

text: My 2 Delayed fights 9.30 hr and 1 hr . ไฟลต์สิงคโปร์-โรม delay 1 hr 29/04/2019 ในเครื่องมีเสียงหวีด แปลกๆ จนกังวลว่าเครื่องบินจะมีปัญหา there was strange sound in cabin , make me worry. Milano - singapore delayed 9.30 hr! (08/05/2019) เบาะนั่งปรับเอนไม่ได้ เรียกแอร์โฮสเตสมาดู ก็แก้ไม่ได้ แล้วก็หายไปเลย ต้องนั่งหลังตรง 12 ชม. จนถึงสิงคโปร์ can not lean the seat , cabin crew cannot resolve the problem , so had to sit in bad seat for 12 hours to singapore cabin crew บริการดีมาก ยกเว้นแก้ปัญหาเรื่องเบาะเอนไม่ได้ Good service อาหารดี Good food หนังมีแต่ค่าย DC ไม่มี Marvel
label: neutral

text: Suite class simply sweet! Flew to Singapore from Auckland on SQ286 recently. I was in Seat 3F which is a window seat. I wish to commend the inflight crew, Raffee and Grace for their warm and attentive service. The hardware was great (the flat bed of the Suite class is so much more comfortable than the Business class flat bed) but it’s SQ’s software that sets her apart from her competitors.
label: positive

text: New to long haul travel I am overweight and wide of backside. A UK size 20. So booked PE. Leg room was good and seat was just wide enough. The gadgets for tv and moving the chair were akward to get to. The staff were nice and attentive on both flights. The food was a mix of tasty (lamb curry was yummie) but starters yukkie and bread a bit blah. Drinks and snacks available. Toilets mainly clean but small. I sat in 31C near a door and it was very noisey. I did not realise planes could be so loud on inside. Had ear plugs and their earphones on but the engine noise kept me awake throughout the journey. I will need to buy my own earphones if I travel again. So my review is midpoint as I dont know much about flying. My fault I am a fatty but still felt cramped and paid well over £2000 for flight.
label: neutral

text: Perfect service and timely arrival and departure Brand new aircraft. Good leg space and also comfortable. Fresh and good toilets with all modern facilities. Crew was good. Only that I had to ask them several times for a head phone which goes over the ear. They did not give and I had to take my kid's one. They provided a small activity kit to my kid and he was happy with it. Beverages were served through out. Perfect service and timely arrival and departure. We got the middle seats hence could not get any views.
label: positive

text: Flight to Australia Comfortable roomy seating with very attentive air hostesses together with excellent selection of meals , altogether a very pleasant long haul flight .
label: positive

text: Mrs Rene Kleynhans My husband and I have been flying with Singapore Airlines numerous times. We find them reliable, reputable and the hostesses and Pilots are of great standards. We would highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: The good and bad of business Our plane was the A350-900, fairly new and comfortable seating, but a bit tight with the leg room when trying to sleep on a long haul I felt. The food choices were good, if a little sparse for business class, and the drink selection as per usual was very good. Found the entertainment choice not as good as it had been on other flights, must have been a quiet time at the box office. This leads me to the age old question of what to do on a flight which has young children on it, like ours did, and who are restless to the extreme with continuous crying causing a lack of sleep for everyone. No real answer to that problem is there, as we all paid the same money to be there, it just kind of spoilt the trip for us who are light sleepers. Headphones and alcohol only go halfway to solving the problem, and the staff seemed powerless. As we landed, both children slept the sleep of innocents!
label: neutral

text: Smooth and comfortable Two long flights 10 hours London to Singapore and then 13 onward to New Zealand. Whole flight experience was efficient, comfortable with good service throughout. Fair selection of movies, good entertainment system with noise cancelling headphones. Food and beverages also of z good standard.
label: positive

text: World's Longest Flight... but calmest experience My outbound to NYC was premium and return was business. It was comfortable both ways. My return on business definitely helped in reducing my 12 hour jetlag (which is worse when you come east). The SIngapore airlines service, was as always, immaculate. Always helpful, calm and smiling. Food was fine. There are only 2 full meal services for the 18 hour flight in business class which i think should be revised to 3. However there are various snacks and wraps option that you can ask for any time during your flight (and this is true for both classes). The cabin is very functional - nothing luxurious - but benefits from high ceilings (it really helps). Overall, i would definitely do it again rather than taking a stopover flight. At Newark, Singapore shares the lounge with Virgin. Whilst the quality of the lounge is great, i understand it would be extremely crowded on days of a full flight and timing clash.
label: positive

text: Really satisfied with the quality and service with Singapore Airlines. Flew from the UK to Australia, and there was no problems or issues on the way. Food and IFE was above par, and the cabin crew were helpful and friendly. Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Great overall experience with multi stop European flights Great airline. We flew Brisbane to Amsterdam and then from Munich to Brisbane with a stopover in Singapore. Food on all flights was generous in serving size and delicious (for airplane food). The planes themselves were a bit of a mix. Some more modern than others but they did the job and all had relatively comfortable seats in economy. Flights left on time from each destination. Entertainment options were varied and free wifi much appreciated with free Krisflyer membership. Overall very happy.
label: positive

text: Excellent service as always As always, excellent service throughout. Had 3 kids with me and we could select a kids meal for them which was very appetizing. Kids also had a free gift onboard which kept them occupied on top of the great selection of movies and games inflight!
label: positive

text: The Boy From Forres Absolutely 1st class service even in the Economy section of the plane, We flew London London - Singapore then onto Tokyo and the same on the way back. Food, Snacks, Drinks and Entertainment were superb and with proper cutlery. Staff on all flights were fantastic and couldn't do enough for you. We had a 5 hour stopover in Singapore on our way home and best Airport I have ever been in with loads to do. All in all Singapore airlines in my opinion would take some something special to beat them for service.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service and on time We flew economy from Perth to Singapore with short layover then to Amsterdam. Tgen ftom Milan to Singapore then Perth. Would recommend Singapore Airlines as seats were comfortable in economy. The meals on board were tasted fresh and staff were happy to attend to all requests for drinks.
label: positive

text: WHEN YOU ARE GOOD First time we flew on the Singapore airline was 42 years ago, and they were one of the best airlines then, better than Pan Am. We were on our Far East trip from Toronto. All the airlines that we flew on before and since cannot hold a candle to them. The staff knew how to treat the passengers, the food was excellent and it made the flight memorable. Glad to hear that they have not lost the touch. On the way back from Bangkok, there was a frightening news on the radio. A Canadian couple was being sort after by the Interpol/RCMP etc. for murdering tourists travelling the Far East, to get their cash, passports and belongings. The passangers
label: positive

text: Great airline. Good pricing for a full service airline. Great service, great plane, great pricing. We chose Singapore as we got excellent pricing for our flights from Brisbane to Istanbul with return flights booked from Amsterdam back to Brisbane. We weren't sure what to expect as when we started our travels, Covid 19 was just emerging. Check in was easy, very friendly service. I was particularly looking forward to experiencing the new A350's Singapore are servicing Brisbane with. I wasn't disappointed, what an excellent airplane. Due to Covid, the plane was very empty so we were able to have 2 rows of 3 seats to ourselves. We were able to spread out and have a great sleep on this leg. The staff on board are excellent and friendly. The seating was good, good room for a 175cm cm male. Food was excellent. The flight was smooth, no issues.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines? NEVER AGAIN We were excited at the prospect of flying Business Class. We departed LHR at 9.20AM and an hour later offered "Brunch". as we had breakfast in the lounge we were not ready for this "meal". About 12.30 we asked for some snacks etc and were informed there was no food available and we would get a meal an hour and a half out of Singapore. There was no drinks cart, no water unless we asked and no tea or coffee!!! this 13 hour flight with little drink or food, we were utterly disgusted.. For this we paid $6500 each. Never again. Be warned. The same scenario happened on the Singapore to Brisbane leg, however this trip not as long, but service or rather lack of was the same. So, best airline, i do not think so.!!!!! I need to add that upon return I asked for a refund of the difference between Business and Economy this refused and after much writing and eventually contacting the CEO we were given a cashcard each of $350. no way enough compensation after paying $12,700.
label: negative

text: . Seoul to Kochi via Singapore. My flight from Kochi to Singapore on SilkAir was very good with enough leg space and tv, food option was just satisfactory, but I appreciate the before flight food pack they gave. Singapore to Seoul was okay, almost on par with Kochi to Singapore but bigger flight (I found silk air have better leg space than Singapore airlines. But return was very disappointing. Seoul to Singapore things except food was on par, but cabin crew was rushing, they gave me less than 2 min to use wet wipes and was eager to collect it back even before I used. Singapore to India worst service, even before they start they were left with veg food and non veg food they asked me but I didn't get it, though my seat was in 1st 15 seats. Toilet just a pair of toilet at back and front toilet though free reserved for business class seats, they didn't let me use it as economy class passenger. There was no TV on return flight and used mobile app to view their movies, limited food option and lack of consistency in service makes me not go on this airline unless to a route that has Singapore as destination for good service and flights are generally scheduled for it Air Asia though less options has better food choices or at least 1-2 very good choices to buy. Advantages Flight Date change possible for very low fee, which I did. Luggage 30kg very useful. Very quick service Definitely gives 6-10 rating no comparison to other top airlines.
label: neutral

text: Excellent We went on holiday with Singapore Airlines and the service and air hostesses were excellent. I will always use this airline again. Very good experience.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines flight to start our holiday. So many positives for this airline. I was very happy with the flight crew service and friendless but the seating in the Boeing 777 ER was terrible. I’m 5’7” so not exceptionally tall but my knees were jammed up against the seat in front and when they reclined I couldn’t move or have my tray table down. I really understand the label “cattle class” my husband was next to a very large gentleman who’s size impinged on his seat space making his trip uncomfortably too Inflight entertainment was good charging port very welcome and food was good. Boarding at Melbourne and disembarking in Singapore was fast and efficient. Disembarking in Amsterdam was very slow and we had to descend down stairs and catch a bus to the terminal buildings. After being crammed into my seat it was hard on the knees. Difficult to give it a rating as so many positives overshadowed by a cramped cabin.
label: neutral

text: Perth to Singapore. Service from ground and cabin staff was outstanding, the aircraft was well presented. The seat configuration of 2x4x2 is better than 3x3x3 on their Boeing 777 fleet. In my opinion, Singapore Airlines is the best airline.
label: positive

text: SQ235 top notch comfort and food The flight home from Singapore was actually enjoyable! Seats were comfortable and easy to sleep in, entertainment and sound was fantastic. The food and service was also top notch. The only negative was that dinner service took such a long time (a large business section on the new A350-900) so I didn’t get as much sleep as I’d have liked to. I would definitely recommend.
label: positive

text: Return from Oz Having been away for 6 great weeks the trip home was going to be a bit flat so we decided to go Premium economy. As I am over 6 feet tall I was looking forward to the extra leg room but that turned out to be only one of the benefits. The seats were more comfortable and wider in a 2 4 2 format and had footrests, the food was very good and the service excellent. The ear phones and screens were also of a better standard.
label: positive

text: Excellent in every respect Every aspect of our flight was exceptional. The Flight Attendants were very polite and helpful. The food was good with variety of choices.. We would definitely choose to fly with Silkair and Singapore Airlines from Cairns to London. Paul & Jenny
label: positive

text: Premium Economy definitely worth it Although not perfect, it was pretty good. Boarding was slightly confusing, though on PE you do board early. There is a good amount of room and sleep is possible with the seat fully reclined, this doesn't affect too much the seat behind. We found the pre ordered food excellent in general with only one dish being slightly dry. The only disadvantage of the Book the Cook service is that you are served first without the bar service, but they will bring you a drink if you ask. Stewards and stewardesses mostly excellent, very responsive and friendly. Time passed relatively quickly and I would recommend to anyone.
label: positive

text: SQ A350 I find the economy seat is smaller than other airlines A350. I’m consider petite and I’m already don’t find comfortable sitting in such a confine space for 13hrs. I have such issue with other airlines A350 though.
label: negative

text: Flight was retimed 6 hours later but no explanation or apology during boarding We were shown a retimed message during online check in. And received email and sms notifications. It was mentioned “ operation issue”. When we took the flight. No announcement, apology or explanation regarding the change in departure timing. The flight took off as normal. When we landed. We received an online survey. Asking us to fill in how was the delay being handled by the airline- this was a big joke! Can the airline please align with the back operations ? Needless to say. I rated the survey questions with low scores.
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines are fantastic We had a great flight all the way. From checking until arrival we could not have asked for better service highly recommend
label: positive

text: Dubai to Ho Chi Minh - Finest in Economy travel I am usually an Emirates flyer, being based out of Dubai its the best option; but on my first trip to Ho Chi Minh i was looking forward to travelling in Singapore Airlines. The hype has always been about the superior premium offerings from the airlines. But the service and experience of flying in Singapore airlines economy was brilliant. Loved every bit of it, from the service to the food, to the inflight meals and inflight entertainment; it was worth it. The stop over at Singapore is great as well, would be even better if they could go easy on the stop over visa charges. But overall its one of the best in economy travel.
label: positive

text: Overall Service is good Overall service is good but the food is not nice. For food,other airlines will be better. SIA is not really attentive for luggage check in. Luggage spoil but able to claim insurance. Do try Singapore sling~~
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Amsterdam via Singapore. Legroom is comparable with other good economy class airlines, but they are wider which makes a difference. They are comfortable, everything works - meals, drink service, food service, punctuality. Singapore Airlines can make a reasonably good economy experience by being friendly, attentive and active when serving customers. Even the food was good for economy, while maintaining simplicity. It was 24 hours from Melbourne to Amsterdam and I don't feel tired or washed out on arrival - had a good sleep on both legs. It's worth that little extra expense and Singapore Airport is the best to kill time in. The business class looked fabulous, but their premium economy didn't seem that impressive as I walked past it.
label: positive

text: Business class is so very good Our first time in Business with SA and most enjoyable. In all we made 4 flights "Up front" with Singapore and standards were maintained in all of them - great seats and superb professional service from Cabin crew. There people are so friendly, pleasant and efficient it really is a pleasure to be one of their customers. No-one seems hurried but everything gets done in time. Trouble is we'll want to fly this way every time in future.
label: positive

text: Just a short 2 hour flight. Food was excellent - had the Pre-Order Butter Chicken. Staff were efficient. Comfy seat but no time to relax back and enjoy. No issues and would fly again.
label: positive

text: the worst customer service ever I booked a round-trip flight from LAX to Cebu for April 7, 2022, and paid for the flight, but all the information they have requested then few days later they send me an email saying my booking is not complete and I have to call their local office and that where the nightmare begins. I called their local number many times and get immediate the recorded message that the waiting time was more than 1 hour then they asked for a pin number which I have no clue what they are talking about. In any case, I tried many times and waited on the phone for hours and no agent answered. I sent them many emails and I got the automatic acknowledgment they received my email, but no one answered my email. Singapore airline looks like a ghost, they never answer any phone or email, if you do not believe just try to call the phone number listed on their website and see if you ever get to talk to anybody there.
label: negative

text: From Frankfurt Germany to JFK. A380 had a great flight was 30 mins late but the flight experience was great. Seats were comfortable and inflight service was good. I would recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Stellar Singapore Airlines (a great way to fly) After experiencing Singapore Airlines' stellar standard of service, one would be hard pressed to travel with other airlines. Their various industry awards and accolades annually, indeed attest that Singapore Airlines is a great way to fly. From purchasing airtickets on their App, up until our timely arrival back to Singapore, the entire journey was seamless and smooth. From Singapore Changi Airport, we had departed on time. Check-in via their App or on-line, was a breeze. We enjoyed impeccable, attentive and efficient service from their staff. During the 14 hours flight to London (13 hours back to Singappre), we were served 2 hot meals, snacks, and they constantly plied us with beverages to stay hydrated throughout our flight. We also enjoyed hot towels, twice. We had a choice of 2 to 3 different meals, each time. Screen size is ample with a dizzying selection of movies, TV and music. We have adequate space and comfortable seats, even in economy class. Despite congestion at Heathrow Airport, we still arrived home to Singapore as per the original scheduled time. Try to book their airtickets well in advance, to enjoy best or promotional fares.
label: positive

text: 1st time flying with Premium Economy on a very short trip The seat was comfortable, decent leg space for a 163cm height female. Though the trip was short, I've enjoyed the seat.
label: positive

text: Long Way Home I like Singapore Airlines but found this flight a bit hard going. The screen did not work properly in my seat - sound in one ear only and no flight path detail. The safety message was long, flat and boring and it was hard to sleep on the seats. But that's flying - you endure it rather than enjoy it.
label: neutral

text: A great way to fly fabulous and attentive service from the Cabin crew lead by Khairul Imran with Marcus Yang,Ivy Chang and Tracy Tang Always a pleasure for my wife and I to fly SQ when coming back home after a long trip .The cabin crew was not only perfectly trained but also friendly and warm attentive to passenger needs Well done Singapore Airlines and keep it up
label: positive

text: Outdated Entertainment Screen The entertainment tv screen on Boeing flight SQ630 was truly dated & awful. No touch screen, outdated operations, limited movie choices etc etc. I’m surprised SIA has not upgraded this item. This must not allow to happen especially on a SIA flight. If possible do not opt to take this flight/plane.
label: negative

text: Would fly again Was a very short flight but was totally worth it. expensive but full service. this flight was operated with a widebody plane and was maybe 35% full so plenty of space.
label: positive

text: Incompetent check in staff I have been a regular customer of Singapore Airlines for decades and am disappointed to see how much their level of service/ competence has deteriorated during the pandemic. I booked a return flight from Toronto to Singapore from Air Canada (i.e. the marketing carrier). I do have a checked luggage allocation of 3 bags. As per SIAs own baggage policy, the first marketing carrier's baggage policy applies (see picture below). Despite me showing them a copy of their own airline's policy, they were adamant that their policy of 2 bags applies. I had to repack my bags at the airport, which is something I've never had to do in my life and a complete hassle. It is also something that I find embarrassing to do. It is really unfortunate that SIA no longer pays any attention to staff training and /or update their publically policies. I have many options when transiting on my frequent travels and will definitely think twice about travelling via Sinagpore in the future. This is not a fake review. My flight number is SQ600 departing at 8am Jan 20 2023.
label: negative

text: World's 2nd Best airline must be a Joke! If there was an option for no stars, I would select that. Singapore Airlines from Bangalore, India to Singapore which was set to depart at 0120 was delayed by ~3 hours. The flight reached Singapore at 1130. Due to this the connecting flight to Perth which was set to depart at 1200 was missed. Due to this I along with my partner had to stay in Singapore city overnight at our own expenses at a hotel. On arrival in Singapore, I inquired with Singapore Airlines Duty Manager on what our options were as our onward journey had been disrupted due to this delay of almost 3 hours to which I was offered no solution at all. In fact, my request was brushed aside by the duty manager based on the fact that I did not have a connecting flight booked with Singapore Airlines or Scoot and that this situation was "no longer Singapore Airlines Problem". I explained to the Duty Manager that a missed connection (either with Singapore Airlines group or any other carrier for that matter) put us in a position where we would incur costs associated with accommodation, meals, transport and loss of pay (in my case) to which the duty manager responded that those would have to be borne at my expense even though the delay was caused by a Singapore Airlines. As mentioned earlier, the general gist of the responses I received from the duty manager was that "this is not our problem". The treatment meted out to me by a duty manager was sub par to say the least and certainly was not expected from an airline which is considered to be among the best in the world. I even worte to them and they have conveniently told me that I need to check with my insurance company and that they aren't liable.
label: negative

text: Disappointed with refund process after Airline cancelled my Flight. Airline cancelled my Flight and promised to give me my refund Tru original mode of payment 2 months later called the call centre Told me I will be ready in my account after 1 week. 2 weeks later no signs of refund. called them again they said I have to wait 14 to 16 weeks... What's going on? Singapore Airline use to Be 5 Star service when it comes to this issues.
label: negative

text: The best airline from my point of view Been travelled thru different airlines just to have felt how each airline is. Finally I have the chance to try SQ (by luck) and I can say that the service is unbelievably beyond every other airlines. The flight attendants are attentive to every passengers' needs. The service has never stopped. Being offered many times for the delectables that my stomach was full when I landed in Singapore. I have requested for halal meals which taste great and enough portion. Ground staff handling has been helpful. I promise myself, next time, i would again travel with SQ for long flight. My advice is, please provide a bottle of water for every economy passengers, besides water is important for long flights, it also gives easiness for the crew. I am such a water drinker that the crew pushed me for having juice or any others (as part of their hospitality) but NOP, water is just enough!
label: positive

text: Very Good Service The boarding experience was a bit weird as they didn’t allow checkin before 3 hours. Maybe it’s a airport policy. The flight was good. Service level was good. No issues. They ensure your needs are taken care of nicely. But if you have asked for a special meal the quality is not that good and pretty much same every time and can be a bit boring for the frequent flier. The choice of movies and TV serials especially from Bollywood needs a serious upgrade.
label: positive

text: Reliable, honest and fab service As always, short, medium or log haul .. Singapore airlines does not deceive. Super service, amazing personnel, also in Econmy. no rushing, no running, no loud talking. Just available and reliable. Am booking SA as much as I can !
label: positive

text: Relaxed flight We flew quiet a bit but Singapore airlines were exceptionall. The most comfortable flight. 8 hours went very fast, l wished l stayed longer. Definitely my next flight will be with them again, btw l flew with them few times over the years and they keep getting better every time. Highly recommended
label: positive

text: Singapore to Jakarta on an A350-900 (9V-SMD). Flight left behind schedule. We waited for like 30+ minutes after scheduled departure time on ground in Singapore before push back to avoid getting trapped in air traffic congestion in Jakarta. Excellent communication from Flight Deck. Flight Attendants on this flight worked hard, providing lunch service with two drink runs on a full flight for such a short flight (1 hour 20 minutes). FAs were very cheerful and polite. I pre-ordered in-flight merchandise (aircraft models) and they brought it to me before the flight lands. Aircraft was a new A350, the cabin was bright and airy. and large windows adding to a sense of space. Entertainment using the latest touchscreen which is very easy and fun to use. Only gripe I had was one piece of our luggage was stranded in Singapore and didn't make it on our flight, but after checking with SQ baggage service person in Jakarta we were told that it will arrive on the next flight from Singapore 2.5 hours later. The issue with the delayed/misplaced bag happened most likely because we were connecting in Singapore an hour before this flight from our previous flight from Houston.
label: positive

text: The Suites & Private Room! Very impressive by Singapore Airlines service standards! Great food, great lounge access, great hospitality from The Private Room lounge to the wonderful 13 hours flight from Singapore to Paris on Suites. No words could describe till you experience the great way to fly. Keep it up Singapore Airlines ✈
label: positive

text: Amazing Experience One of the absolute best flights I have ever taken. We were rerouted onto Singapore Airlines business due to weather conditions at our original transfer airport. The staff were fantastic and super attentive. The food was phenomenal. One small gripe, the seat has a very small area for your feet and unless your a side sleeper, is difficult to use. But otherwise it is a great seat and a great airline and I fully understand why they are the best airline of 2023 according to Skytrax.
label: positive

text: Food remains bad and labs smell terrible There was a strong stench coming from the lavatory the moment I boarded the aircraft. The food did taste good. Vegetables were overcooked until they are yellowish and meats are too salty! Bread was cold. How did Cathay Pacific manage to serve such warm buns that are slightly crispy outside and moist inside? Can SIA offer the same?
label: neutral

text: Delightful Experience 18 December 2020 - SQ957 - Comfy seat and legroom - Great food and drink - Smooth check-in and baggage claim - Nice staffs
label: positive

text: Simply put, “Not the best”. I flew them from Singapore to Tokyo. First off, found the legroom to be very limited compared to some of my favourite airlines. The people in front of me, decided to recline and everything went downhill from there. I was absolutely amazed that the Japanese flight attendant told me “This plane is for everybody”, though she said nothing to the Japanese passengers who reclined, in front of me. The journey to Tokyo was very unpleasant because of this. The same flight attendant, then came back and then apologised. However, she said nothing to the passengers in front of me. I will never fly Singapore again, done. I can honestly say, their standards are dropping fast. You will not be getting my custom, ever, ever again. The more you research this topic, you’ll see people are having similar experiences.
label: negative

text: Amazing airline It wasn’t the first time I travelled with this airline and it has never disappointed me. They are amazing in everything. Confort, service, attentive, nice meals (even in a less than 3h flight). Worth to pay more expensive price to travel with them!!
label: positive

text: Brisbane to London via Singapore. The attentive crew made flying long haul by economy into a lovely experience. From Brisbane, the B777-200er plane was a bit dated, noisy and the seats were comparatively hard. Some seats have IFE boxes taking up some foot space, and the entertainment selection is more limited than the newer planes (e.g. No full box sets). However the crew service with hot towels, amenities packs and attention to detail more than made up for it. The first leg was late departing Brisbane, but without even having to ask, the staff on the ground assured us by announcement that we would make up time en route and sure enough, we did, even arriving early into Changi. This was a relief for me as I only had a 50 minute connection time. The plane change at Changi was easy and seamless. The second leg was on the B77-300er. I found this plane less quiet than the A380 alternative on this leg, but still very comfortable. The ambient lighting and temperature were pleasant. The crew kept the cabin spotless, regularly removing rubbish and cleaning the toilets. They also kept a close eye on the cabin at night, regularly offering drinks and snacks to those awake without having to be asked. The gracious crew go the extra mile to make a long journey special. Having flown this journey with most carriers, I will be a loyal Singapore Airlines customer.
label: positive

text: Manila to Melbourne via Singapore with Singapore Airlines. Both legs of my flight were lovely. The staff were incredibly friendly, the flight only took off 10 mins late due to the late arrival of the plane but made up for time in the air and we arrived on time. Quick service, quite comfortable for economy, the food was great for flight food and would definitely recommend.
label: positive

text: Sets the standard I'm not crazy about the seat and its odd angle on the SQ A380 and B777 but, that aside, the service and the food are excellent. US and European airlines should outsource their staff training to SQ.
label: positive

text: Great service Singapore airlines as well as Changi Airport are the best I've experienced in years. Great service, entertainment and competence.
label: positive

text: Strange food I didnt pre order the food on the plane but then the food I got when I ordered in flight wasnt as good. First of the person I requested for food in the flight was rude and then got an awful food. The food from singapore to kolkata was good though. It was a similar experience for another traveller who travelled from australia that morn and met on the flight to kolkata from singapore.
label: negative

text: London to Singapore - Premium Economy Having flown on air New Zealand to London I was expecting a similar standard on the A380 operated by Singapore Airlines. However, while the lounge at Heathrow was good (fortunately I had gold status so managed to use that, no luck if you don't though) the aircraft was a bit tired. It didn't have any power at the seats, so no way of charging a laptop, just a USB outlet. We had the seats behind the bulkhead (71GBP each) but there was not a lot of legroom. Seats were pretty solid - not exactly comfortable. While the staff and the meals were good, it seems that PE is just a bit of an upgrade from Economy, rather than a downgrade from Business as seemed to be the case on Air New Zealand.
label: positive

text: A step backwards I am writing this review because we travelled on from Singapore on an aircraft which had the older Singapore Airlines's business class seats and what a difference they are from the new ones. Wide, comfortable, plenty of places to store items, a solid table and a wide area in which the stretch legs. The new seats are a step backwards as the seat was hard and uncomfortable, the table a folding affair, apart from a pocket near the legs which can't be accessed when the seat is in the lying position, there is nowhere to put items and the area to position legs is so narrow that it is only possible to lie on one side or on the back. The cabin crew, as always, were the very best but why change the seat design from one which was one of the best?
label: neutral

text: Singapore air on the decline I have used this carrier on several trips and three of the last four the flights the inflight entertainment was broken and food only average. I was offered a voucher for the entertainment stuff up, but on a seven hour flight with children, noise cancelling would have been a god send. The flight was also late with embarkment some what. Shambles They had the hide to offer us economy seats to move to watch movies when half of business was empty. After so many time of poor service I will choose another carrier from now on. I don’t know how they continue to rate so high with expectation. Tip. Don’t bother asking for upgrade it won’t happen.
label: negative

text: To the other side of the world. Polite courteous and on time. Food plentiful you for des and also could ask for snacks whenever. Ample leg room for the 26 hours flight to Nz with plane change in Singapore. We travelled on 5 different routes over 3 week period all without singapore airlines. Faultless.
label: positive

text: Smiley crew I’ve booked the tickets 2 months in advance and the price was almost halved compared to last minute (3 weeks before flight date) booking. Paid extra for seats selection: As the flight was only 2h and I was seated at the last few rows, I was served the meal among the last. There wasn’t much time before landing hence the crew tried to serve quickly and spilled some juice on my “table” without noticing. But it’s commendable that she had not forgotten to smile despite working under pressure and also a few passengers were asking for additional drinks and sauce while she was in a hurry to serve my row. Perhaps SQ could arrange to serve the meals from each section instead of what seemed like one cart serving from the first to last row. Anyway the inflight entertainment and meal were good.
label: positive

text: Best Airline experience personally Excellent airlines: comfortable seats, good leg space, good entertainment and aids, good choice of meals and drinks, friendly,attentive staff, overall enjoyed the whole flight journey, the best of International airlines to Asia, personally for someone travelling regularly home in different airlines, although more expensive
label: positive

text: Comfy Economy Class This was my first trip to Indonesia and the first flight that was longer than 5-6 hours so finding an airline that was within my budget and that appeared comfortable was a priority. The economy class section exceeded my expectations because I did not think it was going to be comfortable (blankets, pillows, and reclining seat) and have current in-flight entertainment. I was thankful for the drink options which included alcoholic beverages at no extra cost and sealed water cups. The coffee was strong and helped me get through the last hours of the flight. The food was average plane food with an attempt to provide a variety of meal and snack options. Every meal came with a newly, packaged set of silverware, which I appreciated. They do provide a menu so it helps to plan out your meals. I enjoyed the desserts and snacks most so I recommend packing more snacks and sandwiches if plane food is not your favorite. The flight staff was phenomenal and attentive to our needs. They had the same positive energy from departure to arrival-not sure how they do it! I enjoyed the hot towel service and the amenities (lotion, oral kits, mouth wash) in the restroom. Overall, it was a great flight and hope to ride on Singapore Airlines First Class one day!
label: positive

text: Really made a long haul flight tolerable. Had not flown with them before and haven't flown with them since so this review is based on my one experience to date.... ..and it was pretty good. Everything flowed along nicely - this was in the middle of a lot of COVID19 issues - and the staff were very professional and courteous. The flight went off without a hitch, the food was better than I'd expected (it had been some years since my last long haul flight) and I'd happily fly with these guys again.
label: positive

text: Love this airline Have flown a few times with this airline, never disappointed, from friendly efficient check in staff to the warm welcome onboard
label: positive

text: Service is good but the planes are old on this route. The service is impeccable. Flight attendants are courteous and efficient. But the plane is old. When will they renew the planes on this route I don't know but they should do as soon as possible. Because we expect the best from Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Best flight! This was the greatest flight I have every been on. The service is above and beyond amazing. The flight attendants are super friendly and offer warm towels at the beginning of the flight. It feels clean and roomy and I landed safe and on time. I can’t wait to fly this airline again!
label: positive

text: Not as expected and as advertised This flight is considered the longest flight, although, returning from New Jersey to Singapore is one hour longer due to head wind. I wanted to give a try.. and expect that the service of SQ should be improved vs the one that I took last year (Dec 2017), flying from Sin to JFK via Frankfurt taking A380 -same class. Flight took off just midnight, local time. I was expecting that taking this long haul flight, we are given option on either have some meal or all day dining style (means we could just request the meal - and would be prepared in about 30 mins time). Reason : being at the business class, where one paid more, and need to have a rest (midnight !!!), why airlines are having this "ODD" regulations on " asking / forcing " their business class passenger to eat???? I am very annoyed, crossed and disappointed with this kind of service.. by one of the renown airlines in the world. I am comparing this service with same class, Middle East origin airlines -Qatar and Emirates... very different. Also comparing with EVA air - also very different. I also notice that SQ flight attendants are not ready/ prepared for long distance flight (fatique??).. because level of service is REALLY fall short to the normal. For short and medium haul flight, SQ service is REALLY GOOD. This means flight up to 7 hours. Anything more than this (duration), level of service, as well as system arranged by airlines is BAD. One thing that improved vs last year.. at least there is a proper coffee served in business class (vs last year - only dirty water with coffee aroma )
label: neutral

text: Absolutely fabulous This airline is the best airline I have ever been on it is amazing I could not fault one thing the staff all are very friendly and cannot do enough for you. Singapore airlines is no match for other airlines it tops them all I love it in there flights and I always feel comfortable their thank you very very much I enjoyed your hospitality I look forward to flying with you again 😃😃😃😃
label: positive

text: Regressing I used to love flying on Singapore Airlines. The service, amenities, food were all superb when compared to other airlines. Not sure whether it is cost pressures but the situation is no longer as rosy as before. Advanced seat reservation now comes at a price; the headphones that used to be provided are now replaced with disposable earphones; the usual Straits Times copy that you could expect to read now have very few copies for distribution. The food used to always come with a menu that you can peruse as your flight took off. Now the menu is gone and the quality of the food has also deteriorated. The flight I took looked like it had a first class, business class, premium economy class and economy class. We had to board all the way from the front and go through the various aisles before we got to our section making for a slow and tedious boarding process. I think they're still better than other airlines but compared to before, SQ has regressed significantly.
label: neutral

text: Never feels like economy class Unlike the disaster I had a week earlier via Air Canada , I've test to experience a bad SIA flight .The staff always make you feel welcome and are extremely attentative to the passengers needs. I will continue to Support SIA and will always select them ahead of other airlines.
label: positive

text: Freezing We love this airline but some flight you are ignored ,the flight over Singapore Slings and smiles all round.__The trip back 11pm out of Singapore lights out and no love we were sitting in row 64 and experienced the coldest ever journey .my partner asked for an extra blanket 3 times and nothing came she put on extra clothing and tried to sleep but shivered all the way back to Adelaide. lucky for us back home it was 6C so we warmed up a little on arrival -disappointing service from a usually good airline,not happy Jan.
label: neutral

text: Worst Air Line This must be one of the worst Airlines out there. I would recommend any potential passengers to reconsider and consider alternative airlines
label: negative

text: A380 LHR to SIN ok seats less comfortable than original seating plan. Inflight entertainment faulty but viewable. Boeing 777-200 to Christchurch on tired and dated planes. Terrible seats and 17 inch. Return journey no inflight entertainment for >40 seats from take off. After 9 hours rebooted system as IFE had now gone down in business also. Poor that it was now clear the problem could have been solved sooner if they were at all bothered. Terrible customer service. Boeing 777-300 new touch screens but the plane noise is so loud almost impossible to hear the movies when sat just behind wing. No snacks offered during 13 hour flight. Not recommended.
label: negative

text: Very professional and well trained Whilst on this flight, I had a syncopal episode and luckily I had a fellow traveller with me who is an emergency nurse. The stewardesses were very quick to spring to action when this event took place. They were experienced and well trained. I think that Singapore Airlines are one of the best.
label: positive

text: Great Singapore airlines service? For years i have heard about the legendary service provided by singapore airlines. I have had several friends and family members use them over the years and everyone ravved about the service. I have to assume none of them ever had to deal with SA customer service. I woke up this morning to a message from SA that they rebooked me for a later flight. This later flight leaves SFO 12 hour later and increases my layover in singapore from 3 to 15 hours. This delays my arrival in the Maldives by 30 hours!!!! I understand avaition is fluid and there are many reasons they may have occurred. The upsetting part is that there are other options they could have booked me on. There is a flight that leaves SFO 4 hours later and a flight departing singapore that would give me a 5 hiur layover. Their website will not allow me to make any osrt of change despite what appears to be availability on both flighy options i would prefer. More importantly flight options that would put me in my desired destination 15 hours late rather than 30. With this i decided to call SA customer service. I have now been on hold for 4 hours. That is right 4 hours!!! Absolutely ridiculous in any case, let alone a company known for "great service". Especially painful when even my local cable company that practically embraces pior service provide their customers the option to opt out of the wait and receive a call back when operatora are available. This great company with a dedication to service doesn't have that option in 2022!!! C'mon Whike waiting i went to the SA website to fill out a flight change request form specifically for those needing to make a change for same day travel. After submitting the form I received an auto reply that says they will get back to me within 15 days!! And the laughs keep coming. That same auto reply says, for faster service please call customer service. So before stepping foot on their flight, i have already decided SA has zero commitment for service. It is great they have such high standards for the flight, but that means absolutely nothing if they cannot provide any service whatsoever prior to the flight. I will never waste my money on singapore airlines again. They can go to hell
label: negative

text: Best flight attendants ever Initial flight from Brisbane to Singapore was great. Food good, flight comfortable and on time. Flight attendants attentative. But return trip showed how wonderful the staff were. Fell ill in the middle of the night, and headed for the rear toilets. Collapsed on the floor and vomited. Not from their food I might add, as I had not eaten due to not feeling great. The staff were AMAZING. Took exceptional care of me. Could not thank them enough. And continued to check on me long after I had returned to my seat, and the next morning.
label: positive

text: Could not ask for better service. Went out of there way to help as my wife is in a wheelchair no matter what we asked for was no trouble. Even got chair as she could not walk to toilet. Thank you very mutch
label: positive

text: premium economy Entry into the Singapore business lounge, Heathrow, with gold elite status from a partner star alliance airline was like a gestapo exercise. Hardly a welcoming gesture. It is not our fault the membership status was not printed on the tickets by the Singapore system. Then upon producing the electronic form on my phone was not good enough, nor an out dated card, and not my wife's current ancillary gold elite card but finally found my current card. We were then able to proceed through. Felt as if we were freeloaders being caught in a honey trap! Service on board the planes was average and the entertainment system had to be rebooted three times.
label: positive

text: Travelled on 17th September with my wife and 17 month old London to Singapore. Really great staff looked after our daughter very well indeed. We paid for her own seat which we fitted her car seat into which was ideal. Food was good with a great choice. Really enjoyed flying Singapore and on the A380 was even better than I expected.
label: positive

text: Excellent flights Having flown with Singapore airline previously, the service hasn't dropped at all it's the best company we have used in all our travelling.
label: positive

text: Absolute bliss on such a long flight We travelled to Singapore then Los Angeles on our way to Canada and return journeys with this amazing airline! Despite such long flying time we were made extremely comfortable with exemplary service along with courteousness, wonderful smiles and genuine care! Much pleasure in recommending Singapore Airlines thank you to all.....
label: positive

text: Singapore Air isn't what their marketing wants you to believe I have wanted to travel on Singapore air for a number of years based on reviews online. I have traveled on most airlines worldwide in first class. I purchased a full fare first class ticket. It was a waste of money! The aircraft was very clean and the seat was comfortable. The amenties were cheap and I did not use them. They presented a menu but most items were not unavailable. I have never used the service call button while traveling in First for over 24 years. I used it three times on this flight which was 8 hours long. I chose the "order the cook" meal and the food was awful! There were two passengers that were drunk and extremely loud (I'm surprised they were allowed to board). The flight crew kept serving them vodka even though many of us asked if there could be something done to help with the extreme noise they were making. I do not believe I will ever travel on this airline agin.
label: negative

text: Very Good Airline Very nice carrier, god food wine,Beer and Very nice seat and nice staff and crew members,.....................overall very terrific Traveling to singapore Airline ............................ ........ .......
label: positive

text: Older planes showing their.age Very average service . The staff seemed to think they were doing you a favour by allowing us to fly with them. Not a lot else to say really .
label: neutral

text: PER-SIN-BOM. B777-200 on both legs. What can I say about Singapore Airlines? Impeccable service from the minute you board to the minute you get off the plane. Hot towels were served shortly after boarding followed by drinks and dinner. Very courteous and pleasant crew members. Dinner choices on the PER-SIN leg were limited to Pork Stew and Stir fried beef but they were not too bad. Breakfast was served on the SIN-BOM leg with a choice of Indian crepes or baked eggs with chicken sausage and baked beans. The aircraft's are showing signs of ageing though as some PTVs were not working and a couple of seats in the middle row seem to have had reclining problems. Overall a very pleasant experience and it's always a pleasure to fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Plenty of space and comfort on A380 to Singapore Very comfortable and spacious, not aware of any other passengers, attentive flight attendants, great inflight entertainment, food average, toilets average
label: positive

text: Hazzle free bording and nice flight experence I have traveled with Singapore Airlines with many times and at any of these trips , I have nothing to complain. Unlike of some other airlines, the check in and bording is well organised and hazzle free. The food is reasonable and ok. it is offering latest movies ,tailor made for the flight duration. The cabin crew is very professional and with fine gestures. I wish SA and hope they keep up their good works.
label: positive

text: Far from expected Very poor food, few drink options and not very friendly staff. No amenity kit and poor selection of entertainment. Good seats. Highly overrated!
label: negative

text: Worst Flight Ever nothing good to say about this airline at all. Got just about everything wring. Will never use again.
label: negative

text: Still worth the trip! I recently flew Singapore Airlines from Houston to Manchester England then on to Aberdeen Scotland and took advantage of the low fare. It was hundreds less than British and American Airlines. The flight was 3/4 full so was able to sit alone. Seats are comfortable and planes are clean. Food is ok if you enjoy Asian cuisine. This flight goes to Singapore so if you don’t like Asian cuisine, then bring your own food. The staff is not as friendly as other cross Atlantic airlines. I could be wrong but it is as if they don’t appreciate UK travelers. Manchester airport is over crowded during holiday season so give yourself enough time between your flights. If your UK flight is with FlyBe be forewarned if you have carryon luggage. They changed their policy so it is comical how they charge extra for those bags that typically can be carryons on other airlines. If prices increase, then I will not fly Singapore to UK!
label: neutral

text: Brisbane Travel Expo Spoke to Consultant on Singapore Airlines Stand at Brisbane Travel Expo who advised we could book brochure flights Brisbane - London departing Brisbane 18th June returning mid July @ Expo Special price. Have tried to contact Singapore airlines over the last two days to book flights, put on hold, transferred to other departments, then voicemail. Very disappointing it appears this Brisbane Travel Expo Special is incorrect.
label: negative

text: Abysmal customer service before we even got to fly We have been so let down by customer service at Singapore Air after buying business class tickets from the US to Vietnam that were fully changeable and refundable, so it was a pretty penny spent. Our flight originally was in February and due to COVID restrictions we had to change it to October, this part was ok. In July we discovered we could not travel in October and called 3 times to change the flight. The first 2 times after much discussion we were told they would have to have someone calculate the fare difference and call us back within 48 hrs (based on online pricing, the fare difference was only about $50/ticket). We never received a call back. Either time. Upon calling a third time in early August, all of the sudden they could calculate the fare difference and guess what, it was then $2500/ticket as tickets had increased in price since we first attempted to make the change. We found flights on Cathay Pacific and called to get a refund of our 10k in early August. There was some confusion as our credit card number had been stolen and thus changed in the interim, but we instructed them to still refund the money to the original number and our bank would manage it. 8 weeks later, no refund yet. Called a 5th time and we’re told they had not processed the refund despite our request because of the change in cc number. They are reportedly processing it now, but it “may” take another 6 weeks. They have had our money for almost a year now, 10 weeks since we requested it back, and I am so very disappointed in what I thought would be a great airline to fly. Everyone is struggling post pandemic, but it should not have been that difficult and sours us from ever attempting to fly them in the future for sure. Beware, their change/refund policies are not as easy as they make it sound.
label: negative

text: Singapore from Perth the Swiss which never used before Both airlines good but that is expected if pzying business class I would honestly have to say Emirates still comes first in my book
label: positive

text: Best airline Have flown with SQ both in economy and business class and at all times the experience was absolutely amazing. The service is wonderful and would really recommend SQ highly. Thank you SQ for wonderful memories
label: positive

text: Brilliant Service Whizz Air Booking in at Luton was pain free. The Whizz Air staff , pleasure to meet. Very efficient, polite and helpful. No major dramas . Whizz Air plane , clean , comfortable and prompt. Cabin staff are all very helpful and have flown with whizz on several occasions and highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Fabulous service After a hideous flight with code sharer Lufthansa it was so wonderful to have the quiet friendly service and comfortable flight with singapore. What a difference. These guys really get customer service right. Relaxed happy customers all asleep says it all.
label: positive

text: Not as good as last time. We have flown with Singapore Airlines a few times before and they were our airline of choice but I will try another airline next time. Economy class seems more cramped on the Airbus A380 and the meals were not as good either. Drinks were not offered as often and this includes water. I also had to pay for seat selection which I haven't had to do before.
label: neutral

text: We have been Silver Krisflyer members for 15 years at least and just flew Johannesburg to Singapore SQ479 26 Apr and Singapore to Brisbane SQ235 27 Apr and the disinterested and offhand manner of the staff was very noticeable. The females with one exception were unsmiling and almost snatched trays from us. During meal service flight attendants in the past always ensured the comfort of passenger dining by requesting the seats be upright but on these two flights I had to ask that this be done. Also there was a huge rush to get a stone cold awful breakfast served before landing in Brisbane - why? Then they missed the fact that a passenger in front still had his seat reclined for landing. We noticed similar problems on a return Europe flight last year.
label: positive

text: A great way ti fly Good cabin crew who were very attentive despite it being a long haul and full flight. Food was OK and entertainment varied and more than sufficient for the flight.
label: positive

text: Good Service & Decent Food Decent service and food from the staff. Exceptional note to the Leading Stewardess who greeted me by name (I am a PPS member) and checked occasionally on whether I needed anything. Saw the Chief Stewardess (red kebaya) offering other passengers whether they wanted to change seats as there were unoccupied seats with empty seats next to them. Food relative to other airlines, was good. Staff would bother to describe what food options you have even though they've given you the menu earlier. Compared to United or Delta who will ask you "chicken or beef" without any menu cards. Like they choose the food to eat themselves with no regard to what it's cooked with. Staff when backing down the aisle will always announced themselves to prevent bumping into the legs of passengers. Something unseen in most other airlines, especially American ones who basically can't be bothered. Staff would also help you put your luggage on the overhead compartments. Again, something American airlines would refuse to do, citing union regulations??!!
label: positive

text: Reliable airline with a modern fleet, some consistency issues. A decent airline with some room for improvement. I've had the opportunity to fly with Singapore Airlines a few times this year and each time I come away with different feelings. The consistency in service that you find on other airlines doesn't seem to exist with Singapore Airlines. Sometimes it's great, sometimes not so much. On this particular flight from Singapore to Dubai, boarding was late by about 40 minutes - not a huge deal but the lack of communication was frustrating. Boarding was relatively quick and the Airbus A350-900 is a fantastic aircraft to fly on. The seat was comfortable (economy) and there were nice amenities for use during the flight, such as a pillow, blanket and headphones. I opted to use my own noise cancelling head-phones connected to the In-Flight entertainment via a cable. As the aircraft pushed back, a flight attendant quite rudely told me "noise cancelling headphones aren't allowed!" Before I had the chance to ask why, she had already disappeared. When she passed again, I asked her about her prior instruction and she told me that I could not wear them during the safety video. At this time she realized that they were in-fact connected to the IFE and said that I could keep them on. The first meal-service didn't start until almost 3 hours into the flight! For those, like myself, who had connected through Singapore from a previous long-haul flight, it was frustrating having to wait this long as I wanted to maximize rest for the arrival into Dubai. The second meal-service was a slice of over-cooked pizza in a soggy cardboard box. Disappointing to say the least. All-in-all, Singapore is generally a reliable carrier with modern aircraft and nice cabins. Perhaps with some work on consistency would go along way. I'm booked to fly with them again in 2024 so it'll be interesting to see if there is some improvement here.
label: positive

text: Overpriced, scam airlines They are not picking up their phones we've been trying to reach them for 2 whole days now and even their baggage customer service is pretending to not hear you on the phone and hangs up. Same thing as their subsidiary Scoot airlines. Singapore airlines is a scam, overpriced airlines. To have peace of mind better book on Lufthansa or Qatar Airways.
label: negative

text: The joys of business class We recently had the privilege of being able to travel in business class from Bne to Singapore on our way to HK. WOW. We thought Singapores service in premium economy was wonderful. In BC I’m sure royalty wouldn’t be treated better. From the food, the drinks to the full recline beds the cabin crew were there too look after everything including guiding me to the loo in the middle of the night. It was tucked away a bit. 😉. Definitely will make an effort to spoil ourselves again soon.
label: positive

text: Wow! What an amazing experience! First 18 hour flight and I was nervous but SingaporeAir knocked it out of the park. Business Class is like your own little twin bed cubby. The chairs transforms into a bed and goes completely flat. Everything can be plugged in and charged. Unlimited videos and music. Food was fantastic, especially the ice cream!
label: positive

text: Very disappointing I have not flown with SIA for a few years now as they've been over priced and disappointing service and old aircraft's flying out of Brisbane, in this instance I had no choice as I had to get to Manchester asap, at Brisbane there was one Cafe open in the whole airport, no lounges because of lack of flights due to covid, we were given a $20 voucher! So the flight from Brisbane to Singapore has an updated aircraft which has a better seat configuration 1-2-1, no welcome drink, (no hot towels menus mags or duty free because of covid) food and service was OK on that flight and we had lounge access before boarding flight from Singapore to Manchester, no welcome drink, they still have those badly designed big seats on SQ51 (12 hour flight) food OK and was told 2 hours before landing they may not be able to serve breakfast but they did and so they should, so all in all pretty ordinary. But then return flights from Manchester to Brisbane were not good, check in was chaos due to all Dpd covid forms, no priorty lane for security, so SQ52 to singapore no lounge access at singapore lounge if you were travelling from Europe even though triple vaccd and neg pcr test, again no welcome drink, no drink after take off either this time, I ordered lamb loin, the meals came out economy style all on a tray, I had to send mine back as I couldn't cut it it was so tough, I complained and was told I would have to wait 20 minutes for another meal, chicken curry and rice which came out cold, at that stage I couldn't be bothered sending back, I could hear other passengers complaining, crew disappeared and if you wanted anything you had to call for service, I felt like a leper, breakfast was pleasant and hot, upon arrival to Singapore we were to go to a holding pen but our flight was late so we were escorted to the gate, sq236 to Brisbane breakfast was served, good job I ate it as no other meal was served on this 7.5 hour flight, crew disappeared quickly after breakfast and no drink service of any kind unless you asked for it and then you got a a bag of nuts or crisps, I think standards have really slipped and covid is being used as an excuse for some of it, I wouldn't fly with SIA unless I had to, I usually fly with Etihad who provide a much better service but unfortunately not currently flying direct from Brisbane
label: negative

text: Singapore to Los Angeles via Incheon. The aircraft was clean and the seats were noticeably narrower than the PE seat on the Singapore A380. Again I was disappointed by the minimal service by the cabin crew. I had looked forward to my flights on Singapore Airlines and found them to be lacking in attention to their passengers. I would fly Singapore again, but I would not go out of my way to do so as I did this time. I doubt that I would spend the extra money to move up to Premium Economy.
label: neutral

text: I had a disappointing experience with Singapore Airlines during my recent trip from Delhi to Denpasar via Singapore. Despite requesting special assistance well in advance, confirming it through emails and at check-in, no assistance was provided at Changi Airport during the transit period. The staff later claimed that my assistance request was only recorded for the final arrival at Delhi, not for the transit at Singapore, which is when it was needed.
label: negative

text: 新加坡航空新A380套房體驗 SQ861 新A380套房只有六個位置 用新航哩程10萬哩，換了單程HKG-SIN-JFK 其中HKG-SIN是新A380套房 而SIN-JFK是舊A380套房 空間：10/10 餐點：10/10 服務：11/10 Amenities: 9/10 Flying smooth: 10/10 Private Room: 9/10 I have to say it is 💯 of my flying experience.
label: positive

text: disappointed with singapore airlines. Food was deplorable. Reciprocity non existent at singapore lounge for virgin gold/ platinum members. Informed as on economy ticket no entrance to lounge. In phuket with local singapore airline also denied entry to lounge. Took forever to disembark aircraft in sydney. In flight movie selection was limited.
label: neutral

text: Wonderful - Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner Took the option to fly Business Class from Bali to Singapore on my way back from Indonesia. The Business Class was the best I have flown thus far in terms of space, comfort and service since they have commenced to use the new Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner. Singapore Airlines uses the Premier Lounge Ngurah Rai International Airport in Bali for the Business Class passengers. While the overall variety of the food in the lounge is not much, the quality of the food is excellent. As for the flight itself, the service of the crew was excellent on board. The only point of improvement if any is the inflight menu. I selected the option of the snapper and it was regualr airline food that you would expect on a flight. Other than that, it was a fabulous experience.
label: positive

text: First timer in business class...hopefully not a last timer There’s one airline everyone raves about and that’s Singapore Airlines. We had the privilege of travelling overseas in business class and what a beautiful experience it was. I pre booked our meals with ‘book the cook’, their choices of meals is overwhelming so be prepared to take some time to choose what you would like. The check in process is flawless and so easy. Kris lounge is exceptional and it was particularly nice to shower between flights so you can get onto the next flight feeling fresh. The flight attendants’ attention to detail is second to none, addressing you by your name and ensuring that you’ve had enough to eat and drink and then you just recline in your lay flat bed to get a few hours sleep. What a way to fly, I never want to sit in economy ever again.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines SIA I have flown on Singapore Airlines for over 20 years over 40 plus flights. It is the best service, and most comfortable flight you can have. There is a consistency of service which is unequalled in any other airline that I know of. I have flown on long haul mostly from the UK to Sydney and various places in Europe. I can see why it is legendary. I have never had a bad flight on Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: A comfortable way to fly to Singapore We flew to Singapore by an Airbus A380 for a cruise on the 'Voyager of the Seas'. Since the flight was not permitted to fly over Pakistan Airspace, the outbound flight took 13 hours and the inbound one 14 and a half hours. Check-in at Heathrow and boarding were trouble-free. Since our party consisted of three adults, we were allocated three seats together towards the centre of the aircraft. We had ample room, and the seats were quite comfortable. My wife and I had asked for 'seafood meals', and these were served first. Unfortunately we had finished our meals before the wine was brought round. The food was adequate, but by no means outstanding, with both the starter and the main course consisting of pasta with seafood. My son had a normal meal which had an ice cream sweet. I asked if my wife and I could have an ice cream too but was told by a member of the cabin staff that the seafood meal did not include an icecream. A few minutes later I asked another member of the cabin staff if we could have an ice cream, and she promptly brought us two. However, on the whole, we found the cabin staff extremely friendly and helpful. We found the entertainment system excellent and easy to use with a good selection of recent movies. When I went to the toilet, I noticed that the waste paper container was completely full, and my wife said that her toilet had run out of toilet paper, so standards have slipped. In our opinion, for a long flight, the A380 is preferable to other smaller aircraft.
label: positive

text: My first experience with Singapore Airlines was wonderful, and nice economy class seats. The cabin crew served customers with a smile. The food could be better, the chicken rice was tasteless but Singapore Airlines do offer ice-cream at the end of the meal.
label: positive

text: Very good, not perfect Good smooth boarding, good food, very clean. The only shortcoming are the beds. Compared to Turkish the are strange, you have to seep diagonally with not enough room for tall people like me. You expect much better on a 17 hour flight
label: positive
