text: Was actually taken in January 2018 Maybe I was exspecting more from Singapore airlines the flight was good the staff could have been more attentive not overly good with drinks. Food got the okay.
label: neutral

text: Great airline Took this flight as an emergency from Germany to New York and got a seat on the second floor extra legroom row. Customer service is amazing as flight attendants are very tentative. We received 2 meals, snacks and drinks throughout the whole flight which was about 7 hours.
label: positive

text: The best in economy...in every aspect! The aircraft was brand new...the best entertainment screen I have ever seen on any aircraft...high resolution monitor...like a mobile screen, it was touch sensitive...nicely organized seat with good quality food tray, seat pockets, power socket, USB port, etc.,
label: positive

text: New airplane. Great service My son doesn't like flying but he enjoyed the flight so much. The airplane is new, the seat design is nice and the entertainment system is perfect. The screen is big and we have a nice headset. The movies selection is great The food and service is great as always. Have been a great flight
label: positive

text: NO rebooking follow-up, uncontactible - lost our flight. Terrible service, NEVER again. Absolutely NO service provided. No real response, No rebooking, No refund. Hour long phone call wait times ONLY to the Singapore office. Followed website instructions to lodge change of date (which they say we were entitled to) My wife recieve an auto reply saying they would "contact us soon" (this is 7 days prior to departure). Up until, and after missed flight date no reply, ticket considered complete. Will never use them again, and will pass on the warning to everyone we know.
label: negative

text: A very safe flight This is the second time we have used this flight with the family. We really enjoyed our 10 hour flight which was on time on both occasions. Take off and Landing was very smooth. The crew members were very nice and friendly and the service was really good. The food and in-flight entertainment was awesome. We will definitely use this airline again.
label: positive

text: Still the best A very comfortable flight, excellent service and the food would rival some food I have had in business class on other airlines. Defintiley the best service and food in econmy on any airline.....and I have flown a few. Travelling as a couple, one preferring a window seat and the other needing an aisle seat after back surgery, one of us usually ends up in the middle seat. With the option to preselect our seats, I opted for a window and aisle. At Melbourne checkin it was suggested we change seats to a window and an aisleleaving thr middle seat in between free. Whilst the airline could not block nor guarantee that the middle seat would remain empty, we took the chance and it paid off. We were lucky that from Singapore to Rome, then Rome all the way back to Melbourne we had the middle seat to ourselves. Thankyou for the heads up Singapore Airline Melbourne checkin. Our selected flights also had only a 1.5 hour stopover in Singapore both ways, which made for a more streamlined journey. Would recommend Singapore airlines and will definitely be my airline of choice where possible.
label: positive

text: Flight experience par excellence Excellent journey all round. Comfortable, clean seats. Well presented, professional and helpful describes the air crew. Food was better than most airline meals. Drinks were complimentary and the choice of movies was up to date.
label: positive

text: An amazing long haul flight experience! This was one of the best flights I have taken in a very long time. The service, the care and the ambience of the flight were superb. My name was remembered throughout the flight by all members of staff, as well as when I was disembarking. The crew could not have done more to make the journey enjoyable and varied. The meals were served with professional skill, and the food was extremely well presented. Nothing was too much trouble. Although Everyone is aware of Singapore Airlines excellent reputation, this flight was exceptional in every way.
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Singapore. This sector was the second sector of my flight back from Vienna, the VIE-BKK sector being on Austrian Airlines. As a short 2-hour regional flight, SQ still lives up to its reputation of being a premium airline. Shortly after take-off, dinner service commenced with a choice of 2 main courses. Being a short flight, menu cards were not distributed to passengers. Instead, flight attendants showed passengers a menu card with photos of the main courses and descriptions of the meal. I had the chicken casserole with penne pasta. Drinks and coffee or tea were served at the same time. As it was a short flight, I did not watch any movies on the IFE. One difference that I noticed was that earphones distributed were of the in-ear type instead of the over-ear type typically used by SQ. Perhaps in a move to save costs, headphones in economy are no longer of the over-ear type? I can’t confirm this as it has been some years since I have flown SQ economy.
label: positive

text: Physician I was flying from LAX to Singapore on Business Class on flight DQ 037 on 24 May 2023. Did not see a service attendant for the first few hours. Then dinner was served . There was no menu for choices just was given a Tray. Never saw the attendant after that. I was woken up about 8 hours into a 18 hour flight to ask if I needed lunch. After that never saw an attendant . The bed space was small. Never given any toiletries which most Airlines offer All in all Singapore Airline was a disappointment to me. Will never fly it again
label: negative

text: Great airline I am slightly disabled and the service they gave me was caring and considerate. The cabin crew frequently checked to see if I needed anything and showed me where the toilet with facilities for disabled was located.
label: positive

text: Make sure you eat before you go!? Seated a third of the way down the aircraft. No meals left by the time the trolley got to us. Only "meal" available was French toast with compotte, read toast and jam!! Five hour plus flight. Aircraft dated and had to play with the headset connection to get sound. Have to say that the crew were excellent.
label: neutral

text: Superb as usual. Service of Singapore Airlines is superb as usual. Stewardess are helpful and polite. And always wearing the friendly smiles. Really makes you feel like home on board the airplane. Always recommended! Thanks SIA!
label: positive

text: Dreamliner Business Class Krisflyer Spontaneous Escapes in January offered redemption discount of 51%, so it was a great opportunity to redeem return business class at 18620 miles, so I selected both flights with B787-10, which were available without waitlisting. The SilverKris Lounge serves a good variety of hot food, alcohol incl Charles Heidsieck Champagne and TWG teas (12 selections). Inflight meal wasn't that impressive. I ordered Book the Cook, Seared Nut-Crusted Veal Fillet - the meat was quite dry and bland. The smoked duck appetizer was fine, and the dessert of passion fruit sponge-mousse was just ok. I expected a wider seat, but not the case for Dreamliner with 2018RJ seat type, compared to older versions like 2006 A380 or 2009 B777.
label: positive

text: Wow!!! So I'm thinking a few of the other airlines should check out Singapore Airlines Business Class experience to see how it should be done. Regardless of seating I believe SA always offers premium service - economy is very comfortable and the service great. Let me say, their Business Class is a whole different level. The food was outstanding, but it is the service that is really the stand out. From the crew setting my bed up, fluffing my pillow, then when its time to eat a cloth is laid on my table and properly set with glass wear and cutlery.........really..........the quality of food was sensational too - nothing missing here.........so nice. Looking forward to my return flight :)
label: positive

text: Distant, aloof, pushy and disinterested We used Singapore Airways for our recent trip to Australia and back and boy I wish we hadn't. I chose Singapore because of the consistent reviews and the fact it had the right non-stop flights for us. Sadly not one of our flights, we had 5 in total, came anywhere close to the reviews I've read on every level. Cabin staff were on the verge of rude and quiet often pushy and disinterested. I normally strike up a quick raport with the cabin crew as I find it useful on a long haul flight especially if you want to walk around and stretch a smile and a hello normally goes a long way but I must've stepped in something from the looks I received in return. As always when meals are served it's curtesy to put your seat upright, no problem, except I obviously didn't do it fast enough for their likely I was told, not asked, to "put your seat up" and then I had them attempt to force it upright, bearing in mind today's touchy attitude I'm not going to argue or cause a fuss, I got the distinct impression difficult passenger protocol was an easy option for them. The food itself was way below par across all our flights with overcooked chicken, soggy and gluggy pasta, undercooked potatoes and was generally poor throughout. As for the legroom and inflight entertainment smaller and tighter in all areas than others I've used for the same trip. Sorry Singapore I don't rate you at all, I'll be going back to Emirates, Etihad, Air Transact, BA (surprisingly) or anyone else for my next trip.
label: negative

text: best airline Love flying with Singapore `Airlines great service wonderful planes very friendly and helpful staff liked the inflight entertainment and and bet airport in the world
label: positive

text: They lost my bag for an 8 week trip, terrible customer service and no compensation I choose to fly with singapore airlines as their on board service is fantastic, but I felt like I was the first person ever to loose her suitcase, I had a stop over in singapore, I arrived my suitcase never did, to cut the very long story short it was awful customer service with no one taking responsibility to help me, false promises my suitcase was on the way waiting for its arrival and it never arrived, no financial support, no help what so ever, 14 different numbers I was told to phone and in the end I had to email reservations to get somone to help me and my complaints were falling on deaf ears. When I was leaving singapore to perth they couldn't even guarantee my seat as they over booked the flight and gave up my reserved seat even though it was on medical grounds. Into my forth week I finally got honest communication that my bag was no where to be found and the lies ended. However now my trip had ended they have a maximum amount that can be claimed so I am well out of pocket for something that wasn't my fault and only offered airmiles or a voucher that in no way at all makes up for the stress and financial loss they have caused me. So how they got the best airline beats me, it has to solely rely on the onboard staff. They have had my claim for around 5 weeks now and I am still waiting for the less the half to be paid out. Its completely appalling. I will never fly with singapore airlines again. They had many opportunities for good customer service and failed me big time. Maybe they treat all economy customers like this? They seem to concentrate on business and first class customers, so if you are one of those you will be ok!! As you can tell, I am very angry which everyone i talk to understands, but singapore airlines does not.
label: negative

text: Pleasant flight as expected of Singapore Airlines The crew seemed to be pretty young and inexperienced, but they did deliver pleasant service nonetheless. Food was good and overall flight experience was good.
label: positive

text: Loved my flight. Singapore really does take care of their passengers. This trip was the first time I have ever flown overseas and thus the first time to travel on Singapore Airlines. Hands down the best service I have ever had! Even on a 2 hour flight, they provided us with a full lunch and all the wine I wanted, let alone the 14 plus hour flight, of course, I didn't drink on the longer ones, didn't want to be dehydrated. But the flight attendants were so professional and so amazing. If I ever get the opportunity to fly overseas again, I will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Customer Service? Do they even have one??? Been trying to contact them for some changes but its like talking to air. They are worse than a budget airlines. I am not sure as to why they are highly rated. There is something so wrong to all the airlines ranking.
label: negative

text: Very good flight Effecient check-in and very friendly and accommodating flight crew. Surprisingly good food for an airline with metal cutlery rather than plastic knives and forks. Decent selection of films, music, on the in-flight entertainment system. Happy to fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Skip Business Class Singapore Airlines Beds -my torso was not in line with my legs so turning on side meant you were sleeping in a zigzag position and when on the other side you could not bend your knees. This is a design fault and needs to be corrected. This is not good for anybody who has any back issues. Loading -no flight call in lounge at Singapore that's okay but when arrival at gate on appointed time about 20 business passengers were left waiting whilst premium economy was loaded first and seats from 47 upwards economy were also loaded. All before business class. Smooth and early loading is one of the reasons I chose business class. Suggest Etihad airlines Thai airlines or even flatbed AirAsia.
label: negative

text: Great vegan experience We had an absolutely amazing trip with Singapore airlines. Both of us travelling requested vegan meals and the airline was so efficient in both their recognition of this dietary requirement and also the delivery. Within minutes of being on the flight one of the friendly team came round and placed a sticker on our seat, we were then offered meals in advance of other guests ( Advantage of having a vegan meal), the food was incredible quality, lots of vegetables and Nutritionally well-balanced, would definitely fly with Singapore again
label: positive

text: Great service and staff Our family of 4 greatly enjoyed our flight with a stopover in Singapore. The service and flight was so good, the crew were helpful and friendly and we all loved the food. It was delicious. The boys were given a kids game each and the inflight entertainment was great. We will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again. I also had to call customer service from Sri Lanka to book the flights I had found online, for some reason my card wouldn't work so the customer service call line was brilliant, the lady booked the seats and organised my payment. I have had this issue twice before with other airlines that were unable to help so I am very grateful for the service that Singapore Airlines provides.
label: positive

text: Safe, comfortable flight Took Singapore Airlines on our recent holiday to Seoul. It was a safe, pleasant and comfortable flight. Service was good and will definitely fly Singapore Airlines again where possible.
label: positive

text: Good service but could be sooo much better Great start to the day was checkin. Very well run checkin desks. Very well run kris flyer lounge. Flight I think was delayed by half an hour leaving and then another 20mins waiting in a queue. Service on board was good. New A380 configuration. What really let this flight down was the quality of food and selection. Very limited and very average in terms of eating. With the delays flight arrived late which led to a massive rush. No help or assistance with transfers for business class passengers. So Singapore airlines are letting themselves down here.
label: positive

text: Birthday trip The crew were very attentive and pleasant. It was a long flight, but there was a good selection of entertainment. The food was very good, although not all to my taste.
label: negative

text: Fantastic service Singapore Airlines could not have been more helpful. My husband was recovering from majorly back surgery and need wheelchair help whilst on the ground st every airport. The staff at Singapore and Silk Air Airlines were there to help all the time and made the entire trip seamless. The cabin staff couldn’t do enough for us.
label: positive

text: Frankfurt to Singapore on Singapore Airlines SQ325, 23 February 2023. 1st drink service served on trays with cups of water or juice & pack of mixed nuts instead of the drink trolley. 1hr+ into a 12hr flight, dinner was served. When it was my turn, I asked for a beer with my dinner but was told there was no more beer onboard explained staff. This flight felt a lot like Scoot.
label: negative

text: Excellent in every aspect. We have flown with Singapore Airlines for many years which in itself is an acknowledgement of their excellent service. On this recent trip we flew five legs with the airline and in all cases their service was exemplary. The cabins are always well maintained, especially the toilets where staff regularly ensure that they are clean and well stocked. We had an issue at one airport where we needed to ensure that our luggage was leaving on the same flight as ourselves; Singapore Airline staff were quickly onto the task of confirming this and once they received confirmation they sought me out even though I had committed to calling into the Departure counter to check. The other great advantage of flying with Singapore Airlines is that we land in Singapore and make use of a stopover for a few days to get ourselves back into the time zone after travelling to Europe. Going through Changi Airport is always a pleasure rather than a chore. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: Organized and comfortable We bought the extra legroom seats in economy and had such a comfortable flight. We almost upgraded to business but honestly, I'm so glad we didn't because it looked like we had more room with the extra legroom seats compared to the standard business class seats. The movies and music choices available were good and pretty updated. The food was good and flight staff was friendly and helpful. I think our transfer were very smooth.
label: positive

text: Comfortable seats, good service and good food! Not a matter to fly a long haul anymore when you fly with SQ. Had a very good sleep on plane with enough space and quite comfortable seat (I was in economy class only but the seat feels like sort of a premium economy of cathay's ones!) Booked the ticket fairly at HKD$5000, which is quite a good deal for 12+ hours flight. Flight attendance are friendly, and most importantly, meals have quite a good taste. Entertainment options are good with a decently big monitor too.
label: positive

text: Flight comfortable enough and entertainment satisfactory. Food ordinary but flight comfortable enough and entertainment satisfactory. Service nothing out of the ordinary except for check in at Singapore on return - excellent assistance.
label: neutral

text: Excellent Flight Cabin crew gave excellent service, meals very good, no plastic cutlery (stainless steel). We were looked after very well including concern and assistance owing to a disability.
label: positive

text: You are just a Great way to fly Excellent! Especially Ms Payal Maur. She was so patient with the elderly folks. Great Crew and great flight overall .
label: positive

text: Wonderful night flight If you have to travel at night and want to arrive refreshed travel Business with Singapore Airlines, it's worth the extra expense. Save up in advance to pay for Business class. My wife and I had comfortable beds and slept well all the way. We were woken in time for breakfast and our arrival in Manchester. We now don't travel long distance unless we can afford Business class. We have reduced our number of trips and save like mad to pay the premium. Don't think of business class as something you can't afford. Everything is possible with pre-planning and personal discipline. It makes flying such a joy.
label: positive

text: The ground crew were unreasonable and very rude. We were denied boarding as according to them we were 4 minutes late. The ground crew did a lousy job of offloading our luggage. We had to wait almost half a day in the baggage carousel before filling a missing bag report.
label: negative

text: MAN-SIN-SYD-SIN-MAN earlier this month was my first long-haul flights since before the pandemic. I’ve always loved Singapore Airlines, and I still do. Generally, a very friendly service, although I felt that the cabin crew on the MAN-SIN leg were a bit less so. I wondered if this might be due to travel fatigue after laying over from IAH on the fourth of four sectors. In-flight catering was my big issue with SQ on this trip. The flight time from MAN-SIN-MAN is longer due to the war in Ukraine and Russian airspace being closed - I reckon at least two hours more. I was a bit frustrated that the two meals were on opposite ends of that 14 hours. The lack of a printed menu (due to Covid - which I couldn’t understand as these have always been printed and distributed fresh anyway) meant that half way through the first 14 hours I actually paid for a bit of internet access, so I could see what refreshments were on offer (it was supposed to be free to do this, but I couldn’t work it out - although in hindsight, I should have just asked!). I was so hungry - the meals, refreshment and alcohol servings were just way too small. Entertainment is great, and the upgrade IFE since I last flew SQ a while back was nice. Seating in Economy is good (always nice to have three of four legs with a free seat next to me), although one the A380 the seat angle was very far back - some people like that, I didn’t. While not quite the uber luxurious SQ of days gone by, I still think they are a great airline. Just fix up the catering, especially.
label: positive

text: Flying Singapore airlines Everything was really good from seating to food, entertainment and great staff on board could not fault anything!
label: positive

text: 2019 UK Trip The staff at Singapore Airlines definitely know how to make a long flight as enjoyable as it can be. Right from Check-in through to disembarking at the destination airport. The cabin crew were very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Professional and well run company.
label: positive

text: Boeing 777-300ER Old Aircraft! In our recent trip to Tokyo, we were flying with Singapore Airlines again and it was an old Boeing 777-300 ER aircraft (I will discuss that shortly). While check-in was smooth in Changi Airport, the flight was delayed due to the "late arrival of the aircraft". It was delayed by 30mins. But somehow we managed to touch down in Haneda Airport just with a mere 5 mins delay, and the pilots did a great job. Both taking off and landing were perfect and so smooth and you won't actually feel anything. Kudos to the team! Next, the aircraft was old though it was supposed to be a retrofitted version. Seat was generally ok as we sat in the "forward section". The in-flight system was old, slow and kept hanging from time to time. Remote was also insensitive and the flight path display was "2D" and look dated. The contents were somehow quite limited too. As for the food, it was average but not hot when served. The crew were friendly, attentive and did a great job, walking around constantly to serve drinks and clear the used cups etc. Overall, the flight was satisfactory though can be better. Return flight: On our return flight to Singapore, it was an airbus A330-300, it was a better and newer aircraft as compared to the boeing 777. Seat and legroom were fine and inflight was better than the boeing 777 though can be better. The flight left on time from Haneda. And again the pilots did a marvelous job, smooth took off and landing and in fact arrived at Changi about 20mins ahead of schedule! As for the food, there was no choice as the more popular item "Japanese set" were all given out and many had to accept the other only option. I noticed some passengers didn't take but requested for instant noodles (either they didn't eat spicy food or pork). Food was average but the ice cream was yummy! Cabin crew was overall friendly and attentive and polite (especially the Japanese crew who kept apologizing and thanking to accept the only other set meal). But the leading stewardess was not too friendly and when we asked about the collection of our purchased item (we did the order online) when announcement that Krisshop was available, she seemed impatient somehow and responded "wait for my colleagues to finish their work first" and walked off. Perhaps she had a bad day or being frustrated with some other passengers? Hmm, is that the "right" or "political correct" answer? She could be more tactful and told us that her colleagues would follow up in a while after they had finished with whatever they were doing. But the crew who later brought us the item was friendly and smileful though. In both of these flights, there were "hits and misses" in the inflight system, seat, food and cabin crew service. But as for the pilots, they were doing a great job for these 2 flights and credit and compliments must be given to them! I hope SIA will seek to improve and not being complacent and taking their passengers for granted, and if not, they will soon be overtaken again by other leading airlines!
label: neutral

text: Bad customer during the covid Never recommend to use this airline, poor customer service, not helpful at all. Checked in the PHN, it the most painful experience, and I have been abandoned without any help. Even have to rebooked, called take more 2 hrs, extrage charge for new booking, everything has been the most difficult thing to deal with, and very unfair for passengers!! NOT CUSTOMER AT ALL! Think carefully before you booked SIN airline. IT will ruin the whole connecting flight. I missed the connected flights!
label: negative

text: Draught and cold Our flight out to Houston was great. The service and the food quality was very good but the return flight was nowhere near as pleasant. We were sat at the rear of the first economy section near the toilets and despite our requests the staff were unable to do anything about a cold draught. In fact the whole section was a bit cold with most people wrapped in their blankets
label: neutral

text: Usual Singapore Airlines top-consistency! As long-haul travel veterans of over 40 years, we've seen many airlines come and go, rise and fall. Singapore Airlines is one of the very rare international service providers that have always delivered consistent excellence of service year after year, decade after decade. It is truly admirable. The staff at Singapore Airlines are always attentive to your every need, and always make you feel welcome....even in the dead hours of the night many hours into those long sectors. We have flown both Business and Economy over the years, and we have found them to be consistent regardless of class.
label: positive

text: Thailand The seats were not comfortable and the food was not nice. We would not use this airline again. Totally dissatisfied
label: neutral

text: First time with Singapore Airlines. We have just returned from a trip to Singapore and Vietnam which we booked to fly with Singapore Airlines. We had heard good reports of the service provided and we weren't disappointed. Our return journey was via Paris Charles de Gaulle where we were met off the inbound flight at Terminal 1 by an airline representative who escorted us to Terminal 2E for our ongoing flight. We had not expected this but having completed the rather torturus transfer we were pleased that this had been arranged. We would certainly look to use Singapore Airlines in the future.
label: positive

text: Comfortable long distance flight. We flew from Australia, via Singapore airport, to Milan. Our flights were comfortable, the cabin was clean and the staff were helpful. Our only slight disappointment was the food- we didn't really like the options.
label: positive

text: Canberra to Singapore We really enjoyed premium economy. It was worth the extra money both for me with a bad back and for my tall husband. I loved being able to pre order our meals too. As always, the flight attendants were just beautiful.
label: positive

text: DO NOT TRANSIT VIA SINGAPORE OR USE SINGAPORE AIRLINES I booked a flight from Jakarta to Darwin, I knew I had a long transit in Singapore (over 10hours) I looked online after booking and saw that I could access the lounge and pay a fee to get more comfort in the terminal 3. Well... we never made it to Terminal 3. Singapore Airlines 'forgot' to mention that no passengers have access to the terminal while transiting but only a WAITING ROOM, I would have look at another option if I knew in advance, it wasn't mentioned anywhere (time of booking or confirmation) I am pregnant and I felt very uncomfortable during my transit, also it was very DIRTY in the waiting room, during the 10 hours I never saw any staff cleaning around, go figure during a pandemic .... I felt UNSAFE, not looked after, this experience put me off SINGAPORE AIRLINES and I already told few friends that are about to travel to avoid at all cost this company.. What a joke !
label: negative

text: Spent a lot of time in the back of the plane with flight attendents as it was a long flight. They were great... No matter what airline you fly to the far east, try to transit Chiang Airport in Singapore and allow yourself a long layover to explore Marina Bay and The Jewel at the airport itself. There are free tours from the airport but if they are full, hop on the train to Marina Bay. Easy access and travel.
label: positive

text: SQ192 in Economy. Gate area was roped off, with traffic going around. Don’t know why, cause as early as 0600 the Information said SQ192. Gate opened extremely late. Ticket quickly verified, and boarded. Was escorted to my seat. Crew warm, vibrant, energetic, and friendly. Short Taxi out, close to runway, and took off. Had a small meal, which was nice touch for a Regional Flight. Landed early in HAN, and I wished a Trainee Cabin Attendant best of luck on Qualifying. Debarking, There was no direction to the Luggage Carousel, no information on it, and no ground staff present. Once again SQ Needs to be training their ground staff, to get better.
label: positive

text: A first class airline. Comfortable seats, great service, good food, good entertainment system. One of the best international airlines.
label: positive

text: Niche service, great food! They had great lobster, Kyoto Kaiseki for food, and the are awesome. The service was very very attentive, both Krug (2004 special version) and Dom (2006) were served. The bed was great, and they had a turn down service after dinner. A upside about SQ first class was that they provide 100MB free WIFI onboard, and you can use them when you were in north pole. Another great thing about this flight was the LAX star alliance first lounge, they had great service, and the shrimp cocktail tasted good. But the downside is that the plane was parked in the outer port, so shuttle connection was needed, and I hated that since it was packed with people and luggage.
label: positive

text: Caring service Just arrived from Cape Town this morning. My Daughter had an upset tummy prior to the flight so we were careful with her food. The crew looked after her well and checked in frequently to see that she was ok. They made her clear noodles and bread, and some dry cereals and croissants at breakfast. Luckily she had a nice flight and her tummy was fine. We would just like to say thank you to the crew for their attentive service.
label: positive

text: cutting cost - ground crew below average I might be wrong but after observing the attitude of the cabin crew over couple of flights, I feel that the cabin crew feels too good to be humble to passengers from certain country and possibly speak the language even if most of them are the native speaker in that language. , ground crew at Singapore airline is equal to the low fare airline. The food is very good but one can tell that Singapore airline is cutting cost. Less flight attendants on flights, water ? well this is the first airline I see that does not have bottled water but serves you water out of the water tank on the plane. The quality of the water or at least the taste of it is not very good. Are you a gold member from star alliance ? you will get treated equally with other airlines with the exception of Singapore airline, clear differentiation between treating their own members first, including boarding, lounge etc. Unfortunately I have two fly with Singapore couple of more times and then I will try to avoid purchasing tickets from Singapore Airline.
label: neutral

text: Well done. Economy travel is rarely noteworthy, however when our connecting flight was delayed due to bad weather, it caused us to miss the next connection out of Singapore. Upon arrival the airline had already booked us on the next available flight and arranged for our overnight accommodation and meals at the Crowne Plaza Hotel at Changi airport. The efficiency and service from the airline for a delay which they technically had no control over, is to be applauded.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines We use them regularly for our flights from South Africa to China. Prices are competitive and the service is good. Layovers are also not that long. Airport in Singapore has lots to do if you are caught in a long layover.
label: positive

text: Horrible Very bad experience with connecting flight,after having boarding pass from Australia they left us on the airport because of the security was lazy to do their duty.they spoiled our surprise to attend my sister’s marriage and i hate that.I really never recommend the connecting flights with singhapore airlines.will never board this flight because of bad memories,i have to treasured that because of my sister’s wedding.every time i am thinking about that I really hate that.
label: negative

text: Seat location is important Singapore Airlines provide a really nice service but you will need to check where you are sitting before the flight. If you need to go to the toilet a lot, then an aisle seat is easier. Try not to sit right at the back as the seats don't seem to lay back enough and the attendants were out of some food items by the time we were served. Our flight to Singapore was great on a newer plane but the trip home was on an older plane that was not as spacious. We also found the overhead luggage compartments were full where we were sitting for the trip home and needed to place our carry on luggage down the aisle further which made getting off an issue to stop mid way down the aisle. For the trip over, we boarded in order of seating which was great but on the way back, they boarded everybody. (Could have been where the lack of storage came from). I expect that most of the passengers on the way back to Adelaide may have had more things such as gifts and souvenirs). Overall, the flight was OK.
label: positive

text: Very attentive and wonderful crew! We had a great experience with Singapore Airlines. With the exception of a delay on our return flight, which they handles as best they could, everyone and everything was handled professionally.
label: positive

text: Excellent - Parfait - The best A perfect flight. The service is wonderful, you have place for your legs. You can walk easily in the corridor. Food is very correct, water a lot during the flight or as you like, apple, cake ... all along the flight. I know now why they are number One. I agree completely with this situation. The best company.
label: positive

text: Appalling customer service. My flight was delayed by 5 hours, which meant I was left in the check-in area for 11 hours. No effort was made to make the delay comfortable. No offer of food or refreshment. Appalling customer service, made worse by the fact I was travelling business class.
label: negative

text: Non-stop flight to SFO This was a vacation for me and my wife and I choose this particular flight because of the departure and arrival timing. I set a countdown on my phone once the flight took off to ensure we knew when we needed to shutoff the inflight entertainment. This works really well and we felt rested and ready to explore SFO once we landed. The seats were pretty comfortable and the cabin service was great as expected from SQ. However, the seat adjustment was a problem for my wife as it was pretty stiff and this is probably because it was a new plane. The food selection was great but taste-wise, we felt it was underwhelming. On our return flight, we decided to try out the "Book the Cook" menu instead and we felt the meals tasted a lot better.
label: positive

text: Mr Very classy airline great staff and service items.food blankets etc as expected on a carrier with this reputation .price was less than a low cost carrier but with parking hotel costs for long layover was about the same just a better experience.
label: positive

text: substandard When I pay for business class, I expect at least a professional customer service. It was substandard. My analysis could be precise and very long with a list of many problems, but I will summarize it in one word: complacency. Singapore used to be one of the best. Not anymore. In fact, it was so bad, I am still considering if I should ask for compensation.
label: neutral

text: Canceled Trip Unfortunately our trip got canceled due to C 19. Singapore Airlines contacted us in a timely and offered re booking, credit or refund as options. Since we don't know when we'll travel that route again, we choose refund and got it with no hassle.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight on SQ608 Flight to Seoul is superb! Like the in-flight services provided by cabin crews. Very accommodating and friendly. The in-flight movies is great! Plenty of movies selections to choose from. It makes my entire flight enjoyable and relaxing. Thank you to the entire cabin crews on Flight SQ608 on 9 August 2019.👏👏👏
label: positive

text: Best Airline that I have flown. When flying I always try to fly with Singapore Airlines , as their Service, is Impeccable. At all times I try for the A380-800 as there is more leg room,the seats are comfortable, the food menu is outstanding and tge Fughr Attendants are polute, helpfull and very willing to oblige. I highly recommend Singapire Airlines for price and for service.
label: positive

text: No birthday cake on my birthday onboard SQ flight I was excited to fly out of Singapore on my birthday for the first time. I had heard of passengers given birthday surprises onboard the plane and I was anticipating if I will have one since I am flying SIA. Well, as in the title of my review...I received none, not even a birthday greeting from any crew onboard. Guess I think too much and too highly of myself (probably I am sitting in the economy class). Apart from the boo-boo, everything are nice and well thru out the flight both ways (departure and arrival). The new plane 787 was good, big screen for entertainment.
label: positive

text: Wonderful Staff We had that 4,5 hour flight from Singapore to Darwin, and were absolutely surprised about the incredible friendly and helpful staff. Was a pleasant flight
label: positive

text: Business as usual For a long and endured trip, need little legs room ? You can pay a little extra to sit by the exit door and Order your meal ahead ( without flying firstclass ) Not to mention the professional and the service From the counter to the fly attendants no tasks is to big ( just do it ) attitude! We are very impressed! The food on other hand , nothing to bring home about!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines experience is affected by cost cutting Singapore Airlines are always have been a great way to fly for me. But due to some cost-cutting, their service in Economy is now worse compared to Korean Air, Qatar Airways. Here my usual review of the strong and weak sides of SIA economy product experience PROS - New aircraft and fantastically maintained older aircrafts - Great economy blankets - Nice choice of drinks - Fantastic food on Singapore-Hong Kong service with ice cream - comfortable seats - nice selection of magazines on board CONS - worse possible economy headphones, Emirates, Korean, Qatar are miles away - very poor catering on Singapore-Brisbane-Singapore sector: meals are not tasty, no any desserts/candy/cookie coming with coffee/tea service - Staff is not consistent - I asked for a bottle of water for my pregnant wife, on BNE-SIN sector we were waiting for 40 minutes - Flight attendants are not supporting the cleanness of lavatories during the flight - No amenity kits in Business class - No places to have a nap in Singapore flagship business class lounge We have been disappointed with my wife as we have been expected a better flying experience on an 8.5 Hours flight
label: positive

text: 2018 Italy trip return The flight from Amsterdam to Singapore was great as boarded in early morning so a sort of all day flight. The meals were plentiful and very tasty. The staff were great. Only complaint is the person in front kept seat pushed back the entire trip.
label: positive

text: Despicable handling of ticket refunds/flight credits. Purchased ticket through Ctrip in early March for an April departure. Conditions then were: free changes to itinerary. Itinerary was subsequently re-ticketed on Mar 16 due to evolving situation. Departure postponed to May. Now they want to give neither a refund nor flight credits, available to customers who had booked prior to Mar 15, because my ticket was re-issued literally minutes after 0000 hrs, 16 March. I am told again and again to wait. As for what, I am not sure. In the meantime, the route has been canceled for the month of May and Ctrip has not contacted me about my itin.
label: negative

text: Best seat I have had and in flatbed mode slept well. Can make the bed a bit softer by asking for 2 covers. Service is very attentive, best I've experienced. TV selection and size of TV are very good. Food was very good though they failed to achieve the medium-rare aspect of my partner’s waygu beef. The selection of port and dessert wines (if you like sweet) is good. First class lounge in Sydney is more private than the business class lounge, but much smaller. Felt that the options for food and drinks were somewhat limited. Shower facilities are good. This was the best flight I have experienced.
label: positive

text: Clean, attentive, polite cabin crew with good bervage Warm towel was the best from SIA, never missed out, food was on time, drinks was all the time, whenever you asked, crews are ready for you, only downside is the seat. But I am happy to fly with SIA again.
label: positive

text: Travel to Bali Fantastic flight. Couldn't fault in any way. Looking forward to flight home (even though would like to stay longer).
label: positive

text: The only way to fly to NY to Frankfurt Flying Singapore between New York and Frankfurt offers first-class service at a competitive price. The A380 is impressively quiet and stable, even in turbulence. Singapore’s flight attendants are true professionals - impeccably dressed and always cheerful, courteous, and attentive. (Seriously. The plane could be doing a barrel role and they would still be offering hot towels with a smile.) Premium Economy is worth the small price increase, with larger seats and substantially more legroom. On my return flight to New York, the “brunch” menu was a little rich for 10 AM (pork belly and noodles was the most “neutral” item on offer), but the food is consistently above par. As a nervous flyer and a light sleeper on planes, I also appreciate the unlimited adult beverage service. I highly recommend this flight for those looking for direct service between New York and Germany.
label: positive

text: Excellent fight with Boeing 787-10 Singapore Airlines always perform excellent fight & service. For my latest trip, I flied with Boeing 787-10. It’s a pretty new model of their aircrafts. The Economy Class is very comfortable with the seats as 3-3-3 for each row. So it has more leg room (in front & under the seat) and also comfy bigger seat space. You can find everything on your front, e.g. Big touch screen nearly 12” which gives very bright & clear image, easy to control & select your favorite programs, USB Outlet, Headphone outlet, Coat hanging, Lighting control, Flight attendant calling, Food tray, etc. It’s very convenience. I love it! The flight attendants are very nice & polite with quick service. The food quality is good. And one more thing that I am very impressed is the new version of “In-Flight Safety VDO”. It’s very interesting and shows a lot of main attractions in Singapore which sync together with the safety instruction perfectly.
label: positive

text: Delhi to Sydney via Singapore. The first leg from Delhi was with Jet Airways (to be followed by the Sydney leg with Qantas). The Jet Airways flight was half an hour late and it was obviously decided before we landed that we would not be allowed to board the ongoing leg, as we were collected and ushered to get new boarding passes for a much later flight. We were then offered a flight only 3.5 hours later with Singapore Airlines and the staff at Singapore Airport completed all the documentation, including the transferring of our bags. But all our bags have gone missing and did not turn up in Sydney. I realise that they are still in "tracking" mode, however we are desperate to get them back before Christmas. We have tried all day calling Singapore Airlines, but they do not answer.
label: negative

text: Excellent Could not fault this airline. Service was great, cabin crew were friendly and helpful. We had to stop at Singapore to change aircraft and the couple of hours were spent very quickly because the airport is beautiful.
label: positive

text: A380 - Extra room and good service Flight from Singapore to Sydney was a much more comfortable flight in Premium Economy on the A380. Extra leg room was fantastic and the service was good. Additional premium economy service ‘Book the Cook’ was great as it allows you to select and book a menu item meal for your flight.
label: positive

text: Great in-flight entertain, good food, comfortable as a long haul flight can be Long flight as comfortable as can be on a flight. I ordered veg meal at point of booking but was not on the meal schedule, but this was quickly resolved without any fuss. Staff cant do enough. Its a tough gig!
label: positive

text: What a remarkable service and experience with SQ 391 in spite of the COVID-19 crisis Traveling on Singapore airlines is always a pleasant experience for me. But it is especially so during a COVID-19 crisis. First and foremost the cabin and toilets are extremely and impeccably clean . The toilets remain so throughout the long flight. The service was excellent and the stewards are all cheerful and helpful in spite of the risks they are undertaking by working during these treacherous times. If they are worried about the virus, they never show it and were all professional and indulging towards the passengers. My special compliments to Daniel and Pei Shan who take pains to accommodate the endless of my boss. They are always smiling and optimistic, eager to serve. What remarkable service and experience ! If you miss Asian food after staying in Europe for more than 3 weeks, the Asian food is very delightful. What a comfort and relief to fly home to Singapore via Singapore airlines during times like that. Thank God for His grace and mercies.
label: positive

text: London to Bali via Singapore. I flew to Australia with Singapore Airlines 5 years ago and the service was out of this world, amazing. I flew last October with them to Bali and back and it seems that standards have slipped. It seems there are a lot more male stewards on board now and they seem to give worse service than the female stewardesses. Male stewards seemed disorganised, flustered and abrupt compared to the female stewardesses who were very organised and polite. The airline needs to have standard procedures that staff follow. We had an issue with my partners meal being vegetarian nut free and Singapore Airlines were less than helpful. They served him nuts and or meat in a few of his meals, luckily he didn't eat them. When we told cabin crew that he was supposed to have been served a nut free vegetarian meal they said we never would have been promised such a thing because it didn't exist. When we showed proof of Singapore Airlines emails promising us a nut-free vegetarian meal the steward seemed disgruntled that we had proved we weren't lying about it all. A female stewardess found something my partner could eat. Pluses: Female members of staff = fab. Clean and comfy aircraft. Pretty decent snacks and entertainment. We didn't pay to be sat together and yet we still were on each leg of the journey. I'm giving it all a 7 because the journey was just about okay, it wasn't amazing like it was last time I flew with them
label: positive

text: Want Customer Service or Have Heavy Bags? run away NOW Flying into Singapore that is complex enough under covid without travel issues. I had 2 bags that were over 50 ponds and Singapore Airlines would not allow me to go over or add an extra bag. I was willing to pay any fee they asked but no. I couldn't go and buy another suitcase. Only 2 suitcases at 50 pounds. So I had to pay for a different flight on a different airline that day and change all my plans. Singapore Airlines then said that flight was non-refundable. I booked with Amex, thank god and got my money back. I was never able to actually speak with Customer Service only email over days.
label: negative

text: Melhor voo This flight was the best flight I have ever made. For a 12 hour flight, in this flight the time passes very fast. they have nice food, nice entreteinment,
label: positive

text: A380 Economy is great! Naturally I wasn't looking forward to the 12 or so hours in economy! I was very pleasantly surprised by the comfort and comparative spaciousness of the A380 Economy cabin. As usual the service from the Singapore Airlines cabin crew was exemplary, the meals offered good choices and were tasty and we arrived in Singapore on time which is a bit of a bonus departing from LHR.
label: positive

text: Maintaining the standards The airline has maintained their standards and the airline food served was surprisingly good. Wonder if it has to do with the fact that we were flying out from japan. Seats were comfortable and in-flight entertainment selection was great. Definitely one of my first choice airline when it comes to traveling.
label: positive

text: Best airline in the world There were problems with delays from MAN because of heavy snow. SQ were fantastic even though this was not their fault. Customer Service is the best I have ever experienced. The cabin crew were lovely and everyone at SQ airport which is beautiful and so clean. I make this trip every year, this airline is by far the top one without a doubt. Thank you
label: positive

text: 5 Flights Great airline, from the service to the free toothbrushes! Food was good, seats reasonable comfy for airplane seats. Good entertainment set up. Overall really good. We flew also from Singapore to Hanoi Vietnam. Good job Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: SQ - always reliable SQ has always been the best choice to fly if you can and of course if they fly that destination too. In this BOM-DPS-BOM there are many options but we choose SQ for their timing and frequency, which was good. However, the food was just average and not great, as per SQ standards. The SQ crew was polite and the connections were on time. The ground staff at DPS was courteous and gave us exit rows when requested (which was denied at BOM). Will recommend SQ if you get a good deal or at par with other competitor of similar category.
label: positive

text: Business class in the longest commercial flight: Purchased tickets in February. SQ counter at EWR, opened what I thought was rather late, considering the Pandemic. Previously at JFK, FRA their counters opened earlier. Check in quick, efficient, and no stress. Virgin Atlantic Lounge was nice, however No alcohol at that early in the morning. We boarded on time. Upon sitting was greeted, with my Surname, and welcomed aboard. My Rimowa case would not fit in any of the spaces, and had to be stowed overhead. Airborne and I had my lunch order taken. I had the Braised Shortribs. Constant, Infinite drink rounds during the flight, with my Surname used. Over Turkey, they served the second meal, I had the Thai Chicken, lots of flavor but seemed rather small. I sent some texts to friends and proceeded to get a few hours sleep. Landed in Changi on time, with a speedy stop in Immigration, and my case was one of the first 10 out. I Have been flying with Singapore Airlines since 2008, will definitely continue to fly with them.
label: positive

text: Top Quality From the moment you step aboard Singapore Airlines you are greeted with the most exquisitely groomed, stylishly coiffed, courteous air stewards. They smile genuinely and greet you warmly. When they move throughout the air craft they do so with grace and minimal disturbance. One day I hope to be flying first class but until then I will be happy with the service and professionalism in economy. Everyone deserves to feel comfortable on a long flight, this was a good experience.
label: positive

text: Dissapointing food and service What a shame, New Years Eve flying from Singapore to Brisbane.We have never had such awful food and mediocre service from Singapore Airlines - usually our favourite.
label: negative

text: Not all that! I’d never flown with Singapore Airlines before and I’d heard that they were one of the best airlines for long distance travel. Unfortunately I was left a little disappointed. Going out and flying back to UK, we were crammed in like Sardines. I’m not the biggest bloke but I struggle to sit comfortably at any time during the 13 hour flights. I also found that the food was pretty poor quality. The only saving grace is that the hostesses were attentive and when I asked for something, it usually arrived promptly and with a high degree of courtesy. In all, I don’t think that Singapore Airlines are all that they’re cracked up to be, unless you can afford first class or a suit.
label: neutral

text: Mr have only just safely arrived at Changi Airport from flight 479. I'm writing this to show my appreciation for absolute stellar service I have reveived from the cabin crew, especially Felicia Lim. Although my booking agency had forgotton to arrange for my vegetarian diet, the crew has gone above and beyond to spoil and accommodate me. Nevermind the warmth and hospitality. I started the flight as an economy class flyer but I left the plane having experienced a first class journey. Thank you Singapore Airlines especually flight crew 479.
label: positive

text: Best airline Their are in a class of their own. Professional Cordial..friendly and a "can do" Attitude of all staff. The on board food was excellent.
label: positive

text: Excellent Services It was not our first time flying with Singapore Airlines in Business Class. We always found the services given to my family and I were excellent. They were super friendly, attentive as well as informative. For instance, when our daughter suddenly felt unwell and vomited, they quickly approached us by giving wet towels, paper and plastic bags and also routinely checking on our daughter condition, making sure that she was feeling better. Besides that, my son - who loves about airplane - wanted to tour the cabin was also accommodated by the cabin crew and my son was very excited. Not only that, when we asked to one of the stewards who was part of that team whether we would be able to catch connecting flight to Surabaya - serviced by Silk Air - He assured us not to worry about that as his colleague at Changi Airport would assist the transferring process from Terminal 3 to Terminal 2 upon arrival at Changi Airport due to tight connection. Finally, we were able to make it since the Paris flight arrived ahead of time - approximately 1 hour 15 minutes. In conclusion, we were extremely pleased and satisfied with the services provided by the Cabin Crew who were on duty on our flight.
label: positive

text: Great for Long Haul Excellent service throughout. Check in was smooth and efficient. Initially checked in online and was allocated a mid seat. I was unable to change to an aisle seat. When I asked for this to be changed at Cairns bag drop, I was advised that it could only be done at Changi. When I arrived at Changi, I found their service desk and requested the change which was completed quickly and with a smile. Very comfortable seats with plenty of leg room as I was in a bulkhead aisle seat. Although seat had a leg rest my feet dangled in mid air due to no footrest and I’m 5’ 2”! Meals were very good for airline food and I was please to see there was lots of regular water/juice provision throughout flight. Entertainment provision was excellent, especially noise cancelling earphones. Lots of good choice from films to tv programmes and music. Crew were professional and polite and assisted me with putting up/retrieving my cabin bag from overhead lockers as, again, being short, I had difficulties with this. I would recommend this airline to anyone travelling in the Far East.
label: positive

text: Relaxing Trip I always love to travel by SQ and most of my trips I will take SQ as priority. For my return via SQ 877 from Taipei to Sin, the whole journey was smooth and good. No doubts to travel by SQ.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline Economy We traveled return to Barcelona. We traveled as a group of 10, we pre-selected our seat so that we were close together. Service was outstanding, nothing was a bother. Seats are as comfortable as any economy class, there were foot rests, blankets and pillows, they also issue ear pieces and a comfort pack, tooth brush, tooth paste and a pair of socks. Entertainment system was reliable with latest movies. Was a reasonable trip considering first leg 13hrs and second leg 8hrs.
label: positive

text: Adelaide - Singapore - Manila on May 23 in economy class. A very professional on-time performance by all crew. This was my first flight with this airline and I can understand why they have such a good reputation. The only comment is that the entertainment system was not as good as Emirates.
label: positive

text: 1st class service in economy I'd like to say a big thanks from myself and my mum for the excellent service that we received on our flight. The cabin crew were friendly and very attentive throughout the flight. The food quality on board was excellent. Drinks were frequently offered during the flight. A great selection of snacks were available in between the meal services. It was a pleasure for us to be travelling with Singapore Airlines. SQ977
label: positive

text: BEST AIRLINES AND BEST CREW IN THE WORLD Dear Singapore airlines team My name is ferdi I was travelling to Singapore from dubai on 12th august 2019 by Singapore airlines and here i would like to put a review for special crew that is serene tan, she treats me very well, very friendly, and she has good hospitality, she should get promote from the management, i was traveling around the world but this is my first time i use Singapore airlines well i just wanna say Singapore airlines is the best airlines and the best crew ever in the world. Once again thank you serene tan and all the crew see you next journey. Cheers Ferdi
label: positive

text: Singapore to Denpasar. In general, Singapore Airlines was good, however, their service seems to be going downhill. Dining experience was slow - the cabin crew on the other section of economy cabin even had finished their service completely while the cabin crew on my section had just finished halfway. Another thing was there was no consistency since the crew started from wrong direction. Usually they start their way form the front to the back but this time one section within the economy cabin started from the front and the other from the back. By the time they have reached my seat, they said there was no more choices so I had to take what was left. Furthermore, on the meal tray itself, my salad or appetiser food container had no cover. Since the crew on my section was so slow; therefore, they expected us to finish our meal so fast so they could clear up. I have traveled with them a lot and I have been in business class. I didn't compare it with business but this was the first time in my flight with them in economy that the service was slow, ran out of choices, no food cover, non-focused cabin crew, etc. I hope they can improve before it goes down to far and losing their loyal customers further
label: positive

text: Very didsappointing Our first time travelling Premium Economy as it was such a long flight. The seat was at the rear of Prem Econ, one row away from economy and tiny babies and toddlers. there were a lot of people using the same loos. The food was inedible. The inflight entertainment choice was not wonderful. The exercise video was useless and told you to do things you couldn't possibly do on an aircraft, like stick your leg out (both sides!) The next leg of our flight was by Air New Zealand. They were better than Sing Airlines by a long way because: Real glass and china Good food Better welcome and service Prem Econ was part of First class cabin. less people using the loos. There was an exercise video to do in your chair (20 mins or so) We felt special and we felt like we got something for the double air fare. We did not feel this either way with Air Singapore. I would not reccomend them.
label: negative

text: SFO ground staff really went out of their way Our flight from Las Vegas was delayed by a freak snow storm and we missed our connection to Singapore. The airline was able to rebook us for the following morning, thankfully Marilee the outstanding gate agent was able to get my wife and I seats together, and the entire cabin crew of SQ 31 made for a very pleasant First flight on the A350.
label: positive

text: best airline in the world. they are not only high tech maintaining latest trends/techniques for airlines, they beat anyone in terms of hospitality, care and positive behavior overall. this is so typical singapoean's nature...warmth with a big smile. that makes them different.
label: positive

text: Heathrow-Singapore-Sydney And Return The flight from Heathrow to Singapore, excellent other than having to ask for mask socks and toothbrush. Singapore to Syndey, this did not feel the same level of service less attentive staff. On the return journey Syney to Singapore again had to request items which felt a bit tiresome. Singapore to Heathrow felt uncomfortable at times when requesting anything including water, as we approached Europe the staff seemed unwilling to bring up the lights and serve breakfast when everyone was awake and hungry. Eventually breakfast was served and taken away so quickly before we landed people didn't really have the time to eat the breakfast. However in all flights check in staff were very helpful and so smiley. Although it seems by this review I was not happy, I would recommend them anytime.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service for Parents with Young Infants We we’re first time new parents to our young 11 month old baby and it was our first time flying with our child. The service was impeccable. It was such a pleasurable experience because of Customer Service and the ease of experience. Here are some pros: - Child friendly staff and super helpful. - Check in luggage of 10kg (Complimentary) - Stroller Check In ( Complimentary ) - Car Seat Check In (Complementary) - Free Basinet supplied in flight - Inclusive water hand carry for baby so it wasn’t weighed or discarded. Our trip was more smooth due to staff friendliness and always offering to help us.
label: positive

text: Best Airlines Singapore Airlines is the best airlines, Crew is very supportive and the quality of food & drinks is very good. Onboard entertainment content is also good. Will prefer Singapore airlines over any other airlines.
label: positive

text: Customer Service par excellence I very much enjoyed flying with Singapore, but the following put the icing on the cake for me. While flying to Manilla via Singapore I lost my wallet containing cash, cards and driving license. Having no idea how or where, I reported the fact to the crew who informed both my destination and arrival airports while still in the air. I arrived in Melbourne two days later and received a call from Singapore informing me the wallet had been located. They forwarded it to San Francisco, my next destination, and handed it to me personally. I was kept fully informed of progress and collection details on a daily basis. The wallet and contents were fully intact. Singapore and their agents went the extra mile and provided customer service beyond expectations.
label: positive

text: I was very surprised to read some of the comments in the review below. I travelled last week from Singapore to Melbourne on an A350-900 in business class, and it was one of my better flights this year. The seat product for a 7.5 hour flight was very comfortable with good privacy (6/1 tall), and the food and beverages that I was served were all to a good standard. Service was to the usual impeccable SIA standard, and the IFE choices were excellent. I accept that everyone's perceptions can be very different, but maybe sometimes there are some other issues at play when a review is written.
label: positive

text: No Support or phone number in most European countries Connecting flight from Prague delayed thus could not catch this flight - Singapore Air Service center could not be contacted as most numbers are automated. Arriving at Frankfurt airport next day told by Singapore Air nothing they could do as all flights fully booked and it was Lufthansa problem as they delayed flight but our booking from and return was with Singapore Air. Result 41 hours waiting at Air Ports with help from Lufthansa got on India Air Business to Deli after 13 wait Qantas to Melbourne but we missed our 3 days holiday in Singapore. Ruined what started out good holiday flight Melbourne Amsterdam OK
label: neutral

text: Reliable, clean and friendly Returning home during the pandemic after living in France for two years, this could have been a difficult journey. Instead, SIA made it pleasant and easy. They provided timely communication, efficient check-in, friendly service on-board, and excellent transit facilities (in Changi airport). I would highly recommend Singapore Airlines for international travel.
label: positive

text: Top Airline Over the years we have flown with many different airlines and always come back to flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Would fly with them again Overall the service was very good. The in flight meal was acceptable (better than average actually) and entertainment system was up to date though would have like a bit more Asian selection. Unfortunately on my return leg with newer 777ER, the control console was not working perfectly (some of the controller buttons were not working). But other than that, would gladly fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Inflight Review of Singapore Airlines The service as well as the food on Singapore airlines to and fro from Mumbai was awesome. Lot of cuisine to choose from. Seat were wide and comfortable. Utmost care was taken to keep the aircraft neat & clean. Flights took off on time and landed before time i most of the cases.
label: positive

text: Excellent service It was very good trip to use singapore airlines. Flight attendents were very kind and food was good. I want to use that airline again.
label: positive

text: International flight This particular trip was very stuffy, it was far too warm in the plane and triggered my claustrophobia so I was very uncomfortable, the next flight from Singapore to Brisbane was better
label: neutral

text: Attention to detail The check in had hiccups because our names were entered wrongly. But the person at the counter was patient and smiled throughout the check in! I was seated in the middle with a stranger on my left. Usually I don't bother about that but this lady kept asking me questions throughout the flight. Worse, I could not speak her language. I tried my best to help her and I believe the head stewardess (she was in green) saw my frustration (as I could not understand her), she stepped in to assist. Even though, she could not speak the language, she tried her best to make sure the lady was alright. Kudos to SQ and the staff! My family and I did not enjoy the food though. Halal does not necessarily mean Indian food. We can have Western meals too. :)
label: positive

text: Schoolies Trip As always wonderful service from the crew of Singapore Airways. We had a first time flyer with us and they checked in often to see how she was doing. Only downside was of course the asshat(s) who insist on dropping their chairs back in economy ( honestly pay business and stop annoying everyone) as soon as the plane levels out. Ended up with some bruising on tummy as the guy in front of me dropped his chair back while my tray was still down. Besides that amazing service.
label: positive

text: MEL-SIN-HKG and return flew out on 7 Sep 12.05 a.m. on a 777/300 - older plane but service good arr SIN 6.30.am connected to HKG - this flight also good. Return HKG-SIN-MEL both legs on A380 - what a plane service seemed better than the outward leg. Could not fault cabin crew - all flights full. All in all will definitely fly with SQ again.
label: positive

text: All excellent The flight was very nice. The seat was very comfortable and there was space to leave my bag in front of the seat. The flight attendants paid extra attention. I had lobster thermidor on the flight and my glass was always filled. I was offered all the desserts they have instead of only 1 choice. But, one thing that I would suggest, the check in process is not that smooth and the staff looks like she had a very bad day. Please place someone professional as he/she will be the 1st person we meet. Overall, my choice will always be Singapore Airlines if possible!
label: positive

text: I travelled to Australia via Singapore on the 10th Dec and returned on the 14th Jan. On both sectors out and back I received excellent service from the cabin staff. The choice of food was entertainment was very good and although it is a long journey the staff were polite and understanding. I will definitely be using Singapore Airlines again and was particularly impressed with the A380 airliner.
label: positive

text: Long haul in relative comfort Best premium economy seats. Very comfortable long hall trip. Worth every cent paying for the extra leg room. The economy service is good, great selection of entertainment and the staff give great service with a gracious smile
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight We were allocated seats in the top deck at the very back... perfect! Had more room and even storage and shelf to the side of my window seat. We were looked after by the immaculate air crew. Food was very pleasant , only criticism was the film choices. Not many recent films to choose from unlike Cathay Pacific . The return flight was through the night and we found the crew less attentive , possibly because of the timing ? Other than that we would choose Singapore Airlines again , but Cathay Pacific just pipped them to the post .
label: positive

text: First experience with Singapore Airlines This was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines. I usually fly premium economy on my regular visits to New Zealand but on this occasion I chose to fly economy. I was happy with my aisle seats and there was enough leg room (although being only 5ft tall that's never really an issue). The food was average in my opinion. In-flight entertainment was good with plenty of choices of films, radio and TV shows. The cabin crew were very attentive and extremely well turned out - the ladies looked so elegant and the men looked very distinguished (other airlines should take their example). My other disappointment was that the booking class I flew didn't qualify for any airpoints under the Star Alliance scheme so sadly I didn't earn any from the thousands of miles I flew to and from NZ.
label: positive

text: Give everybody a chance to perform Pre-booking a child meal does not to ensure you get a good quality kids meal. Disgusting.I have no photos - but I am sure the catering department has and hopefully review what they send out. The same happened on our return trip to Singapore.
label: neutral

text: Travelled with family of 10 We travelled with a group of 10 and were able to find places next to each other. Overall they all enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text: Good When we arrived at the airport to check in our bags there was a reasonable line of people waiting at the bag check in counters for the airline. This went down reasonably quick. The person who checked our bags in didn't seem to have the best attitude that you would generally expect to receive. Boarding the plane wasn't overly bad, the crew seemed friendly and helpful. The seats weren't too bad. There was a good choice of films and some TV programs, To access the games you have to have an account. The food wasn't too bad, did receive one meal which didn't seem to have been cooked properly so had to get to swapped. The crew came round with drinks fairly regularly and if you wanted anything you could just go to the back of the plane and ask. The hygiene felt better as not flying since covid we were concerned a bit. Overall the plane seemed newer, the crew friendly and helpful. For the return journey, there wasn't any people really waiting to check baggage in, it seems to be self bag check in. The staff on hand to help with checking the baggage in were very helpful. Boarding the plane wasn't too bad and the crew seemed friendly. The plane seemed to be older and more worn as panels especially in the toilets were badly cracked and also the hygiene of the plane didn't seem to be as good as the outward flight. The entertainment was the same as the outward flight. The crew occasionally came round with drinks. The food was ok. Overall the crew were friendly
label: positive

text: (Two separate return journeys, different equipment). Pretty well can't be faulted. E.g. the airline staff went the extra mile in several respects, including luggage which didn't make a tight connection, but which I still got in 24 hours. The A350s are somewhat more comfortable in feel than even the A380s, the IFE on both aircraft is good, though the A350s have a live BBC news feed I can recommend. Would happily fly with them again.
label: positive

text: My first choice for air travel The highlight of flying with Singapore Airlines for me was the tour of the city I took when having a 13hr transit stopover. Apart from Changi Airport being a fantastic airport to lounge in, the option of leaving for a few hours and seeing some sights (for free!) was a great activity. I also hired a room and had a nap and shower in that time so I was well rested for the next leg of my journey home (and the Singapore Slings went down a treat!). The airline is consistently good, the service, food and amenities made the return trip very enjoyable.
label: positive

text: Comfortable enough, but should increase the frequency of their flights There is only one SQ flight each day between Manchester and Singapore and it is a busy route. Singapore Airlines should really consider increasing the frequency. The flight was 100% full (yes, not a single seat was left empty) and we understand that the flights on the days before and after are the same. Nonetheless, the service was good, flight was comfortable, and the whole process went smoothly. However, meals this time round was just average. For the lunch, I took the prawn and rice set, and it was mostly rice. Plus the salad was a pasta salad with all pasta and no vegetables, so the meal ended up being carb heavy with not much else. Dessert was a rather sweet tart. The breakfast was the normal eggs and hash browns. The inflight entertainment this time round was rather dry. The movies were mainly quite slow and dark, with an indie feel.
label: positive

text: Good Service, Clean Cabins and Good Food Took SQ return to Taipei Taiwan for work, the 30kg checked in baggage of the airfare is very very helpful. If you took budget airlines, the extra charge of checked in baggage is very expensive. If you had checked-in baggage, just pick this airline. It adds up more economical at the total cost
label: positive

text: Well done on refund Just want to give kudos to Singapore airlines for refunding us our tickets, and not taking any cancellation fees etc. We originally opted for a credit because I broke my ankle and couldn't fly because of complications but changed our minds when Covid broke out and asked them for the cash back. Great response and we will happily fly with them again as soon as the world settles down and borders are open.
label: positive

text: Good but inconsistent service My family of five have had good experiences while travelling on flight number SQ346 on a A380 from Singapore to Zurich in Switzerland on 18 December for our holiday in Europe from 18-27 December 2018. The service on our first encounter provided by flight stewards were amazing and lived up to the high standards of Singapore Airlines especially by Mr Teo Ming Zhong and his colleagues whom we were deeply impressed. Food were great and services were first class. However, on our return night flight on Singapore Airlines via SQ321 also on a A380 on 26 December, the service provided was a let down though. Food were as good anyway as expected of SIA. The flight stewardesses attended us were of sub standard quality where simple requests like asking to remove used cups and little food containers at the very moment when they came over to serve main courses were met with blunt refusals and excuses like " I can't do it now as I am serving food" and the like. My request to redeem the small fruit pack were also turned down after I missed my turn when I was asleep and woke up to see the handing out of the same had just passed me a few seats in front. Reply given was there wasn't anymore left. When I insisted my share as I observed many were also bypassed during the serving round and there had to be some more available and fair enough, one of the flight attendants came back minutes later with a pack and told me on my face that this was the only one left. As the flight was a long haul of 13 hours continuous flight, I took the trouble of walking around the cabin area for some simple stretching and went to the loo and to my surprise, I saw the same little fruit packs were available in abundance both at the serving area in front of our seating section and also at the upper deck serving area together with the packets nuts, crackers, biscuits and buns.
