This is displeased to say the least. The service I encountered this time round was a far cry compared with the experience I had on 18 December. In addition to the bad experience of the 2 young flight stewardesses, one of the toilets at the far end on the plane has no water for washing hands and a bottle of mineral water was used as a replacement and most of the time it was emptied and no one was filling it up. I hope that being part of a group tour and be seated at the far end of a plane would not be the reason for the indifferent quality of service provided.
label: neutral

text: just excellent The service was good and already started when we were able to board earlier because we were traveling with kids. The flight attendants were super nice and very attentive to us. It is quite a long flight and our little ones decided not to sleep. The flight attendants would come by and ask if they needed extra drinks or food. We had a great flight, the entertainment was good, food was good. It is nice that you can order a kidsmeal in advance. The kidsmeal was a really something kids eat. It is usually also served a bit earlier so the kids can eat and then you can eat afterwards.
label: positive

text: Uncomfortable seats I chose centre isle seats because of ease getting out, but I felt squashed, hard to sleep and seats were uncomfortable after a few hours. Disapppointed.
label: neutral

text: (Almost) Always a Great Experience Flew a direct flight from Osaka to Singapore leaving late at night and arriving before dawn. The airline is highly service oriented and operations are almost always smooth and easy. The check-in scanner had trouble reading my passport but there was someone to help. Boarding was well-organized and disciplined, there was plenty of on-board staff and they quickly went to dim lighting shortly after takeoff. The flight arrived a little early and baggage was delivered quickly. Happy to fly them.
label: positive

text: Wonderful airline Such a huge shame airbus will stop making the magnificent A380, by far the most comfortable plane in the skies. Took the option of premium economy on this route, more curiosity than anything else. Have previously flown economy and paid extra for exit row seats. Premium economy is good, service is better, equipment etc. (Headphones, tv screen). The legroom wasn’t great surprisingly. You get 6 inches extra though it disappears as soon as the passenger in front redlines seat. Food was good, extra also. Ice cream, beer selection. Staff are fabulous in both economy and premium. Having paid for premium economy ticket, was a little surprised to find part of my journey in economy on silk air! Only a short hop from KL to Singapore so didn’t mind too much. Can see what this airlines gets so many awards. Previously a huge fan of emirates until they introduced new seating charges, haven’t flown with them since and now fly Qatar and Singapore.
label: positive

text: Great Airline, let down bye loathsome airport experience The airline service was exceptionally good. Attention to all passenger needs was good, in flight entertainment was great and easy to navigate. Seats were comfortable, meals were unremarkable but appropriate. Cabin crew were attentive and polite. The airport at Changi, Singapore is appalling. Dirty carpets, narrow thoroughfares, inefficient boarding procedures were just what we didn't want as we connected on our two long hauls. No excuse for an international airport, was just run down and unwelcoming.
label: positive

text: Extremely pleasant flight Flew to Australia with Singapore airline from Manchester. very friendly staff and good service during the flight. Had a minor issue with size of hand luggage, had to check this as the first flight was to Amsterdam and they would not let us carry this with us.
label: positive

text: Holiday Flight was on time check in was easy happy flight attendants had two seats together in the centre but would not have mattered where you sat all seats where good service was good with good bar service and food lots of movies to choose from but a lot where old . Ear phones on board where not much good had three pieces to choose from that kept coming apart . Blankets where thin and not soft need replacements badly but over all a good flight would book again if it was a good price if not look for another airline.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines is a shining star Me and my family flowen in Singapore airlines SQ-942 from Dubai airport to Chani airport on June 18, 2019. The flight was on time and the flight attendants were nice and attentive to suit all needs. Check in was also instrumental and the counter staff were very friendly. The in-flight entertainment program was also excellent and good no of new movies were presented. I like the quality of the airplane, Boeing 777, as it was a new airplane, also the business seats were one of its kind that have excellent size and good privacy.
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight I flew from Singapore to Barcelona, paid slightly more for extra leg space at the front and it was the best choice. I had a comfortable flight, service is great as usual. In-flight entertainment has the latest movies and time passed quickly. Checking in is breeze, will definitely choose SQ again.
label: positive

text: Reserve your seats Singapore Airlines has a history of providing great service and its reputation is supposedly impeccable. However, with its recent changes to the booking system, getting decent seats without paying for one is close to impossible. On the day of check-in, only 9 seats remained available. Everyone else had already selected/paid for one and there were 0 aisle seats available. Shocking. The airlines did not reserve any seats for normal check-in and this is highly disappointing as my family were scattered throughout the plane. Given the premium prices, this really shouldn't be happening since other airlines offer better seat selections. Moreover, the food provided on Singapore airlines frequently disappoints and nothing about the airline stands out anymore. Singapore airlines have been dethroned and this is hardly a surprise. Last time flying with them.
label: negative

text: Disappointed this time after 3 years We always fly premium economy to Singapore and usually the staff and food are amazing. On this occasion, we felt disappointed. The seats were great, but the staff were unfriendly and looked like they did not want to be there. We did Book the Cook and the food was lacking. When we asked why we didn’t get a dessert but the seats behind did, we were told it was because we had a ‘special meal’. We received no juice on arrival and no hot towels and this was because of COVID. I think using Covid as an excuse still is wearing thin. I had to ask for water on 3 occasions and they forgot to give us coffee after the meal. The seats are not cheap, therefore they should provide an adequate and appropriate service.
label: neutral

text: Very good flight ... As usual with Singapore airline Almost perfect flight. A small detail only : It seams the meals were prepared for people with a seasoning allergy. It is fine so but for the others it will be better to get optionally pepper and chilies.
label: positive

text: Jakarta to Singapore. Exemplary customer service experience from Garuda and Singapore Airlines. Our flight scheduled to depart at 15:20 from Pontianak to Jakarta on 27 March, was delayed for 3 hours due to bad weather (heavy thunderstorm). We missed our connecting flight scheduled to depart at 19:00 from Jakarta to Singapore. Upon arrival in Jakarta we brought our case to Garuda customer service and it was promptly processed. There's no flight available for the day so we were put in hotel with dinner and breakfast voucher. The next day Garuda customer service staff went to Singapore Airlines office and they were able to release 2 tickets for us to fly back to Singapore on that day. A gracious and much appreciated act from Garuda and Singapore Air. Thank you!
label: positive

text: Highly recommend Singapore. The crew is the biggest asset to this airline, they are not only highly professional they are also friendly and personable. The crew on our flight went out of their way to help us when our son got a blood nose upon landing, ensuring his wellbeing and helping us even after all passengers had disembarked. The customer service is outstanding, we wouldn’t fly with any other airline.
label: positive

text: Worth that little extra Worth that little bit extra for the bigger seats and better service, particularly for a long flight. The service was great - as usual - and the extra leg room and bigger entertainment screen made the trip easier. The food was of the usual high standard, good choices and adequate portions. Not our National carrier but probably our airline of choice now.
label: positive

text: Amazing flight to fly with Great service by the crew members. The airline seats are quite comfy even in economy. The crew members on the ground and in-flight are well behaved and help people when ever required.
label: positive

text: I boarded the Airbus flying from London to Singapore on 18 September it was two hours late owing to technical difficulties. Sometimes these things happen. However I was sitting in seat 41c. From the start the air conditioning was frightful. A freezing cold breeze blew around all of the passengers near the back of the cabin while the passengers towards the front complained that it was too hot. Also the stench from the toilets was unbearable and seemed to be wafted out of the toilets at regular intervals during the trip. I did not experience this on any of the aircraft's I flew with both to Amsterdam six weeks previously or on the flight home from Singapore to New Zealand. Although spoken to the staff were unwilling to acknowledge that there was something wrong. On the Singapore to NZ part of the trip I also tried to charge my Air iPad but it would not charge on any of the seats near where I was sitting. The steward said there had been difficulties with Apple products. Potential customers need to know this as it could be important to work during a long haul trip. I had been relatively pleased with Singapore Airlines but my experience on the Airbus has left me wandering if I would fly with them again.
label: negative

text: The Great Way To Fly Love it! Love it Love it! I and my spouse have flown business class several times with different airlines. And Singapore Airlines is the best among the bests. This time 13 of us have flown that include my mom, sister, my brother's family, my wife, her parents and her sister's family. It was awesome from check-in to baggage claim. The lounge is wonderful. We enjoyed the food and the ambience. The cabin is clean, flawless and comfortable. The cabin crew made us feel at home particularly when celebrated my niece's birthday at 40,000 feet. A cabin crew surprised her with present and a birthday cake. Thank you very much Singapore Airlines. Truly, it is a great way to fly with you...
label: positive

text: Singapour Airlines PCR Singapore require all passenger, except Chinese passenger, to have a pcr test, even with vaccin, just for transit in the airport for 1h 🤔 I say, avoid this airlines, Emirates and others don't ask you to this.
label: negative

text: Once I arrived at the check-in counter, a friendly smile greeted us. When I boarded the plane, I found that it was an old plane, but things inside were excellent. For instance, the seat was a bit narrow but I could comfortably sit. Cabin crew were polite. The food was delicious and a variety of drinks to choose from. There was not many movies to watch I linked to the WiFi. The experience was very enjoyable.
label: positive

text: Great flight and service We now know why Singapore airlines were voted the best long haul carrier. The certainly live up to their accolade. every thing was perfect from start to finish!
label: positive

text: I can't imagine flying international with a different airline My friend and I flew economy on Singapore air, on what I'm pretty sure was a Boeing, from LAX to INC (Roundtrip,11-hour flight) and the overall flight exceeded our expectations. Cons: -My only complaint was the trouble that we had finding our gate in LAX on the way there. On all of the screens, apps, sites, and even our tickets, the gate number wasn't there. We asked a few LAX employees and they also didn't know. We spent much of our 7-hour layover looking for the right gate. Closer to departure time we saw a Singapore Airlines plane through the window and followed it as it rode to our gate. At the gate was a small sign that confirmed that we were in the right place. The gate number never appeared on the airport screens. Pros: -The onboard service. My friend and I had some issues when booking our tickets and ended up being seated away from each other. My friend told a flight attendant about our issue and she managed to get us seated together on a fully booked flight. We ended up on the front row of a section with endless legroom. Despite there being no seat in front of us, we still had access to inflight entertainment and a table for meals. It was all tucked away inside the seat. Though I will say that these seats in the front rows will likely not be comfortable if you have big hips. -Good food. The food was surprisingly good and the desserts were really tasty. No request seemed too big. On both flights, we were served two full meals that we chose from a menu. -Extras. While boarding the flight they had a basket with earbuds that are specific to the inflight entertainment system. The entertainment system also had headphones attached. We received a small pouch that included socks, a toothbrush, and toothpaste. -Lighting and A/C. The cabin stayed thoroughly cool throughout both flights. I always bring a coat with me in case I get too cold. In between meals, the lights were turned off so passengers could rest. It was a big help to me, I was able to nap on both flights.
label: positive

text: My wife and I had booked a trip to Europe. We unfortunately had to cancel the day before we were scheduled to leave due to a death in the family. I did not have trip insurance and had obtained the tickets with miles. The miles were not refundable. I called Singapore and after providing medical documentation, they generously credited me my miles back so we can re-book our trip at a later date. To me, this is the sign of a FIRST CLASS organization. They were in their rights not to refund the miles, but they did. I have flown Singapore for years, even if a had to take a second flight to arrive at my destination. I will continue to use Singapore every chance I get. I give them 5 stars for their compassion, consideration and rapid response. Thank you.
label: positive

text: Best Five Star Airlines Singapore airlines really made me comfortable during the flight with the best service from your cabin crew, best taste with the breakfast, lunch and dinner menu with the high quality. This is first time I'd try your Airbus A380-800 route Singapore - Hongkong.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth and return. We were pleasantly surprised to be greeted by name when we boarded the plane. Crew took time to make my kids feel comfortable on the flight. Cabin lights were turned off about an hour after the flight and then breakfast was served at about 4am. Unfortunately, my husband was taken ill shortly before landing – thankfully there was a doctor sitting just across the aisle from him. The crew was amazing – they thought and took care of every little detail. My kids and I were given assistance through the airport, and even helped into the taxi to go to the hospital. I didn’t manage to get anyone’s names but I am very grateful for their assistance. SQ214: Again, impressed with service. Senior crew was outstanding, some junior crew seemed a bit indifferent. Seats on both flights were comfortable and acceptable for a medium haul flight (they were angled flat seats ie. old business class). For anything more than 7 hours, a full flat would be perfect. Selected breakfast from book-the-cook for SQ225 flight, which was delicious. IFE kept the kids entertained the whole time.
label: positive

text: SQ478 to Johannesburg on 18 June 2013 and returned on SQ479 (departing Johannesburg 20 June). Flight scheduled to leave Singapore around 1am and due to some aircraft problems after boarding we had to return to the terminal and wait for a new aircraft. Flight resumed close to 7am. SIA arranged for refreshments immediately as well as pillows and blankets for our wait at the new boarding gate. My biggest compliment is the crew. The same crew served us on the flight back.
label: positive

text: Enjoyed my trip from Singapore to Amsterdam in the A350. The best of it was arriving jetlag free, both ways. Normally I feel grotty for at least a couple of days. The service was the usual Singaporean courteous and efficient. The food was good and the ambience pleasant. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: Awesome experience Most amazing flying experience .On time.. fantastic, professional service...Great food.The best air line...
label: positive

text: World's Longest Commercial Flight, in Premium Economy Solo Seat. Bought Tickets in April. SQ Counter at EWR rather late to open, however incoming aircraft arrived late. Staff didn't know final destination, and I had to help them. No bother, as they appreciated it, and checked my Rimowa through. Cabin Crew arrived 40 minutes before boarding time. Ground staff again were novice, and boarding was kind of "rough" due to misplaced announcements. I was the last to board. Upon boarding was greeted throughout my walk to my seat. One Attendant even asked where I was going, smiled, and got out of the way. SQ Premium Economy Solo Seat so comfortable, and side bin holds so much. Took off on time, to a lovely sunny day. Had to use the Lavatory, and had to wait, because a Cabin Attendant was cleaning it. She noticed me, and expedited her clean. On IFE the "Old is Gold" section is gone, but a excess of Old movies were available, and I watched Star Wars. A drink run commenced, then Lunch. When they arrived for Lunch, the Attendant Instantly apologized, and said they only had 1 meal type however, however promised multiple options later. So I went ahead, and had it. Was tasty, followed my Ice Cream, and another drink round. I dozed off, and woke up over Denmark. Went to use the Lavatory again, however it was again being cleaned. Snack/drink runs were conducted. Really appreciate the crew on the details. Had the second meal of Iraq/Iran. I had the Seafood option. Was exceptional, hot too symphony of flavors. More drink runs followed. I dozed off again, and woke up with a Made in Italy pocket Pizza next to me. Landed SIN, to a beautiful evening. Once again SQ21, SQ23 Exceptionally shine.
label: positive

text: Amazing Experience Actually mine was a round trip. New Delhi-Singapore-Brisbane-Gold Coast-Sydney-Singapore-New Delhi, me & my family went for a vacation. Great experience. Right from booking to Airline ambience- dot on time performance-Comfort-In flight dining-hospitality. That's precise reason we chose Singapore Airlines :)
label: positive

text: Well Expected From The SIA Quality! Every holidays/overseas trip start from the air flight. It is a flight that all should try, experience and get pampered before landing.
label: positive

text: CPH/SIN - SIN/CPH economy. Two excellent 12 hours flights good seat comfort staff service superior they walk through cabin with juice and water three times per hour staff provide a good atmosphere and spirit in cabin and at all times kept toilets clean. IFE screens needs update too small and inferior image quality. On flight back to CPH captain made very thorough explanation prior to entering severe turbulence this info made many passengers feel better during the one hour rough ride. Have flown SIA regularly for 35 years still my absolute favorite.
label: positive

text: Continuing story: Singapore Airlines doesn't like Western vegetarian passengers See all the previous reviews about SIA and their lack of service for vegetarian passengers. The food on SQ323 from Amsterdam was a disaster. Tried again for my daughter to get a better service for this leg. First don't try to get "customer service" by phone. After +2 hrs. waiting on the phone, you're just cut off (obviously common/normal). OK, you've got to go downtown to their ION office. Packed! Well, try today at check-in. My daughter was referred to the ticket office. Waiting! She had to dash off to get her flight to BKK. I waited in line and could finally explain the complaint to an agent. I share the conversation: Agent/A: Sir, your daughter already changed her meals. Me/M: Yes, she did. Her only option is either Chinese or Indian vegetarian, but not Western. So she had to choose Indian. A: But she also selected waffles for the flight to Amsterdam. M: She did because there was no other Western option. Waffles for dinner and breakfast. The "Book the Cook" option didn't offer an alternative either. A: Sir, she could select a vegan meal. M: Vegan is not vegetarian. A: (other agent mixed in) saying in Malay (which I happen to speak) "refer the guy to the service phone". M: (In Malay) is this how you treat your business class passengers? Why don't you Google vegetarian and vegan. After this other disappointing experience with Singapore Airlines, I left. The agent can't help you if the company doesn't offer decent alternatives for their BUSINESS CLASS passengers. If their website is one of the worst in the business, their "customer service" phone is perpetual busy and factually non-existent, and their focus is on non-Western passengers, don't expect their agents to be "customer centric" or helpful in any way. Bottom line: If you are Western, and you're a vegetarian, DON'T fly with Singapore Airlines. They do everything to discourage you to fly with them. If they treat business class passengers like this, what will they do with coach passengers?!
label: negative

text: Flt sq 282 16 march '19 The 10 hour flight was satisfactory and the service for me sitting at seat 54 H was good,pleasant,efficient.Very happy with the outstanding service provided by flight steward Yap Shi Ting who helped me ,without asking, to place my bag onto the overhead compartment. Noticed that he was friendly,helpful and very professional when dealing with all passengers;later ,we spoke to him re our forthcoming sq flight to Kuala Lumpur on arrival at changi ,and he tried his level best to explain our questions,all correct! a confident,extroverted young man with a passion for his work! Those in his group were performing well too...absolutely no complaints! Easy check in and systematic boarding,we were given a small bag containing toothbrush and socks,2 rounds of refreshing hot towels,and several rounds of various drinks plus buns n bread etc in between the 2 main meals Food was average,nothing extraordinary,seat was rather cramped and leg room was average but still comfortable. Overall...7/10
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines I think SQ is the best. The crew is extremely friendly and kind. The food is delicious and the inflight system is good cuz there are so many movies from various cultures and a lot of movies for kids.
label: positive

text: BlurBlur Stewardess Well I was at sit 82 on Upper deck , this girl was serving everyone drinks , and she forgot me. I'm big and yet was transparent....she gave to everyone around me. Is it the attitude given because I asked for night mask. WOW! ...suddenly she came to me and said "did u ask for Singapore Sling"...i said didn't but would love one. The male steward assisting her was way more cordial and professional. As we reserved 2 Oriental Veg meal (tired of eating Indian veg for 10 days) while booking , another stewardess conveniently gave 1 to another guest ,as my brother was sleeping and too tired to consume at that time. He ended up eating a combi of both Indian & continental veg. Overall , very reluctant service.
label: neutral

text: Was hoping for more from all the hype Had to fly SIN HAN and had several choices for carriers. Heard all the hype about flying Singapore Airlines, how it supposed to be great, etc. I think the hype is gone. Don't get me wrong, it got me from SIN to HAN ok but it was a little 737 max for an international flight, was served a bento box for a meal, and to be honest I was really hoping for more. The ticket was more than say on Vietnam Air or Air Asia so I thought you really got more bells and whistles but it was just a regular flight with almost no frills. Even the excess baggage fee was quite high, you would think after paying for such a high ticket they would cut you some slack on the fees. In flight service was fine but I thought they would come around more than just giving you your "take-away" box. I guess all the hype that Singapore Airlines has the best service is no longer. At least I left out of T2 (versus 4) from Changi but I'll be flying someone else on those routes next time.
label: neutral

text: High recommendation This airline is always the best I love to fly with them and now they have more destinations to enjoy a very nice and comfy plane without worries. Overnight is super!! Aldo you can find a very nice price on Skyscanner super easy Voila!
label: positive

text: Was not a pleasant flight I flew Singapore Airline from Singapore to Denpasar , 1. Staff was not really welcome at Check-in counter , no greeting , no smile and didn't say thank you , a bit racist I think since they treat us different with white people ( I saw it next to me ) 2. At Boarding , the officer staff took our drink from our bag ( caned drink ) which is not open yet, 3. During the flight , one of passenger bags carrying bottles of drinks stored above the cabin leaked and dripped quite heavily right above my seat and made my shirt wet and it was not really comfortable at all !!( and the question is why other passenger may bring drink into the cabin while they throw away my drinks that I don't even open upon boarding ) The positive think was : the senior crew and the food
label: negative

text: Polite crew, pleasant service At the boarding gate, the passengers were kept updated that boarding would start soon. Onboard, the cabin crew members were polite. Could also hear one senior coaching a junior crew. A pity that the selection of movies was limited.
label: positive

text: Long haul flights in ecomomy are tough Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines in the world. We did several flights with them including this one which was on time. The good are the food, beverages, customer service and entertainment which are all excellent. Unfortunately where this airline and most others fail in the lack of legroom and comfort in economy where they cram in too many customers to improve the bottom line. On this long haul flight, for a tall person it is torture and uncomfortable.In future I need to review whether I fly at least premium economy or possibly business next long haul flight.
label: positive

text: Best in-flight entertainment and service always! SQ never fail to keep me well entertained and fed whenever I fly. The stewardesses are always helpful and friendly. I strongly recommend SQ for long or short flights!
label: positive

text: Best Airline service ever!!! The service along the trip was very good.. The food was great. The staff very friendly and helpful. For economy class, the seat was comfortable. My kid was very enjoy flying with Singapore Airlines . Amazing experience. Thanks Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Luxury and comfort Omg! Never flown business class before but what an experience!!!! Was fantastic to be able to sleep in a bed, food ordered from book the chef was fresh and delicious, service was excellent, staff all friendly and helpful. Was looked after like royalty. Will definitely fly again!
label: positive

text: Excellent food and service The staff onboard are brilliant. The food served is very good too and when it is ordered in advance you are served first. The aircraft is very clean. The check-in was smooth without any queuing. Our baggage allowance was enormous so we were able to pack the kitchen sink!!!
label: positive

text: Safe yourself a big trouble & avoid Singapore Airlines SQ becoming one of the worst airlines in the world - masquerading as full-service airline in reality worse than the cheapest no-frills budget airlines. I'm utterly frustrated by this airline - despite emails promising to contact me to change my booking within 15 days - it's now more than a month and the flights are next week. What do you have to do to actually get their attention??
label: negative

text: Solid experience Our 10+ hour flight in BC was solid. The crew was professional and very friendly. The 777-300ER was very comfortable. Plenty of room. I only watched the map for part of the flight, and the screen was great. I was able to pre-order meals two days in advance so I ate what I wanted. There were plenty of choices. The seat\bed is very wide, 26” I believe. Comfortable. All in all a very enjoyable experience.
label: positive

text: NEVER FLIGHT WITH THIS COMPANY, IT'S A SCAM YOU CAN'T CHANGE YOUR BOOKING, THEY MAKE YOU WAIT HOURS ON THE PHONE never flight with this company, it's a scam you can't change your booking, they make you wait hours on the phone they said when i purchased the ticket that i can reschedule anytime, it's a lie and their refund policy is a scam too forget singapore airlines
label: negative

text: Excellent Service, you must try their cocktail Singapore Slinge World class airline, Asian hospitality. The best part is they serve most of the cousins. Depending on the flight, the leg room may vary. Enough food and beverages served together with lot for entertainment.
label: positive

text: Best Bussines Class One of the best Bussines clas I have ever travelled with. Great service, friendly stuff, fine food, good variety of movies and comfortable seats.
label: positive

text: Awesome Inflight Service Cabin crew were courteous and served drinks/snacks quite regularly. Food & drinks were good. Flight experience was pleasant.
label: positive

text: Still first airline in my heart and my choices I used this company again after 4 years from my previous flight. Actually i made two flights one from Colombo to Singapore and the second from Singapore to Hanoi. I was very relaxed and calm before the flight because i already knew that staff, service and flight will be everything fine and very well organised due to my previous experience. I wsn't wrong. Everything went smoothly. On the first leg check in was good and quick from the company, flight was excellent with an airbus a350-900, very modern, with new devices for inflight entertainment and very good service and food. The second leg it was not like the first and that why i give 4 stars instead of 5. The aircraft was a much older one a330-300 although service and check in was great. Also food was not so good as the first flight. Another minor thing that i would like to mention is the luck of salt and pepper in both flights. Regarding the airports for Singapore I can not say a word. For me is the top airport of the world, modern, modern facilities, good information everywhere, very helpful staff, decoration, clean, even toilets could be a place to eat. Regarding Colombo airport we can say that is some years back to the time. Old one not so clean. Very expensive stores comparing to the place and too many security and imigration checks, our passport got 3 stamps only for departing from the country and large rows that we were waiting for over 1 hour full of many rude locals that were pushing or making noise, unfortunately i will say it once more, locals are great and kind but some of them believe that they are something else and this ruins the great image of the country. Hanoi airport was much better, more organised although also old one. Visas were issued very quick and rows in immigration were smaller and everything was going fast. The only disadvantage is that noone helps you in anything and everyone is trying to offer you drive to anywhere instead of answering. This should change.
label: positive

text: Absolutely disgraceful airline Was scheduled to fly with this airline to Japan in May. Booked through a third party that tried to get me a refund but was unsuccessful. In addition to no refund, the airline offered me credit and when tried to use the credit, the tickets that they offered as "alternatives" were 4 times what you could find them online for. Absolute worst experience of my life with this airline. I would avoid them at all costs.
label: negative

text: Great expereince The leg space, food and staff were all great. They had a huge variety of films, shows and music to listen to and the pilot and his crew kept us up to date on arrival times, expected turbulence and weather at our current distinction. Would highly recommend Singapore Airlines, they may have just become my favourite!
label: positive

text: Seats are comfy. Screens are old My seat was comfortable and I had an okay sleep. The inflight monitor display, however, was very fuzzy and grainy compared to premium economy. Since I was needing sleep it wasn’t an issue but if I’d been on a longer flight I might have been annoyed. Staff were excellent.
label: positive

text: My recent flight from London to Singapore was very disappointing. Granted that the departure and arrival times were very good, and my seat was comfortable. Gone are the warms towels prior to your meal, no menu cards and no water runs through the flight. Then there was the lunch service, the bread roll was more like a brick - when asking the flight attendant if I could have another one he replied that they were all like that. No entree /dessert on meal tray. Breakfast was served 5 hours prior to landing and my meal was very poor in quantity and quality.
label: negative

text: So comfortable Every time I fly Singapore Airlines I remember why I love flying with them. The food is excellent, the crew seem determined to empty the champagne bottles as often as possible and everything is done with such good humour. Premium Economy is superb value, especially on a daytime flight. My favourite way to fly.
label: positive

text: Exceptional crew and service as usual Exceptional care and service. Genuine smiles and care. 4 crew members stood out for me on this flight FSS Kao, FSS Hoon, FS Tan and CS Frankie. I would to be on the same flight as them again!! Food was amazing as always too.
label: positive

text: EXCELLENT SERVICE AND GREAT FOOD I always enjoy the service on Singapore Airlines. I love the hot hand towels. The food was really good and flavoursome. I flew AKL-SIN-PAR then back again and I had no trouble on any of the flights. A very pleasant long haul journey.
label: positive

text: Best In the Sky I was on an economy seat near the wings side, the seats were very comfortable and a cushion was placed at the seats. A tv screen was available for entertainment with a complimentary headset as you board the plane. Plus, what amuses me is the toothbrush they've placed at the lavatories. Without a doubt, Singapore Airlines is one, if not the best in the Sky.
label: positive

text: Best first class service and seats Amazing service, best seats ever. To sleep and to just enjoy a trip to the city of this airline - Singapore. The 4 seats in Singapore Airline is private, perfect and the service cant be better than you dream of. I will surely travel Singapore Airline agian. Love the size of the seats, there is no airline who has bigger seats and better beds than this airline company. I had a great trip, actually I did not want to sleep at all because I was afraid to miss all the good food and service you give to your customers.
label: positive

text: Beyond Disappointing I have flown Singapore Airlines previously and have always been happy to recommend them but a recent flight from Singapore to Brisbane has changed my opinion. This flight was really bad in a number of ways. Firstly, the seats were so squashed in, it was really very uncomfortable and claustrophobic. Previously I have found Singapore Airline’s economy sears to be spacious and comfortable. These seats had zero leg room and were very narrow. Seems like they have gone the “make more money and shove more seats in” pathway as so many airlines seem to do these days. It really felt quite unsafe and I wondered how on earth they would ever evacuate passengers safely from these cramped conditions. The second disappointment was the food - honestly I wouldn’t have served it up to my dog. It was terrible and inedible. It was obvious they had gone for the cheapest possible option which was worse than the worst cafeteria food. It was an insult to serve it to anyone. Again it seemed to reflect a desire to maximise profit while not giving a damn over really taking pride in what they served up. The entertainment system was also disappointing with a very poor choice of mostly violent and puerile movies - I struggled to find even one I would like to watch. The screens were also very old and very poor quality. The airplane itself also seemed to be old and unattractive, including the toilets which were like something out of a bad high school. No attention to aesthetics here. All in all I would struggle to fly with Singapore Airlines again and now feel no enthusiasm for this airline.
label: negative

text: Excellent service and help when needed Cabin staff very attentive and great service and help with getting to and from areas within airports with my post operative limited mobility.
label: positive

text: Amazing airline This is the best airline I've been on, customer service was excellent the airplane was clean and great choice of entertainment and food!
label: positive

text: Excellent and accomodating My flight was 2:25 am, and I had to go to the airport early around 10:00 pm. I had already checked in online and did not want to wait around to get the boarding pass. I requested the counter to give me a boarding pass ear, and they were very flexible and kind to do so. This is the type of flexibility and understanding that makes a difference. Well done !!!
label: positive

text: To and From London on Singapore Airlines We Flew from Melbourne to London via Singapore with a stopover in Singapore on the outward and inward flights. Our flight was without incident and very comfortable as we had the wider legroom seating which we paid extra for. Service was impeccable as usual and the food was of high quality with one comment and that was that they ran out of a dish and that only left one choice which was not what we really wanted. Our stop over in Singapore was fantastic and we were able to shop, visit new places and indeed old ones as well which I well remember when I worked there many years ago. Keep it up Singapore and Singapore Airlines we will always travel and be with you.
label: positive

text: Very Comfortable Check process was good, there is only bag drop staff so you either check in online or you have to use the machine at the airport. Check in process was smooth. I do recommend you arrive at the airport 3 hours prior to departure.
label: positive

text: Who smiles when they collect rubbish ? I have flown Singapore airlines before and then they were undoubtedly the best. On our flight over from Jhb to Singapore I thought they may have lost some of their sparkle but on the way back the service was truly amazing. The beautiful air hostesses,who are immaculately turned out, were absolutely superb even smiling as the collected trays of rubbish after the meals. Punctuality and state of plane all excellent
label: positive

text: Disappointing Overall I was disappointed with my Business Class Singapore Airlines experience. When the seats are in flat bed mode they are at a strange angle making it difficult to position the pillow and sleep in a comfortable position. Also, unlike other airlines, unless you are a regular Singapore Airlines customer, you have to ask a member of the cabin crew to rearrange the seat into the flat bed mode and back again if you need to sit up for meals etc. The (vegetarian) meals were nothing special and were unimaginative and tasteless. Finally, a member of the cabin crew asked me sit upright and fasten the seatbelt when we were an hour from landing. I pointed out that this had not been requested by the captain and that I would do so as soon as the seatbelt sign lit up. Singapore Airlines would not be my first choice for any future Business Class flights.
label: neutral

text: Travelling to Auckland Great flight to Singapore. New premium economy seats very comfortable & very attentive, friendly service. Limited food options but very tasty. However, flight from Singapore to Auckland on an older plane & seats not as comfortable. Service & food Ok cabin staff very friendly & efficient.
label: positive

text: It's a nice experience to take Singapore Airline A380 from Hong Kong to Singapore. The ground staff in Hong Kong is not very nice but cabin crew are friendly. I order a seafood meal and taste good, however, as A380 is the largest aircraft it takes long time to board.
label: positive

text: SYD-SIN on 10 Nov 2013. Excellent service as usual fantastically attentive and friendly staff - moved me to a bulkhead seat to give me extra legroom. Food great drinks always available lots of water provided. Aircraft entertainment more than adequate. Normal high standard.
label: positive

text: Flew from SYD-SIN-IST Business Class on an ageing 777-200. Aircraft was the same all the way from Sydney to Istanbul. Whilst old the aircraft was very clean and well looked after. Food and Service were very good. The staff were wonderful. The Business Class seats/beds on this aircraft are a little hard compared to seats on other airlines which made it difficult to get comfortable on two night flights back to Turkey. IFE isn't as good as on other airlines or as good as SIA's newer aircraft but didn't affect the journey in a negative way. SIA would do well to offer pyjamas to customers in Business Class in the same way that Qantas do.
label: positive

text: Treatment of passengers February 2018 I traveled to Beijing - economy class from Perth to Singapore and premium economy from Singapore to Beijing. Two out of the four flights I took turned out average. However the flight from Singapore to Beijing was the Gem. The staff turned over backwards for me resulting in a very pleasant flight. My return from Singapore to Perth was an absolute nasty experience. A male crew member turned that flight into an embarrassment to me and an unpleasant five and a half hours. When the supervisor came to me he too added to the embarrassment. He actually supported the bad behavior and worse customer service of the crew member. I was threatened by the supervisor that he would call the captain and I welcomed that but because he realised that I was not backing down the captain never came. I complained to the upper management at Singapore airlines and was given the cold shoulder and shove around and bribed with 15000 Krisflyer miles when the realised that again I was not going to back down. In the end nothing happened.
label: neutral

text: Flew outward BCN-SIN via Milan as part of a MAD-KUL journey. For reasons we still can't understand at check-in in at MAD Air Europa checked our bags through to SIN only and couldn't issue boarding passes beyond BCN. We had to check in again at BCN which proved a blessing in disguise as SIA impressed us by unprompted noting that our bags weren't checked through to KL and organising that for us. Flight was on time and reasonably comfortable (on 777) crew handled some noisy adjacent passengers well by taking time to circle the cabin rather than going to them directly with our complaint. Food was OK; although obviously partly serviced from Milan with some uninspiring Italian products. Drinks came with good frequency although self-service option overnight especially for water might be better. Back SIN-LHR on A380. Again check-in staff did well readily changing our seat allocation to what we preferred. Flight delayed mostly by re-routing 75 minutes causing some stress over connections in London - no information offered on those at all. Service OK with choice of three meals (against only two outbound). Breakfast could do with better bakery selection but hot choices both OK. Strange that despite the one hour delay it was offered a good 2.5 hours before arrival (ie 3.30 in the morning London time) and in a vary patchy fashion with different parts of the cabin served seemingly at random. IFE worked OK on both flights lots of channels although not everything on them appears on the menus which is confusing. Wifi offered on A380 but pay as you go so no experience of that. In all entirely satisfactory product but not outstanding or memorable although customer care at check-in was well beyond usual experience.
label: positive

text: Great service, great experience as always! My wife and I had the pleasure of flying business class with Singapore airlines recently. The experience was fantastic from check in through to disembarking. We were travelling on the A380 and it was a rather busy flight, however, the attentiveness and smiles of the cabin crew never waned and it is easy to see why Singapore flight crews are consistently rated the worlds best. My wife was pretty tired once we boarded and struggled momentarily to get her bed set up, literally in a couple of seconds we had a cabin crew member there to assist and offering any additional blankets or amenities for my wife's comfort. The food in flight was of a very good standard, we both chose the book the cook options and were not dissapointed! The range of wines available was also great and complimented the meals very well. Lounge access at both Melbourne and Singapore is also a welcome option and the food and service at both locations was very good, particularly in Singapore. From a comfort perspective, the seats are very wide, comfortable and the fully lay flat option is easy to deploy. I'm a tall guy, but found I easily fitted in the bed when it was time to sleep, albeit the range of movies on the large screen was difficult to pass up! All in all a great experience and will certainly look to fly Singapore airlines again on our next trip! The Bad: Nothing negative about the experience! The Better: The quality of the food and range of drinks The Best: The in flight service! Always attentive, with a smile and genuinely there to make sure you enjoy the flight at all times
label: positive

text: Good But Not the Best Don’t get me wrong, this was a nice flight. But after all the press on Singapore Airlines being the top rated airline in the world I expected more from Business Class. The service was excellent but the amenities and food were not up to the excellence of Virgin, or BA, or even the new Delta planes. No toiletry bag; food choices were limited and not outstanding; bedding felt very used; wines were not great.
label: positive

text: Superb Flew SQ478/479/118/119. All trips where outstanding and exceeded all my expectations. The cabin crew are humble and polite and ever willing to assist. The aircraft was super clean and fresh and the food was great. I always thought that the middle east carriers where the best, clearly not as SIA is. Their service levels is on another league all together. The cabin crew literally carried the flag of Singapore and gave passengers a glimpse of what the country of Singapore stands for and that they mean business when it comes to service delivery etc Have to also mention here that the Johannesburg ground team of SIA is pathetic. If you have a query and call them all they say is "SINGAPORE AIRLINES" and remain quiet whereas if you call airline "XYZ" in the middle east thay say "hello and thank you for calling, how may we be of assistance" this type of bad attitude at SIA will eventually lead to the loss of customers. Overall: Food:5/5 Onboard service:5/5 Cleanliness:5/5 Inflight entertainment:5/5 Johannesburg Offices of SIA:1/5
label: positive

text: Disappointed All crews didn't help at all even I had 1 year old baby The worst experience for his first flight Not welcome at all
label: negative

text: Fantastic We flew with Singapore airlines from Phuket- Singapore and then from Singapore-Bali. This is our first ever time flying with them but would def fly with them again. The planes are nice, big and clean. The seats as a good size too so you are not squashed together like some airlines. The service was impeccable all the way through. The air stewardesses were friendly, helpful and always smiling. I ordered a Hindu vegetarian meal and the kids had a children’s meal. They were amazing too. The meals were so tasty one of the best food ever, like it’s been made for a restaurant nothing like the other airline food we usually eat. Can’t wait to fly with them again soon.
label: positive

text: Great service We flew with Singapore airlines to Singapore then Bali and return . All flights were brilliant the service and the air stewards were fantastic the service and in flight entertainment were great . The seats were comfortable and we had plenty of leg room
label: positive

text: Very good flight. Thoroughly enjoyed flying with this airline. Happy with seats. Service was excellent. Even got a cup of tea while most passengers were trying to sleep. Economy wasn't too bad - there was enough legroom and seat was quite comfortable.
label: positive

text: Great Service We travelled premium economy for the first time. The comfort was good and the cabin crew really looked after us. We also took advantage of the book the cook service which helped with choosing something that was gluten free. A great airline to fly with and would always choose this as one of the first choices.
label: positive

text: impeccable service SingaporeAir gives you impeccable service with excellent meals and faultless service. Recommended One of our best long distance flights. Could . Nothing to complain about, I've been flying premium economy between Singapore to Beijing (5-6 hours) quite a few times, and I am very pleased with the comfort level . The seats are much wider, more legroom, noise-cancelling headset and bottle of water provided immediately on the flight. from the economy cabin,
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines A380 from Sydney to Singapore full flight, plane showing it’s age, cabin service up to usual standard expected of Singapore airlines, A350 Singapore to Cape Town, exceptional aircraft, preferred to A380. Cabin service up to usual Singapore airline service
label: positive

text: I don't understand why people say SQ is the best airline in the world. The service has really gone downhill in the past 5 years. I was traveling with my 10 month old daughter and husband on the non-stop from Singapore to LA (round trip). The flight attendants don't pay attention to details. They say they will wash baby bottles, but they hand back the bottle with milk still in it. So I had to request to wash the bottles myself (thankfully they allowed this). We ordered the "Book the Cook" meals, but the flight attendant didn't look up our info so they tried to serve us regular meals. When I told them we ordered "Book the Cook" meals they asked us what we ordered. I couldn't remember. Between the two of us that's 8 meals on 2 different flights that I booked in advance. If I knew I had to bring confirmation of the meal request, I would have done that. They heated up my daughter's meal without asking so it had to be thrown away because it needs to be consumed within one hour and she was sleeping because the flight was a night flight. The seats are uncomfortable for a 16 hour flight. I feel that economy plus seats for a long-haul flight should recline more. Also, the seats were really difficult for me to recline. When we boarded the plane, there was no bottled water in the water holders. Overall, it was just underwhelming. The price wasn't too bad considering it was Economy Plus and a non-stop flight to LA. I think the airline has good ideas, they just are executed properly by their staff.
label: negative

text: My review is about the poor service in trying to get an upgrade for a segment of my Singapore Airlines flight. I purposely bought an E ticket, paying 50% more to get that class, so that I could get an upgrade, but now that I try to get the upgrade, the website tells me the ticket can't be upgraded, and I cannot get through to a human on the phone. I sent a message through their e-mail system, but only got a confirmation that it will be attended to within 10 days. This is terrible service.
label: negative

text: A very good flight. The staff were polite and the whole experience pleasant. If I ever have to fly into Manchester again, I will certainly use Singapore Airlines. The price was right too.
label: positive

text: Experience with Singapore airlines We started our journey at 10.45am 15.12.2018 from Chennai (India) with SilkAir SQ5335 Airbus A320 to Singapore we had pleasant experience. From Singapore we started at 8.10pm our journey to Wellington(New Zealand) via Melbourne(Australia) by Singapore Airlines SQ247 Boeing 777-200 and reached Wellington at 1.15pm on 16.12.2018. What an incredible experience... Cabin crews are so friendly and very much helpful with parental care and genuine smile. Flight served us delicious food, (we've pre ordered Muslim food) Every seat equipped with TV display for watching different languages entertainment with a remote control. Wash rooms are equipped with eau de cologne, hand wash, moisturiser, baby care table, tissues etc.,
label: positive

text: used to be top long ago very disappointing, after quite some time I decided to use SQ again, remebering the good old days when SQ was top. not again, whereby LH improved quite significantly, SQ was pure disappointment, I did not feel welcomed but a nuisance to flight attendants and pursers on both flights (return), the wet towel was bone dry and cold, when I told them this, the second one was lukewarm but dry-means they don't even understand the purpose of that hot towel. When asked for attendance, I had to call twice and wait quite a while for a blanket, seat turn down. Wherby the SQ business sleeper seat is akward to say it mildly compared to other airlines A350,very uncomfortable and hard to sleep.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Unfortunataly not a good review for Singapore Airlines. On our way from Singapore to Denpasar Bali boarding the Captain announce a technical problem with the aircraft and we have to disembark. We were very tired after a long flight from Cape Town and Johannesburg this was not the best news. The airline could have make it more tolerant if they have maybe refreshments for the passangers waiting another 2 hours for the next aircraft.
label: neutral

text: Premium economy long flight. We thought we would try premium economy this time as business class had really gone up in price.Better than economy but still not enough room for me. The first 8 hrs to Singapore during the day was fine. We stopped over one night and flew out at 11.30 pm the following night. It was 13 hrs to Milan when we thought we could get off for an hour and stretch our legs and get a bit of exercise. However, we were not allowed off the plane. We let off passengers but did not pick any more up. They did a partial clean of the plane which was a bit strange as they could not do where the passengers were. We did 'Book the Cook" before we left and selected our main meals. We were always served first and had a better menu than that on board so we will do that on the return trip. My husband slept well can't say the same for myself, I would call mine dozing. We are both tall so need legroom.
label: positive

text: The best I am from the UK live in Austin Texas since Singapore airline included Houston to Manchester service to there schedule I have traveled with them they are the best the service is unlike any other airline
label: positive

text: World Class Airline!!! This was my first trip with singapore airlines but for long flights in the future i would always prefer to fly with Singapore airlines. Service, flight attendants, food, drinks, entertainment, cleaniness, and check in are absolutely outstanding. I have been using American Airlines and United Airlines for my business and personal trips but in comparison to Singapore Airlines the total experience that Singapore Airlines provides to customers is outstanding. Other airlines should learn from Singapore airlines as a role model airline.
label: positive

text: Outstanding Travelled to Thailand with Singapore Airlines and they were absolutely fantastic. Economy class felt like first class. Plenty of room with the seats, excellent entertainment and the food was superb, I would 100% use them again
label: positive

text: Nightmare I booked a flight with Singapore Airlines sfo to Dhaka. I had a transit in hongkong that they didn’t Flag that i need a visa for hong kong with a Bangladeshi passport. I called the customer service to inquire but they didn’t provide that information. Then when I went to board my flight.. they couldn’t board me. They also couldn’t transfer or upgrade from the airport. Just amazing. Then when I called the customer service.. talking to perhaps the worst customer service out there ( including the US ones) ..I had to pay 1100 dollars. Just unreal.
label: negative

text: First time and great experience First time flying with Singapore Airlines. Although a short 2.5 hour flight from Bangkok to Singapore, it was a pleasant flight, great service and good food.
label: positive

text: Best Airline Comfortable flight even when passing turbulence. Food was delicious, good attitude of the steward and stewardess although I only fly economy class.
label: positive

text: Best flight We've flown Premium Economy with several airline companies, and specifically the A380, and Singapore Airlines rates No.1 with us. We loved the extra large leg rest, not just a foot rest, and the compartments at the side of the seats to store books, glasses, pens,etc. The cabin crew were delightful, food was good and the flight was excellent.
label: positive

text: Manchester to Singapore flight of 12 hours 55 minutes literally flew by, helped by a decent seat but mainly because of stewardess Shirin. It was an absolute delight being served by her, she was friendly, helpful but at all times very professional. The only disappointing issue on the flight was the food which was of a poor quality and tasteless. The onward flight from Singapore was good but again the food on this flight was dreadful. My overall thoughts on this journey were very positive other than food and on that basis I have already booked again for later in the year.
label: positive

text: Love it Singapore airline is always my first choice whenever I go. Comfort and leisure environment. Cabin crew very professional and helpful. Food quality is high and taste good. In flight entertainment just nice.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline Worth the value . We've board the new plane, where the seats come with black furnishing looking modern and sleek. The entertainment system was great, up-to-dated movie and music. The ear pierce given out upon boarding , the plug comes in size which i think is very attentive.
label: positive

text: Business Class I booked Singapore Airlines since my boss insisted on traveling on them. Whilst I’ve no problems with SQ, I would’ve travelled with Cathay since I’m a one world member and would’ve preferred to accumulate points under my FlySmiles number. Nonetheless, SQ we flew from Colombo - Singapore - Perth. Colombo to Singapore sector is serviced by an aging 330 and the seats were very narrow. The Singapore to Perth was serviced by a 777, where the seats was newer and was the latest product offering. I found the newer product very difficult to stretch out since I’m over 6 feet tall and one must at an angle. This was a difficulty and turning the seat into a bed needs you to get up and press all types of buttons where I was too lazy to do so. Thanks to the Book the Cook service, I was able to enjoy some fabulous lamb shanks. The food was excellent and the service, as being Singaporeans, was efficient. After flying Qatar last year, I consider the SQ service as extremely efficient but very impersonal.
label: neutral

text: Never again My sister and our partners booked our flights for our family holiday 10 months before our trip so we could be on the same flights and get the window seats we always prefer. I booked business and my sister booked premium economy and our flights went via Singpaore with a one hour layover. A few months later Singapore took premuim economy off our flight and moved my sister and partner to a flight that them meant they had a 4 hour layover in Singapore and we had to purchase separate airport transfers. A short time after that they reinstated premium economy but DID NOT offer my sister and her partner their original flights/saets back. We have tried continuously to get them back on their original flights and Singapore have not helped at all. We have emailed and called. Obviously they do not care and are happy for our family trip to now cost more for transfers and inflict an uneccessary 4 hour airport layover onto passengers with NOTHING offered to make this situation better. The bare minium would be lounge access for the four hour layover but no nothing. It is not fair that I will board my flight and see the seats my sister and her partner booked and should be seated in only for them to be filled by others who booked much later than them!! Not fair Singapore Airlines! We travel Internationally at least twice a year but all our family will avoid Singapore Airlines because they do not show any semblance of caring. It is all about the money.
label: negative

text: Meal service was very slow I took Singapore Airlines flying from Hong Kong to Jakarta by transit in Singapore on 15 October 2018. The service from HK to Singapore had run smooth. But it was not similar from Singapore to Jakarta. By SQ 968, it supposed to take off at 8.55 pm in Singapore time, but then delay for 30 minutes. During flying, it was time to provide meals for all passengers, but I just realized that the flight attendants did it late in start. With 1 hour 45 minutes flying time, I was certain that it supposed to be enough time for them to do an excellent meal service. But in the actual conditions, seems that all flight attendants had no well plan to do it. They went rush to provide meals, and served it very slow. I was thinking that it must be done row by row until reached the end row. But, they did it randomly. Some rows had complete meals, but the rows behind those had no meals at all. With 30 minutes left before landing and the pilot announced that the flight would land soon, more than half passengers just received their meals. You could imagine that they must eat their food in a rush time including me. And awkwardly, the flight attendants seems panic, tried to get all food trays from passengers while some passengers had still eaten, and some others didn't finish the food. Couldn't imagine by myself that the 5-star airlines apparently had weakness in this concern.
label: negative

text: We arrived in Paris today flying SYD-SIN-CDG both legs on the A380. We were seated in upper deck economy which is much better than the lower deck (quieter less people smaller seat configuration). The staff service on both legs was excellent - lots of drink runs and when I discovered one of the earphones on my headset wasn't working I was promptly given a new one. Staff always had a smile and were polite. Seats comfortable food not too bad for economy. Only drawback was the entertainment system could have had more movies.
label: positive

text: Above and beyond gate service My girlfriend and I got into some trouble on our trip to Asia as our COVID test wasn’t accepted by our destination, AND we didn’t have any of our documentation (~20 documents at the time) in a hard copy form, which we realised 2 hours before departure for the international leg of our journey. Having to find a place to get the right kind of test in a city that we are unfamiliar with was pretty tough, and our documents were all over the place, too. We wouldn’t have made it on time, if not for Neda, our lovely agent from Singapore Airlines, who kept the check-in desk open for us ~25 minutes past the closing time, doing her best to manage our printing and sorting. We ran into Neda again at the gate, which she kept open for us another ~20 minutes longer than it was supposed to be, because our COVID test hadn’t arrived on time, simultaneously coordinating expectations with the rest of the staff on the radio, hotspotting us from her phone, and apologising that we had to go through all that. The results miraculously came in and we made our flight which miraculously took off just a little bit late.
label: positive

text: One of the best airlines Red Eye flight from Singapore to Seoul. It was a great flight from start to land. The service is great and the seat was comfortable. The seat can be make into a comfortable make shift bed which allows the traveler to have a good rest while on board the plane. The entertainment on board has a good selection hence you never get bored. SIA is definitely a great way to fly
label: positive

text: Luggage Delay This is the second time that our luggage got delayed. (2 out of 3) A few years ago, our luggage got delayed at arriving to UK and very recently, it got delayed again arriving to the Philippines from Singapore (Silk Air) by a day. Not on really for a supposedly the best airline in the world. Never encountered this problem with other airlines and hopefully never will. Calling them at Singapore from UK to report the issue incurred massive international phone bill which will offset their £35 compensation they offer.
label: neutral

text: Fantastic flight ... outstanding service! If you have the opportunity to fly with Singapore Airlines you must! The flight crew were attentive. The seating space was roomy for an average sized person and we had plenty of leg room during the flight. In flight entertainment was abundant including current movies, television series, and video games. There were two full meals provided on the flight with snacks in between and alcohol was included.
label: positive

text: Racist staff and not friendly Very poor sevice come with racist... not friendly and not helpful..i never expected this thing happen to me on that day..i thought singapore is a good country but im totally wrong..
label: negative

text: BNE-SIN-CMB-SIN-BNE in Economy Class. Flew A330 on all legs. Seats were comfortable cabin crew were polite and friendly and entertainment was great. If there was any complaints it would be the lack of leg-room (I am 6ft 2') although it may be more than enough for a shorter person. Would definitely fly with again.
label: positive

text: Fantastic service Never flown with this airline before but will definitely use again. Fantastic service on board with nice in-flight meals and drinks. Flight crew were very attentive nothing too much trouble. Positives 1. Nice seats 2. Good in-flight entertainment 3. Nice food and drinks Negatives 1. None really
label: positive

text: Ruined a trip of a lifetime for myself, wife and family. From cancelling our paid seats, that were booked early, we were then separated on the flight. Some of our baggage was left behind, and a absolutely nightmare trying to sort. Staff on plane and at airports not interested and give the feeling that they did not want to be there.
label: negative

text: Good value, packaged with Scoot flight to Athens Looking for the quickest and most reasonable price for our annual sojourn, Brisbane to Athens flight. We booked via an agent a package, Brisbane to Singapore with Singapore Airlines then Singapore to Athens on Scoot. For the Brisbane, Singapore leg, we pre booked our seats in advance. We found the seat pitch quite narrow. My wife is not quite 150cm tall and her knees touched the seat in front. Similarly the tv monitors were very close. Fortunately the people in front of us did not put their seats back. The entertainment system was great with a selection of recent movie releases. The flight attendants were polite and nothing was a problem. Drink carts and drink service was great. However the quality and description of the food described on the menu and the slop that we were served were totally different. The aeroplane and flight were of the standard to be expected from Singapore Airlines. The next leg of our flight on Scoot was uneventful. Our package included 30kg of luggage plus carry on, meals and a blanket. We opted to pay an extra $50 per seat for the Scoot in Silence zone. The “Silent Zone” was behind the Business Class area. It was very quiet and isolated from the Economy section. As it is a low budget airline there were no in-seat TV monitors. However data can be accessed on board for fee. The seats were comfortable and seemed to have a larger Pitch than our Singapore Airlines flight. As part of our package we received a very smart blanket. The food included in the package was non descript and flavourless. The upside of this package is, this is a very economical and quick way to get from Brisbane to Athens. The aeroplane was fairly new. Both the Brisbane to Singapore and the Singapore to Athens legs are quick, but as the layover in Singapore was quite long we opted to stay an extra day. Apart for the poor quality food on both Singapore and Scoot flights the trip represented value for money!
label: positive

text: No compensation for a broken chair on a long flight On my flight back from Kuala Lumpur to Amsterdam I was given a broken chair that was unable to recline. Three stewards have reviewed the chair and regrettably informed me that the chair was indeed broken and no other seat was available on the fully booked plane. I was told I will be receiving compensation for the services not provided by email. What followed was disgusting. I received a voucher for the Singapore Airlines KrissStore of only 100 Singaporean dollar of a 1500 euro retour flight. Furthermore, the shop is outrageously expensive compared to local stores, most items are not deliverable to my country and if they are Shipping costs are 65+ Singaporean Dollar excluding Tax fees. After not providing the services you paid for they will try and steal more money from you through the bogus store compensation. After months of discussing and waiting through email support they state there is nothing they can do because there is no medical proof of injury due to the broken chair. Never again Singapore Airline.
label: negative

text: Carina 217 Excellent. Airline. Comfortable and very friendly hostess. You feel safe traveling Singapore airline which I have many times. One little criticism is that the food can be better and bread rolls were hard and icy cold. All round great airline
label: positive

text: Best Flight to fly with small kids Was about to join the long queue to board and was approached by the staff to ask us to board the flight first!! Because I am with a young kid, so to let us settle down better they allow us to board first and toys to keep the child entertained! And was always there to check if you need any help.
label: positive

text: Very good Flight and Service! Singapore Airlines is my preferred airline. Very competitive pricing, airline safety, friendly and professional cabin crews. The food is always at it's best with a variety and quality on the menu! I can only recommend the Airline and its staff!
label: positive

text: Very Professional Service I found the service from Boarding to Landing is extremely professional. Quite a few times, I traveled with SQ and I found the services are very standardized and consistent. Airline timetable, food quality, cleanliness, professionalism from the cabin crew, entertainment system all are adequate for a very great and comfortable journey. One thing i loved most that they tell you which food is Halal and which is not. Then it's your choice. I recommend this airline for family travel as well. They are very caring about the kids.
label: positive

text: Best Airline in the World Recently I flew Singapore Airlines from Mumbai to Seoul. Their Economy class is equivalent to Business Class of many other airlines. Cabin crew was very friendly and helpful. Even after dimming the lights the cabin crew member will keep serving beverages like water or juice to keep you hydrated during the flight. Will definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Service in Style I travelled with my family. We were treated to great service on board. Beautiful people, friendly service, relaxing and enjoyable
label: positive

text: You Will Not Go Hungry This is my first time flying Singapore Airlines. Now I understand why it is highly rated. Check In was a breeze, the distance between seats were comfortable, the flight attendants looked gorgeous and dignified. They were also very helpful. They served a meal from Manila to Changi and another meal from Changi to Phuket. Food was very good. Love this airline!
label: positive

text: Great in flight experience but pooor customer service otherwise. We had a great inflight experience. The cabin crew was attentive and the plane accommodations were comfortable. However my over the phone experiences with this Airline was horrible. Long wait times (over an hour) and there didn't seem to be any urgency to attend to customer service needs.
label: neutral

text: America The flight was on time and staff extremely helpful.. Seats comfortable. Plane was clean.. I loved the food.. Very fresh and great choice.. Cabin crew were so helpful..
label: positive

text: Business trip to LA The seat is very comfortable, food is good and services is excellent. I forgot to take my thermos flask while leaving the plane and the air steward actually run to locate me to return the flask.
label: positive

text: Back on SQ after a long absence It was good to be back on SQ again after quite a long absence and far too many flights on budget airlines. Maybe that's why I appreciated this more than usual. Food was decent, service was professional and efficient, and I had an empty seat next to me. Online check-in worked well and the flight was on time. Operated on a B777-200ER with the older style fit-out, but still in good condition. All good over all.
label: positive

text: Service Travelling yesterday to Australia to visit my daughter and new grandson, went economy class via Singapore,long first leg (13.5 hrs), but comfortable seats,very good entertainment, very good service from friendly cabin staff. Singapore airport big,friendly,with excellent facilities.
label: positive

text: Class Wow!! Wonderful service provided by some very beautiful ladies. Everything was perfect. Highly recommend this airlines.
label: positive

text: Very poor service, was told not to take my cabin luggage onto business class, but all the bags in the plane including economy were bigger. Cabin crew brought the wrong dinner and basically told me to eat it, only replaced when I did not. Seat not able to got flat, very poor seating configuration for someone over 6’.
label: negative

text: Short flight experience Though it's just for a short flight, I really love it. In flight entertainment is up to date, food is delicious, seat is really comfortable. Check in process is good.
label: positive

text: Holiday Checked in on line.30kg luggage Clean and comfortable seating areaGood in flight foodAlcoholic drinks included
label: positive

text: Very good airline but rated the world’s best??? We flew two long legs and two short legs with SQ. Overall all flights were good. All the basics were well done from check in to boarding and during the flight. Staff were polite and friendly. Food was average. There was little to complain about. However was anything a standout? No. Do other airlines like Cathay, Qantas etc do just as good a job? Yes. So, I would recommend SQ but I wouldn’t say it’s the best airline in the world which is what it was rated in the last two years.
label: positive

text: What has happen to Singapore AirlinesConstanly changing precooked flights We have previously flown with SA and been impressed by the quality of both service and overall operations.Unfortunately since the Pandemic things seem to have gone wrong. We flew to Cairns in Au last April 2022 but even before we left our flight times and dates were changed twice leaving us having to make last minute changes to accommodation and car rental at extra cost.Then they lost my suitcase for 12 days and I spent everyday trying to reach reps in various parts of Australia who seemed to only operate on mobile phones.Eventually after I had tracked the case to The Whitsunday Islands and spent several days talking to Greg,one of only three members of staff at the tiny airport it suddenly appeared on the drive of my daughters house with no notice or explanation! I was paid the grand sum of $12.45 per day as compensation after complaining. Unfortunately we had already booked two more retur flights with SA and have just returned from our latestwhich was to spend Xmas with family in AU. This too was changed several times with the initial change giving us a return date of Christmas Day! I have every sympathy with the poor young people in the contact centre who seem to have to continually cope with frustrated customers but seem to have little control over the ever changing schedule.We eventually found ourselves moved to a return flight on New Year's Eve which of course wrecked any New Year plans. This week I received two more emails from SA which changed both our outbound and return flights booked for this April,the latter change leaving us with an unwanted two day layover in Singapore where we were expected to arrange and pay for our own hotelAfter further extended calls to the contact centre we have been offered another date.However . this rearrangement offered means no extended layover but a return date of the 5th June when our original booking was for the 22nd May! What is going on.Is the published schedule simply a work of fiction. All the original flights were paid for and confirmed and booked direct with SA. But all have been changed to less convenient and wildly different dates with no explanation or compensation.
label: negative

text: One hour of monotonous music with poor customer service After sitting on the phone for one hour, while listening to music which was on a continuous loop - I found myself wanting to rip the very hair from my scalp. The call centers could barely speak coherent English, which only made the issue more difficult. We asked to speak to their manager, but alas, they didn't know what that was. And what was even more entertaining, they hung up whilst we were on hold! Clearly the company lavishes itself on it's own luxuries of being one of the most renowned airlines in the world, but obviously lacks common sense when it comes to being decent human beings that can manage a customer with getting their flights booked and confirmed! We are still attempting to get this flight confirmed, booked and ready to go - we have a time limit till the end of the day as the tickets are getting issued at 11pm tonight, but so far, it seems that the flight we paid good money for - won't even be for us.
