Thank you Singapore airlines, for your incompetent customer service which makes those with the strongest of wills want to give up on life. This somehow makes Tiger airlines and Jet Star seem more reputable. Not good.
label: negative

text: Family reunion Had an excellent flight on the 350-900 Service was excellent and the food was Just as good. Very roomy seats, The toilets were always clean
label: positive

text: Great flight Good flight the staff were very friendly, meals were fine we almost missed our plane due to bad train experience from Singapore but they managed to get us through. Can not fault them. There is a bit of leg room on the plane (dream liner)
label: positive

text: Top quality airline This is the first time I had flown with Singapore Airlines and I was suitably impressed. The lady at check in at Sydney airport was very helpful and made the process quick and easy. The on flight staff were friendly and efficient, the food on board was excellent and the flight on board an A380 was amazing . Would not hesitate to fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Good flight from London to Perth via Singapore Last week I flew Singapore Airlines from London Heathrow to Perth, with a stopover in Singapore Changi airport. The first leg of the journey (LHR - SIN) was fantastic, the flight left (and arrived) ahead of schedule, thanks to a speedy boarding process. The plane was modern and comfy and in Economy, passengers received the standard pillow and blanket, along with a toothbrush and a warm pair of socks for the flight, which I thought was a nice touch! The staff were very helpful and friendly. Food was served at three occasions and was very tasty (I had Gluten-Free meals but it seemed like there were also good options for those without dietary requirements!) The entertainment was pretty good, there were quite a few new releases (film and TV) but I had unfortunately already seen most of them! All in all, the first leg was fantastic. The second part of my journey was (SIN to PER) a little disappointing, especially following the great 1st flight.. The staff were friendly but quite disorganised, meaning that prep for taxiing and take-off took a while, as did the food service. We only had one meal, which was pretty tasty but faced with a number of special diet requests, the staff seemed underprepared. This resulted in everyone waiting for their food for a very long time (especially those with no specific diet needs). The entertainment was the same as on the first flight. I would also add that I had to wipe down my tray table, armrest and entertainment remote with sanitiser on flight no. 2, as they did not seem clean at all :( Overall I had a good experience and I would certainly recommend flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines ..Again! I admit to bias but still cannot deny that SQ does deserve the accolades it is showered with ! The recent flight I took only reaffirmed my loyalty - I refer particularly to the ground staff’s assistance in retrieving a checked baggage I had left behind after I had left the security area and checked into the adjacent hotel at Haneda. It was all done within a short space of time and self- imposed anxiety overcome, it became a pleasant experience I’d “A Great Way to Fly!” SQ, try and Ensure Premium Economy does not feel like the “sandwich class” on both outward/inward bound sectors the seats don’t recline easily or comfortably - I hope the cabin crew fed back !
label: positive

text: No Wonder Why Its #1 First off Singapore Airport is one of the best in the world. Lots of shops, resting places, an inside bird & butterfly enclosure with lots of space. The pre board area has many comfortable seats and places to use free wifi. The plane was clean, safe music played as we boarded. We were lucky and were seated in the emergency row. Lots of leg room. We I plugged in there were 320 movies to watch, music to listen to or TV shows to catch up on. As luck had it when they were serving lunch they ran out of the fish and chicken we had ordered. No problem, the head steward went into first class and brought us meals from there. Yum yum! There were no other problems, smooth flight and easy exit when we arrived in Taipei. One last thing to mention, the flight attendants were all great and wear really nice uniforms.
label: positive

text: Bad Policies, Slow Service Incessant reminders to wear a mask and pull it up over your nose. All while being asked to share a medical exemption if you don't (which is illegal by the way to ask for and can be kept private between yourself and Dr. if you wish, like any medical information). Not to mention the masks they hand out are completely ineffective as are 99% of all masks used (cloth, N95, surgical). Just search on duck duck go, 150 studies proving masks are completely ineffective and often increase transmission (don't get your info / commentary from news sources / gov sites). So this political issue, passed onto airlines to mandate is deplorable with no leadership by a private comoany nor evidence based logic. Just wear it and be good. Just because they tell you to, doesn't mean it's right or lawful because it's not. Meals also took forever to be collected so sat for way too long while everyone just wanted to get back to sleep. One positive, ran on time.
label: negative

text: Dropped the ball My dear SQ I have to advise the check in at LHR T2 was the slowest I have encountered in nearly 20 years of Asia travel on your airline Second the T2 lounge requires a complete staff training exercise as there was close to zero service and thought Overall why is SQ slipping from the standards set years back so much? Certainly SQ knows how to charge but the delivery is far from the $ for sure ! Time to pick up the game !
label: negative

text: Suites on the A380 are in terms of comfort and layout 100% better than on the SQ 777 although the high standard of service remains the same for both aircraft. Lovely welcome from the staff and the cabin crew are exceptionally well presented in grooming and demeanour. I also am appreciative that I was addressed by my title and surname as I am of that older generation that appreciates such niceties. The suite very comfortable and lovely to have a seperate bed. The two bathrooms are spacious with many amenities and the food glorious. A very special thank you to senior flight crew Tasha (from Indonesia) who was so friendly and epitomised all that is excellent with SQ and also to Kelvin whom I think was the flight manager.
label: positive

text: Good airline, good price flight I booked 5 months in advance on Travel Trolley and got my ticket for £642 which was excellent. Singapore Airlines is a really good airline, and the stop over at Changi airport is fine. Buy Duty Free at Changi! I fly this route often and find that taking a night flight often means that there are empty seats so I've usually had a row to myself. The food is excellent and the cabin crew are usually very friendly. The entertainment is disappointing in my opinion so I download stuff onto my laptop before flying. Also irritating is the fact that to book a seat you have to pay. Luggage allowance is a generous 30kg.
label: positive

text: Excellent, Comfortable & Reliable Airline Flying with Singapore Airlines especially long distance travel have always been a great experience. I am referring to flying on Business Class. Even better if travelling on the A380. The service was excellent and good options with regards to meals as well as food & beverages offered. The flight attendants were extremely polite, helpful and ensure the passengers are feeling good. They go at periodic intervals to check whether we need any drinks or special requests. The seats are very comfortable, spacious and not congested. Coupled with wide selection of inflight movies. All in all an enjoyable flight. Singapore Airlines will be my priority airline option for future long distance travel.
label: positive

text: Great Airline I love flying with Singapore airlines one of my favourite. The Flight attendants are elegant and classy and handle themselves with poise. They are efficient and help as quickly as possible when needed. Just wish there was more leg room but I feel thats an issue with all airclafts.
label: positive

text: Ordinary The plane was comfortable and the crew friendly but the breakfast was really diappointing for a flight so early in the morning. Next time I will make sure I have breakfast before I board.
label: positive

text: Big disappointment! Not the airline it used to be ,very unfortunate.. We use to fly Singapore airline regularly ...normally service and approach was OK . This time total opposite From Frankfurt to Singapore the aeroplane was not clean ; carpet etc ,but we tried to ignore and fall a sleep .However the second half of our trip was even a bigger disappointment. We were simply told :if we are asking for Dinner there wont be breakfast for us .....??????If we choose breakfast it wont be served dinner ????? For a very reputable airline paying $15000.00 very unusual.Nil beverages. What is happening :administration is going wrong ????
label: negative

text: Excellent This was a happy and comfortable flight. There wasn't a great deal of leg room, but with an aisle seat and an afternoon flight this wasn't a problem.
label: positive

text: Jakarta to Singapore. This was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines and I was impressed. The flight was on time, the cabin crew was friendly and courteous. The cabin was really clean. It was a short haul flight which only lasted for 1 hr 45 mnt but really enjoyable. The food was decent for a short haul flight. It has 3-3-3 seat arrangement which is great and the legroom was spacious. I wish they could improve more on the flight entertainment system because even though the movie selection was great and had many new titles the touch screen was not responsive and the earphones were not comfortable enough
label: positive

text: Another excellent Flight Very smooth flight. Excellent service and as we had not pre booked our seats was very pleased that th3 ground staff went out of their way to give us both aisle seats with empty seats in between.
label: positive

text: I do not recommend booking a flight with Singapore Airlines. I am very disappointed with your ground staff at Tan Son Nhat International Airport .I had a horrible experience at the check-in counter. My flight was SGN to Zurich. ground staff, Ms.Pham thi Hoang Anh, had no idea of the regulations and entry requirements of foreign nationals to Switzerland. A very low level of knowledge and poor service. MsPham thi Hoang Anh,told me that Israelis must show their departure flight from Switzerland. Israeli citizens do not need exit flight tickets from Switzerland. She updated me that she had called the manager of Singapore Airlines and it would take him more than two hours. Maybe more I told her I would miss my flight. I felt I was having a heart attack! I asked him to give me the boarding pass. She refused! I do not recommend booking a flight with Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Service !! Always count on the friendly service with a wide smile with singapore airlines. I have flown a number of airlines, and I rank Singapore airlines for a pleasant trip, short or long haul. The food is good as well and the entertainment system caters to a wide range of ethnicity.
label: positive

text: Zero reply from Singapore airlines since 22nd December 2022 It’s extremely disappointing that an airline like Singapore airlines has not responded at all regarding late baggage & broken golf club! My review & 3 emails to Singapore Airways customer service is silent. Not exactly the so called high customer service they market themselves 🥵🥵🥵
label: negative

text: Excellent and prompt service Lost my passport and was all nervous, but Lea Martin əz, ground supervisor knew exactly what I needed and made it an ease. On actual day of flight Ray, ground crew was again professional and efficient. A great way to fly!!
label: positive

text: MNL-SIN return with 3 kids. Fantastic airline despite using old equipment (777-200) for the regional route. Kids meals very tasty that even my daughter who is a very picky eater had no problems finishing the generous portions. Specialised headsets for the kids as well as some activity materials too. IFE acceptable and adequate to keep the young ones entertained for the 3 hour flight. Well worth the money.
label: positive

text: Cancelled flight and would not rebook Singapore Airlines cancelled the flight and was placed on a waitlist for a new flight, blocking all the website functions from cancelling or changing flights. After contacting them three times (email twice and chat function once) h and waiting two weeks for a response, I have still not received a call or new flights. As the last straw, I bought a local sim card and tried calling the helpline. I was on hold for an hour, and then the line disconnected. I understand things might be difficult if I want to change my flights, but I am shocked at the response from Singapore when they cancelled the flights. I will never fly with this carrier again.
label: negative

text: Amazing flight It was the best flight ever!!! The air hostesses were very sweet smiley and beautiful! The food was excellent!!!!
label: positive

text: Simply the best ! first time with Singapore Airlines and will not be my last. Exceptional staff and customer service. Can not find any fault. The service and attention details made the two long flights seem easy. The food was superb. the selection of drinks - non alcoholic and alcoholic was great. The snacks available was also impressive. The seat pitch was good. The entertainment on offer was also great. I can see why they are the worlds best airline. We have flown with many other airlines but Singapore Airlines is without doubt the best from our experience.
label: positive

text: Top Class service from an Airline that never fails to deliver excellence in all departments Everything about SQ spells Class. The aircraft interiors are well maintained, the hot towels in Economy are a luxury, the food choices are very good, the smiles on the faces of the attendants never fade, the punctuality is second to none, the IFE is top of the Line. Very difficult to pick any negatives with this airline. Definitely a great way to fly. Cheers
label: positive

text: Along way home I am not keen on long haul flights. We chose Singapore for their hospitality and all other aspects of our flight home.
label: positive

text: I love the service but not the breakfast The seats was super comfortable I never sleep because of this, but on this airplane I sleep super well, the entertainment was really good, but the breakfast was too heavy, I didn't like the eggs and sausages but I try the noodles and were good, I think the smell of the brekkie in the morning in the whole airplane was too much, not only for me.
label: positive

text: Mrs Perfect flights. Wonderful crew. Even sang happy birthday to my husband. Received cake and candles. Highly recommend
label: positive

text: Ordinary for business class Once again business class in Singapore airlines has dropped over the last few years. Food is not very appealing. The business class lounge in Singapore is not nearly the standard of the one at Heathrow. The food and beverage at the Singapore Lounge Heathrow is of a much higher quality. Also the staff in the business class lounge in Heathrow were exceptional as they helped us with our boarding passes.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Flew from Delhi to Singapore on the 19th of Feb in Premier Economy & returned on the 25th. The staff was indifferent, the food both ways was very poor & the drinks were of poor choice. Very poor show SA
label: negative

text: consistency always been excellent,theres no wonder why people talk about this airline,salute and excellency of service.
label: positive

text: Could not access in flight entertainment or checkin online Could not check in on line - kept receiving error message. Paid extra for forward seats but could not get inflight movies for first three hours of the flight. The plane was not really clean with left overs from last flight. Krisworld magazine all ripped and the lamb pie well below standard you would expect of Airline rated number 1 in the world. First flight with Singapore Airlines and memorable for all the wrong reasons. Also a Kris Flyer member for 2 months and still not received membership card
label: negative

text: Below standard Flew return Europe business class. Dreadful experience both ways. Broken seats, old planes, running repairs with blankets filling in seat gaps, poor customer service, sub standard complaint procedure and limited food options some legs. A huge fall from grace for this airline. Have switched allegiance to Qatar and Qantas.
label: negative

text: Ample leg room, friendly staff, great meal selections This was the first time we flew Singapore Airlines and we were particularly impressed with the attentive staff. Throughout the night staff came up and down the aisles with water, juice or any other beverages one might request. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We felt there was more leg room than on other airlines we have used and the meals were especially tasty.
label: positive

text: Typically enjoyable flight and service BNE lounge had a good variety of tasty options, the plane left on time and food was OK. The entree and dessert not wonderful but the fillet steak for a main was very good. Service was consistently responsive. Seats were the previous version of Business Class where you have to sleep on an angle and they lack comfort when not sitting up. Landed on time and bags were out quickly.
label: positive

text: Family-friendly and great air crews I've traveled with kids on Air Asia so of course the difference would colossal. But never thought it could be this good and left long-lasting impression on us. The price is almost the same with Air Asia, taking into account bulkhead seats, food and luggage - but the service is way better. Firstly, the air stewardess really made us feel like home, with great service and endless smile. Even when I am stressed out with handling two kids under 4, they're always cheerful and helpful which made the stress went away instantly. They provided toys for my kids, and there was a time when I was handful, they offered to clean my baby bottle. They are also very attentive, offering to reserve my food while I take turn with my husband feeding our boys. They also offered complimentary seats with bassinet for the whole family, which has large legroom, enough for my kids to play on the floor. As well, they way they designed the seats on the bulkhead row, allow for a flexible arms rest instead of fixed one, which I can pull up, and allow my eldest son to lie on me. The food, despite Muslim Meal are very tasty, unlike other airlines who tend to serve sub-quality halal food. But I would complain on the selection for the baby jar food, which I would suggest to offer halal ones as well (or at least seafood or vegetarian). They offered us two jarred baby food with beef, and one with mixed fruits. Unfortunately I can only feed my son the mixed fruits one. Luckily I have already brought pouch food to last for the whole flight. As well, they only serve lunch about an hour after take off (around 3 pm SIN time), and only crackers before arriving around 9.20 pm (8.20 pm SIN time). By the time we've arrived with the immigration, picking up the luggage and chasing for the last train from the airport, it is already late in Osaka and past our dinner time and seriously hungry. We had to feed our boys while queuing up for the immigration. Luckily the stewardess gave us some more biscuits before touch down noticing how cranky our boys are from hunger. Would suggest to at least serve sandwich or pies before arriving. Regardless, will definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: The days of free upgrades have gone, bidding for Premium Econ Singapore air now offer you a bidding lottery to upgrade a class on available sectors. We guessed a fair price for the final leg of our journey from Singapore to Brisbane and were successful in moving to Premium Economy. Very much more comfortable seats than economy, with lots of leg room. Meals not much difference. However we are now converts and may well choose premium Economy for the longer legs Singapore to London and reverse. This also would let you skip the horrendous Heathrow bag drop (took us 2 hours in a queue - premium economy check in with Business class - no queue at all!
label: positive

text: Utter waste of time Am currently stuck in the plane from CGK to SIN. Flight was supposed to depart at 210pm but was delayed to 3pm due to bad weather in Singapore. What??? If we had flown, could the skies not have cleared by the time we reached Singapore which is 1.5 hours away? By the time 3pm came, was informed that it be (maybe) another 1.5 hours before we can take off. As I said, we could have touched down at Changi by the time we even get to fly now. Would definitely not recommend SQ because of this in my mind, unnecessary delay.
label: negative

text: Very deceptive, crap service, not covid safe, disgusting food, paid 9 dollars for water I went from phnom penh to Singapore then to Singapore to Melbourne. From Singapore to Melbourne 300 mls of water cost 9dollars, the seats were hard and cramped, the meal was absolutely disgusting and no attempt had been made to hide it was microwaved, the ventilation felt poor (definitely not covid safe), no entertainment. Worst flight experience ever. Staff were extremely unfriendly at the luggage drop off. When I went from Melbourne to Singapore the Australian women who worked for the company was yelling at us like we were cattle and she had a very patronising tone with some other customers which I felt was almost racist. This occurred because Singapore airlines changed my flight from Singapore to scoot. They still charged me as though it was a Singapore airlines flight. They even printed my ticket out with the Singapore Airlines logo. I don't get why companies can't just be straight up honest with you about there product? Like if it was going to be a scoot flight then just say that? I'm sure it was written in the fine print, which covers them in other areas, but not in common decency. They even printed "Singapore airlines" on my boarding past. Anyway, in my books definitely not a good, reliable high quality company. They will change your flights around and don't care about quality.
label: negative

text: Fantastic Layover Services The crew are just amazing. I eventually planned a long layover to go for sight seeing in Singapore. At the airport, they offer free tours, or you can just use the train connected to the airport and go for a quick peek to famous spots. The place has more to offer and will definitely be back for a longer period.
label: positive

text: Flight to London Very efficient crew. Excellent service. Good food and drinks! Would fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Flawless!! Flew SQ 406 from Singapore to Delhi. Travelled in the A380 Upper Deck. The service, the food, the announcements, the drinks, the seat comfort, the in-flight entertainment, the selection of magazines - everything deserves five stars. No question of trying any other airline if SQ is one of the options - go for it without thinking twice!
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight I've always been very proud of Singapore Airlines being Singapore's own International Airline. I would like to commend on a senior crew which for the 1st time I have very good impression of how this senior steward tried to make contact and he was very friendly and made passengers who walked past him felt so comfortable and at ease. He will cracked some jokes and this definitely helps those who have flight phobia to felt at ease. He was also very helpful and offered passengers who needed help willingly. Though my flight was just a short flight of about 2 hours, I would say, this is 1 of the BEST experience I had with Singapore Airlines. Thank you for that friendly gestures and your kind & helpful attitude in serving.
label: positive

text: Still one of the best I’d heard a couple of reports that SA had gone downhill a bit but I’d had no issues in previous flights myself but was interested to see how they would do as I hadn’t flown with them for a couple of years. I am happy to report that I found the seats comfortable and the service excellent. I was particularly impressed with Valerie (in flight crew) who was charming and appeared genuinely happy to help with anything. Having said that all the crew were pleasant and worked hard. The reason I have given 4 stars and not 5 is purely because the flight was cold. The crew had tried to adjust the air con but couldn’t - even they were cold! So very happy to have had a good flight but take layers for the possible air con extremes!
label: positive

text: Night and Day with BA - Wow, thank you! Regular BA flyer (nothing wrong with them, by the way) but my experience with Singapore Airlines has blown me away. Helped me with a premium economy multi-trip plan, which BA doesn't have on its website, and then gave us front row seats when it wasn't possible to seat us together during one leg of our flights. Took about 45 seconds for someone to pick up the phone, and they did all this proactively and called me back the next day. I wasn't expecting this level of service but was blown away. Shout out to Evi, thank you!
label: positive

text: best flight to japan This was a wonderful flight. We flew from LAX to Tokyo Japan. The flight is 12 hours. It honestly didn't feel like 12 hours with all the meals, snacks, movies, and hot towels. We were served two meals and numerous snacks. The crew was awesome! They were very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. It was a little cramped but not unbearable. I was able to get comfortable and nap so not to bad. I would definitely fly on Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Bad customer service I booked with first name , and last name . Don’t have middle name . I asked them a lot of time to help me to ask middle name . But no one to help me . I tried to contact more than ten time , waste more than a moth , but no one help me to resolve it .
label: negative

text: Interesting Experience Where was the up beat and positive enthusiasm that SQ is always known for, one might ask, had you been on SQ 221 on the 31st of July 2018. Something lacked in the service which made the flight forgettable even though it was on their latest A388 operating the inaugural flight that very day! The food? Forgettable to say the least. Biggest disappointment being the cold breakfast they served. While the seating, cleanliness and IFE prove that the airline well and truly deserves its repute as a 5 star airline, the service left a little bit to be desired.
label: positive

text: Thank you Singapore Airlines Great flight, friendly and professional cabin staff made the trip very pleasant. We would definitely recommend Singapore Airlines, one of the best we’ve experienced. Communication was good, also the meals and refreshments.
label: positive

text: Not as good as I was expecting This is not my 1st time travelling through Singapore airlines. But the experience that I had this time was not good. I won't say it was worst but the amount of service they used to provide before is not the same as now. Food doesn't taste good as before.
label: neutral

text: Great way to fly as compared to other long range flights, I have to mention SIA as the top choice to travel within Asia
label: positive

text: Great experience flying from Hanoi to Singapore We were lucky as it was the launch of A350 aircraft for this route by SIA. To my 5 year old's great delight, everyone was given a SIA A350 toy bear as souvenir for the launch. For me, it was a great delight because there's personal entertainment center provided now (most airlines don't have this for short haul). My kid just entertained himself by jumping movies in kid channel and leave me be with with my own channel. The food was tasty (love the curry chicken and mash potatoes). Kid was a little disappointed as I told him there'd be ice scream, just like Silkair but it's not available. Air crews as usual are nice and courteous, they give kids their food first so it's great (no more Mommy, when it is my turn for food, I'm Huuuunnngggry...). Traveling with kid short haul would be so easy now :)
label: positive

text: Bring on the A350!! Connecting to ANA Good food preordered by Book the Cook Lots of Charles Heidsieck champagne but for 7 hours this business class with slant beds is very dated Good lounges in ADL and Sin Will be much better when they put the A350 on this route
label: neutral

text: Long haul fllght Was travelling in premium economy class for return trip. Technically speaking there is plenty of legroom in this cabin. Unless you are sitting in priority seat there is not much legroom once the passenger in front of you starts to recline his seat. This was what happened to me when my friend was occupying the window seat and I had to stand for her when she wanted to visit the bathroom because of the reclined seats in front of us. The amount you spend on premium economy is not worth because of this reason. The bathroom was very clean initially but towards the end of the flight it became dirty as I could see tissue paper popping out of the bin and the crews did not really bother to clean it. This was especially for flight from SIN-FRA-SIN. Overall it was a good experience as the cabin crews were very attentive and did their best to serve the passengers.
label: positive

text: Mr. After not flying for almost 7 months I finally take my first fight again from Hong Kong to Singapore. The entire process was a very pleasant one. I arrived at the airport and checked in very smoothly. The Singapore Airline lounge is closed but they diverted me to the Traveller Lounge bear Gate 6. The service was very good. When it come to boarding. The airline specially arranged for all the transit passengers to be boarded first as they were seated at the end of the plane. Then follow by the rest of the passengers. There was no mixing of the two groups of passengers and all necessary precautions was well taken. I was also given a personal safety bag with hand sanitizer, mask, etc inside. There were normal food served on the plane as before Covid 19. I landed in Singapore and the whole journey ewe a very pleasant one. Singapore airline has done a great job in ensuring all the passengers have a pleasant flight with safety placed at high premium.
label: positive

text: New aircraft experience! My wife and I travelled economy Brisbane - Singapore - Munich and returned London - Singapore - Brisbane with Singapore airlines. Three of the flights were on Airbus A350-900s and the london - Singapore was on an Airbus A-380. The staff service on the first leg to Singapore was, I believe not up to the airlines standard where as the last 3 legs the service was great. The ground services in each airport was excellent from check in to luggage pick up. The Airbus A350-900's were new aircraft but I found the seats (Economy) were to thin and as a result lacked padding and as a result were not as comfortable as other aircraft I have flown on. The A380 was showing its age but the seating (economy) was comfortable to fly in. The best part of the trip was the London - Singapore leg on the A380, the worst part was the comfort of the A350 seats and the inflight service from Brisbane to Singapore ( the menu handed out was for the Singapore - Bombay route)
label: positive

text: A short but magnificent flight Rated as one of the best, if not the best, airlines in the world, even a short three-hour flight was magnificent. The smiles and attentive service of the crew is insuperable.
label: positive

text: A tight squeeze ! Having flown Adelaide to Singapore with Singapore Airlines at least a dozen times I must say my most recent experience was the most uncomfortable. The A350 plane has been configured to cram in as many seats as possible so that ,unless you are extremely thin or a child the tray table will not sit flat. Also if the person seated in front of you puts their seat back it is almost in your face. The staff were their usual friendly and efficient selves and the flights were on time.
label: positive

text: Never fails to meet expectations Being among the top full service carriers in the world, Singapore Airlines has lived up to its' reputation as usual. Check-in at Changi Airport was a breeze, seat was comfortable, food always good and services impeccable. Cabin crew service one of the best I've experienced.
label: positive

text: Great flight Service above and beyond, Cabin staff friendly and couldn’t be more helpful, nothing was too much trouble.
label: positive

text: London > Singapore > Auckland > Sydney >Singapore > London Flight The food on Singapore Airlines was very poor! Wine in Economy was served in plastic cups...... the amount poured was half a plastic cup and the quality of wine “Frontera “ could be bought in an English Supermarket for less than £5 !! We were so looking forward to flying Singapore Airlines and were so disappointed, we will in future go BA which we have travelled with before! L. Morris
label: negative

text: Nearly Excellent Returning to Brisbane via Singapore - Staff are very friendly. The seats in Business, while vertical, are quite comfortable, lots of little places to stow items and the chest belt is a little strange but just another gadget I guess. The flatbed however isn’t designed for sleeping. The little blanket is only big enough to cover a child so sleep is a not a great experience. The worst thing about this flight was an Australian couple who boarded after us, and had the middle aisle seats - on Singapore these mid seats pairs are sited close together then the next set are further apart (not far though - maybe a 12”/30cm divider) and they were given the set with the divider. The wife started as soon harassing the flight staff as she was seated and loudly. I have never been so ashamed to be an Aussie - “she needed to be near her husband, when we’re these seats fitted into Singapore, how could you expect a couple to sit so far apart” on and on it went. Until the Aussie couple in front stood and said they were happy to swap Immediately the woman in question cast a filthy look at the flight staff and moved, told them to move her belongings and continued to treat the staff very poorly through out the flight. Very poor behaviour and the staff were taken up at a very busy time (take off) with one very rude, demanding, awful woman. Never seen it before, hope to never see it again. Meals are on par with any airline BC - they were served hot, quickly and far too often :)
label: positive

text: Amazing Service! Wow what can I say. We flew business class. Check in was made very easy, cabin staff were fantastic, beautiful food and great inflight entertainment. The welcome on board was really nice, as were the seats and goodie bags. The seats were really big with lots of room. The food was fantastic along with amazing service from the cabin crew where nothing was too much trouble. Very attentive and polite. This airline was first class and would highly recommend you fly with them. 5*
label: positive

text: One of my new preferred airlines My first trip on Singapore Airlines. What a very special treat, and well worth paying for Premium Economy. My baggage was marked priority so came off with the first batch. On the plane, the seats are spacious, the leg room also spacious. What is nice is a foot/leg rest that comes up to support your legs. The food is good, and the service excellent. The bathrooms are always clean - unlike other long distance airlines where the lavatories get a bit gross after 6-8 hours. This airline is well worth the price.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines are World Class Singapore Airlines are world class! The captain and his crew were always professional and pampered the fliers! Highly recommend!
label: positive

text: great service service is good.Good entertainment. My kids like the flight.Food is good. Excellent cabin crew.Everything perfect.
label: positive

text: Assured quality service Addressed all my concerns before travel and during travel. Food served was hot and tasty. Indian aloo parantha were the best I had till date.
label: positive

text: 17 1/2 Hours Well first off being in a plane, any plane for this amount of time is daunting. But if you do SingaporeAir is the airline to do it with. Ill start with the best part of the flight, the staff! From the moment we boarded till the time we left the crew made this flight as comfortable as possible for us. A special thanks to Chui, our stewardess who personally looked after our every need, thanks. The seats were comfortable and lie flat for sleeping but you have to angle your legs into a little cubicle, which being 6’3” was a little tough, but it sure beats premium economy. The food was plenty and often and pretty good for airline food. All said we look forward to our return flight in 3 months time!!
label: positive

text: My worst experience with singapore airlines I always have a great time flying Singapore airlines with friendly flight attendants and a great seat and that wasn’t different about this flight but it was delayed 8 hours and I missed my connecting flight which they weren’t able to put me on another Singapore airlines flight like every other time but instead put me on a budget air Asia flight for 5 hours which was a horrible experience but in Johannesburg where I was flying from they only gave us an 150rand food voucher at one specific restaurant before security and that is around 15 Singapore dollars and the food voucher wasn’t even enough for one meal and the delay went over lunch and dinner so I had to spend quite a bit of money and the virgin Atlantic lounge was closed and with the krisflyer card I had I was able to go there but since it was closed I had to pay 400rand to get access to a lounge which was mediocre at best and the other thing that I hated was that they told us to come to the gate for boarding when the plane hadn’t even landed in Johannesburg from Cape Town so I had to wait 1 hour to board when I could have just stayed in the lounge which was much more comfortable but still the actual flight was great like always but Singapore airlines should have done better with their management of the flight being delayed and there were many people who didn’t have lounge access and other things that I had so I think their time was probably much worse than mine and this is the first bad experience I’ve ever had with Singapore airlines and I think you should still fly it as it’s usually great and this is the only bad experience I’ve ever had.
label: negative

text: Overrated airline and service Heard a lot about singapore airport and singapore airlines. i feel they are simply overrated. This was my first SIA flight and unfortunately got middle seats only,. the seats are pathetic, cramped with very less comfort. Emirates economy is much better. Food was also not great. Feat were paining in Singapore SFO flight which was almost 16 hours. Didn't like this.
label: negative

text: good service but old fleet for some routes nice service but for the singapore - jakarta route they use a really old fleet. it has a very small tv screen and very low resolution. food quality was also not very good on the jakarta to singapore route. it was fried rice but and it was tasteless. lastly, its very tiring to fly singapore airlines in general for people who start in jakarta. because there is always a transit and change airplane in singapore. unless you're only flying to singapore.
label: neutral

text: Best airline and flight experience This is literally the best airline I have ever flown. We flew Paris -> Singapore -> Bali in business class. These flights were like a natural extension of our vacation! We were truly pampered by the steward/esses. The white tablecloth service elevated the experience and the food choices were absolutely delicious. No detail was overlooked. The fully reclining chairs to beds were comfortable enough to get a great night’s sleep on our long haul flights. The TV screen was monstrous. The bathrooms were clean and well-maintained mid-fight with great amenities. I have been royally spoiled!
label: positive

text: Simply the best. If I have a problem with Singapore Airlines its that it has made it harder to retain your Gold Membership by reducing the points I travel by fifty percent. I was close to retaining my membership so I e-mailed Krisflyer but they never returned me message, so bad luck, what a shame.
label: positive

text: Great entertainment system Always reliable, the flight departed and landed on time. Normally, we order the low fat meal, because you get served first and there is no chance of them running out of your choice. This time the low fat meals were just bland, so we won't be doing that again. Pity because the meals on the airline are normally exceptional. The one feature that is an improvement is the entertainment system, which now features a huge array of choices.
label: positive

text: Good airline Great service, free food and drinks. Average legroom. Plane was a bit older and there were a few issues with the seatback entertainment system, plug for earphones did not work well. Overall would recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Great flights! We had wonderful flights from California all the way to Bali, then back home. We flew Economy and had enough room. Small foot rest , seats reclined nicely and a ton of food! I couldn't believe all the food! Handed out snacks inbetween meals. They even gave us a sandwich as we were landing in case we got hungry waiting for our luggage! Nice touch. The staff kept us very hydrated on the flights. Always offering water and orange juice frequently through out the flight. My daughter was so impressed with Singapore, that she wants to study abroad in Singapore for a semester. She's currently studying Electrical Engineering at San Diego State University, and can't wait to go back to Singapore. Of course, she will be flying Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Flew IST-SIN SIN-SYD on B777-200. One of the aircraft had been "refitted". Both had quite hard seats. For the first sector I was seated in 51A which on a night flight gets a direct beam of light coming from the toilets on a regular basis. It's quite disturbing and I wouldn't recommend this seat to economy passengers in this part of the cabin. The inflight entertainment is dated and the screens quite small compared to other aircraft in the SIA fleet and other airlines particularly the second sector where the screen was exceptionally small. This must have been one of the oldest aircraft in the SIA fleet. It seems SIA reserve their ageing aircraft for the IST route. The inflight service on both legs of the journey was very average. I ordered a special meal so received my meal first however it took over an hour to get a drink to go with my meal which is served when the rest of the meals are served. I think there is some room for improvement here from SIA. I was surprised to have to remind the cabin crew about my missing drink as normally their service is second to none. The food was fine and well above average although the coffee not always hot. Check in staff were quite good at IST and as with almost every flight I have ever taken departing from Ataturk Airport it was a delayed departure - this flight by 45 minutes.
label: neutral

text: Perfect flight with the new Airbus A350-900 A fligth time of 12h on a beuatiful plane can be bridged with the care of SA! The motor noice is indeed very low. The care of the SA crew is outstanding!
label: positive

text: Disabled friendly airline and very communicative supporting office staffs We travelled as a family of five on 25th of June. Our little daughter is disabled and need extra arrangement prior the trip date. I sent email to the office staff to let them now my daughter's medical condition .I got the reply within 24 hours from their local and Singapore office staff to advise what to do so that I would had a smoothest flight. With clear information do and dont from the staff as well as good communication we had, indeed our trip was smooth and no problem at all. Checking staff at Heathrow airport, I forget her name, she is very nice lady and helpful . She greeted us with broad smile and helped us with clear information and direction on how to get to the departure gate as the location was quite walk distance from the check in counter. Upon entering the aircraft, all crews members greeted us with warm hospitality and one of them arranged and made sure my daughter's buggy kept safely in their luggage storage . Overall we enjoyed the long haul of 14 hours flight ( 2 hours transit in Changi Airport Singapore). The crews were excellent. The journey were smooth as velvety cake in my mouth ! Will travel again with Singapore airlines, for sure.
label: positive

text: Airbus A380 from LAX to Singapore with a stop at Tokyo-Narita. Excellent cockpit crew and cabin staff. Very attentive to the needs of the passengers. Ground staff at LAX and at Changi were very helpful courteous and friendly. Once the plane reaches cruising altitude it is practically quiet. We will always fly on SIA whenever our schedules allow. We go to Asia every 2 to 3 years and SIA is our first choice!
label: positive

text: Ground staff Singapore Airlines incompetent Here are my details of my trip. 2nd March, 2023 – I flew with Delta to JFK in order to connect with Singapore airlines – JFK-FRA-SIN-HKT , due to arrive 4th March, 2023. When I arrived at JFK, on my way to collect my luggage I saw a Singapore desk in the area. So, I decided to stop and ask for directions: where to get my bag and where to check in with Singapore airlines. It was staffed by 2 individuals. While asking for directions and informing them that I will pick up by luggage from Delta and bring it across to the check-in desk. They both told me that it wasn’t necessary, just show them my Delta tag and my itinerary and they will have my luggage picked up and delivered to Singapore. I asked them twice if they are sure because Delta is not Star alliance. However, my luggage wasn’t picked up from the Delta carousel. 3rd March, 2023 – Attempt to ask and verify my luggage was on board to a Singapore rep in Frankfurt, where I was told that she was too busy to help me I should come back later. 4th March, 2023 – I arrived in Singapore and I went to T2 service desk (near F30) and was told that my luggage is in the system, it would arrive in Phuket. I arrived in Phuket but my luggage was missing, I was first told by the ground staff in Phuket that it was in Singapore and would arrive the next day and that I should make a claim. I did just that. 5th March, 2023 – I waited 2 days before I realized that I was receiving no assistance from Singapore airlines except for e-mails stating that they are sorry for the delayed baggage. That’s when I had to take action on my own. I received this message about 10 times over the past few days. "We are still trying to locate your delayed bag(s) and will provide another update by tomorrow. You can also check the status here, with your reference number." 6th March, 2023 – I decided to check myself to locate my luggage and found it on Delta’s website, I then tried to call Singapore – JFK and inform them of the situation and this is when they told me that they couldn’t help me and hung up the phone when I asked to speak to a supervisor. Erroneously thinking that since I found the luggage that I would receive some help as I have been without clothes, toiletries and medicine for 2 days. I finally got through to Singapore JFK via e-mail and they now asked me for a photo of my bag and of my flight details and boarding passes before they can help me. How bizarre? Questions for Singapore Airlines: 1. Why was I told by JFK ground staff that my luggage on Delta airlines would be transferred to Singapore airlines, when it wasn’t. Even though I offered twice to retrieved my luggage myself the two staff members insisted that it wasn’t necessary as it will be handled. It wasn’t and of today 9th March, 2023 I still don’t have my luggage. 2. Why is it at FRA airport where I was in transit that no staff was at the Singapore desk for most of the day. I did manage to find a person at the gate that told me they were too busy to assist me – I wanted to verify that my luggage was indeed transferred. 3. Why was I told when I arrived in Singapore by the staff at the service desk (next to F30) that my luggage was in the system and would be at my final destination – Phuket. 4. Why could the ground staff at Phuket airport and Singapore airline online unable to find my luggage and kept sending e-mails that they have contacted every station for information. 5. Why is it that when I called the Singapore customer service at JFK airport in NYC they told me that they can’t help me and hung up on my call. 6. Most important – Why is it when I located the luggage myself 2 days later – as it was with Delta and informed all parties that my bag was in JFK Delta office that no personnel from either Singapore office made any attempt to retrieve my luggage. I had to call Delta in Atlanta and ask them to contact Singapore ground staff at JFK and inform them that the luggage they are looking for is at JFK.
label: negative

text: Not the quality or Service I expect Having Flown Singapore Air many times before, the service standard appears to have fallen. This was experienced on all of four flights. Whilst entertainment was good the main quality wasnt there, Provisions have reduced in quality and what you get. Food has dropped in standard and they didnt have the choice many people wanted on all of four flights. They need to learn what meals are popular, it isn't hard, but this seems to be cost-saving they are doing. The people who pay extra for legroom at the front like me seem to get worst deal being served last, with cold food and no choices. The food is no longer great, a continental breakfast was six bits of chopped fruit (4 apple) a dry roll and muffin - Thats it. No cheese, ham, yogurt, cereal, etc. They dont come round as often with drinks and snacks on the long flights. I will be choosing another airline next time.
label: neutral

text: Contradictions Return flights via Changi. A350 -900 in all sectors. Outward flight excellent in service, food and general comfort in both sectors; inward flight excellent in service and general comfort, very average in food. I would recommend this airline. The A350 is a superior aircraft in comfort compared to B787. I particularly liked the seat recline, seat as well as back moves, thus avoiding a pet dislike,i.e. the passenger who reclines seat back so far that there is no room to get in & out. Changi airport is extremely impressive and spotlessly clean.
label: positive

text: Great flights. Service very good, food really good. Overall all that we expected and more. Little touches like any apple or packets of nuts handed out in the middle of the night flight.
label: positive

text: Always nice to fly with Singapore Airlines. Again had great flights, enough legroom. Entertaiment was sufficient. Very friendly crew. Will fly with them again. Seat number 43A and C.
label: positive

text: Great airlines Though expensive, this airlines is so far the best I have traveled in. Be it the cabin-crew or the ground staffs all are friendly and patient with the passengers. They have very professional pilots who fly safe and talk less. The inflight menu, special menu are all amazing. Carry an Eye-Mask if you intend to sleep without any hindrance. They provide a mini-pillow and a sheet.
label: positive

text: Not the usual standard, although still good I set the bar very high with SQ and this flight did not really deliver. The quality of food was not good and they were not able to offer everything on the menu - so no fresh juice or fresh fruit. People drinking wine got non stop refills but because I was drinking juice, it seems they just wanted to clear my things away and ignore me. Of course, I could ask for more, but it seems strange they are less keen to serve non alcoholic drinks compared to alcoholic drinks. An older plane with lower standards maybe.
label: positive

text: I flew from Singapore to Los Angeles (SQ11/SQ12). Being a krisflyer member I never regret taking a Singapore Airlines flight. It has truly made my flight comfortable. Food was excellent customer service was good and so were the seats.
label: positive

text: Not what they used to be We have used this airline numerous times over the past decade, but feel that the standards have dropped markedly. The food was very ordinary, the wine too and choice was limited. Premium ecomony seats are definitely better than economy, but having flown with another Asian airline on their PE seats, it was not in the same class. Staff are pleasant, but with a couple of exceptions, not friendly or welcoming. Their rewards programme must be of the worst around, with its complete lack of flexibility, and poor and expensive purchase options.
label: neutral

text: Excellent Very spacious, very comfortable, food and beverages great, can even pre book prior to flight for a better choice. Cabin crew make you feel very special. Nothing too much trouble and you certainly can get some very high maintenance travellers Would be my number one airline to choose to fly with
label: positive

text: the long long flight Flight took off at 2330 hours and as passengers in the packed plane settled for some sleep about 2 hours later, the pilot announced that the plane was heading back to Singapore because of technical issue. Eager queries were made to the cabin crew about connecting flights, reason for turning back, and delay in appointments. Only after sometime was it revealed that the flight team has found the oxygen mask not in operation mode, and after deliberation it was decided that the best option was to fly back to Singapore, where the airline will try to get another plane to replace this. Only when we reached Singapore we were informed that a replacement was arranged to fly us to Spain a few hours later. The SIN to BCN trip is about 12 hours, add in another 9 hours, it was 21 hours flight! Our holiday was almost ruined. It was salvaged by a planned easy first day in Barcelona.
label: positive

text: A disappointing experience Tight time schedules between flights:Phuket/Singapore: long way to move from landing gate to departure gate. Last people to enter plane although we ran most of the way. Crazy. Plane to Copenhagen arrived more than an hour late. Our grand children going to Oslo did not get their connection together with other passengers. Were rebooked on flight at 4 pm. Our luggage did not arrive. Have still not received it more than 10 hrs after we arrived at our final destination. No response from SPair. Check web site. No information. Will need more clothes to wear. Compensation? This was really bad. Food and service on plane terrible. Why serve rubbish, waste of resources.
label: negative

text: Very bad seats nd no veg food while coming to mumbai Hello We asked for good seats as my daughter was not well. But he gave me worst seat. Which was like end of Piland something 63 row next to a.c. blower. You can't keep such seats just to earn money. It was freezing cold nd two storage both side. In complete journey we were in cold nd it was torture for us. After asking nd requesting you are giving such a bad seat nd that also we were so early for check in. Very bad experience while coming also they didn't have veg food. After making us wait like more then 45min they told they don't have veg food as it shortage.
label: negative

text: Long but Pleasant Flight Best of the best flights as this was a new aircraft A350 and for a couple traveling on the new Business Class seats was a welcome experience. We were actually able to talk to each other without me (smaller one of us) climbing on my knees to speak to my partner. The wall between us was lower than the old version of the plane and during the night we were able to sleep next to each other as if at home. Yes, we loved that. Service was excellent and food so so, but the comfort next to none. Amenities were clean at all times, thank you. Boarding always seamless with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Trip to Beijing The whole flight is very good. We get all the good services from the stewardess. The flight is good. The service overall is good.
label: positive

text: Amazing onboard service Amazing onboard service, great foods, and free snacks and drinks between meals. The entertainment system also have almost to many options. One negative thing to remark is however, the foodrest, as it was of no use for me do to the fact I am almost 2 m high, but it was still there on the back of the seat in front of me, taking up valuable leg room. The service was better than European airlines, but prices was also slightly high.
label: positive

text: Adelaide to Singapore We flew on the new A350 packed in like sardines, the service was virtually non existent, we asked for a drink and after an hour still hadn’t seen anyone, eventually asked some one else and after about another 20 minutes finally got one. On the return night flight we were given a hot towel, a drink and a small packet of bar snacks then the crew disappeared until about 2 hours before landing when breakfast was served. Would never fly Singapore air again.
label: negative

text: Good service on economy Good service and reasonable legroom for those of us that need it! pre-booked an Indian veggie meal which always seems to be a better meal than the standard fare. Little disappointed with the range of films on offer - not as up to date as expected, but at least there was plenty of choice.
label: positive

text: Excellent service for a reasonable price Singapore Airlines consistently provide a very good service and, while is not a budget one, has normally the reasonable airfares. Plus to that, a stopover in Singapore?Changi is always a delight.
label: positive

text: Early morning flight to Jakarta, on the A350-900, with a 3-class configuration. The overall ambience of the cabin is bright and airy, and the newest version of the in-flight entertainment is a big bonus for this short hop flight. Seating is comfortable for this duration of flight (way better than the experience in an A320 or B737). We left on time, and the crew were then rushing to serve breakfast. Food was reasonably good (omelette or nasi lemak), and we landed on time also. Crew were a little rushed and courteous rather than friendly, but good enough. I appreciated that the crew were meticulous about asking passengers to raise their seats to the upright position for the meal service, small things like this help in economy.
label: positive

text: Ok to Singapore, but great to Hong Kong. Traveling to Singpore, was ok, but from Singapore to Hong Kong the Flight was Great. We felt that the seats to Singapore were a bit too well used. Premium to Hong Kong, was a hell of a lot better. Everything said new.
label: positive

text: Still my favourite long haul airline Chose this airline, because it has a daytime flight from Singapore to Sydney, and I find it helps with jet lag to arrive at night. Have used Singapore a few times, and the service is exceptional. They get your name straightaway, and they "pamper" you in the best possible manner. Nothing is too much trouble, the food is great, as is the choice of wines, and if you get stuck with the entertainment system, they are delighted to find anything you want. I find the airport lounges good too. They always have a wide selection of food, there is loads of space, and the area is well laid out, so that it is easy to find a quiet corner. Their coffee is good too.
label: positive

text: Memories More than 10 years ago I travelled with Singapore Airlines and the flight is still the best I have experienced. Outstanding service from a polite, hardworking and beautiful crew. My return flight was spoilt by the fact I was in crutches after an accident and in a great deal of pain. The crew couldn't have done more to assist me both on the ground and in the air. I was accompanied by a ground crew member during the refuel time to do duty free shopping in Singapore Airport, if only the same help had been provided in Gatwick. Sadly Gatwick provided an unhelpful, lazy, rude and selfish person who insisted I get my own luggage. And get from the terminal to bus station myself.
label: positive

text: Joyful flight Once again had the most relaxing flight possible ,, always service with a smile ,,, up to date movies at hand ,,, landed feeling ready for the adventure ahead ,,,
label: positive

text: The worst trip of my live In 30 years, this flight was my worst experience. I don't understand why the baby bassinet was placed in front of my seat instead their parents. The service was terrible because they forgot to serve part of the food and made a mistake if you order a especific dish (too dangerous if I alergic) It was imposible to rest because the cabine crew disturbed you every time to support baby parents. Ok, it is important to help the babies but it's not necessary that they forget the rest of passengers.
label: negative

text: My favorite airlines I really like to fly using Singapore airlines. The service is very good, the food is very good. Flight doesn't feel long because of good service
label: positive

text: Ho Chi Minh City to Singapore, and Singapore Airlines Business Class seat was very comfortable for the two hour flight. Crew pleasant and took the time to learn my name. Meal and beverage service was excellent, better than my 15 hr. Air Canada flight from Toronto to Hong Kong. I can see why this is a 5-Star airline.
label: positive

text: Disappointing Flew Perth to Singapore then on to Colombo, first flight was pretty good had 2 seat option on our aircraft. Staff were attentive and service good. Second flight from Singapore to Colombo was not so good, the toilet even before take off was awful, terrible smell of urine and dirty, water everywhere. Service was ok but turbulence meant suspension of service on collection, understand staff safety is paramount but it’s awful having to sit with the tray in front of you any longer than needed! Hope the return journey is a little better!!
label: neutral

text: Best Airline we have flown Once again flying with Singapore Air is a pleasure Comfort, flight crew, cabin crew marvellous We cannot vault as we always fly from Koh Samui to wherever & never had a problem Will continue to do so & looking forward to our flight back to Perth WA in September
label: positive

text: A Comfortable and Stress-free Flight Although full, the cabin crew dealt with everyone in a calm and orderly fashion and helped the time to pass quickly and comfortably with the minimum of fuss.
label: positive

text: Good flights on schedule staff very polite Flights from Manchester to Da nang was good,the staff were very polite and efficient but the food wasn't too good on both legs of the journey. Toilets were clean and check in was quite quick. Would recommend this airline on the A350.
label: positive

text: They feel like family We always travel with Singapore when ever we can. The staff are always gentle, respectful, generous of themselves & with their time. The cost is often higher but we feel very safe & in steady hands.
label: positive

text: Excellent as always A350 Plane and service was as excellent as ever. Singapore are really making it difficult for passengers to choose any other carrier. Thank you for a fuss-free flight. You have my loyalty. Just wish the prices were sharper!!
label: positive

text: Sydney Heathrow Return Our trip to London required a stop in Changi Airport which is a destination in itself. We had three A-300 flights and one 777 they were all good with plenty of staff and options for meals too.
label: positive

text: Service Quality service from check in at Tullamarine to arrival Changi Airport and continuing onward journey to Milan. All staff were immaculately dressed and were extremely friendly and helpful. The aeroplane was well presented, clean and comfortable. The menu provided a wide variety of choices. There were some strange meal serving times on the overnight leg when it was preferable to be sleeping. I did find the operation of the bed and the comfort not as good as other airlines.
label: positive

text: Melbourne - Changi Very good airline to travel to Singapore we actually arrived ahead of schedule by 1/2 hour. Our biggest problem in the A380 in Economy in row 45-55 approx. travelling at midnight, the air conditioning was too cold and I had two blankets around me to keep warm. One passenger in our row being moved up front for the flight. Friends in Premium Economy upstairs said their air conditioning was fine but did note that the air from economy rising up the rear stairwell was cold. Take note that we were travelling under a travel group booking.
label: positive

text: Overnight flight delayed in takeoff due to airport congestion brought on by inclement weather. On boarding the large number of passengers on this oversized aircraft was impressively quick and smooth. Flight attendants were elegantly efficient - the female flight attendants were strikingly lissome. Sitting configuration was 3-4-3. Seats were comfortable but given that most seats were occupied, the cabin felt crowded. Lots of film choices on the seatback personal entertainment system, they were easy to access. Ample overhead luggage space. Leg space a bit tight. Seat reclination juts the backseat TV screen rather close to your face and the tray table to your tummy. In fact, the flight attendants, while serving meals, ensured that the passengers returned the seats to a more straight up position. A dinner and a breakfast were served. A multi page menu book was provided to all. There were two entree choices for both meals - no vegetarian choice. That was a shocking surprise. I chose the fish dish. It was amply portioned and tasty. The breakfast cold sandwiches were dry and virtually inedible. Predinner drinks were served in plastic tumblers from a tray that flight attendants carried - juice, beer, white wine were on offer. Dinner and breakfast cutlery were metal, not plastic. Duty free catalog was thick but nothing distinctive products on offer. Cockpit crew kept us informed of the flight and take off delays. Singapore Airlines should consider their impact on the environment - on this relatively short overnight flight they can simplify the breakfast and dinner, dispense with the paper menu and the basic amenities bag and ensure a vegetarian option as standard. Bathrooms were clean throughout. A good option over Lufthansa or United. Arrived more or less on time after a somewhat bumpy flight.
label: neutral

text: Paris and return in Premium Economy with SIngapore Airlines Premium Economy. Not always the best value. I do believe the best value price on Singapore Airlines for premium economy would be aproximately 50% to 60% more than the standard economy fare. The good things I found were express check in (but not at every airport), 35kg baggae allowance (now that was good) and an express lane at some airports for boarding. The food was very good with agood range and you could order specifically what you want on line up to 24 hours before departure. The seats were wider than economy with extra leg room however at 6'3" (191 cm) I still couldn't stretch out completely or utilise the leg support. The seat belt on one flight was very thick and could be uncomfortable. I believe it contained an airbag. Cabin staff were helpful and always polite. Plenty of overhead locker space. One thing I found strange was having to walk back through the first section of the ecoomy cabin to get to the toilet. Unlike First and Business class there is no specific toilet for Premium Economy. You have to pay for WiFi on board if you want it. Bags were off loaded as priority at the destination which was helpful when arriving home and getting into the customs line up a little earlier than normal. In all Premium Economy (at the right price) was much better than travelling Economy and with Singapore AIrlines I haven't had a bad flight yet. Even in economy.
label: positive

text: Comfortable & Safest airline I always feel safe traveling with SIA being the youngest aircraft group. Also Excellent customer services be in on the ground or up in the air.
label: positive

text: It's Great! The plane we had, Dreamliner 787 was a new plane and that makes alot of difference to the entire flight experience. The screen is touch screen so bye bye to that cumbersome telephone lookalike remote control. The screen was bigger and the intense graphics colour makes viewing movies more pleasurable. There's a USB port to charge your phone, and also powerpoint at the base of the seat in front of you to charge your laptop. The flight from SG to Narita is 6.5hrs and there's 2 meal servings. One is a flatbread with chix served about an hour or more after take off. The other is a set breakfast served at 4am where we get to choose scrambled egg with sausage and potato or Japanese breakfast which I dont know whats in that menu. Sit on the left of the plane if you are flying to Tokyo for a chance to see Mount Fuji. On your return, sit on the right for the Mount Fuji view. Like I have said earlier, the new plane already tip the scoring. So its 5 stars for me.
label: positive

text: Wonderful flight excellent service and good food easy checkin and friendly staff. well worth paying extra for premium economy.
label: positive

text: Professional, super-friendly and hugely enjoyable This was our first experience with Singapore Airlines and WHAT a great pleasure it was! Every detail from the booking, through to check-in, and the flight itself was so efficient, friendly and professional. We couldn't fault the experince in any way.
label: positive

text: it is still good, but other airlines started to get better SQ business class used to be known as one of the best. but I can say I would prefer JAL or Emirates for now. I would point best items that SQ is still number 1, the food and the hospitality. JAL would be a competitor to watch, they serve great food. SQ flight attendants were one of the most friendliest I've ever interact with. Although I did get some unpleasant reaction when getting on board with my backpack and dusty boots. Amenities? My best would be JAL, it provided many things from luxury toiletries set, slipper, soft fabric cardigan, to noise canceling headphones. SQ? all those minus the toiletries set and cardigan. Yes, they had stop giving away the toiletries, even for longer routes like Singapore - Dallas. Seat comfort also been rather declining a little - or maybe it depends on the series of the plane. this one was a bit narrower than I though, couldnt flip my self to the other side. But it is indeed still one of the best three i would use :)
label: neutral

text: Surprisingly Disappointing I had high expectations for this airline but was disappointed. I travel business class for long trips and this was the most uncomfortable plane I've ever experienced. The lie flat beds are ridiculously at an angle. You have to be some sort of a contortionist to be able to appreciate this service. Since this is a round trip, on the way back to Manila, the lounge in Singapore didn't offer much for their breakfast. The food trays didn't get refilled. After spending 30mins waiting, I had to go out of the lounge and just buy our breakfast from the fastfood area. Thought they were at one time the best airline. Will definitely have 2nd thoughts with this airline.
label: negative

text: Business Class ++ Sure, you pay extra, so you expect things to be good. Still, this airline gives more than good. The service is flawless, every customer and every request is treated as important.
label: positive

text: A relaxing journey An overnight flight. Two meals supplied with good service. Just a lot of hanging around before the flight with security over the top.
label: positive

text: great flying experience I had a really good experience, from the check in, where I had over weight luggage and had to re arrange my bags. The staff were very helpful and willing to assist me. The inflight service was good. My special meal was also brought for me as I have a shellfish allergy. The flight was not bumpy at all. All staff friendly as usual. Great flying with Singapore Airlines. From start to finish it is a painless process
label: positive

text: No water This was probably one of worst experiences of a commercial airline. I heard and read such good reviews I was looking forward to flying with them. A 13 1/2 hour flight, a daytime flight, no sooner we had taken off, they wanted the window shutters down and dimmed the lights- remember that this was a daytime flight. They wanted everyone to sleep so they wouldn’t have to give any service. We asked for a bottle of water, none available just given half a plastic glass of water out of the tank. Food was awful and no snacks offered. We had to keep asking for water or juice to try to keep dehydrated. Only went to use the bathroom once……. Floor soaking wet, toilet not flushing fully and sink blocked (half full of water). Getting off the flight we both had bagging headaches and had to buy water to rehydrate. I have contacted Singapore airlines for them to comment but it’s been 11 days and nothing. Please avoid them as it is apparent that their service has been compromised
label: negative

text: Comfortable, professional, high quality Flew from Adelaide to London via Melbourne and Singapore with Singapore Airlines in December 2018. Fantastic service on the flight. It was my first time flying with Singapore and I could not have asked for better. I struggle with motion sickness and had an issue halfway through the flight, one of the flight attendants went out of her way to make sure I was dealing with it okay and was all good. Legroom was fine. The meals were also fairly good, some of the better airline options I've had. The frozen strawberry yoghurt dessert was incredibly tasty. Can't fault Singapore Airlines. I'll definitely fly them again.
label: positive

text: Five Star Economy When you've flown budget airlines, and then you step up and fly Singapore Airlines again, you really appreciate the comfort and quality of this airline. At boarding they ensured the group numbers were adhered to, so that people at the back were boarded first. None of that scrum that is usually experienced with budget airlines. It was lovely walking into a toilet that was cleaned frequently throughout the flight, toothbrushes in the bathroom, and staff that were so pleasant. The food was delicious and if you wanted alcohol that was free and available too. The crew work hard and are always smiling, even when they have some privileged economy customers that act like they are flying first class. Flying Singapore Airlines has reminded me of the beauty of premium airlines.
label: positive

text: Best Airline in the World is simply FAKE NEWS! Yes, I am complaining about the business class service, its strictly a first world problem, I know, but when you pay for a premium service you expect exactly that. I have seen some customers act very rudely towards the staff from a sense of entitlement, and personally always make sure to treat the flight attendants, or in fact anyone I come across in my travels with absolute respect. Even if it is not reciprocated always, I feel good about myself, and invariably can get you through a border crossing without a full body search. I travel with Singapore Airlines a lot now as our travel has been restricted through Hong Kong since the riots in September. Perhaps this is simply a case of comparing apples with onions, as Cathay Pacific set such a high standard. To come back to the flight experience with Singapore Air, whilst the staff is initially very friendly, as soon as the first service is completed they are nowhere to be seen and service levels just dropped. I had to use the attendant button multiple occasions to request service and was done with a very clear lack of interest, they were NOT rude but it was not what you'd expect for premier air service. The seats are very uncomfortable and the design is simply grossly unergonomic, whilst the seats recline your legs are then pushed into a little shoebox where you cannot turn around or bend your legs. WHO CAME UP WITH THIS DESIGN!! The pods are large but as a consequence the seats only suitable for small people. MANY complaints online.... The and warm towels that are handed out from a disposable aluminum cooking tray smelled like the chicken satay skewers they served up afterward. Disgusting. If only I knew that the food was going to be worse on this flight, I would have held onto the towel to eat it, as it was not as tough as the meat I was served. They have a "book the cook" service, which is a great concept, but the delivery alas falls so far short on quality. Overall my experiences with Singapore Airlines have been similar since September, and suspect they simply leverage a good economic model that works on the basis of "it's good enough". I refuse to fly with Singapore airlines whenever I can practically avoid it. I think I will leave my disdain for their disgusting lounges in another deservedly scathing review, Singapore Airlines lounge is one of the saddest lounges around.
label: negative

text: Business Class comfort - almost Singapore Airlines Business Class provides all the extras one would expect in the class. Fast check in and security operation, access to an excellent Lounge (at Heathrow T2), priority boarding, plenty of seat space, flat bed, excellent service from cabin crew, ample overhead locker space and quality food and drinks. The only slight drawback (just being a bit picky here) is that for taller people the flat bed design isn't perfect with legs at a slight angle and not much space for your feet. Also, there is insufficient space for stowing personal bits and pieces in the seat pod area. The seat pod design in Emirates business class, is still the best we have found.
label: positive

text: Attentiveness The flight was general clean. Loaded with good entertainment. The couple sitting beside were vegetarian and they didnt request for special in advance. But the stewardess did her best to serve them vegetarian food. I had an bad encounter。A stewardess looked pissed when i didnt hear her calling me. She gave me an irritated look.
label: positive

text: Worst Airline Ever The flight itself was adequate, the food was mediocre at best, the service was appalling. Staff totally uninterested in assisting staff. The did it begrudgingly at best. Worse than that was the after service. I left something on the plane and wanted to see if it had been found. I know exactly where it was. I couldn't contact SA by phone because the number on their website is incorrect. I used their online form, sent emails and tweets, even Facebook, but no response whatsoever.
