I consider this extremely rude and very unprofessional. Absolutely appalling customer service. Circumstances meant I had to change my booking for a return flight. I've done this with other airlines without any issue whatsoever. SA had to prove their ineptitude yet again. They went out of their way to do it. I eventually had to call Australia to get things organised properly. I have complained and asked for an apology, but as per their arrogant customer service policy, they've just ignored me. I had flown SA before, and they were good. I expected so much better. I will not be using their services again in a hurry. I recommend everyone look elsewhere.
label: negative

text: Wonderful service I hate long haul flights but the staff can not be more accommodating. Every request is carried out willingly and with a smile. Food was very good and a great choice of alcoholic drinks. Pillows and blankets help with comfort.
label: positive

text: Departing SIN-LHR on the redeye flight (departing 1 am), this means a group of grumpy and tired travellers. Took the front row bulkhead seat in PE on Boeing 777-300ER which gives quite a lot of legroom, the downside is the the inflight entertainment (IFE) system is tucked away on the floor, in a it's own separate housing. I eschewed the champagne and dinner for sleep, and here I still find the SQ PE seats very stiff and difficult to recline, it really takes quite a lot of effort to force the seat into a recline position. Nonetheless, there is a reasonable amount of elbow space, and the personal reading lights, noise-cancelling earphones and cubby holes give a sense of comfort. The IFE is the new touch-screen system with a separate seat controller handset. My IFE monitor refused to come out of it's housing, but the aircrew performed some magic with a knife and fork, and saved the day! Food (the breakfast that I tried) was reasonably good, and crew were proactive with drinks and snacks through the flight. The only downside of PE in the B777 series is that access to the shared toilets is at the rear with normal economy, and you have to manage the queues for access the best you can. Overall, a good experience especially now that PE pricing appears to be equivalent to the prices from competitors such as Lufthansa.
label: positive

text: A first class flight A great flight on this first class airline. On time and business cabin was great. Cabin crew could not be better. Food exceptional. Highly recommended
label: positive

text: Abandoned in a foreign country My flight was cancelled at the airport but the cancellation didn't show up on singapore airs computer system so they didn't believe me and would not rebook me even though my travelling partner was rebooked within an hour. They wouldn't do anything and left me abandoned in a foreign city 30 hours from home with no way to travel. I had to find and pay $2500 for a flight on another airline and travel 6 hours by train to another city to catch it. 8 months on singapore still will not refund me or call to discuss, only standard email responses that aren't relevant to the matter. will never fly with them again
label: negative

text: not top! It was certainly good but not the top! what you hear everywhere and all the time about Singapore Air. With Singapore Airlines it is good marketing! Nevertheless... it was a good experience. The cabin looks nice and elegant with nice colors and nothing cheap! The seat, the space: the seat is wide and really very comfortable. There is enough space for personal belongings. For sleeping a seat cover will be put over the entire seat for more comfort and it really feels very good. What I still do not like is the little cubby hole for the feet when stretching out and that I have to lay not straight on the seat but at an angle. The service during dinner was slow and unattentive. Even that Business Class was half empty I was surprised that the crew was busy but not busy with customers. The food was a total disappointment and disaster. They had many food options on board but then I had lost appetite. The beverage service inbetween was practically absent: no one to be seen. The wines were okay. I was irritated that they advertised a French wine on the wine list but didn't have it on board. So why mention it??? That would not happen on Qatar AIrways! It was a good experience but with significant flaws! Singapore Airlines is certainly better than BA and AA but they can't reach Qatar Airways... according to my experiences.
label: positive

text: Really disappointed! Messed us around a lot My partner and I had payed $3000 all up for our flights back to New Zealand from Ho Chi Min and we were extremely disappointed with the service we got. They sent us an email to let us know that they have cancelled our original flight at 12:15pm and had rescheduled us onto a flight at 7:50pm and that our flight from Singapore to Christchurch would be the following day now at 7:50pm and that they would provide us with accommodation. We were very understanding although it meant a change in our schedule and our connecting flights from Christchurch to Nelson would be effected as well, we thanked them for organising us the accommodation and that we understood that it was a busy time for them, I asked where we would be staying and they emailed back saying they will give us the details at the counter When we are at the airport. When we arrived in Singapore we went to the counter (11pm) to ask them where the accommodation was that we were staying in only to be told that there are no more rooms available and that they can’t give us a bed although they promised they would, they offered us a food voucher instead of accommodation which we would have preferred a bed over food but took the food voucher because we couldn’t get a bed. It wasn’t just us that had been told they had a room reserved for them it was everyone on that same flight going through to Christchurch and other flights to so there were no couches left to sleep on in the airport and all of our bags had gone straight through to Christchurch so we have no warm clothes or blankets and then when we tried to get dinner with the food voucher we got told that they aren’t accepting the vouchers any more.
label: negative

text: Fabulous airline We undertook our first long haul flight in August (to Australia) and then back to England in September. We booked with Singapore Air as they were highly recommended and we weren't disappointed. The flight from Heathrow to Singapore was right on time and as soon as we boarded we were welcomed and made comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble for the cabin crew. The food was hot and tasty - drinks were offered and the wine and beer were lovely. Not only was it our first long haul flight but we had to change planes for the first time as well - I was a bit anxious about this but it couldn't have been easier. Well signposted with staff at hand to help and advise. We would love to fly with Singapore Air again and would highly recommend them
label: positive

text: Impressed with Singapore Airlines I have heard a lot of good things about Singapore Airlines before, but this is my first time to fly with them. I have to say, I am impressed! I felt that your ease and comfort in traveling was their top priority, and I felt well taken care of. I would love to fly with them again!
label: positive

text: Best sleep on a aircraft I’ve had Great airline, excellent service and the best sleep I’ve had on a aircraft, this must be because the noise of the aircraft is so quiet. We appreciated being served our food first with what we had preordered (not so on our onward flight with Air New Zealand).
label: positive

text: So back home from Auckland So our first flight ever with a A380. We had seats on the upper-deck. Nice spacious cabin. Great luggage bins. Legroom was less than in the A350-900 from Amsterdam. Staff was again very friendly, a lot of drinking services.
label: positive

text: Perfect All The Way A long journey but was very comfortable and enjoyable. Our first leg was London to Singapore and then on to Auckland. Singapore airport is fabulous, it's like a big shopping center with great facilities. Lots of lounges available with showers etc. payable locally. Food and service on board the aircraft was excellent and cabin crew were most pleasant and attentive. Would highly recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Newark. Cabin crew attitude, IFE & food were amazing. The only problem that I had with them was my Mileage Plus, both the cabin crew on the outbound flight and the ground staff in Newark barely knew anything about it. I asked the outbound flight crew about my Mileage Plus, they told me to consult the ground crew who just said both airlines are members of Star Alliance. He wasn't even sure if Mileage Plus members flying on Singapore Airlines were able to access United lounges. However he did tell me that Mileage Plus users (me inclusive) had to upgrade to Gold before accessing a Kris Flyer lounge but that seemed to be the only thing he knew about Mileage Plus.
label: positive

text: Flew Premium Economy as this was Long Haul (13 hour) Flight. This was a Long haul approximately 13 hours. We chose Premium Economy because my husbands height exceeds 6’ 6” And we were celebrating my 60th Birthday on this Holiday
label: positive

text: CNY 2020 Arrived into LAX with 1 missing luggage but was returned to my home the next day. Zipper was broken due to forceful breaking of lock and entire suitcase was bent. Showed it to delivery guy who said I should report to SQ which I did. Reply from SQ was that they are not responsible as this is considered "wear and tear". I don't understand what has this got to do with "wear n tear" when lock is missing with broken zipper and suitcase was bent?? Lucky for me, even with broken zipper nothing was missing. Didn't know SQ is so irresponsible to give me such a reply. Very disappointed as this is not my 1st travel with SQ. I've given good reviews before both business class n premium economy. In fact, was a crew member with SQ back in the 80s n is very proud of this airlines until now!!
label: positive

text: Attitude and Service at its worst Terrible experience on flight 423 on 4/26, from booking, check-in, boarding and in-flight. Booking: All seats on Premium economy, Business and First Class were completely blocked out when online booking was made. Only economy class was available for the above sector. Unbelievable. Check-in: I had asked the ground staff if I could do an upgrade (using my miles, not free upgrade, just to be clear) so that I could get some rest on this red-eye flight due to sore back and stomach discomfort. Ground crew Indian guy informed that flight was completely full and no seats in Premium econ, Business Class or Suites were available. Checked in for the econ class as booked. Boarding: Went to the line for Business class but was turned away by the ground staff, Indian lady. Pointed to the board which indicated Business Class and PPS Club. Oblivious about it, the unbelieveable staff insisted that I go queue in the Krisflyer line together with the rest of the Econ class passengers, despite my ticket showing Group 2 boarding. When finally got to the desk where staff checked boarding pass, I had immediately feedback to the staff to ask if PPS/Group 2 boarding was no longer in practice but to my surprise, she had said I should be using the lane for quick boarding!! Is this now a total disregard for PPS member flying on econ class?? Not to mention the demeaning treatment and embarrassment caused??!!!! In-flight: Was greeted by crew on-board, Matthew. Commented about not being able to book a seat on PE/B/F class and a busy night for the crew for a completely full flight. Feeling discomfort with the seat, I sounded out to him that I was disappointed that there weren't any available seats in Premium, Business or Suites for me to do an upgrade. Was shocked to learn from him while Premium and Business class were full, there were still available seats in Suites. He had then helped to approach the ground staff to check if an upgrade could be done. Ground staff came back to say that they weren't able to upgrade despite seats were still available. (Again, not asking for free upgrade but using my own miles.) Reason given sounded ridiculous, something like the system was closed and nothing could be done. Inflight supervisor came by to say the same. Utterly disappointed that a simple gesture of goodwill for a 6-year PPS member could not even be done, in spite of the discomfort of an unwell passenger. I seriously wonder if this is what and how the airline treats a long time customer these days, not to mention the support and cost in flying premium most of the time. If there isn’t any premium recognition for the premium customers, there serves no point and reason for continuing patronage with the disappointment and letdown caused. And it’s ironic that I had previously given a full rating on TA that contributed to SIA being awarded the world’s best airline by this very same website. Slap!
label: negative

text: With this airline - READ THE T's & C's!!!! Having read the reviews we were excited to say the least! My wife is disabled and I wanted a direct flight to Singapore where we were going to get on a cruise. I booked the flight independently as we wanted to see Singapore over 2 days and not have to rush directly to the ship! Unfortunately 3 days before the flight NCL cancelled the cruise due to the Coronavirus outbreak. Probably a good thing as my wife is over 80 years old (this was to be her 'bucket list' holiday.) I assumed we might get some kind of refund but when I rang the airline they told me that they would not refund a penny - BUT I now owed them $200 cancellation fee!!! I was shocked to say the least as when we read that bit in the Terms and Conditions we thought that it meant we'd get $200 on top of a full refund if they cancelled the flight. So we've lost the full £1,200 cost of the one-way flight plus the cancellation or no-show cost. To add to our misery this was not claimable from Stay Sure Travel Insurance which had cost the two of us £1200 for the year!!!
label: negative

text: What happened to our National carrier?? We had to wait 1.5 hours to check in our luggages at Istanbul! After having a great meal at Turkish Airline’s lounge, we cannot helped but to compare how sad our own Krisflyer lounge at Changi has become! Food and cleanliness were just missing! Hardly any top up and food was pretty tasteless compared to Turkish airline’s lounge where fresh breads and cook to order live stations were well manned! We tried several times to ‘book the cook’ and were not given that option. On board the leading and more senior stewardess ( in green and purple) gave great service as usual, however, the junior stewardess in blue kebaya was just rushing and practically panicking up and down the aisle! For a moment I thought I was on Air France again! There was no grace and the nice touches of serving us on bended knees have all disappeared! Bread had to be requested even after mains were served. Tea had to be requested too when desserts were provided. What happened to the satay too?! The route from Singapore to Istanbul had none. At least the Istanbul to Sin had some!! And the worst part was, when we landed at Changi airport, we discovered her luggage wheel went missing! Her Samsonite was damaged! After making the report, Changi has stated they will repair the luggage not replace it!!! So why did we have priority tags on luggage if the bags were going to be so badly mishandled?! We really would like a replacement Samsonite And seriously, pls do review standards. It is not expensive to provide bed slippers automatically especially the route from Singapore ! Why are there double standards? The Singapore to Istanbul crew stated slippers and eye mask were now upon request only, while the Istanbul back to Singapore had all the usual amenites at the seat? We used to be so proud and happy to fly our national carrier. Now we are seriously thinking its better to go on Qatar Q suites. At least we get pyjamas too and dont need to request for cheap slipper on board
label: negative

text: Fabulous flight Everything was perfect: the service, the food (we got to choose our meal ahead of time), the subtle Christmas decorations. It was an airbus 380 and we were on the upper deck with very comfortable seats and LCD screens. Just perfect for a long day flight.
label: positive

text: Still the BEST! Singapore Airlines never cease to amaze me. Great service, great staff and I know Changi Airport is a different company, this whole experience of flying via Singapore is always a pleasure. The aircraft and crew are always immaculate, the service beyond reproach and while some airlines might be rated better - they really don't come close.
label: positive

text: Extreme attention to passengers Confortable seats and great service,good entrateinment.Kindness and attention to customers.Some problems with connection flights ...even if we try to change the flight from Bali the office in Rome said that will not be problems in Singapore with the return ,also at the airport in Bali they said that will expecially us..So we lost 2 flights and a luggage for arriving late due a late airplane departure from Bali.Anyway we arrive at Milan via Munich and Lufthansa connection
label: positive

text: Disappointing Customer Service after cancellation of connection I booked a flight in January 2018 for a trip in June 2018 through the Singapore Airlines website from SJC to NRT through LAX. They booked us on an Alaska Airlines flight to get us from SJC to LAX. The day before our trip, AA cancelled their flight and Singapore did not even notify us of the cancellation. Fortunately, we were notified by our tripit app that the flight had been cancelled so we called Singapore and they basically said, oops, sorry, then they rebooked us on a Delta flight from SJC to LAX. When we got to the airport in the morning, the Delta flight was completely booked so I'm not sure how we would have gotten to LAX if we hadn't been notified by tripit. We had multiple delays for our SJC to LAX flight on Delta and ended up missing our connection for our LAX to NRT flight on SA. Even though SA booked our flight on Delta, they had no idea that we were delayed and actually called me to see if we were going to make the flight. While we were sitting and waiting in SJC, I called SA to figure out our options since I knew we would miss the connection. Their solutions were to book us on a magic flight that took us from LAX to Boise (I think) and then back to San Francisco and we would get there at the same time as the flight leaving LAX. The other option was for us to fly from LAX to Singapore and then to NRT. At least with this route they conceded that it would kill a day for us. Their final solution and what they actually ended up doing for us was to wash their hands of us and say that Delta was the one that had the delay and that it is their fault and we need to deal with them to get us to NRT. Singapore ended up completely passing the buck even though they were the ones that booked our flight. It wasn't like we booked our own SJC to LAX flight that was delayed. Singapore booked us and then washed their hands of us once the flight they booked us on was delayed.
label: negative

text: Easily the best in the Airline industry I can't think of any other brand in the industry that works so consistently to be number one in a lot of areas. From their service, the type of products (premium economy being my favorite) the courtesy of the staff and their entire motto/ value system they follow is remarkable. I always believe, that for a company to be so successful and consistent, it generally starts from management and trickles down. SQ is a perfect example. Great vision and it shows. How i wish they flew from abu dhabi as well.
label: positive

text: 17 1/2 hour flight I had wanted to fly the Airbus A350-9000 aircraft since I became aware of it. There are two classes. Business Class and Premium Economy. I got a good airfare where it was BC going out and Premium Economy for the return. This review is the outbound in business class. The inbound is a few weeks away. The good: Boarding. Cabin Service. Food (great). I used the Book the Cook service prior to the flight Large Entertainment screen The NOT SO Good: The seat. Yes the seat. It was a lie flat seat but one had to angle one's legs into the left corner instead of straight on. To get into the lie flat position one had to get up and pull the seat back down. Make up the seat, etc. The reverse when going back to a sitting position. The entertainment selection was not by using a touch active screen but a overly sensitive controller. Would I fly it again? Doubtful.
label: neutral

text: Return flight from Hell! We purchased return BC fares on SAL in March this year. 3 days prior to our return flight to Melbourne scheduled for Oct 2nd, I noticed my wife’s return booking reference had disappeared from my SAL app. I rang SAL at that point to be advised that this ticket had been redeemed/cancelled. Big surprise and consternation at this news as neither we nor our travel consultant had requested/received this flight refund/cancellation. Wife in tears for the next few days thinking she’d be stranded overseas or needing to pay a fortune for reaccessing her BC tickets home. Agreed to pay an extra $1708 to SAL @ Schiphol to obtain a BC seat for my wife. Travel agent paid $1400 for economy class ticket for my wife’s Sing to Melbourne trip home. Worst travelling experience we’ve ever had in 40 years. Never flying SAL again and will be “evangelical “in the future describing the appalling lack of Customer Service or care/interest SAL showed for our predicament - apart from the 2 SAL stars at Schiphol (Peggy and Stephen), who did what they could in the circumstances. 0/10 to SAL for this appalling experience!
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Very comfortable seat, on board entertaining very good, cabin crew first class. we also flew Silk Air to Phuket which was also a great trip
label: positive

text: Excellent service Singapore Airlines is our first choice for long distance flights. Their service is amazing, meals surprisingly good for airline food, and seat space better than most.
label: positive

text: Amazing service and great seat I just flight from Munich to Singapore in business class on the New cabin The service as expected was just amazing. The air hostesses attitude was excellent at all time . The seat can be transformed into a flat. bed with quite good space . Since I was seating on a window seat the privacy was total as it’s like small individual cabin . I will use Singapore airlines in near future for sure . TV selection and movies is great although just few languages are available.
label: positive

text: Absolute rubbish Flight delayed 3 hrs , consequently missed connection, no tea or coffee available meals were attrocious
label: negative

text: 14 and a half hour flight better than anticipated Choose this flight because it was direct from Singapore to Manchester. We were returning from a cruise so flight was included in deal. This was a night flight leaving at 2 am in morning. Cabin staff were very friendly and helpful. They made me a cup of tea in the middle of the night. We had frequent offers of water or juice or on request alcohol. The dinner was ok with free wine and a G&T. Breakfast of scrambled egg and chicken sausage (chicken sausage not very nice). The plane was comfortable and one advantage was a foot rest in economy. We did not have that luxury on an A380 super jumbo. Film choice fine. For a long red eye flight it was about as good as it can get in economy.
label: positive

text: Very good Very good service in a fairly new airplane. Short flight with a good service and online check in. Recommend.
label: positive

text: Mrs Ward Felt like Slightly more leg room than many other airlines. Hot towels. Two meal choices. Good on screen safety instructions.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines and Changi Airport Flying from Bali to Singapore, we inadvertently left a carryon bag under our seat. It was 0100 and we were extremely tired. We were unable to recover the bag since they moved the aircraft to a parking area. We departed on our flight to San Francisco before we found the bag. The bag was found later and turned into the Changi Airport lost and found. Singapore Airlines notified us of the status of the bag. After Contacting Changi lost and found, we confirmed the contents of the bag and they apologized for discarding the pistachio nuts. Once we contacted Singapore Airlines at San Francisco airport the personnel notified Singapore Airlines in Singapore and they obtained the bag, after we authorized it’s release from the lost and found, and placed the bag on the next flight to San Francisco. I sent Singapore Airlines San Francisco a FedEx label and the bag was delivered two days later. We received the bag which had a nylon tie on the zipper and everything was in place. We were relieved since there were two noise suppression headsets in the bag. We were sincerely grateful to the way Singapore Airlines and the Changi Airport lost and found handed our situation.
label: positive

text: Excellent, as usual A very good flight, as usual. We had checked our baggage through from Manila, and it arrived fine. I particularly liked the at-gate security checking.
label: positive

text: Flying with Singapore airlines is a must If you have to choose between a number of airlines to reach your destination and SQ is one of them, you'd be doing yourselves a favor to go with that. Travelling with Singapore airlines was truly satisfying. From the food to the service to the smiling crew to the overall comfort, everything was great, regardless it being economy. We travelled Melbourne to Singapore and back, however on the way we continued our journey to Athens with Scoot. Now that is a different story!!! I felt like I hopped off a 5 star hotel and onto a 2 star. I think that may be for another review!!!
label: positive

text: JFK-FRA-SIN-PVG and back to JFK. A380 on JFK-SIN and 777-300ER on SIN-PVG. Everything with Singapore Airlines and Changi Airport was superb. Great entertainment system great food great service great airplanes great economy seats. The food is delicious for asian taste they are one of the best I've seen. My feeder flight was delayed on my way to PVG so I missed my PVG-SIN flight. The SIA staff in PVG changed my ticket without any question or fee. The inflight entertainment on FRA-SIN leg was not functioning properly. When disembarking in SIN the airline staff gave every passenger a gift of leather wallet as compensation and apologized personally to everyone. I am very impressed by Singapore Airlines. They deserve to be a 5 star airline. I will definitely fly SIA again. If there was one thing bad is that I didn't really like their check-in staff in JFK.
label: positive

text: The staff kept waking me up Hated the fact that the staff kept waking me up for food and drinks - seriously it's hard enough to fall asleep on those seats let alone being woke up 3 times. The food was small and not great. I couldn't eat it - was reminiscent to a cheap microwave meal... edible but just.
label: neutral

text: Service Excellent full meal service and any drinks,latest in-flight entertainment, decent leg-room Crew was very friendly and helpful
label: positive

text: Bad experience I will give no star for Singapore airlines if you TripAdvisor has no star for rating. Because I had a terrible experience from Singapore Airlines at DPS (Bali). They have no rule for getting the line. I pay extra for my ticket because I don’t want to wait and getting lines with economy tickets, BUT the coworkers of Singapore airlines at DPS airport don’t care about what I pay extra for. Thus, they let economy passengers who has child go to the airplane before me, doesn’t matter I getting the lines at business lines before them. Firstly, I don’t know why economy passengers who has children can go before me event I pay extra for business tickets. The economy passengers has only 1 child, but they go with 10 adult from 30 to 50 years old. OMG child looks a like an express ticket, that has more powerful than business and first class tickets. Secondly, if you guys rule can let them go with business lines, so they need to getting the line right? The rude things from Singapore airlines coworkers is they let those rude people skip the line and go before business and first class lines. That is so mean and rude service. Third, in the airplane one of passenger has coughed like 30 minutes, that he couldn’t stop. The cabin crew didn’t come to ask him or help him at all. They should tell him goes to the bathroom or give him hot water or at least try to help him, but they didn’t do that. Finally, I will give Singapore Airlines one star for rating. I will not recommend to go with this company. Their service very terrible. If you guy don’t believe me, you can try and will see what happens at DPS Bali airport. Good luck!
label: negative

text: A long flight bit the Airline was good Checked in on line bit unable to change seats that was allocated to us as there was a Cauldron system . Ground agent's very good got there early but could not change seats.The flight was full,maybe that was the reason no change of seat. The A350 to Singapore very Quite in flight and what with the lighting seating and the air,I did not feel as tired. The food was ok but had better food on airlines. But way made the difference was there was a nice hot damp towel,and with all the two flights properly metal cutlery. Also through out the 12 hour flight there was good entertainment on the screen. Along with snacks and a few of the flight attendants going up and down with water and Orange juice. Yet again different to other airlines that don't do that if you want a drink or a Snack you have to press the call button and all the Cree are in a huddle On the second flight much smaller plane and ran by Silk Air but once again flight 3.5 hrs The flight attendants were helpful and friendly that flight again left on time and arrived on time. Well done Singapore/ Silk Air carry on with the good service.
label: positive

text: Long Flight but Sign up for Mobile Passport The flight time is 18.5 hours so be prepared for one long non stop service flight. Service is always very good on SQ but use the time wisely to get yourself adjusted to the local time zone through sleeping time, meals and time to catch in some movies. Upon arrival at Newark at 6am, be prepared to face long queues at US immigration. As of beginning in 2019, arrivals should apply for mobile passport to avoid long queues....not only for visitors but also US passports (those without Global Entry Access). Mobile Passport is easy to setup on line but one can get a free trial to start the App but there will be a charge $19.99 for a year's fee. However, at 6am, the queues are long for all lines so it doesn't really prove that Mobile passport is any faster. Anyway, it will take around 45 mins to clear immigration; which is still way too long compared to other countries.
label: positive

text: So disappointed!! I recently flew from SIN to HK in economy class on a SIN A380. While the service was fine, I was shocked to see how dirty and worn the aircraft was. Several seats had tears in them and the area around my seat was filthy (dirt marks, coffee stains etc.) This is not the Singapore Airlines I remember. What happened to cleaning your aircraft? They should be ashamed of this type of experience
label: negative

text: The standard seems to have slipped in recent years We flew with Singapore Airline a few years and and considered it to be the best carrier we had ever experienced. Everything was impeccable. However, this time, the standard had somehow slipped. The services were still excellent but the seats were cramped. The meal was meagre - only coffee and tea plus a main dish. No entree or sweets or anything. I am a small eater and even I found this to be inadequate (but for some reason, on our return flight from Singapore later on, the menu was much better, The food quality and quantity improved significantly). The cabin was very clean and so were the toilets which also provided other basic amenities such as tooth brushes and combs. Boarding was not too easy as they changed the gate number one hour before boarding. Lucky we arrived early and so had plenty of time to find the new gate and the departure hall was quite large.
label: positive

text: Business Class The Pro's The width of the lie flat beds The service (except for last time) The showers in SG The Con's The price Rebooking a flight is always a nightmare. The Business fares come in Lite, Std and Flexi. If you want to rebook on Lite it is virtually impossible. I checked for 3 weeks (no flights fot Lite, and only 1 for std!) I regard it as a con. $4k pp to change! We have flown with SG Air for 15 years, but are trying someone new, and will never fly again with them.
label: negative

text: New business class I was quite happy to be upgraded to business class on a recent flight but was disappointed with the new seats and food. The seats are comfortable but rather tight for anyone over six foot tall, there was not much choice in the movies presented and the food well......chicken rice and later a pulled pork roll just don’t cut it. The service from the staff was impeccable as usual and I even was given a second bread roll when I asked. I can see it is a part of a cutback that most airlines are doing now to lower airfares but maybe if Singapore took another $20 out of business class fares they could maybe give flyers a better food choice.
label: neutral

text: Stay far away from SIA Terrible terrible airline. I boycotted them for years, but thought I’d give them a shot again. Nope, bad choice. I had to change one way of my return trip. Sent in an enquiry for change before my flight, which is the only way you can get in contact with a human. Without informing me first, they cancelled my return flight, and sold off my reservation to someone else. Then proceeded to tell me to rebook my original booking for an additional 2k USD, with the excuse being a flexi ticket instead of a lite ticket. Unethical and money grabbing. Please note, if you had the misfortune of booking with them before reading my review, that they do not hold tickets that they quote you in an email. They will proceed to tell you that the tickets they quoted you in the morning has been sold, so your only option is to pay more money, than what you’ve already paid for a business class ticket, to beg them to give you an economy ticket. Please, for the sake of your sanity, stay away from this airline. Pretty much any airline out there is a better option.
label: negative

text: Still one of the best Our first flight on an A350 and the seating was excellent, both the ‘normal’ seating and the lay flat bed. The plane was almost brand new so everything on board was immaculate. The check in ar Düsseldorf was seamless and the checkin staff were efficent and extremely pleasant. As always the service on board was all one could ask for and again, as previously the food was excellent with a good wine selection. Singapore never fail to impress and they are definitely up there as one of the leading aitrlines if not the best.
label: positive

text: I just don’t get it. What am I missing? World’s best airline? Not by a very long shot!! I quit flying SQ’s economy products years ago while living in Singapore. It was so often terrible, notably dirty. Most recently I ventured back into their business class to discover their new fit out. I honestly didn’t think I could dislike a plane seat more than their old fold down leather seats which became lumpy and rancid smelling, but alas, at least you had space to stretch while the seat was in its bed configuration. The new seat is a regular slide down seat BUT it’s extremely hard and excruciatingly uncomfortable to sleep on. It’s like laying on a wood floor with less than an inch of fabric to provide comfort. Bring back the smelly old leather seats I say! Although on my return flight I got that old fit out on an A380 and it was still stinking like the back of on old man’s car. A note on cabin crew: I find the so-called SQ girls (and boys) to be extremely insincere and unhelpful. Even in business class, they are slow to respond and barely articulate. The fake and uncomfortable grimacing is upsetting. The Singapore girl on my aisle was trying hurry me into menu choices I didn’t want because she visibly couldn’t be bothered. Worse still, she couldn’t pronounce any of the words correctly, which was ridiculous. Not a matter of accent, but a complete lack of interest. Generally speaking, Singapore Airlines is just so tacky. From the ugly old uniforms to the lounges, to the inflight music and the menus, which look like they were typeset in the 1980s using your neighbour’s word processor. Just awful.
label: negative

text: Comfort and Great Customer Service keeps me faithful to Singapore Airlines I have flown SQ whenever possible, to China, South Korea, India, Indonesia , but never have I experience such good service in economy class then on this route I flew Singapore to Johannesburg and return by Cape Town. On the way in i had a rash on my arm and requested the stewardess for some cream to relief the itch. She not only came with the anti-septic cream but also offered to apply it for me. Thanks to her I had a good flight. She checked up on me 2-3 time afterwards and eventually offered me to take the tube of cream on my trip. Its these little gestures which make me go back to flying SQ time and time again Service aside, SQ lies 350 3-3-3 configuration. The leg room was extremely generous. I am 1.68 and could stretch out comfortably without touching the back of the seat in front. Airflow and air pressure was excellent
label: positive

text: Perth to Singapore. My seat was a single seat by the window. The seat fully reclines and a little enclave under the monitor allows legs to be fully stretched out (for short people like me). Overall, a comfortable flight with good entertainment and plenty of food. I was even able to get Umeshu on the flight. Service is excellent and the complimentary WiFi service tied me through 5 hours on WhatsApp.
label: positive

text: Disappointing Although this airline gets the best airline in the world the last 3 times we have flown buisness class out of Australia to Europe and Singapore have been disappointing. The staff are mostly quite good with an occasional expection. The food was very average and very disappointing. The flavour and the quality was ordinary. The fish was watery and bland. Sweets were unamaginative. Fruit presented in a basket for other passengers as well and you were asked to take what you wanted with your hand!!!!! The bread rolles were ordinary and they preferred you had the garlic bread which looked awful. Cheese was presented without crackers. Quality of choclate poor on one flight. It felt like the cabin crew wanted to keep the bread and chocolates and cheese for themselves to eat or to save momey. On one flight no combs, toothbushes or decent toiletrees in the toilet. All in all not good enough and disappointing. Will try other airlines next time.
label: neutral

text: Disappointed Had not flown SQ since the days their "BigTop" used to land at CYYZ. Their new Ultra Long Range 350, while technically impressive, had sub-par seats/lie flat beds; passable catering and a cabin crew member with attitude! In fairness, my interaction with other members of the cabin crew were most cordial. A poorly designed seat and tasteless meals detracted from an enjoyable flying experience. Not looking forward to our return flight - to EWR.
label: neutral

text: Why can't Singapore Airlines act in good faith when altering bookings. "Complimentary / No penalty" should mean that. We booked return business class flights to Europe on flexible tickets. It was then necessary for us to change the Sydney Paris leg to Sydney Istanbul on a later date. The ticket conditions stated "Booking change fee Complimentary (a fare difference may apply)" . We expected this fare difference condition to be applied in good faith. Singapore Airlines imposed a 30% penalty for this change. I questioned the Singapore Airlines staff on this 30% penalty in two regards Firstly, we were changing to a shorter, cheaper flight, why was the cost increasing? * Flight Time for Singapore Paris is 13h 35m. Flight Time for Singapore Istanbul is 11h 0m * The fare for Sydney Paris is AUD7792.39-8217.25 The fare for Sydney Istanbul is AUD 6342.59 at the time we proposed the change to the booking. Secondly, part of this change is that an airfare Singapore Paris on 26 Aug is now made available for sale by Singapore. The price of this fare is higher than the Istanbul fare which would be taken off the market by our change. So as well as charging an extra 30% for the outward bound leg of our journey, Singapore profit further by the higher sale price of that Paris fare. Singapore may well say that they might not sell this fare. Perhaps, but they also may not sell the Istanbul fare. Despite interactions with many many Singapore Airlines staff, not one person ever answered the issues raised, or in any way "owned the problem" To make matters worse the Singapore Airlines representative proudly told me there was "no penalty" for the change in booking. In such case why the 30% charge for changing to a cheaper flight ? So while I understand “revenue maximisation models” I also understand concepts of acting in good faith with customers. How does this latter concept factor in their penalty ? Singapore Airlines talks with pride about the experience it provides to people who fly with them. The process we are going through now is part of that experience. All we were looking for is that people act in good faith and with fairness. These practices should really be reviewed by Australia's consumer protection authorities. The statement "Booking change fee Complimentary (a fare difference may apply)" is clearly grossly misleading. That should be our next step.
label: negative

text: Continually fantastic service From the moment you sit to the time you step off the plane the staff are always helpful and polite. The wet towel to refresh, the pillow and blanket, the snacks given out straight away.....all these little extras make for a comfortable flight. I always found my seat comfortable and roomy, and clean with no rubbish in pockets. Toilets are clean. Food is always nice. The stopover in Singapore was easy and overall Singapore airlines is by far my airline of choice. A pleasure to fly with them.
label: positive

text: Very Uncomfortable Biz Seat Quite how the new seat design was approved is a quirk of nature. And to install it on the longest flight in the works is some kind of cruel joke. In unreclined mode you are sat bolt upright with nowhere to rest your legs, unless you have the flexibility of a gymnast and can squeeze them into the small space diagonally opposite you. Some points awarded if you can get one of your legs in the hole! Then when you want to sleep, rather than press a button and recline you have to stand up and wrestle the bed which is heavy and cumbersome to get it to fold down (watch all the other irritated passengers doing the same) and then lie down at an angle to try desperately to tuck your feet into the diagonal hole. Incredibly uncomfortable and best suited for those auditioning for Houdini roles or small kids who I imagine don’t travel Biz too often. I am 6,1 and 180 lbs. You will wake up in some strange contortion with new aches in your body. Awesome. Food is excellent, entertainment excellent and cabin noise low. But even the service level has dropped as you are automatically woken for food, all lights and music go on and it feels like a production line versus the old SQ EWR SIN nonstop which was bespoke and tailored to comfort. A sentence that could never be uttered for many years, but the AA biz seat is the Tesla of seats compared to SQ’s Reliant Robin clunker.
label: negative

text: Best Airline Experience The service and professionalism on the airline is top notch and I only happened to stumble upon this airline/flight on Expedia. I was in economy so I can only imagine the service and amenities in first class or suites. Great entertainment, hot towels, good food, yummy snacks, comfy seats.. what more can I ask for?
label: positive

text: Best staff ever Although flying with Singapore Airlines is comfortable and convenient, we would like to mention that their staff are what makes them exceptional. We had a difficult situation and they handled it with patience, kindness and effectiveness. They didn't stop until they found a solution. We want to thank to the staff in general but very much in particular to Thuong and Hang, from the ground staff (Hanoi). Thank you very much! We will definitely use Singapore service whenever possible in the future. You got two new loyal customers!
label: positive

text: Nice in-flight entertainment program First of all, UI/UX of in-flight entertainment program is nicely working. Program such as movie and music is good, too. Meal is not bad.
label: positive

text: Spot On Again Having previously criticised this for 'penny pinching', I am more than happy to praise them for what they have now got right on two recent long haul flights. The customer care is back to being second to none and the food and entertainment packages were also first class. We were lucky in that the return flight was not full and so my wife and I had three seats each, this enabling us to get flat and sleep properly. I would most certainly rate this airline in the top few of long haul carriers and we really enjoyed each leg of what is a long journey. Many thanks to Singapore Airlines!!
label: positive

text: So disappointed I was happy to travel with SQ as it was one of the top airline. The advertisement shows always business or first. But for this trip I traveled in economy. I was surprised by the old plane A330. The Seat was uncomfortable and no space for legs. I am not a tall guy!! Impossible to touch the small meal. The only good thing is the air hostess with great smile. But a smile is not enough to satisfy a passenger. Next trip I will go Bangkok. Let see how will be SQ
label: negative

text: LHR-SIN economy 12 May 15. Airplane was very comfortable with flat seats extremely comfortable to lay down (as it was half empty most of people had a row of seats for himself). Inflight entertainment had a large variety of movies of any genre. Food was good and generally abundant. The only two drawbacks were the delay it had departing from Heathrow (more than 1 hour) and the possibility to have dinner with reclined seats meaning that I had little space for my dinner as the child in front of me decided to do so. I would still classify a 5 star experience.
label: positive

text: Singapore to New York JFK via Frankfurt. The cabin staff are friendly and responsive with what I requested. The seat was quite comfortable, they also provide blanket, pillow, eyeshades, earplugs, playing cards for the kids and more. The inflight entertainment was awesome with latest movies. However the ticket is quite expensive because I'm a traveler which likes to accrue 100% miles when I'm flying. And maybe if it's possible for the wi-fi and internet connection they should give as a complimentary for the guest who does not a promotion ticket.
label: positive

text: Best Airline. Ever. The crew are so gracious, lovely and kind regardless of your cabin class. They will do their best to serve you and fulfil your needs. The food is delicious and the entertainment system was filled with endless movies and TV shows!
label: positive

text: Not as good as we expected We were disappointed with our first experience of Singapore Airlines, we expected far better. The plane was old, the seat back touch screens were in need if maintenance and repair, I like to play the games but you couldn’t. The food was only just warm (health risk?) and the staff were not very visible, they seemed really keen for everyone to sleep, although it was a morning flight. There was a distinct lack of drinks and no alcoholic drinks were offered at all. This said the flight was boarded on time and arrived on time.
label: neutral

text: Love it It was my first time traveling with Singapore and I enjoyed it The staff were very kind the meals were abit odd. I do definitely recommend this airline
label: positive

text: Singapore to Sydney. I always fly Singapore Airlines as it offers the most direct flights out of Singapore. Flew on SQ241 on Feb 8th. SQ advises that all their SQ flights with B777-300ER and A350/380 has wi-fi. Unfortunately this flight has no WiFi despite it being a B777-300ER plus flying out at 0700 one would expect a little breakfast. Sadly there was no meals until 12 noon Singapore time which means about 3pm Sydney time. I overheard an American passenger asking for some food as he was hungry. I can understand that most of the passengers are doing a transit but there are many of us who are just starting our day and with a flight at 0700 there is not much time for breakfast. I would appreciate if SQ indicate clearly which flights have wifi and not a blanket statement about the aircraft.
label: neutral

text: We Flew from Sydney to Prague, then Paris to Sydney on our way home. Clean, friendly, great food! Service was exquisite! Fellow travellers, I would like to share our experience with you. My partner & I were booked on a river cruise Prague to Paris. We boarded Singapore Airline flight SQ 0228 to Singapore, short airport stopover at Singapore Airport then on to Frankfurt Germany. Although we were only flying Economy class, the service was certainly first class, we had all the creature comforts an airline can offer. The staff treated us like family, very helpful & concerned for our comfort. The food was sensational (for airline food) so much so we were waiting for our next meal. The cabin was comfortable and clean and the pilots ensured we had a comfortable & safe trip. We flew back to Sydney from Paris ,,,, well done Singapore Airlines! Would I fly Singapore Airlines again? You bet I would!!
label: positive

text: Sydney to Singapore. We are very disappointed that we arrived 5 hours before the departure to get seats in row 30's and we were told its all full. As we are older people in early 70's. We were told we should select our seats by Internet. We checked 48hrs before departure online however all seats were allocated, the seats available were the same seats open 48hrs ago. What a shame that airline has no remorse to senior people. We are seating in toilet class row 56's. As seniors we make two or three trips a year however we haven't encountered this situation in our travelling time. Manager was not considerate or seriously shown any interest. Remember sorry does not make pain go away. I will advise the all the family and friends not to travel Singapore Airlines in future.
label: negative

text: Singapore rocks A380 JFK-FRA-SIN. great as always B777 SIN-MNL-SIN -OK B777 SIN-INC-LAX - ok. Can’t fault anything Singapore does. There is a reason they are always number one rated.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Manila return. On my outbound flight, cabin crew welcome at the aircraft door and they escorted me to my seat and helped to place my hand carry-on bag. I was pleased with the positive attitude that staff displayed throughout the flight. My flight back to Singapore was the same, and my biggest concern was getting a 2 seater window for my friend and I. Onboard the Boeing 777-200, 99% of the aircraft is configured 3-3-3 seating. I highlighted my concerns to cabin crew and she spared no effort trying to find a 2 seater seat in the economy cabin, though she was not able to do so.
label: positive

text: Tokyo to Jakarta via Singapore. Exceptional, but not in a good way. Missed connecting flight to Jakarta due to afternoon typhoon in Singapore. Plane from Tokyo landed in Batam, Indonesia instead, flew back to Singapore in three hours. Same issue happened once due to technical problem, but apparently SIA always tries their best not to compensate me with business class seats, even though I missed my flight because of their problems and I have been their gold member for 4 years now. I was compensated only with another economy class seat and SGD 15 meal voucher that I can only redeem at limited number of food outlets at Changi airport, and most of them are too random (food not looking good at all). They have been also been doing this cost cutting in the economy class meals by not giving appetizers anymore. FAs never happy when I order some special drinks even though they are on the menu. If SIA wants to do some cost cutting or what not, they should have made it less obvious, especially to loyal customers, otherwise loyal customers will look for other cost-effective Star Alliance carriers. Their ticket price for the same route is a lot more expensive compared to some other Star Alliance such as ANA and Asiana Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Best Airline during Covid Due to very sad reasons I had to fly to the Netherlands/ other side of the world unexpectedly during Corona. On booking I called Singapore Airlines and this guy helped me patiently to get to all the info I needed for flying during these times. Everything went smoothly flying there and coming back with a stop over in Singapore. I never felt at risk of getting Corona and am very grateful for their help. I felt very safe with flying Singapore Airlines and would definitely recommend it to any one who has to travel during these uncertain times.
label: positive

text: Bali to Singapore. As always SQ know how to run an airline business. Warm hospitality and I will always take with them for Southeast Asia route, always keep up the nice work!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Always has been my jet of choice for both leisure and business. The service as usual has always be perfect and your reasonable request will always be met.
label: positive

text: Over booking !!! Pleasant flight.When we were booking our seats.we were told that the double cabins were booked up, We were suprised when we boarded that there were 3 other paxs in the single cabins like us, My wife and I were deprived of a double cabin thanks to overbooking!!! Apparently SIA allows advanced bookings of up to 9 months thus the business travellors book their seats ahead of any intended flights-whether they were flying or not,and the airline allows this till 1 month before the flight.!!!
label: positive

text: A class above the rest Flew SQ833 (A380) from Pudong to Singapore. Was able to secure Premium Economy seats for my family of 3. Unlike other airlines where this category is mostly a step up in terms of space, there are other noticeable difference for SQ's offer. The personal monitor is larger, champagne is offered, better food, Haagen Daz ice cream was served for dessert. The icing on the cake has to be their service. That is truly what sets them apart from airlines that can offer comparable hardware.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines has lost its edge. Undertook four long-haul flights with Singapore airlines in November/December 2022. The flight from London to Singapore was excellent. Attentive and courteous flight attendants plus good service. Just what one would normally expect from Singapore airlines. the next three flights were average to bad. Boarding in Changi airport was a complete scrum. No clear differentiation of lines for business class and economy. The return flight from Singapore to London was totally lacklustre. Although business class was approximately one third empty the staff were lethargic at best. The only drinks offered during this 13.5 hour flight were at the two meal services. Over the past 30 years I have travelled extensively in both business class and economy. I can mostly say that the level of service is far better in Thai air economy class. Come on Singapore airlines, don't rest on your laurels in this highly competitive market.
label: neutral

text: Amazing experience in world class A380 Singapore airlines is indeed world class airline with very good service.I booked seats on upper deck economy behind business class which was but very comfortable with little more leg space & 2 seats configuration.Flight was on time and staff was also very warm & helpful.I would recommend to fly in Singapore Airlines by paying little more for their world class hospitality with good entertainment system as well.
label: positive

text: One of my Favorite airlines! Amazing airlines and one of my Fav! Aside from their airport which has an amazing attraction and view, their city itself is very safe and homey!
label: positive

text: The best flight ever (that I can remeber...) Everyone complain about how hard it is to fly more than 20 h. But with Singapore Airlines it’s a pleasure. The seats are really comfortable and have a lot of room for long legs, even with a foot-rest. The service is excellent, also food and drinks and the entertainment system. I will totally fly with SA again!!
label: positive

text: Disappointment at request My husband has a medical problem which means he needs an aisle seat. Every time we fly Singapore, we are allocated a window and the middle seat, in spite of requesting an aisle seat. Usually we can change this when we book in on line. This time we could not do that, even though we tried as soon as bookings opened, so the concierge at the hotel rang them and asked for us. He was told they could not help us because we had booked through a travel agent, the plane was full and no change was available. We have flown to Europe with Singapore and are frequent flyers, but we then decided to change to Qantas for our next visit to Europe and will no longer fly with Singapore.
label: neutral

text: Appalling customer service On the second leg of my flight to Sydney which originated in Manchester I was groped while asleep by the passenger next to me. I had been travelling for over 18 hours by this point and when I woke to find another passengers had running and squeezing my thigh I was shocked and frightened. I didn’t know how to discreetly report it to cabin crew and quite frankly just wanted to get off the plane. When I landed I was in tears. My friends encouraged me to write an incident report and send it to the airline. The airline were shockingly unsympathetic and unhelpful. They told me it was a police matter and nothing to do with them. They were cold and unsympathetic. They told me all the things they could have done had i reported it on board. There was no sympathy or understanding of how difficult my experience was. I was also provided with incorrect information about how to report the incident to the police which worryingly indicates to me the airline has not got a grip on the issue. I can’t find the words to express my disappointment adequately. Passenger safety extends beyond showing people where life jackets and emergency exits are. These issues need to be taken more seriously by the airline.
label: negative

text: Airline from hell Terrible customer service wo t return. All or fiction issues just sY someone will call back within 24 hr to 48 but never do
label: negative

text: SQ25, JFK-FRA, in Business. Check in Counter, did not know how to put a Final Destination on my luggage, and instead insisted that it go to FRA, and get rechecked in. Finally a supervisor came over, and showed them how to put my luggage through. Virgin Lounge was nice and comfortable, although few available meal options. Boarding was fast easy, crew came around to take orders, and offer me a blanket. Slim menu choices, with no Don Perignon, but as we are in COVID, I accepted what was offered. Seat was extremely spacious, and comfortable. IFE was a disaster. I have been flying with Singapore Airlines since 2008, and 24 November's Flight was a appallingly horrific turnaround from what I've previously experienced. Difficult to use as well. Landed in FRA, and proceeded to next flight. Can't wait to fly Singapore Airlines Business Class again, but on a longer route, and hopefully out of COVID.
label: positive

text: One of the best Airline to Fly Singapore Airlines is one of the best airline to travel oversea. For Indian Vegetarian people, food outside India is very important factor. I was served very good quality hindu veg meal. Leg room was less, but that is the same case with all airlines if you are travelling in economy. Inflight entertainment was very good with latest movies and series available to watch. One good point was that I was able to follow Australia open final with inflight wifi service.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - What a disgrace !!!!! What pathetic service!!! I had 2 international seat booked flying Cairns to Germany for a family vacation. Unfortunately my manager walked out 72 hours prior to my departure so my approved leave at work was cancelled and I was unable to travel if I wanted to keep my job. After spending in excess of 4 hours on the phone to customer NO service was unable to transfer the NAME ONLY of the existing ticket to another family member. I was even fortunate enough to have the customer service manager tell me she has other calls waiting and would hang up on me. Best they could offer was cancel the ticket and purchase a new one at DOUBLE the price for another family to travel the same flight - highway robbery. My husband has now traveled solo and there is a vacant seat on the flight next to him.
label: negative

text: singapore airlines Seats on both the A380 and Boeing A350 were very uncomfortable. Singapore Airlines was as usual excellent, but the food on both flights was awful.
label: neutral

text: Unsatisfactory customer service We nooked our flight with our credit card but we didn't carry physical card with us bcoz we have other international cards for our trip... But during checkin this manager wanted to see our physical card and when i hv shown my cards copy on phone along with other proofs he just denied to accept and asked us to pay the same amount with 100aed charges... This is absurd... They just doing this random check if this is security related it should be checked with everyone... Hopefully my husband gets the card from home on time... If else they dont even refund the flight ticket
label: negative

text: Disgrace I went to Perth in June expecting another world class performance from sq but no it was quite the opposite. So firstly the flight was delayed but at least we took off. The flight attendants on the flight were suprisingly horrible. All they said when I boarded was hi. HI😳 The food in the flight was utterly disgusting. Rather poor by sq standards. The tray table wasn’t cleaned and the attendants literally ignored me. Sq world class service 😂😂😂 I had always liked sq but after the flight I wasn’t quite sure to fly sq ever again
label: negative

text: Worse customer service ever! Do not waste your money with them!! I Made a mistake on booking an upgrade, tried to get SA to cancel like within 20minutes. I upgraded the wrong flight! But at the same time I was half asleep and didn’t think SA would ask to if I wanted to upgrade on a short leg of my trip, and the second leg of my trip. They would not help, quoted T&Cs, spoke to me like robots who read from a check sheet. No compassion horrible service. Clearly terrified of showing any compassion. I didn’t want a free flight or anything, I just want to cancel the upgrade. Will never fly SA again, the onboard service is always the best, but let down my politics and office staff. To just quote T&Cs all the time and take the stance they have, is some big company bully. T&Cs that clearly protect them but not the customer. They state they can cancel an upgrade when ever the want, but same reversed they can’t! These people forget that without the customers there is no company. And from time to time, idiots like me make a mistake! Just another robot company, in it for the money and nothing else.
label: negative

text: I reported them to department of transportation They advertised complimentary rebooking which is why I chose this airline. Because of COVID, I felt I needed the flexibility. After reading several similar reviews on tripadvisor, I have just reported them to the Department of Transportation. Their website lacks functionality to rebook or cancel flights. Live chats with customer service state there are no representatives available. I have tried submitting an online form 3 times with an automated response received but no follow up to resolve my issue within the time frame they promised. I have waited on hold for over an hour with their Los Angele office only to be disconnected at 1:20. I have tried calling their office in the country I am visiting several times and I waited for over 30 minutes without success. I understand that with the pandemic, airline response times will be slower, but I began this process 18 days before my flight and still no success. I have never reported any business before, but this is the peak of negligence - either that or fraud. Even if this eventually does get resolved, which I am beginning to doubt, it has been a miserable, frustrating experience. I have resigned myself to lose a lot of money. Maybe in a pre or post-covid world this airline is good. But I wouldn't book with them at this time.
label: negative

text: Damaged Luggage Policy - APPALLING Singapore Airlines' damaged luggage policy is appalling - it excludes damage to wheels, handles and even cuts to your baggage - see copy of policy below. It appears that SA doesn't actually cover any damage to your suitcases. I just returned from a trip to China and found that the handle on my expensive Samsonite suitcase had been damaged. I have traveled a lot (mostly with Qantas) so knew that I had to immediately report the damage at the airport. However, at the baggage counter for Singapore Airlines, the exclusions were pointed out to me. The exclusions are extensive - see below. I couldn't believe that Singapore Airlines will not cover damage that they have done to your suitcases. Seriously? However, I would like to note that the lady at the Counter was very empathetic and nice to me - which took a bit of the sting out of SA's horrible policy. SA Damaged Baggage Policy Except as the applicable Conventions or other law or regulations may otherwise require, we do not assume liability for normal wear and tear to baggage. This includes: Cuts, scratches, scuffs, dents and marks that may occur despite careful handling Damage to, or loss of, protruding parts of the baggage including, straps, pockets, pull handles, hanger hooks, wheels, external locks, security straps, zipper tabs or other parts attached to the baggage Unsuitably-packed luggage (e.g. over-packed) Baggage accepted under the conditions of the Limited Release tag – this includes items retrieved or confiscated by the airport authorities or security personnel
label: negative

text: Exceptional, as always SQ26 SIN-JFK Beautiful Suites, Glorious food, unending Krug (or Dom) champagne, but most of all, unparalleled, superfluous FA service. This experience should be on everyone's bucket list!
label: positive

text: Best Transit Flight Flight Service was great experience even for my daughter, enjoyed her first flight for vacation entertainment is also fine for kids, as well as the food selections was great for the amount we paid during our flight..it was month of October and during transit of 5hours we enjoy our airport tour with butterfly garden, free chair massage, kids corner, free airport WiFi..
label: positive

text: do not book Singapore - They canceled connect flight to many people Myself and my friend flu in Singapore back in July. My flight from Sydney -Singapore-Zurich-Vienna -ZURICH -VIENNA FLIGHT CANCELED- NO EXPLANATION My friend Sydney-Singapore-Munich-Vienna Munich-Vienna FLIGHT CANCELED My boyfriend & his brother Flight scheduled for 10/10/22 We just learned they cancelled two flights ZURICH -VIENNA /Vienna-Zurich NO EXPLANATION They sell cheap flights and then cancel without a refund- only credit. No worth the hassle- Don't book with this airline
label: negative

text: Cut short holiday Had to cut short our holiday in Australia for sudden bereavement , and other reasons in family. the airline would not transfer our tickets to a departure 2 weeks earlier , we had to cancel our flights first before we could rebook , and then pay for 2 seats as well , as it was we had to get home so we paid .Staff in Flightcenter Manly were very helpful and did all they could for us ,many thanks to them , but disappointed with airline , probably will not fly with them again .
label: neutral

text: Fantastic service Singapore airlines are truly the best out there I've flown with many operators and they are by far the best
label: positive

text: Trying to cancel a flight and get a refund This review is not about a flight experience but the awful experience we had with Singapore Airlines trying to connect with a live agent and to get someone to address the cancel and refund process that we wanted done within 24 hours of our booking. Their webpage has numbers that don't exist, call centers are staffed by rude, unprofessional people that hang up on you after giving you another number that doesn't exist. We spent 6 hours trying to sort the simple issue out. We finally found a number after an extensive online search and by just randomly hitting numbers on the number pad when it went into auto mode, we connected with an individual. Mercifully, Joni was the exception and she handled the refund issue in 15 minutes. We just lost a half day trying to sort something that was a mere 15 minutes ..if that and to get an email stating that our refund would be made available in 4-6 business weeks. It doesn't take that long for SA to collect monies from us but, boy, the completely asinine process in place to amend an issue is unbelievable for an institution that has been in place for as many years as SA has been.
label: negative

text: It's maintained its class Whilst most airlines diminish their service to passengers, Singapore Airline (Manchester to Singapore) continues to value its customers Food good, drinks good,snacks available throughout flight, really nice and professionalcrew, Will fly Singapore at every opportunity
label: positive

text: #1 for a reason Singapore airline is rated the number 1 airline in the world and it shows. The staff on board are the most accommodating and professional I have ever saw. The airport is immaculate and the plane is just the same. Everyone gets a pillow and blanket. There are TVs located behind every seat with enough movies and shows to keep you busy during such a long flight. The in flight food is pretty good also. They feed you what seems like every 4 hours lol you also get free alcohol and snacks whenever you want. The flight was smooth to Germany then to Singapore everything went well no hold ups or delays. The flight staff were well dressed and polite to everyone on board. I can’t recommend this airline enough when traveling abroad. Like I said they are #1 for a reason and it really shows. I’d pick Singapore airline everywhere I go and I wish airlines in the United States would model themselves after them as they are the pinnacle of flying right now.
label: positive

text: The entertainment! Got a 2 to go tickets otherwise this carrier is out of my budget. The flight to London is a Beoing 777, nice seats and bright toilets. Coming back, it was a A380 but I didn't like the toilet because they are dark and cramped. Food is awful. The breakfast chicken noodle was mushy it became one 'united' noodle that was disgusting to eat. Missed the nuts; the cracker pack has green peas that can break my teeth. The plane stinks and was nauseating when they get ready for meals. They provide water periodically. I watched almost 24 hours of TV/movies both ways; what a great way to fly. More Korean movies would be much appreciated. Checked in with mobile app and the passport scan is pesky and inaccurate data capture. But it is convenient because trips are all consolidated in the app.
label: positive

text: First SG Dreamliner Flight Left early and arrived early! I like 787's and this was a good one - the seats were snug compared to the 380 but that's how Boeing did it - changed the original 2-4-2 configuration to a more cramped 3-3-3. Better video system than the SG 380. My lamb curry was exceptional!
label: positive

text: Long flight made pleasant We have flown different airlines in the past but Singapore airlines has been one of the best - for space and service mostly. We didnt find the in house films particularly exciting although there was a huge selection in various languages - could be they just werent to our personal taste. The food was reasonable although it beats me how all the airlines seem to offer quite a lot of stodgey food. The fresh fruit salad was wonderful. Flying via Singapore with a long connection time we took advantage of free bus tour around city; Got a few hours quality sleep in a transit hotel in the airport. Tips given staff at Singapore Airways which we enjoyed.
label: positive

text: Can Not Believe it’s Singapore Airlines My family had been using Singapore Airlines for five decades and IT WAS my favorite until my last one five weeks ago. The first flight from SGN was better but the long one to the states was so bad. The seat was not comfortable comparing with other airlines as premium economy, the food was not good but Hägen-Dazs ice cream that I like and the most upset me was the lady flight attendants being so rude even our cabin was about half full, maybe due to this time when passengers were wearing masks to keep themselves safe during the flight. It was too costly for us to purchase one way tickets to fly with Singapore Airlines I used to think it was the best for traveling in Asia. Full of disappointments for this trip when we’ve almost got charge for almost another 8 hundred dollars so we had to fly a day later for almost 2 hundred instead for the date change after we got the tickets
label: negative

text: Generally excellent courteous service but Entertainment system which offers a vast selection of films is the only downside to the flight. I am constantly pointing out to the flight crew out of every 4 flights I take on SIA I will experience problems with the entertainment system on at least 3. If not complete breakdown it is usually a problem with âstuttering (picture freezes and then catches up but cutting out parts of the film in the process) and/or the sound disappearing half way through a film. My family members share my experience. Consequently the problem is systemic and chronic. The fact that SIA does nothing to improve this demonstrates not only a clear lack of commitment to delivering a seamless enjoyable passenger experience but also a lack of consideration for the flight crew who have to spend so much time unnecessarily dealing with passengers complaints. By the way system reboots are a very frustrating and annoying thing for passengers to put up with. But this seems to be the cheap route they have chosen rather than fixing what is patently broken.
label: positive

text: Business Class Night Flight Changi Singapore to London. Perhaps the best night flight one can experience. Almost surreal with wraith like hostesses in traditional sarongs so professional and attentive. The seat / bed virtually goes back to horizontal and although secured by a seat belt, you can lie comfortably on your side. High quality food and drink. I normally start off with champagne, have dinner with red wine, then finish off with a brandy. This suffices to ensure a good eight hours sleep, waking up in time for breakfast refreshed, prior to landing in London. You pay more, but by Harry, it's worth it.
label: positive

text: A great Airline I have flown many times both economy and Business class and have never been disappointed, the staff are always attentive and nothing is a problem the planes are well maintained and always spotlessly clean
label: positive

text: Long haul service plus No long haul flight is easy, but SA offered great service with friendly staff from beginning to end. Literally a Champagne welcome set the tone, and the hospitality was excellent throughout. Premium Economy offered a step up into comfortable seats and more space overall. Getting my feet up was wonderful.
label: positive

text: Best Airline ! PAIR-PAGSS is the outsourced ground staff of Singapore Airlines. 2-thumbs up for their excellent service!! Singapore Airlines has regained my trust after a disastrous boarding at Changi Airport 4 months back.
label: positive

text: Dated aircraft but good on time performance Boarding was efficient so the flight departed Changi right on time at 0930 hours, arriving MNL two minutes early at 1303. The flight was far busier than my connecting flight from Melbourne, and had about 280 passengers. Service from the crew was very slow. It took 75 minutes to get the basic meal and a drink. They just weren't as friendly as on the leg ex Melbourne. The KrsiFlyer entertainment menu is best in class: way above any other airline on which I've travelled (more than 20). The economy and business cabins both look somewhat dated even though the B773ER was only eleven years old. Overall, still better than many competitors but this 3.5 hour flight was not memorable.
label: neutral

text: Far East journey With a 2 - 4 - 2 seating plan this aircraft gave the two of us some privacy. Dinner was served as soon as cruising level was reached, a choice of 2 main course was offered and was very tasty (beef). In flight tv had a vast scope of viewing and the flight past smoothly, as ever on Singapore Airlines the cabin crew were excellent.
label: positive

text: Very good After reading the reviews was expecting the worst, I needn't have worried. Excellent in flight service, especially from the crew. Pleasant food, champagne and nice wines by the glass. Seating very comfortable on this 787, though if you want to lie down your body is at an awkward angle and not conjusive to a good rest. Singapore Air did cancel one of my return flights to Perth which left me with a 12 hour stopover after flying in from Bangkok, but that's another story.
label: positive

text: Taking Advantage. Due to Malaysia being on lock down and being forced to stop in our hotel rooms without any amenities we decided to return home early. Singapore Airlines charged us RM 2700 for changing our flights. As a frequent flyer on Singapore Airlines I think these charges are excessive when you take into account the World is in Crises. Thank you Singapore Airlines for your understanding and treatment of customers during this crises profit is obviously of more concern to you.
label: negative

text: Attentive service and great food The crew are very attentive and friendly. The stewardess servicing us are always caring and attentive to our needs. The foods was good with fantastic Japanese cuisine, good choices of cheese. This flight is one of the best I have ever encountered.
label: positive

text: Great experience A twelve hour flight in economy. It is hard to get excited about a trip when you have this in front of you.
