But, they gave us bulk head seats without paying extra, the meals were good with a snack sandwich in between, if you wanted, Singapore Slings and the attendants were so nice. I arrived not feeling like I had been put through the ringer.
label: positive

text: Sydney to Kolkata via Singapore. If it's Singapore Airlines then it's perfect. I have travelled on Emirates, Qatar, British Airways, Thai Airways, you name it. Over all these airlines I love Singapore Airlines. I travelled on a Airbus A380 from Sydney to Singapore and trust me they have the best seats and best food around. It was a pretty long flight and I never felt bored, to be honest I wanted to spend a little more time on the A380. Later that day I had a connecting flight to Kolkata. I spent a bit of my time at the lounge which was splendid. I was 10 mins away from missing my flight because I almost forgot what time it was when I was at the lounge. The flight to Kolkata was a red eye and pretty tiring one, but I asked the flight attendant if she could serve me hot chocolate after I wake up. Surprising just after I woke up she came to me and did her duty, and she even asked me if I wanted some food. If you're flying Business or even Economy it's got to be SIA!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - Hotel in the Sky I always love flying Singapore Airlines - one day I aspire to fly business class - but this review is about Premium Economy from Singapore to Dubai. Always friendly smiling staff, nothing to hard or difficult for them. Facilities were great.
label: positive

text: Very disappointed! We were looking forward to our first flight very with SPA as we’ve heard nothing but good things. First thing I’d say is the 50 minute connection time they offer is hellish... don’t do it! We had to run for an age just to make the flight with no help from anyone! The plane was not bad when it came to comfort and the leg room was average. The entertainment was a massive disappointment as I’d heard they were supposed to be industry leaders.... they certainly aren’t! The service we received was in my opinion poor with the crew only offering random people drinks and flying past whilst collecting rubbish. We also got very little food considering the flight was over 13 hours. Speaking of food as vegetarians I had visited the website prior to Traval to book our veggie meals and confusing I couldn’t find a vegetarian option only specialised meal options like kosher, Muslim friendly and bland options amongst others. It did state that the food would be a menu so I assumed one of the options would be vegetarian.... you can guess the rest. Three options for the two meals... ALL MEAT! Also they didn’t have much else with the meals. I think I’ll stick to other airlines in the future.
label: neutral

text: Great airline Overall the flight was great, service and food was great. Easy transfers in Singapore to get connecting flight.
label: positive

text: Disastrous layover, at fault delays, and insulting customer service Subject to a 5-hour delay which then caused us to miss the connecting flight and extend the delay to 30+ hours. We were placed in a hotel by SQ adjacent to the airport for a sudden 24hour plus layover near midnight with a "food coupon" that we had to fight for as we were starving due to the long delay and no food service on the plane. After arriving at the hotel we found out that those food vouchers were not even valid according to the hotel, Capri by Fraser, and no food service was available. Capri by Fraser's on duty manager in Singapore apparently said they don't take "food coupons" from Singapore Airlines for emergency layover guests and that this was a miscommunication with SQ. At near midnight where nearly all restaurants were closed and Capri is far from the city center, how were we expected to get a meal after being misled by Singapore Airline staff at the airport about the availability of food and their miscommunication? What if we were first time guests in Singapore with no knowledge of the local language and not able to navigate the situation? This is a complete failure from a management perspective as delayed passengers who miss connecting flights after a certain time at night should at least be informed properly if not put in a hotel with 24 room service/dining options in or nearby and given the courtesy of not having to worry about starving on top of rearranging travel plans etc. For an airline with a world class reputation where one pays a premium for the service this just is not acceptable. I submitted a complaint to Singapore Airlines but their complains team threw a response back at me: “as much as we acknowledge the inconvenience you went through as a result of the delay, as an industry practice, and in line with our Conditions of Contract and Carriage, we would like to share that airlines generally do not compensate for consequential losses or inconvenience arising from flight delays.” However, I know international passenger rights stemming from Article 19 of the Montreal Convention which covers delays due to fault of the airline. SQ senior customer service staff repeatedly mislead and misrepresent int'l passenger rights trying to essentially brush me off. There is a lot more to this story but currently they have ceased responding to my emails and appears to think that ignoring the issue will fix it. I don't know what more I can do at this point but I hope this review will serve to shed light on the holes in SQ's 5 star service and "World's Best Airline" reputation. I hope no one has to experience what we experienced during that disastrous layover in Singapore.
label: negative

text: Flight almost empty, still charged for extra baggage. It was always my intention to buy additional baggage as I was over, however this was not possible online as the app would crash at the payment point. I was oddly directed to Agoda to complete the transaction. They had no clue why I was sent to them. Anyway once I arrived at the airport I was unable to self check in as there was an outstanding payment, I was sent to customer service who firstly said no worries the plane is half empty we have loads of space for luggage it’s fine just go check in. As I was checking in the guy received a call saying I now needed to pay and as such needed to go to the payment section with my bags. I went and explained the situation. They suggested I pay and claim a refund when I get to the other side. This didn’t sound like a good idea but I had no choice in the matter. I paid £243.00 charged at £16:25 per kilo. On arrival I did as suggested and challenged the charge this was on the 23 November, I have yet to receive a reply. I am so disappointed as normally Singapore Airlines are always very good and normally provide excellent customer service and it’s always been an excellent experience. I think it’s time for me use a new carrier.
label: neutral

text: Standards have really fallen The quality of the service has really dropped over the years especially when compared with Qatar and/or Emirates. Our luggage was booked through from Zadar but Singapore airlines could not locate it when we finally got our boarding passes. We were told to check before boarding. Staff still could not locate our luggage and told us to check with ground staff in Singapore. No toiletry bags were given on the flight and normally this would not be a concern however had we not received our bags some toiletries would have been helpful. Our bags were located once we landed. The food was as bad as you would get in economy. Had two mouthfuls, that was enough. Just slapped on a plate instead of a tray. Pretty poor.
label: neutral

text: This is the first flight of the day from Singapore to Perth. Flight was full but we were all able to board and take off on time. Hot towel was served shortly but no drink offer after on this morning flight. Meal service commences after we reached cruising height. As it is a full flight, they made an announcement to apologize if the choice breakfast is no available. I had my pre-ordered seafood meal which was served before the main meal service. But somehow Singapore Airlines crew always didn't ask those who had special meal any drink when the cart is at the row when they offer the rest. Overall the flight was pleasant and clean.
label: positive

text: Well worth the extra Recently flew 757/900 premium economy from Barcelona to Singapore great service nice comfortable seats , the only thing I would advise to the airline is there is a box under the seat in front of you which sticks out a little to far and impeded on my ankle (I am 5,10”) so this is the only annoying thing , the seat belts actually have airbags in the as well ( just in case!!!!!) food and drinks were all good, plenty of inflight movies we stayed awake the entire flight watching a lot of new releases I can see why SingaporeAir has a very good reputation
label: positive

text: Excellent service Staff went an extra mile to get me a slice of cake when I flew on my birthday. Great batch of crews and excellent service!
label: positive

text: Business and First Class flights Perth to Singapore leg was Business class as no first is available. Great seating, very tasty food, a good selection of wines and other alcohols. The First class leg from Singapore to Tokyo and return was absolutley Nec Level.. The suites are so big and roomy. seperate swivel chair and bed. The biggest TV screen I have ever seen on an aircraft, probably around 40". at a guess... The food was superb, and the staff were exceptional. Very friendly and welcoming. And my personal guy kept my glass full and was up for a back and forth about the Australian wines too... Couldnt fault the service at all... Impecable...
label: positive

text: Best flights Great: service , comfort, room,and food.First time with this airline was on a deal going to Perth was highlight off flights looked forward to return flight
label: positive

text: Flight delayed with technical fault meaning missed connector to London. Seat in Premium Economy was also broken with token voucher offered. Seats are old and very unsupportive and still cramped for me and I’m not even 6ft. Not worth the money.
label: negative

text: Good flights and excellent cabin service. My wife and I recently travelled Melbourne - Singapore - Istanbul return travelling Premium Economy. All flights were on time and cabin staff were friendly and efficient. Food (some Book the Cook) was good except for the final leg, drinks service was generous with frequent walk through water runs. Seat was comfortable and we managed some decent sleep. When my IFE did not work Singapore to Melbourne and we found out they knew about this before the flight and we should have been informed by the ground staff, the cabin staff including the Supervisor were very apologetic, checked in with us several times and compensated us with a generous voucher for the In-flight shop and a Business Class goodie bag.
label: positive

text: Smooth flight as usual Took the B787 morning flight to Bali. From checking in to boarding, it was hassle free. Enjoyed the in-flight entertainment with the latest movies. Touch screen panel to control TV, easy to use. In-flight meal was okay except sealed water pack was missing, never encountered this before. But the beverage which I asked for was available so it was fine. Happy with ample leg space for economy seat which was comfortable. Would fly Singapore airlines again in future.
label: positive

text: Excellent experience on Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines are justifiably the best airline in the world. Even in Economy, there was plenty of legroom, the service was excellent as were the meals. An excellent experience and we will definitely be travelling with them again.
label: positive

text: Australia We have been flying with Singapore airlines for the last five years and on each occasion they have never missed a beat consistency and quality of the service is 2nd to none so this review comes with high recommendations Singapore airlines have never disappointed my wife and.
label: positive

text: Comfortable with awesome Indian vegiterian food Very comfortable flight with lot of movies to watch in the inbuilt screen with excellent Indian vegiterian food.. Best flight experience till date..
label: positive

text: good except for business class sleeping. Food good, service good, but to sleep, the seat had to be unlatched to lie flat by the flight attendants, and then no button to change to a seat until an attendant was free to do it for breakfast. So, NO control to have a seat position, half position, or back to a flat bed when you wished to do it! AND the leg room for full length was stretching your feet to the left, (or right)
label: positive

text: Superb service Having travelled with most airlines Singapore Airlines always comes out on top, even in economy the level of service is superb and if we could afford a higher level of cabin it would be with Singapore. Excellent food from a pre printed menu with seating offering footrests. The entertainment offered is one of the best in the sky and can highly recommend.
label: positive

text: GREAT SERVICE, FRIENDLY STAFF We travelled to Singapore from Brisbane recently. From checking in, to obliging cabin staff we thoroughly enjoyed our flight. One of my friends travelling had a birthday on the day of departure and at 4.30 am before arriving in Singapore we were all given a glass of champagne along with a cake. A very lovely gesture and surprise. The service on Silk Air from Cambodia to Singapore was also excellent.
label: positive

text: Great Flight About 10 hours non-stop from Manchester to Houston. Pleasant and efficient check-in. Flight was full but very comfortable. Excellent crew as usual with Singapore Airlines. Good food. Very nice aircraft. Departed a little late because or air traffic but arrived maybe 15 minutes early.
label: positive

text: Best in the air Comfy seats in economy with blankets and pillows and good food. Friendly staff and a good quantity of inflight movies
label: positive

text: My husband and I flew 28th July Tullamarine - Singapore SQ 238. 29th July Singapore - London SQ 318. 27th Aug London - Singapore SQ319 Singapore - Tullamarine SQ217. I have nothing but high praise for staff at all time. Attendants were attentive polite and helpful. Food was fine and plenty of it. We haven't travelled a lot but Singapore Airlines will be my choice of airline.
label: positive

text: Unpleasant experience of reserved seat been given away upon online check in I had an unpleasant surprise when I checked in online and found that my reserved aisle seat had been changed to a middle seat. As there was no other aisle seat available, I decided to check in first and then tried to change the seat at the airport counter. The ground staff told me that I should not have checked in online if I wanted to retain my original selected aisle seat, that did not make sense to me since the online check in was to facilitate the check in process. After much arguments, the supervisor was called and I was finally given an aisle seat. I was surprised that SIA has resort to make changes to our pre-selected seat without informing us. So what is the point of selecting your seat when booking the tickets? Really annoying practice and a disservice to your royal customers.
label: neutral

text: Flying Singapore Airlines from Seattle to Delhi Singapore Airlines was easy to book with and their friendliness, food, and flight from Seattle to Singapore was long, but very good. The flight from Singapore to Delhi was not quite as good service and food wise, but was okay. I was very thankful that I paid the extra money to book aisle seats ahead of time.
label: positive

text: Flight from Seoul to Singapore - Served by Pleasant Air Stewardess I travelled with my mom and sister in this trip. The staffs were so wonderful. They were really caring especially this Air Stewardess I think her name is Nurul Ain. We experienced a few turbulence on our way back. The staffs ensure that we were safe and if we had to use the bathroom, they ensure to check that we were fine. Excellent service. Thumbs up!
label: positive

text: This is my second time flying with Singapore Airlines. It was such a great experience. At first I was a bit concerned because the layover was only an hour; I was afraid there would be any kind of delay that would potentially made me miss my connecting flight, but the flight was very punctual and we even arrived ahead of schedule. The cabin was clean with 3-3-3 arrangement, the legroom was spacious, the food was delicious, I really enjoyed having ice cream as dessert. The FAs were friendly and corteous. The only downside of the flight was the inflight entertainment system; the content was good enough with plenty of new movies but the hardware really fell behind. The screen was not a touchscreen, it was small, blurry and pixelated. I suggest other travelers to bring their own headphones like I did because the earphones were not comfortable. Over all it was a great flight and I would fly with them again
label: positive

text: SIA are the best Refunded our tickets in full. So what it took a few weeks but they kept us fully informed. When this is all over, we will only travel to Europe/ Singapore with them as they have proved to be most trustworthy, and their planes and service is the best in the business. Thanks again SIA.
label: positive

text: CPH-SIN-DPS-SIN-CPH outbound on 15th of May and return May 21 (four segments). Must say that I am very disappointed at their service performance. Having flown many times on SQ I did not expect almost rude service from some of the cabin crew attendants. This is not the 5 star SQ that I am use to. CPH-SIN was an old refitted 777-200ER with an entertainment system from stone age. The food was quite tasty tough. Next time I fly to South East Asia I will definitely choose other options like Qatar Airways or Thai. Much better value for money.
label: negative

text: New York to Frankfurt. This was my first time flying in Singapore Airlines business class. The experience was fabulous from beginning to end. Lounge experience was a bit disappointing, but that seems to be a thing at JFK for most non-hub carriers (SQ uses partners' lounge as the airline doesn't have one at JFK). The A380 was bit old, but clean with ultra-wide seats. Service and catering were excellent.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Best business class experience ever. Very clean and comfortable. Even the bathrooms were extremely clean. food was flavorful with nice presentation. Flight attendants were very friendly and welcoming. highly recommend this airline
label: positive

text: When only the best will do After spending time away from home the only thing on your mind is getting back home, so to find when we where checking in for our home bound flight that my wife needed a visa to get back in Australia (UK born permanent Aus resident for 45) the panic started to set in. Not a problem a Singapore airline staff member showed us to a desk where within minutes they had a visa from the Australian Government to fix everything. The flight itself was as normal treated like first class great food plenty to drink as well there for your needs should you require them, no wonder your the best airlines in the world the service to every passenger is outstanding always smiling willing to excel in every department.
label: positive

text: Another winner from SG Absolute shocker - boarding didn't go smoothly! Confusing mainly due to the announcements were indistinct - quiet and muffled where we were - likely the low ceiling. As expected the cabin and seats very comfy - only 8 rows and the seats wider than usual. Also, as usual, the floor chilly. The advertised meal choice was unavailable but excellent anyway. Service wonderful - apples during the lull in regular service in mid-flight plus a muffin with a coffee. The pre-flight chat by Captain Singh needs special mention - he was a real star!
label: positive

text: Not a pleasant flight. My wife and I had just got off a pretty unpleasant Silk Air transfer from Cairns and were looking forward to a huge improvement in service, food and entertainment similar to the service we'd enjoyed on the way out to Australia. What a disappointment. Having worked in air engineering for a few decades I was surprised at the condition of the B777 we flew home in. It was dirty, both our seats wouldn't return to the upright without pushing them up manually and both our meal trays were broken. As the aircraft powered up and made it's way down the runway I seriously thought it would fall to bits. The internal cabin furniture was shaking around very badly. The crew weren't particularly friendly and we both got missed continuously for refreshment. They ran out of some food and had to make up a breakfast for my wife. I should have taken down the aircraft's MSN.
label: neutral

text: I took Singapore Airlines SQ 609 from Seoul to Singapore on 25 January 2015. The inflight entertainment system on that flight was not working properly and I had to swap to another seat to continue watching my movie. From what I understood from the onboard announcement quite a number of passengers were affected as well.
label: positive

text: Very bad, disappointed Respected Faculty, I am Bincy, writing this to file a complaint regarding a cancellation of the connection flight of Singapore airlines and the irresponsible service from Singapore airlines airport staff members at Singapore .My parents 67 yr old Dad as 63 yr old Mom travelled from Brisbane airport in Singapore airlines SQ236 yesterday at 14.45 hrs and arrived at Singapore airport at 20.25hrs yesterday late evening. Then only they were informed that the connection flight SQ 536 which was booked and confirmed, has got cancelled and they have to wait until next day night. This was not informed to us in any form of communication. And secondly, though my parents are very older with so many health issues, (my parents are Diabetic also, taking insulin and my parents have high blood pressure, taking medications)but they had to wait in airport in a chair without any support for 24 hours without any food especially when they are from a non English speaking background. The mental stress and physical discomforts for 24 hours they were gone through are unimaginable and we cannot express it to the full extent. They didn't get any emotional or physical support from staffs at Singapore airport.They didn't arrange any room to rest or any proper lounge and not even any food for 24 hours (my parents were not prepared to stay at airport for more than 4 hours as we booked the tickets with least transit time at Singapore airport) We had a trust in the services of Singapore airlines, and so we booked the flight for our parents with much confidence. We booked the tickets through an agency Sanjo travels in India but we got the confirmation that Singapore airlines didn't inform the agency as well. So it's completely the mistake from Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Very comfortable flight The flight was very comfortable and a very modern aircraft. Staff are lovely, they are very polite and helpful.
label: positive

text: If you're going to have 24 hours of travel time, make it with Singapore Airlines I had to go to Singapore for a work trip from New York. In searching my flight options, I chose to go with Singapore Airlines because of the "technical stop" in Frankfurt, without having to change planes, yet still have an opportunity to get off the plane and stretch my legs for a few hours. Having not flown Singapore Airlines before, but hearing nothing but great things, I had a good outlook for the flight. Sure enough, the boarding process at JFK was fairly efficient. The aircraft for this flight is the largest airliner in the world, the double-decker A380 from Airbus. Once onboard, I found my seat in the economy section, and to my surprise, was very comfortable, roomy, and a decent amount of legroom for me, and I'm 5'10. If you're a bigger & taller, you may have issues. They also have a wonderful entertainment system on board, with a LCD screen right in front of you with a lot of recent & classic movie releases, not to mention TV shows, etc. There's plenty there to keep you busy, including keeping track of the flight. The staff on board, made of up most women, or as they call them, the "Singapore Girls" is on point when it comes to customer service. They are constantly available for anything you need and run a tight ship. On our flight, there were several drink and meal services and they were about as efficient as could be. The stop in Germany was a couple of hours and as I mentioned before, a welcome break before the longer haul to Singapore. Everything was smooth, comfortable, and better than expected. I would highly recommend this airline to any one!
label: positive

text: Best Flight Ever This was the best economy service, I ever had. There were several meals and snacks and beverages the entire flight. Warm towels, ice cream, headphones, socks toothpaste and brush, blankets spacious seats and great personal entertainment screens. The staff were very polite and accommodating. I will definitely fly Singapore airlines when I can.
label: positive

text: We had the most horrific check-in experience with Singapore Airlines on Nov. 7th flight SQ 25 from JFK to Frankfurt. The check-in area barely had any travelers when we arrived and we were greeted by an agent immediately. The horror began. Our ticket was a one-way ticket since we were going to Split, Croatia (our final destination) for a longer time period for us and, especially, our toddler boy (29 months old traveling with me and my wife of course) to enjoy time with family and friends. Therefore, we purchased an airline ticket for each of us and chose Singapore Airlines as a well-respected travel provider. Each of us had 2 check-in luggage, one carry-on, one backpack, and a car seat for our son. Leaving for an extended period of time with toddlers requires carrying a lot of luggage and we carefully packed it all, measured it, and tried to pay for extra weight online before flying. There was no option for it. As I was taking care of our son, my wife was checking us in at the counter (the first class counter right next to the business class counter in Row 8). I noticed that she became visibly distressed and that the agent was on the phone holding off the check-in procedure. I asked if everything was ok and she responded that the check-in agent was not letting us check in. What he and his supervisor who he was on the phone with, and who seemed to be a business class agent right next to us, said equals absolute harassment and a complete overstepping of their boundaries. They proceeded to tell us that we needed to purchase a separate return ticket each because we won’t be let in to stay in Croatia. This is unheard of, absolutely wrong, and untrue, a situation created by the agent and his supervisor that doesn’t exist. I am Croatian and an American citizen, and my wife and my son are American citizens who can enter Croatia with American passports as they wish. Then, the agent (still on the phone with the next counter supervisor) asked my wife if she had at least $8000 and after taking my Croatian passport said it would be fine for me but not for my wife who never changed her name - so was asked to produce proof of our marriage. Thankfully she carries our marriage certificate in case of this but for other countries as we travel - not for the US! And this “interrogation“ happened in an atmosphere of hostility where the agent and his supervisor, who at some point was having a laughing chat with one of his colleagues, behaved with utmost disrespect towards us as their/your client/customer. Zero courteous smile. Zero understanding. Zero any sort of empathy that we have a toddler with us. We knew that we would pay for extra weight in one piece of luggage (the 9 kg option we couldn’t do online). They proceeded to make us check our two carry-ons that were barely over 7kg (and this has never happened to me or my wife in our 25 years of global flying) at a cost of $700. The Crew and flight were great. The food was horrible and the seats were not too comfy. Also, the customer service was almost ignorant of our complaint and defended their agents' actions without any understanding. Never again Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Disappointing Use to be my favorite airline but last trip was to cramped didn't enjoy the trip and will not fly with them again
label: negative

text: Great Flying You don't need to worry when you are flying with Singapore Airlines. Crew members are friendly and very helpful. You will get your Halal food if you mentioned before. Very comfortable Journey :)
label: positive

text: Really old plane This must be one of the oldest planes left in the fleet. I did a round trip on this 777 as part of a trip to Europe. The seats were nice and wide, but had had a lot passengers on them over the years. The controls were falling apart, but the worst thing about them was that they barely reclined at all. I was quite tired comic back from dubai and would have loved to stretch out. The service was very good as usual on Singapore airlines , the food was ok, as was the wine list. The entainment system also in the ok category. I believe they are upgrading the entire fleet in the next couple of years
label: neutral

text: Wonderful Experience It’s been 3 years since my last flight after my pregnancy and childbirth. I was so looking forward to my ride after so long. It was my son’s first flight to Bangkok. The experience truly never disappoint. The airline managed to surprise my husband with an wedding anniversary cake on our flight there. My son enjoyed his plane ride so much that he keeps asking when our next journey will be. And the airline surprised us with another cake on our flight back to Singapore. What a great celebration trip it was for us!
label: positive

text: Service level has deteriorated Unsure if it was the full flight that caused the drop in level of service. The wrong choice of meal was served. Not sure if that was caused by mislabeling. Not much of an apology preferred. Service was perfunctory when handing out snacks and water in the dark, though I had waved , they missed me twice. Guess I have to shout from my window seat next time. I know they serve camomile tea in business class and I requested for it as an aid for sleeping. Again, it was a perfunctory “no, we don’t have it.” Previously, they would make the effort to say they will check with business class for availability or maybe I have gotten confused with better service from other airlines???
label: positive

text: Great trip Great trip, full plane but the service was excellent and the crew very friendly. The food was good as well.
label: positive

text: Just joining the crowd of afficionados A very special anniversary justified a very special trip and I must say that though an expensive one way gig, it was well worth it. Want to know more about their service ?Just go on their website. For once, what they advertise is what you get: comfort and perfection in service.
label: positive

text: Still a joy to fly A balm to the soul after our earlier connecting leg in economy on another airline. SQ business is always good - great and plentiful food, personable and friendly service (although there are always still differences between sets of crew even in J; if you get a good batch they really elevate the whole flight experience). The A350 seats were comfortable; a touch smaller than the A380 seats but larger than the 787 seats which are really more medium-haul at best. At night, the bulkhead seats give you more legroom when you go full flat, but you may have to deal with some light from the galley. Only negatives: One of the wife’s dishes (fajitas) was served with parts still cold; not sure if this was an issue from the dish itself, or poor preparation by the crew. Fortunately they did their best to rectify this quickly. Also, the wine list on J doesn’t seem to be as impressive as it used to be (cheap Chianti as an option, really?) But we know this latter is nit-picking somewhat. Would still recommend.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline Have travelled with them a number of times and always had good service even in economy. Good food and nothing too much trouble
label: positive

text: Disorganised, unhelpful, This was a return trip and we checked in online. Although we checked in 48 hours before the flight there was no option to change seats, even though that is supposedly offered. We were told to check with the desk in Singapore but they were completely disinterested and blamed Silk Air which was our connecting flight. I though they were part of Singapore AirlInes! Once on the flight they were disorganised and missed rows with meal service and drinks. We have always travelled with Singapore Airlines but they dropped the ball this time.
label: negative

text: Best Airlines only for First Class? Singapore Airlines is trying very hard to be the best airlines in the world. Probably it only applies to First Class. First of all, inflight meals of economy class were terrible. And I’m trying to reclaim my miles of my flight from SFO to YVR. (I booked that flight on SQ official homepage), Air Canada is the Star Alliance and SQ partner. The first stfaff (VK) replied me that “we will not be able to add miles for your Air Canada flight”. He has no knowledge that Air Canada is SQ partner. I told him that Air Canada is SQ partner airline and shows him a screenshort of my my KrisFlyer account, the claim missing miles page shows AC (Air Canada) is SQ airline partner and is able to choose to claim for missing miles. Then the 2nd staff asked me to attach all the documents to reclaim my miles. I’m still dealing with them and so far they have all different staff to reply me. (Aleady dealed with four different staff already). I think Singapore Airlines can do better than this. This is such a disappointment with the Airlines that chosen as the BEST in 2023. You really have to improve your inflight meal (economy class) and customer support’s quality.
label: neutral

text: Price Match Guarantee - SCAM Very bitter taste in my mouth. I believe I have been mislead by Singapore Airlines who have been advertising a Price Match scheme. I spoke with one of their representatives who informed me that the $4400 I was about to spend would met their criteria for the scheme, resulting in me being able to gain a refund of $400. After paying in full I applied to have the scheme applied as per my previous conversation with their staff member. Apparently now, it does not met the criteria and they have refused to cancel my booking or honour the original scheme. On further investigation their T&C (once download as not in their initial T&C relating to this scheme) do show that my booking does not meet the criteria, however, I was told it did and they have call recorded and are still refusing to honour the agreement. Simple put, why would I pay additional $400 more than I had to unless I believed I would be refunded the amount back. I am unsure where I can go with this as Singapore have been extremely slow in responding and have basically told me 'too bad'...hence trip adviser.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines - Premium Economy - Rather underwhelming I specifically chose to fly with Singapore Airlines due to my positive experiences in their Economy Class from years ago. Having explored premium Economy options with various airlines since then, I was eager to give Singapore Airlines another try, considering their esteemed reputation and my previous impressions. Regrettably, the experience fell short of my expectations. Both legs of the journey, from Zürich to Singapore and back, featured uncomfortably cold cabin conditions. While the staff were friendly and hospitable, I didn't sense the distinctive Singapore Airlines ambiance I remembered. What disappointed me even more was the absence of an amenity kit. Additionally, having to share toilets with Economy passengers was less than ideal, resulting in lengthy queues reminiscent of standard Economy travel. The meal service was identical to what one would receive in Economy. While the privilege of checking in and boarding ahead of Economy passengers is granted in Premium Economy, I questioned whether it justified the higher price point. Personally, I found that the added value, aside from extra legroom, didn't justify the cost. I must admit that Lufthansa and ANA offer significantly superior Premium Economy services. They provide access to lounges and offer amenity kits (in the case of ANA). Even LOT surpasses Singapore Airlines in terms of attentive staff. Cathay Pacific also outshines Singapore Airlines in their Premium Economy offering, excelling in terms of food quality, attentive service, and the provision of a modest amenity kit.
label: negative

text: A true five star airline Singapore airlines is one of the best airlines if have ever flown with. The flight attendants are true hosts.They deeply care for your wellbeing. The planes have stellar in-flight-entertainment, comfortable seats with good legroom and the food is quite tasteful. The best part is the stopover in Singapore: whenever you have the opportunity, choose a 24 - 48h timeframe for visiting this amazing city. But even 6 hours is fine - the transit area is one of the best I have ever seen.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Canberra via Sydney. I have flown many times with economy airlines such as Jetstar and AirAsia. But my first ever flights with Singapore Airlines which I had high hopes for were a washout. The economy seats are much smaller than AirAsia and all you are getting for your extra dollars is a menu and entertainment options. Also I have an injury and asked for help getting on and off the plane before the crush. They made me get a medical certificate to prove the injury but let me on with every one else. And with a broken foot those small seats were even worse. I will return to AirAsia for future flights.
label: negative

text: airlines Flight and check-ins were good I found the seating very small I could not even put my tray down properly as not enough room because of my belly.
label: positive

text: Flying High There is a reason Singapore has won airline of the year or have been in the top 10. Their service is absolutely first class, from the captain giving us updates to the cabin crew that really and truly look after you for the duration of the flight. Flew on the A380 on the way to Singapore and it's still a marvelous aircraft to travel on. The cabin crew are extremely friendly and are more than accommodating to meet any needs required. The IFE (In Flight Entertainment) is fantastic, you're not going to run short of options here, you can watch TV, films, listen to music to your hearts content. All in all it is a great airline to fly on and hopefully I'll be flying with them again soon.
label: positive

text: Should lift their game. My main complaint relates to the business lounge at Denpasar airport. This is VERY ordinary. Tired sandwiches and some other pre prepared offerings. The toilets are a disgrace. Not good enough. On the plus side, the business lounge at Changi is great. Plenty of choice and freshly prepared. For the actual flight, I missed the personal vials of hand cream etc. Qatar Airways has a much better overall Business Class experience.
label: neutral

text: Why Singapore Airlines? Very simple 0 crash on record. I travel for safety not comfort I only travel with Singapore Airlines and I intend to keep it that way
label: positive

text: My Favorite Airline Flew with Singapore Airline from Singapore to New Chitose Airport. The service from the cabin crews were great and the wide variety of inflight entertainment makes the flight a wonderful experience. Always my number 1 choice!
label: positive

text: Perth to Phuket Sovereignty Event Reasonably enjoyable, cabin staff friendly and ample leg room between seats, Airbus which I prefer to Boeing. Good selection of inflight movies. Food choices unappealing though the fare is typical of economy travel nowadays. Definitely preferable to Qantas Perth to Phuket and the Singapore to Phuket leg transition with Kris Airlines was a major step-up from Jet Star. As this will be a regular travel route for me, much happier with Singapore Airlines than my national carrier. Budget carriers that are better than Qantas.
label: positive

text: Fly ikec royalty or at lEAST a CEO Singspore Business Class makes you feel fabulous. Business class boards a separate entrance and exits first ahead of economy - no rush no push no hurry. The food is restaurant quality- aka a very good foodie restaurant. Service makes you feel human, everyone is so nice and kindly helpful. And they know your name!!! The beds open out totally flat. You actually sleep! But it is the service that would bring me back over and over again.
label: positive

text: Poor Flight My seat recliner got stuck. The foot rest was keep on falling to my foot. Very old bad flight. Had neck pain after long flight. The seat is in very poor condition.
label: neutral

text: Premium economy First time flying premium economy with Singapore airlines. Good price for flights and excellent service checking in with priority desk and generous baggage allowance.. We ordered book the cook for meal service and enjoyed a very good Thai green curry for first meal however breakfast was served still frozen and returned after being reheated but was still ice cold. The flight attendant was very apologetic and offered an alternative from the economy trolley. Although crew were very attentive and friendly, we did not feel that the extra cost of PE gave a better experience apart from some extra legroom and slightly wider seat. Qantas PE in our opinion is much superior and offers a more exclusive service if business class is out of reach..
label: positive

text: Great flights. Both flights were very good. A380 on the way out and 777 on the return. Comfortable cabin with good legroom. Excellent service. Shame all airlines aren't like this.
label: positive

text: Kuala Lumpur to Bangkok via Singapore. Singapore Airlines is for me one of the most elegant when it comes to the design in and out. I had finally an experience to fly with them which was very nice, the service of their cabin crew was amazing. Sincere service I would like to call it.
label: positive

text: The best Flew with singapore airlines to tokyo was excellent and would reco end them to everyone food and drink was very good
label: positive

text: I ordered Muslim Meals and received Chicken curry for breakfast lunch and dinner. Seriously chicken curry for breakfast? About 20 years ago I wrote to Singapore Airlines about the same issue. Take note Muslim diets are much broader than chicken curry.
label: neutral

text: Fantastic Singapore Airlines Flight It was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines in Premium Economy and have to say it was a fantastic flight. All service served with a smile. From the check-in desk at Changi airport, through to the Krisflyer Lounge, and especially the on-board service, the experience was phenomenal. Sylvia was the flight attendant who looked after me and she was amazing. She made sure I was comfortable in my seat, brought out snacks for me and made sure my wine glass was fully topped up. Fantastic food provided by Singapore Airlines (notwithstanding I wasn't flying Business) and an amazing in-flight entertainment system with over 300 movies and 150 TV shows. The flight flies by in an instant. I absolutely loved my experience with Singapore Airlines and will definitely fly with them again. One of the best airlines in Asia, and the world. Try them - you won't be disappointed!
label: positive

text: What A Disappointment! I was surprised to see the old large -wide seats & no pod. It took a while for me to feel comfortable. Luckily the cabin crew were eager to assist making the bed although I found it difficult to click the seatbelt on when preparing to sleep. A couple of short bursts of turbulence had no affect on me. The meal offerings before arrival were poor & gave very little choice..the frittata was ok. If I fly with this airline again I'll be sure to check flights with pods
label: neutral

text: Excellent experience, hugely improved cabin Very well designed and improved comfort on this A380 aircraft in the business class sector. The seats were very comfortable, easy to adjust, bed making is easier, everything is at a finger touch ! Very very comfortable and bravo ! The food was very good with different choices of meals, wines and good champagne. Inflight entertainment was a real deal with touch screen comfort - this is a HUGE improvement. Well done Singapore Airlines - not a wonder you are the world's best airline !
label: positive

text: J class short flight Short trip but always relaxing, from Changi I always try arrive in time to use the lounge and eat and drink plenty of excellent food, wines, spirits, bubbles etc and then more onboard. Sadly still the old style seats on this route but still good enough. As always, great service from the SQ ladies, bubbles, hot meal and decent IFE. Thanks again see you next week
label: positive

text: Our trip to Vietnam A very nice and friendly service during the whole stay on board. Descrete but always there when we had a wish. Food and drinks were great too with a high degree of selection. Business class had a warm athmosphere with good air condition. Due to less seats in business class compared to other airlines, Singapore airlines made our trip to a special experience. On the top of that, we saw a good cost/performance ratio. When travelling for the future, we will chose Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: SingaporeAir became worst nightmare for budget travelers Don't get fooled by Singapore Air cheap prices. They started charging anywhere between $23 to $115 per seat to get seats together for family (otherwise they are giving individual leftover seats) and usual wait time at Singapore airport is anywhere between 8 hours to 24 hours. They started charging for few extra pounds in luggage and for many other onboard services. There are many other airlines with few extra dollars (Emirates, Etihad, etc) with exceptional service and no cost for services and wait times.
label: negative

text: FCOPI International Director I have well over 1 million Miles as Star Alliance Gold. The Food Service on Singapore Airlines was the worst my wife and I ever experienced on any flight anywhere! This was for a $6400 per person ticket. I don’t complain often but for the to be a top rated airline is a joke. I will do my best to never fly them again. I strongly suggest any alternative.
label: negative

text: One of the best airlines Service was very attentive and the food was delicious. It had a Spacious toilet. :) We received a cleaning pack and a comfortable warm socks.Their pillows are second to none. This flight wasn’t the first flight for us with this airline and we definitely will use them again.
label: positive

text: Really Good But....... We recently travelled to Oz on holiday and although it was a good comfortable flight with decent food the cabin staff were very thin on the ground, and even although most of the flight was made during the day they seemed intent in putting the cabin into darkness and then disappearing, resulting in infrequent service if like me you are reluctant to annoy them and press the buzzer every time you want a little attention.
label: positive

text: I flew Milan to Singapore return in business class. Seat was very comfortable, on return flight I think I slept almost 10 hours after having dinner at the Singapore lounge. Service very good. When arrived in Singapore I found my luggage broken. They collected it from my hotel the morning after, and in 24 hours the luggage was repaired and back to my room.
label: positive

text: The best airline in the world so far! We have been travelling with Singapore Airline for years but we have never written a review before. Singapore Airline has always been our choice airline when travelling to Asia and beyond. We have always had nice experiences with excellent service, friendly smiles and you always felt welcome when flying with Singapore Airline. The beds in business class on long haul flights are wide and spacious although on the recently renovated 380 they are not as comfortable as before and we hope this will not be the standard for the new Singapore Airline lie-flat bed on long haul flights. The A350 and B777 have great beds. There are no toilet amenities bags but everything is available, the only thing is that you don’t get is the bag to bring home, for those who think that it is important! The catering and wine selection is excellent and from most major departure airports you can choose your own meal through ‘Book the Cook’ service which gives you choice that most other airlines can’t even dream about. The choice of movies on in-flight entertainment is good but we would like a little more choice in Western/New Releases and Classic movies. We will recommend this airline to anyone who is looking for a comfortable long haul flight connecting through Singapore.
label: positive

text: An good experience that could have been excellent! Picking SQ over others was an obvious choice since our experience with SQ last year was a very good one. The brand is known for it's quality services hence we went ahead and booked our tickets. I remember signing up for a vegetarian meal while booking my tickets however to our surprise the crew ran out of veggie meals and we were served cup noodles. It was surprising to say the least but the crew was courteous enough to serve us with additional items like ice creams and juices. For our return journey I wrote to the airline via email ensuring we are served with vegetarian meal. We were served with the desired meal however it was average and not really great but something is better than nothing. The quality of the meal offerings can be enhanced a bit. Apart from that, the experience flying with SQ is a good one. The in-flight entertainment is very good and the crew is very courteous and helpful. The aircraft's are always spic and span and the timings are also good/punctual.
label: positive

text: Awesome experience. A highly recommended airline. From check in to landing, I highly recommend Singapore Airlines. I have flown with them on numerous occasions, and have found their service to be professional, courteous and kind. They are most certainly my first airline of choice.
label: positive

text: A terrific airline We flew on Singapore Airlines (Star Alliance) as part of our trip from Tampa to Manchester. Our aircraft was the Airbus A350-400 and it was very roomy in Economy. The flight was not completely full so we were able to shift from the center seat so that we were sitting in the window and aisle seats. We were brought hot towels immediately and were given menus before the service so that we could select our meals. The food was very good and the alcohol was complimentary during the flight. The seat back entertainment screens were much larger than expected and there was a good selection of entertainment options available. Before landing, we were again brought hot towels and served a breakfast meal that was also very good. We would fly on Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: First time flyer For a first time flyer I was terrified but wow what an amazing experience. I literally loved every moment of my flight there and back and my thoughts on being on a plane has changed forever! Comfy, friendly. Just amazing!
label: positive

text: Lived up to expectation We were looking forward to our long flight to Singapore having decided against BA and opting for the more expensive airline based on their reputation. Singapore Airlines did not disappoint and every part of the service from choosing the flight, checking in and disembarking was carried out smoothly, on time and with a genuine smile. The quality of food, drinks and choice available via the entertainment system was amazing. We had told the airline in advance that it was my wife's birthday the day we flew out and they made the flight extra special with a couple of glasses of fizz, a lovely cake, gifts and a handwritten note from the crew. Our experience supported why they are the award winning number 1 airline.
label: positive

text: Flew from London Heathrow to Singapore Changi. With Singapore Airlines, there is always this high standard that most airlines aspire to achieve in terms of service. And because of this I am compelled to write one especially when they fall below their own minimum standards. This is one rare flight where the air stewardess was rude to a passenger, never smiling (forgiveable) and non apologetic when it came to dropping cutleries on her. To top it up, she even pouted annoyingly when the passenger was not awake when meal was served. Rare indeed, and ultimately undid all the good things her colleagues did on this same flight.
label: negative

text: ALL the positives are true !!! My sister & I flew Singapore Airlines Premium Economy from NY-Singapore just last week. We flew in an Airbus A-380 and cannot comment enough at how comfortable our seats were. We had plenty of leg room and were able to recline an adequate amount to allow some sleep. There was a large video screen on the back of the seat in front us and we were supplied with large earphones. In addition, the list of available videos was truly impressive. The outer wall/window is a few inches from the seat contributing to a sense of spaciousness (we sat in the H-K row). We took advantage of the "Book the Cook" service and were very impressed with the quality of our meals. All attendants were very professional and welcoming. We feel we received excellent value for our money and would recommend SIA Premium Economy to anyone flying a long-haul flight. (We wish they flew to Hawaii, but alas they don't..) You know when you're offered Champagne at the start of a flight that you've likely made the right choice!!! Hope to fly SIA in the future. Excellent airline !!!
label: positive

text: A long flight Paid the extra and got the legroom, that made the trip nearly bearable. The only concern was the long flight from NZ to Singapore and then on to Barcelona. All in all 24 hours flying but I have to say Singapore Airlines treated us very well. I would (and probably will) fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Good flight Friendly staff. Food was good for airplane food. I was sitting on an aisle seat next to a toilet on an overnight flight and they gave me an eye mask and ear plugs in case I wanted to sleep, which was nice. In flight entertainment very up to date, with the latest movies.
label: positive

text: On 25th May I flew on SQ736 to Phuket. A young child was running up and down the aisle, during turbulence, approach and after landing, during taxi to gate. The parents absolutely didn’t care and the cabin crew didn’t either.
label: negative

text: SIN-SUB SQ930 26 May. A330-300 on both legs. Hot towels were served shortly after boarding followed by food. Very courteous and pleasant crew members. The aircraft's PTV was good the movie was updated. The seat on A330 was nice and better for other full service airlines operates this aircraft. Overall a very pleasant experience and it's always a pleasure to fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Super good hospitality and customer service & support Singapore Air is one of the world best airlines. The hospitality, service and support are great. Aircraft are top class and seats along with the entertainment system is top class even in economy class
label: positive

text: Enjoyable Flight Flight from Stockholm to Singapore could have been better. Dinner service very rushed. I had not finished eating and my plate was taken from me. The service on this flight seemed disorganised. Seats very comfortable, lounge and flat bed good. Singapore to Auckland old style seats on A380 still very comfortable and slept well. Service on this leg was far more professional. Dinner was not rushed. I was not impressed with the lobster Thermidor. We booked meat dishes from book the cook and these were good. We also booked food from the flight menu and also good. We will avoid fish dishes. The Singapore noodles were very good we had these just before arriving in Singapore and were not sure as to whether to order them. Lounge in Singapore nothing special. Compared to Another Asia airline flying from Abu Dhabi.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth. Was disappointed with the level of service as my grandson wasn't served the entree and my husband who had pre-ordered his "Ramen" main meal was served it cold and has to ask for it to be heated. Fail to understand how in business class staff can fail to serve one of the courses particularly when my family members were seated in the second row from the front. Overall on my earlier flight from Rome to Singapore the service was okay, not outstanding. I have flown numerous times Business Class in the last 5 years and I have noticed a deterioration in the level of service.
label: positive

text: great service, friendly staff, on time and dont forget to "book the cook" As most travellers will know, singapore airlines are known for being a great airline and they lived up to their high standards of being on time, having friendly and helpful staff and comfortable seats. two things, 1 good and 1 not so good. on the positive, I was made aware of their book the cook service, whereby you can order premium foods before the flight goes. I had lobster and my wife and lamb, and it was cooked to perfection. A great innovation. However we were a bit disappointed that the lie flat beds meant to get our feet flat, we had to lie on an angle because of the seat in front. I think its an issue well known, but it was a bit disappointing as it meant the bedding didnt fit quite right. still, we will continue to fly with them. keep it up
label: positive

text: One of the best flights I've 🐝 on This is a.new route for Singapore and my first time flying with this airline. I was very impressed with the whole.experience. On time.both ways, comfortable seating with reasonable leg room and good entertainment screens. In flight complimentary food was of a good standard and the staff bey attentive and pleasant. Well done Singapore!
label: positive

text: Fabulous experience Was unexpectedly re-routed to Singapore Airlines for my flight to Johannesburg - what a treat it turned out to be. The ground staff were so helpful in getting our group through the formalities and onto the plane with moments to spare. The in-flight staff were beautifully groomed, super-efficient and very pleasant. The hard product is comfortable and spacious. The food was amongst the best I’ve ever had on any flight. In-flight entertainment caters to a diverse range of tastes and for someone who doesn’t sleep on a plane, I wasn’t at a loss for entertainment. Our luggage did not arrive in Joburg with us - not remotely the fault of Singapore Airlines but due to the extremely tight layover we were given. However, our luggage arrived on the next flight and was couriered to my office in less this four hours of touchdown. Exceptional in every way and highly recommended.
label: positive

text: Most Arrogant Inflight crew I ever had on flying app. 100.000 miles per year since 15 years We flew Johannesburg to Singapore on SQ479 on July 7th in Business Class and experienced the worst most arrogant crew ever. I travelled with my wife and 2 Daughters (2 and 4 years old) and we were assigned seats 19F and 20D and F. As the seats are very closed, we would have preferred to sit all in one row, so we asked at Check In to be seated in one row, either 19 or 20. They told us it was fully Business Class, but they will leave a note and we can check at the Gate. We did, but the passengers on the window seats did not want to move, which was OK to us as they have been faster than us, so it is OK. Upon closing of the doors, we saw that Seat 20K was free, so I asked the flight attendant if my wife can move then from 19F, so we can sit in one row. She said this is a cockpit seat and she needs to check with the pilot. Upon departure she came back and told us that the pilot does not want to change the seat to 19F or 21K. Really? A pilot who used this seat for 30 minutes does not want to move one row back to let a family with 2 Kids sit in one row? Maybe SQ needs to inform pilots who is paying their high salary.
label: negative

text: Excellent as always Lived up to its excellent reputation. Great service. Good food. Considerate attentive staff. On time
label: positive

text: Usual great service on Singapore Airlines As usual the service on Singapore Airlines was top notch. We used "book the cook" where available to choose our meals on the flight and the food was pretty amazing. The flight attendants are always helpful and we love that they regularly go in and clean the toilets to keep them fresh. The in flight entertainment was pretty good too with enough new release movies to keep us occupied during the flight - even including the return journey. The check-in counters were also very efficient and helpful and the Kris Flyer Lounge more than adequate. In addition Changi Airport is an amazing airport and has plenty to offer travellers in the event of a longer stay between flights.
label: positive

text: Unprofessional staff Mr. Dharamveer Singh was amazing at service and tried best possible effects to meet my preferences. But a lady - bit healthy was not at all professional. She was using unprofessional language while Mr. Dharamveer was processing my boardpass. Jaldi kro kaldi kro , side m khara kr do , aap side m khade ho jao were the phraseology used. Totally not acceptable. More over as I got confused with the seat allocation. I tried to get clarity from her, she used inappropriate facial expression and more over was extremely rude. This is not acceptable from a reputed airlines. Not a welcoming experience.
label: negative

text: New Aircraft? I had a return flight SIN-NGO-SIN. I only review the return flight because I did one review in November 2017, so as to compare the same. It was same as SQ671, but I think this time round was a new aircraft as I could see the interior was very new. The legroom was definitely much bigger space compared to the one in 2017. With the bigger legroom, it was much comfortable for sure especially for my husband. And the toilets were very clean compared to my other past experience, no bad odor. This time was not stated any special on the menu, but was given choice of Japanese food and it was good, especially the dessert. Overall a very pleasant flight experience for people like me with tendency of air sick.
label: positive

text: SQ LACK OF PAX CONCERN Great airline in the air but one of the worst on the ground. I had to change a flight recently and was directed to a call center. The experience defies description with misinformation, disinterest and lack of professionalism at the forefront however the most concerning was how my request to speak to a "manager" was handled. In the initial call, I was placed on hold for over 15 minutes which the operator tried to locate a "manager". Was eventually told that none were available as they were all in meetings but was assured a "manager" would call me back. It has now been almost a week and despite 2 further calls trying to speak to someone to resolve my issue and despite being assured that someone would call me back - NOTHING. I even asked for a telephone number in SIN I could ring but was advised they are not authorised to put a passenger in direct contact with the airline and the Filipino Call Centre could deal with the issue. Passenger issues are dealt with with distain and a lack of care. Shame on you Singapore Airlines. If anyone in Singapore Airlines are interested, my Krisflyer is 8080523886
label: negative

text: Great flight Had a wonderful flight with Singapore Airlines recently. We flew Business class because we knew we could totally relax and be refreshed when we arrived. The cabin crew were amazing and looked after us so well we are considering them again for our next trip.
label: positive

text: Great experience We had a very pleasant flight from London to Singapore. Service was attentive and the food pleasant. The cabin staff had discovered that we were celebrating a wedding anniversary and presented us with a congratulatory cake and bubbles. All in all a very enjoyable experience.
label: positive

text: Very pleasurable flight Checking in was a breeze n the flight was well attended by a great bunch of friendly flight attendants. They even complied with my wife’s surprise request for our anniversary cake, which the crew so nicely furnished. Truly chuffed.
label: positive

text: International flight to Japan SQ is the one of the good star for airlines, hence the price is also competitive for its class. Leg room is quite big for economy seat.
label: positive

text: Having last flown Singapore Airlines more than two decades ago, I was enthusiastic to fly again in their A350, albeit a short flight from Bangkok to Singapore. It began with a speedy Business Class check-in, with instructions to follow the signs to the SilverKris Lounge. Through Fast Track security, I headed towards the Gate 7 area, which was a fairly lengthy walk. Boarding was efficient. The first thing that impressed me was the gorgeous look of the cabin. It appeared in pristine condition. The cabin colour scheme of shades of mauve and light bluey-purple looked impeccable. Laid out in a 1x2x1 arrangement, this was a long-haul seating aircraft, operating on short-haul regional flights (sadly in Europe we have to contend with an 18-inch wide seat and 30-inch pitch, and no IFE). All the essential features of flatbed seating on this A350 were there. The seat functions on the side of the seat worked smoothly and effortlessly. A large pillow and blanket were placed on the seat. And on the side, was a small locker containing USB and power points, along with a menu and headphones. The pull-out mirror was a nice touch too. Preflight soft drinks came around, and requesting champagne, it was promptly served soon after. Just before pushback, hot towels were provided, and the safety video began with instructions to put on the 3-point seat belt (which has the shoulder strap). Once at cruising height, the breakfast service began. Being a short duration flight, the meal was served on a single tray. I was addressed by my name, and so opted for the Seafood Pad Thai, which came with prawns, scallops and fish cake - absolutely delicious. Without requesting, I was served with more champagne, followed by coffee. The touch-screen IFE worked well, and I noted a good selection of some of the very latest movies. I assumed that this was the same on all flights, as it wouldn't be possible to watch a 2-hour movie on a 2-hour flight. The headphones were a tad heavy and did not feel too comfortable. Overall, although the crew were non-engaging (short flight), the service was friendly and carried out with precision. It all came to an end too quickly, and I hope my next flight with Singapore Airlines will be a 'proper' long haul.
label: positive

text: Amazing service 👌🏼 This was my first time traveling with Singapore air and what a pleasant experience! I had a long journey ahead and Singapore air made it easy by their amazing service. Great food options, entertainment was okay not as upto date as some other top airlines. Overall good experience I’d definitely recommend it 👍🏼
label: positive

text: Amazing Experience with SQ suites class Dear SQ, I few SQ first class suites on July 23rd from SIN-JFK and I was the only person on the First Class Suites cabin. I have flown alot of first class airlines in my life and I have never emailed any feed backs. This is the first time I am writing to SQ because the amazing service and experience I had with Singapore airlines. I will def be back flying with my family next year and I do rate singapore as my top and fav airline for their first class products. Special Mention to these following staff who did an amazing job to make my flight memorable. CSS Alice Kok LSS Charlene Tan LS Jeff Low I have flown JAL, Cathay, Emirates, Thai, ANA, Etiahd first class and none of them compare to the SQ suites i Flown and I felt very welcome thank you SQ,
label: positive

text: Not so swish We were quite excited for our flight home with Singapore Airlines but it didn't quite live up to our expectations. The plane we boarded felt like it needed a bit of an overhaul. The seat when turned down to a bed was fraying in different areas. We felt that we were imposing on a few occasions when placing different requests. Our flight out from Sydney was with Emirates to Dubai and we couldn't fault it so we were quite excited to fly with Singapore Airlines being of the understanding that it was highly rated. There didn't seem to be a comparison. Maybe we were spoilt
label: positive

text: Fraud from subsidiary company scoot Dear Scoot, (and parent company SIA) Today I booked a flight on the system at 130 pm when it was know to scoot that the flight was cancelled at 11AM as per your ground handling agent. I could have flown TG, AA or SQ if I had know. And now I have to fly you due to cancelation on a much later flight. In legal terms this is called fraudulent conveyancing - selling something know that you cannot deliver. Under the singapore consumer act, this is defined as an unfair practise, as I should have know that the flight was cancelled. I have copied case singapore on this email as this really is terrible consumer practises. I short you are committing fraud. Sincerely,
label: negative

text: Service is still good I have been flying Singapore airlines for work since 2005. Their service is still one of the best. I have tried other airlines and some of them leave you feeling as if the cabin crew are the paying customers.
label: positive

text: Flying with Singapore Airlines We priortise to take Singapore Airlines whenever we go for overseas trip unless we got to know that other airlines offer cheaper price than SIA. Everything is perfect eg services, food, entertainment and etc. Smooth and safe journey. If happens their tickets on sale, we quickly compare and purchase first although we are travelling in 10 months time and that's what we always do.
label: positive

text: TOP CLASS SERVICE & COMFORT I love flying Singapore Airlines for the simple reasons below: - Very comfortable seating, with decent space in Premium Economy - Friendly staff, catering FIRST CLASS service, and always with a smile. - New planes, making you feel safe - Fantastic entertainment center in-flight, with huge number of choices for all tastes, with recent movies and music. - Food choices are decent. This is not 5 star restaurant, it is plane-food. Comparatively to other airlines, Singapore quality is way above average. SUMMING UP - 5 star rating on T.A. - simply for 5 start quality service. It is as simple as that, and ALWAYS a peasure to fly with this airline.
label: positive

text: Comfortable, spacious seats, New aircraft, excellent inflight service The flight was long - 16 hours but the seat comfort, service and entertainment system made it bearable. The aircraft was the new A350 - spacious, quiet and comfortable, The cabin crew was attentive but not overly - letting you rest but aware when you are awake to offer you refreshments and food throughout the flight.
label: positive

text: Best Airline for me and my family As a frequent traveller between Europe and Singapore, and also previously in and around Asia, no other airlines can compare! Singapore Airlines is the best in my opinion. Especially if you travel with babies and young children, the crew onboard provides with every possible assistance they can to help you feel comfortable. So whether long or short flights, my family will choose Singapore Airlines whenever possible.
label: positive

text: Business Class with no USB port ! 2 (consecutive) flights with Singapore Airlines; neither plane had a USB port - which, nowadays, is essential to charge phones and other devices. Very disappointing.
label: positive

text: Ground crew left elderly stranded SQ meet & assist is a joke. I called multiple times to confirm if they can help an elderly to check in at the hotel in Jewel Changi upon arrival to Singapore and they confirmed multiple times over the phone that that's something they always do. Guess what, on the day of, they refuse to send a non-English speaking elderly to the hotel and conveniently blamed it on the associates that told me in the first place. They recommend my elderly to sleep on the lobby in the terminal instead. What a service! Truly disappointed how this went down and they don't seem to care to accommodate anything. I would not recommend any minors, kids or elderly under SQ care because they are unprofessional, unreliable and has no empathy.
label: negative

text: Premium Economy Flew premium economy for the first time and it was very good on the Airbus. Great leg room and comfortable seats. On the 777 Boeing, not so good. You pay the same expensive price but the seats are just jammed in and very little leg room. However I guess anything is better than economy. Love the airline though and the crew are always friendly, courteous and helpful. I will travel with Singapore Airlines whenever I can.
label: positive

text: 5 ⭐️ Service in the Sky Recently me and my husband took a week long holiday in the Philippines. We had booked a flight with Singapore Airlines and both of us were delighted with the service provided by the stewardess.Their quick action on request was superb. Cabin crew was amazingly friendly and food was awesome.
label: positive

text: 400 miles more Because of high turbulences, the pilot choose to divert the flight more south, so,wehad a pleasant flight and no longer that it was suppose to be. Thanks to the whole crew
label: positive

text: Seat #41C - The nightmare seat Selected the seat for extra leg room and regretted doing so from the moment I boarded the flight. From boarding passengers to air crew trolleys, all decided to encroach on my personal space by stepping on my foot to pushing their bags in my face. The 8+ hour flight was probably one of the most painful thanks to this “special” seat. Every time I tried taking a short nap I was rudely awakened to somebody stepping on my foot or another trolley banging into my knees. All I could do was stay alert the entire flight to save myself more pain. Personally, I would suggest the SQ team to try one of these seats themselves and let me know their flying experience! The least the airline could do is to have seat legends that warn passengers of possible risks associated with seats such as these. Similar to concert tickets wherein seats with restricted view are clearly called out letting the ticket purchaser know exactly what they are selecting and potentially getting into. I don’t think it’s the air crews fault or my fellow passengers but the seat position which stands out like a sore thorn. There’s minimal or no leg space unless you encroach on the leg space of the person to your left or one has to be of shorter stature themselves. I have been writing a number of reviews/ feedbacks for SQ over the last 10 years and every time I write one I tend to question myself if these are truly being read and actioned or just end up in somebody’s junk mail. Wrote this one to them on November 26 soon after landing and no reply as usual.
label: negative

text: SQ Meal Vegetarian/Vegan meals MUST DEFINITELY be improved! Vegetarian option - very miserable , mostly boiled vegetable. Can do better with many people going for vegetarian/vegan. SIA status should move to another level in providing appetising food for vegetarians. Had vegan option in Japan flight in 2018. Was amazing! - specialised meal with vegan chocolate cake!!
label: neutral

text: Disappointing flight from Singapore to Auckland. A good seat, tasteless food and the worst Illy coffee i have had. What concerned me the most is the cost we paid for these flights, this one one of four flights we took on Singapore airlines over the last three weeks. The Auckland to Singapore flights seemed understaffed, whereas the Singapore to Bangkok flights seemed a lot more organised and a better food selection.
label: negative

text: Very good flight My family and I love Singapore Airlines. First class service. From checking in to your destination you receive service with a smile. Good food, great entertainment for a long flight. Always good movies.
label: positive

text: Singapore Air very uncomfortable sleeping accommodations When I travel a trip over 11 hours I am careful to get Business Class since I don’t want to get DVT. Really bad sleeping arrangement on SingaporeAir. Other people in my party traveling from Newark said the same thing. You cannot stretch out because the area where your legs go is at a diagonal to the area where your torso goes. You cannot stretch out because it does not have a seat that refines at all. The flight attendant has to “make your bed“ and then you cannot sit up anymore for the remainder of the flight unless you have the bed unmade. The mattress or sitting arrangement are very thin akin to the kind of mattress found in China. The flight attendants are very nice but the food selection is quite limited. The timeline for getting food is right away when you arrive on board and then halfway through the flight. This way you aren’t usually hungry at all after having breakfast in the airport lounge and either don’t eat and try to rest midway through the flight or you eat too early and are hungry again when you get off the plane. It takes a long time to get anything you request from the flight attendants. There isn’t enough water offered so you have to keep asking for a water bottle if you want to stay hydrated. There was a guy coughing in front of me and I requested a mask to wear since I could not get into my purse which was stuffed under the bed once it was made, but I did not receive one for at least a half hour. With the coronavirus, it was unconscionable that I had to wait so long. If you can take another airline for that $4000 fee, do so. They use Airbus so perhaps it is the way that an Airbus is configured as opposed to Boeing.
label: neutral

text: Barcelona to Sao Paulo. First flight with Singapore Airlines and I was interested to see if travelling with Singapore would be substantially different to the experiences I had with AA/BA. I flew economy but the service in economy with Singapore Airlines was equal to that in business class on AA. The Boeing 777 has a 3-3-3 layout so a bit more spacious for those in economy. We had the bassinet seats at the front as I was travelling with my wife and 3 month old daughter. Food was great, frequent drinks brought around as were snacks and fruit. In flight entertainment great.
label: positive

text: Fly with them if you want to be involuntarily downgraded... I had originally booked on an A380 which offers their FULL business class product, and was downgraded to a REGIONAL A350 product which is usually used for their shorter (2-4 hour ish) routes. This is not acceptable for an 8 hour flight. What annoys me most is that I wasn't even told about it and thus wasn't even offered the chance to rebook.
