The cabin crew were great, but I didn't get what they paid for - after countless emails and escalations, I still can't find anyone who cares.
label: negative

text: Good service on the flight but overcharged on extra luggage The service from the stewards was very good and the food good for an airline. However, I was moving so I brought with me plenty of luggage. I was over the weight limit as I expected but I was ok with paying more as I didn't have much of a choice. Neither legs of the flight were busy. Not many people at all and most passangers had 3 seats to themselves. Despite this they charged me over 1100NZD for the extra weight on my checked in luggage. While I understand there are set prices for extra weight, I think based on the lack of passengers, they shouldn't be charging so much and could have shown some decency.
label: neutral

text: The ground service was appalling. Singapore Airlines does not seem to have much of a presence in Dubai anymore and DNATA handles everything. To say that the check-in counter staff was inefficient and ignorant would be an understatement. She did not even know that Scoot Airlines is a partner of SQ and had no clue about which terminal it operates, and worse still she gave the wrong information. In-flight service and food were excellent as usual but on arrival, the ground staff were again inefficient. IFE was outstanding and the free wifi was well appreciated. SQ has a weird policy of not providing amenities and will only offer it if asked for.
label: positive

text: Purely Excellent Caught this flight to SIN, my first international flight after 2 years due to COVID-19. Check in was smooth and efficient. The seat was good and full with amenities. They are introducing new concept of Regional flight meal which is a box of hot food which is acceptable for a 2 hours flight.
label: positive

text: Underwhelmed. Heard good reports about their business class but doesn't compare to middle eastern airlines. The seat position was at a weired angle. Folding the seat over to get the bed was awkward. The staff on the flight were ok but not very attentive. The quality of the food was poor. Won't be flying with them again. Will stick with Emirates and Qatar airlines.
label: neutral

text: Kris FLYER miles cant be used to offset ticket. Ive always flied with singapore, i recently chose to fly to australia from europe. I had allot of built up miles which where expiring. I had no option to use them when purchasing the ticket. Whats the point of giving "Miles" if i cant use them. Its a scam, and i hate companies that scam people.. Next time im going with emirates..
label: negative

text: Another great way to fly SQ806 SIN-PEK It’s a new retrofitted B777-312ER 9V-SNA. Bigger LCD screen and comfortable seats compared to their old B777 without even electrical outlet or USB for charging phone. Friendly crews. However, for the the main meal, improvement needed on the appetizers.
label: positive

text: Seats too close We had an almost-new, spotlessly clean A350-900 crewed by very capable and pleasant flight attendants for the 8-hour flight. Food was very good and service faultless, but we could not watch anything whatsoever from the extensive in-flight entertainment range, as the people in the seat in front of us opted to recline their seats, forcing the screen to be no more than a hand's width from our faces, completely blurring anything n the screen. Also, the seat was hard up against my wife's knees (she's only 5'3"). We thought about reclining our seat to get away from it, but felt that those behind us would face the same discomfort as we did, so didn't. The plane is lovely to fly in, it's modern and quiet, but the seat issue will continue to create problems unless something is done about it. Happy to fly SQ but perhaps I should save up for business class next time.
label: positive

text: Long Haul champions If you are ever taking a long haul flight to Europe, Asia or Africa, you will do well to travel with Singapore Airlines. From checking in to Changi airport and onwards, you will not be disappointed. They are efficient, friendly and economy class is roomy.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Brisbane Singapore Airlines was once a good airline however after the recent experience of my wife and I they are not much better than Jetstar and Jetstar is an airline I will never fly with. Leg room nonexistent on the A350-900. It was obvious that the economy cabin was packed in like sardines to compensate for the sleeper seats in Business class. If you are travelling soon I would give this airline a wide birth. Very disappointed with the cabin service, seating arrangements and overall comfort was very poor (no sleep at all on an overnight flight). In myth opinion TAA - Try Another Airline
label: negative

text: Great Experience Great experience from start to finish. First time flying Singapore Airlines and would definitely fly with them again. Seats were very comfortable and the service was excellent. Meals were all very very good. Can’t really fault anything. We normally fly with Qantas and found that Singapore’s service was overall just that bit little bit better.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Munich. Check in was great, straight up to the desk. Used the business class lounge which was good to have a bite to eat and relax. This aircraft had the new business class seat and the reviews are right - it is the best business seat I've come across. Heaps of room and your own little compartment. Had 3 course meal before bed. The bed was great with myself 6'4 being able to totally lay stretched out and get hours of sleep. Booked the cook and had the full English breakfast before landing. Couldn't fault this flight one bit.
label: positive

text: Great service and staff We went up and back to Singapore flying Singapore airlines and it was a lovely flight great crew and service lots of room we sat by a bulk head and plenty of leg room flight only half full on the way home so everyone had 3 seats to them selves
label: positive

text: Holiday The experience on Singapore airlines was second to none . The staff were excellent and courteous . Would highly recommend 👏👏
label: positive

text: Safe but not great Singapore airlines is known to be very strict all around, which is great in terms of flight safety. I enjoyed the feeling of safety and comfort during the flight. However, I’m not sure I’d recommend them otherwise, at least not for premium economy. I flew once on regular economy and it was okay. However, my flight in premium economy was disappointing. Cathay is MUCH better for this class. Seats are much wider and have a much greater foot rest extension on Cathay. Your feet barely lift off the ground on Singapore Airlines. As well, Cathay has much better food. SA food made me very sick. Cathay also provides a welcome drink and amenity kit. I was very disappointed because SA advertises that they give this to premium economy, yet I did not receive either. To top it off, flight attendants decided to come up with a crafty lie once they were caught being racist :)
label: negative

text: Flight to Singapore and Bali Excellent service even in economy! The flights were full but not every seat was taken so I got two of three seats on all of the long segment flights. The entertainment selections were timely and extensive. The cup holder was one thing that impressed me the most! Why don’t other airlines have cup holders? The flight attendants were very nice, responsive and helpful. I highly recommend Singapore Air!
label: positive

text: Travel styles We had a booking from India mumbai to Singapore . I thaught the flight would be of Singapore airline but it was some alliance air I suppose was left unhappy. I wanted to see the flight of Singapore airlines. It was a ok flight only delayed by 1 hour might be there was reason but was provide with refreshments for the same. Hope to have a better option next time.
label: neutral

text: First Class Suite - First Class experience Our flight from Sydney - Singapore, on the A380 was in their Suites. Overwhelmingly incredible experience. From the suite itself to the staff service, food, chair and bed, it really was first class treatment all the way. Singapore - Shanghai was in their 'normal' first class. Chairs very comfortable and service and food outstanding as always.
label: positive

text: First time Business Class To tick off a friend's bucket list item we flew from Singapore to Adelaide - Business Class. The location of our seat was ideal with plenty of leg-room. The seating was not comfortable and sleep did not happen. The stewardess was very accommodating asking us when we wanted food served. We declined this offer as we were not hungry and arrived in Adelaide about 35 minutes earlier than scheduled. The Krissflyer Lounge was an absolutely wonderful experience. Continual different foods, always clearing away plates and glasses and nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: I expected more In general, SQ's service has always been good. Trusted by my family since the 80s. As much as I would like to support local, I would only take SQ if the price is right. There was a deal for this trip to HK that made flying with SQ more desirable than taking budget. The seats felt awkward for me. I am 1.58m but I felt that that the table was too low for me. There was only noodles left by the time the service staff came to me & unfortunately part of the noddles was hard. So I only ate half of it. To my surprise, the coffee cup that came with my tray of food was broken. I was still eating the hot dish when the air stewardess was came around with ice cream. So I told her, "Maybe later." Without prompting, she came back after my meal to ask if wanted my ice cream now. The movie selection was updated & I couldn't resist watching 2 shows on board.
label: positive

text: rushed service on midnight flight rushed service at dinner with no offer of desert after dinner . lack of choice for breakfast . We were in the forward cabin but did not get our choice of Asian breakfast . The service from cabin attendant was less personal comparing to that of Cathy Pacific who recognised by your first name
label: neutral

text: We did not receive much assistance on the Noi Bai side, but it was good on the Changi side on arrival. The Song Hong Lounge was decent, with good food and nice view of the apron. Singapore Airlines used an A350-900 for a 3-hour flight, which was amazing. Our book-the-cook meals were decent, though not as good as I would like. In-flight service was excellent.
label: positive

text: Professional service, on time arrival The meals were delicious and the cabin crew came around frequently with water and juice. Legroom was fine. The in-flight entertainment has a good variety of movies, TV, music and other distractions. The WCs were cleaned regularly. My only quibble is the A350 seats have less padding than on other aircraft, so I wouldn't want to sleep but this flight (1205 out of BCN, 0700 into SIN) can be considered a daytime flight from the perspective of BCN time) if you have a a day hotel to check into at SIN. Also I didn't discern any advantage in paying extra for a forward zone seat as I had the opportunity to compare it with a normal economy seat.
label: positive

text: Always a Pleasure It is hard to look forward to a 20+ hour flight, but Singapore Airlines makes this possible. The attention to detail for even Economy passengers makes every trip a pleasure. Hot towels, menus, entertainment galore helps one to forget they are on an aircraft. The attendants are beyond gracious and constantly appear to offer water, drinks and snacks. I am so excited to try the nonstop flight from Newark to Singapore next month.
label: positive

text: Bit disappointing I was very disappointed about the vegetarian meals I was served, they were tasteless, lacked freshness and had expected better as I was flying premium economy. All in all premium economy at Singapore air lack what other airlines have. Will not do so again.
label: neutral

text: First time flying on the A350 and it makes the flight from Munich to Singapore considerably more comfortable than on the 777. As usual Singapore Airlines staff were friendly and professional, as we were traveling with a toddler, we were invited to board first and get ourselves settled. Stewardess came by to check if we needed anything for our daughter and if we would like our meals at different times. Seats were comfortable, row 41, which has the advantage of lots of leg room but has fixed armrests which hems you in a bit. There is an extensive selection of movies which will keep most people entertained for a flight longer than the 11 hours we had. SQ is saving money a bit with the food portions getting smaller but flavour and quality were still there. A350 is quiet and the lower cabin preasure is noticeable in that you arrived refreshed even after the long flight, I even managed a few hours sleep. Flight departed a bit late but arrived 30 min ahead of schedule. Once again Singapore Airlines is a great way to fly.
label: positive

text: No customer service at all and had to chase my refund I had to cancel my flight due to a positive covid test and there were no other flights to Perth for the foreseeable future that I could see online. I tried to call to find another flight but they never answered, I was just put on hold. In total I waited five and a half hours on hold. The worst was when I waited 2 hours and 35 minutes on hold to be cut off by Singapore. So, I had to cancel online. 30 days later no money in my account. I followed up by email and was given some ridiculous excuse of the call centre in Rome going through to Greece - made no sense. I had a fully refundable ticket for cancellation yet they demanded a covid test result or doctors certificate before they would give me my money back. I pointed out that I had a fully refundable ticket and did not need to give a reason to cancel. Eventually they agreed to refund my money as an exception (I didn't need an exception) but I really had to chase and work for it. Even then the woman I was dealing with made it sound like she was making a real exception in giving me a refund and that in future I should make sure I keep all paperwork for special circumstances, ignoring that my ticket was fully refundable with no fee. I just didn't get it. Never again, ended up going with Emirates and they were so good to deal with.
label: negative

text: just fantastic Everything was just awesome excellent service on board.. I have flown in a lot of Airlines but Singapore is just the best in every term. Had a wonderful Flight. Foods were Excellent. Highly Recommended.
label: positive

text: Delhi to Manila via Singapore. The crew on the Singapore - Manila leg of the flight, SQ918 were stern or not in the mood to serve on this flight. We were still offered the usual food and hot towels, but the atmosphere was cold at that section of the plane.
label: positive

text: Bumped off Premium Economy flight - No response from Customer Service Manager Booked a premium economy flight via Verve Travel Management (Hello World Travel) on St Kilda road Melbourne, I later selected my seat online. When checking in the night before the early morning flight there was no booking and I had been what appeared moved to another flight for some reason. After calling Verve Travel and Singapore Airlines nobody could provide with me an answer, Singapore Airlines stated that there was 0.1% chance of getting my seat back. I was forced to go the airport at 5am to see if i could get onto the flight. This was a number of months ago and after 35 emails and constant requests for answers Singapore Airlines and the Customer Affairs Manager responded once (blaming her managers) and to this day have never resolved the matter. Incredibly disappointing as I though they were much better that that....especially on a premium economy seat. I will keep on trying to get a fair outcome.
label: negative

text: Singapore airlines Simply the Best 🎶 Great customer service. Seats comfortable and reasonable leg room. Flights on time. Good food. Flown with them a few times and will continue to do so .
label: positive

text: Disappointing Business Class experience Booked Singapore Airlines economy, then decided to change to Business Class despite the huge difference in fares. Singapore airlines charged $300 per ticket to change which was the first disappointing thing - we were already paying a huge amount. they have "book the Cook" for business and first class passengers where you can choose your meal before departure. I tried to do this but for some reason it didn't save to our booking. the food provided was absolutely awful. Tough scallops and prawns, then almost inedible main courses. Very disappointing. The staff were helpful and lovely and the seats/beds were comfortable. I contacted Singapore Airlines in Singapore and asked them to book our meals for our return journey as I still could not get them to save to our booking. the return trip was much better - the plane was nicer, the food was excellent. I have flown SA before in economy and found them to be very good so it was extra disappointing to find Business so ordinary. Fortunately our return journey went some way to alleviate our disappointment from the trip over.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Holiday In flight service was faultless and wine and food selection and quality was even better than our expectations which were preset at a very high level. Simply outstanding. Ground crew were helpful and prompt. Everyone should at least try business or first class once in their lives, it is truly a different experience. This trip was mum's 80 birthday celebration and we were concerned how well she would handle the long flight. We went from Wellington via Melbourne and this workperfectly with brief visit to Melbourne lounge both ways. She arrived there and home fresh and rested on arrival.. Flight staff really looked after every one.
label: positive

text: Check in at Melbourne Airport was efficient. Terribly disappointed at the inflight service, quality and quantity of food offered (and I don't have a large appetite) plus the age of the aircrafts. SQ tickets are not cheap and not having travelled with SQ in a while, I was so looking forward to my flight given the inflight service reputation which in my opinion has gone to the "dogs". Aircraft was old and used my wet towel to clean the tray table and mess. No bar service - just a round of juice, beer and sparkling wine before the meal, which was a beyond belief. Hot casserole and bread and nothing else - not even salad or dessert. Asked the steward for bottle water and was told they only offered tank water. I said I don't drink tank water and he brought me a small bottle from BC. Breakfast was a terrible meal too. On the return one round of Bar service provided this time. Same story with bottle water request and cabin staff brought me a few extra sealed cups of water off other pax trays. Again, horrible breakfast with a hard cold muffin and a poor fruit salad. Seats were small and cramped.
label: negative

text: There's a simple reason why Singapore Airlines is always rated amongst the very top airlines in the world. They're excellent. Both their hard product and soft product are very impressive and consistent which is not easy to achieve. This 17.5 hour flight from Singapore to San Francisco (via Hong Kong) is absolutely heavenly. The 777-300ER has the next gen First Class cabin which is noticeably different from the previous first class. The leather is firmer, the design more fresh with subtle colour adjustments and the seat has many new compartments to store all your onboard 'necesseties'. The IFE has also been completely revamped with a great new remote system which is very intuitive and easy to use. Love that you can now quickly rate movies that you watch. The dining is amazing. As if I was sitting in a fine restaurant in town. I love ordering via Book the Cook for I can specifically choose my meals for every part of the flight. Excellent job SQ.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Surabaya. I always fly Singapore airlines for work, and it has been getting worse by the day. The flight is perpetually delayed. It seems like they do not have a good concept of punctuality. In addition, cabin crew are average in terms of service and pleasantness. the hard product in itself is not something to be lauded. However, among all of it, it has always been the late departure over and over is the one that I think is the biggest pain.
label: negative

text: Never again. Well I have flown to Australia quite a few times with other airlines. Also flown many counties around the world. But I have a fear of heights and flying. I just try and keep my mind off that I'm in the air. Most flight will get a bit of turbulence now and then. It can't be helped, but both the 13hr flight from Heathrow to Singapore. Then the connecting flight from Singapore to Sidney had severe turbulence for 90% of each flight. It was literally like travelling down a bumpy road for the whole journey on both flights with the patches of extra bad turbulence. I spent the whole 2 flights terrified and shaking. Not what you want when flying for 20hrs with a fear of flying. I mean I know turbulence can't be helped, but how could I possible have consistent permanent turbulence for basically the entirety of 2 flight from one side of the world to the other. I don't know if you teach your pilots to fly a certain way, or maybe take short cuts somehow. But it was one of the most terrifying couple of days in my life. And the worst thing about it is I have to fly back with them in 2 weeks
label: negative

text: The Best! Singaporeairlines premium economy is the best affordable way to fly! I say affordable when you take advantage of the specials, which ia quite often. In my case from JFK to KL was the price of economy for premium economy seating! U get more options for meals pre booked twelve hours before flight! U get served first! naw that’s awesome. Food quality was great so was the service, the pick up after meal was took a little longer but hey nobody is perfect but for Singapore it was damn close. Tip: if u wanna take advantage of the specials, long haul flights usually got pretty good deals but no stopover except for transit, if u decide to stopover in Europe en route to Asia, it’ll cost you significantly more but it’s worth every penny. For me Singapore, Emirates and Qatar are best!
label: positive

text: Singapore Air Always efficient, friendly and as comfortable as economy can be. is there any solution to. People having their seat fully reclined from take off - this was the only uncomfortable part of the journey being squashed by the traveller in front. For most of the trip to Singapore.
label: positive

text: Best flight ✈️ I have been lucky enough to travel a lot in my life. I flew from Phuket to Singapore 🇸🇬 and from Singapore to London. I can honestly say that Singapore Airlines beat the others hands down in all areas. Economy travel very comfortable. Food excellent Air stewards attentive. Entertainment extensive. Well done and keep it up.
label: positive

text: Seems the standards in some areas have dropped .... Traveling back to New Zealand on this flight - had exit row seats in economy on an A380-800. probably seems good on booking but didn't enjoy the space seated in the seat. The seat just didn't seem wide enough? The ability I get straight out and stand up was great, but the nearness to the outlets was a let down. The food was. average to poor and wasn't what I remember pre-COVID. The flight was clean and crew kept the toilets very clean, but a full flight and seems the titles were always in use. In hindsight should have booked a window and aisle seat and hoped no booked the middle seat - lesson learned. Overall I found the standard of service had dropped and wasn't as good.
label: neutral

text: Cancel my original flight and stranded me in Singapore for 2 full days Had a flight from Rome to Sydney(AU) with a changeover flight in Singapore with 2 hours stopover. They have modified my flight and stranded me in Singapore for 2 full days. I have requested to leave rome the day after or add me in any other flight the same day(They operate 4 flight/day to Sydney) but non of my request was possible. I'll need to lose 2 days of work because this. Nether offer hotel or anything. Not too happy.
label: negative

text: You got to book this flight ! It was really impressive . It was probably one of the best airlines that I had ever travelled on . Marvel-ous ! Keep it up !
label: positive

text: Much vaunted Business Class disappointing Having read so many rave reviews of Singapore Airlines, when I couldn't get a direct flight at a reasonable price (my own fault for going in August) I decided to fly with them Hong Kong - London - Hong Kong via Singapore, despite the journey time being so much longer (17 hours vs 12 hours direct). On the plus side, all 4 flights were on time and the fare was good value for Business Class on this route. The first leg, 4 hours HK-Singapore, was fine - very comfortable seat where you could put your feet up, bottle of water at your seat, latest model touch screen entertainment system. The 13 hour Singapore-London was much less good - luckily I'd read reviews which recommended getting bulkhead seats as those are the only ones where you can rest your feet comfortably - all the others have the foot stool to the side so you have to sit twisted round. Although the seats are very wide, when folded into lie-flat beds only half the width is available and when I stretched out my head touched one end of the bed and my feet the other: I'm 5'8", so this is seriously inadequate for really tall passengers. The entertainment system is old-fashioned, with no touch screen, although the headphones are good quality. Coming back, while the London-Singapore leg was the same, the aircraft for Singapore-HK had been downgraded to an older model - seats were wide and comfortable but you couldn't put your feet up, I had to pile up pillows and blankets myself to get my feet just a bit elevated. Unfortunately for me, my ankles swell up if I can't have my feet up, one of the main reasons I fly Business Class on long haul flights, so this was a real problem for me. The staff clearly didn't want to deal with this, so they pretended not to see it - although they did offer me extra chocolates as they could see I wasn't happy. On all 4 flights, the wines were good, so was the coffee, but the food was no more than OK, certainly not living up to the hype that Singapore Air is a gourmet experience, I've had much better food on other airlines, so this was a real disappointment. Breakfast (which I didn't bother with) was distinctly weird - choices were Asian (fair enough), sickly sweet waffles with cream (not for me!) or some kind of concoction with caramelized onions instead of a normal eggs and bacon type offering. The connection at Singapore on the outbound flight was fine, on the return flight arrival and departure were in different terminals and it took an hour to get from where we landed to where the next flight departed, the last thing you need after a 13 hour flight. As for the famous cabin crew service, it's certainly attentive and polite - one thing I did appreciate was that the flight attendants hurried to help you getting luggage in and out of the overhead compartments, which some airlines seem to have a policy against. On the other hand, there's a certain stinginess about the airline which is quite unattractive - I've done the HK-London trip in Business Class on 7 different airlines and this is the only one which doesn't give you a little goody bag with toothbrush, moisturiser, etc. You do get a pair of cheap slippers and socks (which of course the airline can use again if you don't open them) and there are toothbrushes in the toilets, but although it's a stupid little thing the gift bag is the kind of touch that makes you feel welcome and valued. In the same way, when I used the shower at the SilverKris lounge at Heathrow, there was no shampoo, conditioner or body lotion as there is in the showers at other airline lounges - instead there's a notice saying "if you want amenities you have to ask for them". And why give passengers a bottle of water on a 4 hour flight, but not on a 13 hour flight? Again, the only one out of the seven airlines not to do this. While the biggest problem for me was the length of the journey - I wouldn't use this route again for that reason alone - I'm afraid that I just didn't take to Singapore Airlines and am quite bemused that so many reviewers clearly love flying with them; I certainly don't plan to do so again.
label: neutral

text: SQ319 from LHR to SIN on the 777 300ER with new business class. Generally a good flight with excellent service good food and fantastic entertainment. The big downside is the new seat / bed. This has been ineptly designed and suffers from several really irritating issues that should have been resolved before it was rolled out. The seat is wide and has no side or lumbar support so whatever position you adopt it is not good for the back and not comfortable. The armrest to one side contains the table and a a small locker. Both are opened by pushing down. As these are exactly where your arm naturally rests they keep popping up which is annoying. When flipped over into bed mode the mattress is very hard. You have to lie at a diagonal angle due to restricted length and this is not comfortable. A further problem is that seat belt when in bed mode is an inertia reel seat belt - it is far too sensitive so if you turn onto your side or at least try too it locks and stops you turning and then you have to stop again very gently pull it out before completing the turn. It is nearly a great seat and bed but suffers from too many basic flaws which could and should have been spotted and resolved by the designer. Disappointing. Other than the poor bed / seat and lack of an amenity kit a good flight.
label: positive

text: The A350-900 is a massive upgrade for the Wellington-Melbourne-Singapore service The Singapore Airlines A350 in economy is amazing, good entertainment and comfortable seat. Singapore Airlines also has great delicious food. The crew was also great but I did ask for a Sprite a never recived it. Overall great product and great service. The aircraft was only 2 years old 359 and was Comfortable and quite. Overall I would highly recommend flying Singapore Airlines to Wellington. In economy I would recommend sitting in seat 55a for a great wing view.
label: positive

text: This is for Manila to Singapore and back I mean, it's singapore airlines, it's your best option flying from Manila to Singapore. And the ticket prices, if gotten early, will be almost the same price as Cebu pacific's. Inflight entertainment ... you have your own big lcd screen infront of you with hundreds of movies, tv series, documentaries, whathaveyou to choose from. You actually beg that you can buy extra time to be able to finish what you are watching. That said, the USB port they give you is useless for current phone models that need higher amps to charge. Food wise.. I have to be honest.. it's starting to be crappy.. Philippine Airlines level crappy. It's possible that it is for just Manila to Singapore flights... so do consider that when you read this review. HOWEVER, they made up for it by giving us ice cream cubes for dessert. overall, always check cebu pac's prices first, then check on singapore and philippine airline's if they're about the same price. Singapore airlines should always be your first choice because you will be given a more pleasurable inflight experience.
label: positive

text: Not for the elderly or people with disability The airline is good for the experienced, able-boded traveller. However, if you are elderly, person with disability or requiring assistance, I would suggest you find alternative airlines. Their support staff is horrendous in terms of providing appropriate assistance to those who need it the most. The Live chat agents are also hopeless (don't waste your time) and feedbacks/complaints take a while to be responded to. As I said, if you are able to navigate well, are tech-savvy or well-travelled, you're all good. You will have a comfortable flight. However, if you are someone likely to require the airlines' assistance, forget it. Their support staff is horrible.
label: negative

text: Best airline Experience I have ever had If they flew everywhere I would fly no other airlne. The seats are huge, the food is excellent, the beds are flat and wide and the stewards are attentive and serve you always with a smile. This is the third time I take this flight this year and my only complaint is that there was no orchid in the WC on this flight.
label: positive

text: A bit disappointed The airport lounge in Manchester not solely Singapore Airline.It was cold crowded and the food was terrible.So not a good start.The airline and staff were OK .The food was good ,wine selection very poor American Chardonnay or German Riesling.I needed help to alter the seat to a bed but had to go looking for someone no response from the buzzer.Extertainment was average.I ordered coffee during the flight but it never came.At one point I went to the loo had to make my way past 4 staff and was not acknowledged by any of them. A very disappointing experience for the so called best Airline in the world.
label: neutral

text: AS GOOD AS IT GETS The 777-300 could well be the best aircraft in the Singapore Airlines fleet. The business class seat is truly amazing. The seat itself is very spacious and comfortable. The aircraft has an overwhelming roomy feel. It may be because there's no overhead storage in the middle of the aircraft makes such a difference. Our flight was the usual SQ standard - we had a delightful meal and when ready for sleep the steward was standing at the ready to assist. The flat bed on this aircraft seemed even more comfortable than usual. In fact it was more comfortable than a few hotels we'd slept in on the trip! Our best advice: if you can afford to fly Singapore Airlines - do. You won't be disappointed.
label: positive

text: Absolutely easy and comfortable nonstop direct flight from Newark to Singapore We flew business class to Singapore, and premium economy the way home and were very happy with both legs of the trip. I was worried about such a long flight, but loved not having to stop enroute. It made the trip much easier and shorter. Business class service, as usual, was fantastic. What was really a wonderful surprise was how comfortable premium economy was including the food, seats, space, service and entertainment. I was worried about not flying business class, especially on such a long flight, but had such a good experience that we would fly premium economy any time again with Singapore Airlines. The food wasn't served as beautifully, and the liquor selection wasn't as expansive, but it was still quite good. We used the Book the Cook feature on the way from Singapore to Newark, but next time, would stick with what is served on the flight, especially the Canyon Ranch menu which looked really good. I have trouble sleeping on airplanes and often my back hurts from sitting too long. Neither was a problem on either flight. The lighting and sleep cycles, the roomy feel to the plane and the cabin pressure being set at a lower altitude were also great features that made the trip so wonderful.
label: positive

text: World Class Comfortable flight and excellent service. The flight attendants are polite and helpful. Will recommend/
label: positive

text: Still the best airline for me I am a frequent traveller and had taken many flights with different airlines for my business and leisure trips. I must give compliments to SIA for the great airlines that it is. From the caring, friendly service that the crews provide to the safe, clean planes that usually arrive to the destination on schedule. I have been travelling with SIA for over 25 years and they are still the best in the business despite the challenges coming from the "oil fuelled" airlines which can provide excellent service at lower prices. I have taken flights to Bangkok using Thai Airways, their service and plane is not at the same level and if the price for airfares are not too far away, I will always choose SIA. I have tried travelling with Scoot due to an urgent meeting arrangement but the experience was really bad. On the return trip, their plane had issues and were delayed for a few hours. On this trip, there were no surprises and that's what I like about SIA. No surprises are good for me.
label: positive

text: Hanoi to Singapore with Singapore Airlines. I feel that my expectations were really high and I don't feel like there was anything special about Singapore Airlines. The seat was wide and the IFE system was fantastic, but I found the food to be terrible and the flight attendants kind of rude.
label: positive

text: Fabulous flight! Managed to get a VERY cost effective fare - at least half the price of a comparable Air NZ flight. Everything was impeccable on this trip - except the check in people who didnt seem very interested in doing their job (not Singapore Airlines issue - as the staff are all contract and swap between airlines) and the outdated entertainment system. Staff service was fabulous, food very edible and luggage allowance very generous. For the price there is no doubt this warrants a 5 star rating.
label: positive

text: still as good, but avoid the fish meal has been flying SQ for more than 30 yrs, still as good, but recent trips, the fish meals onboard were not good at all. Shd hv order chicken instead.
label: positive

text: Very little room Flight attendants are lovely and very welcoming, great service. Only thing bad is it is very cramped not much room between seats. Because of this the earl trays are small, can’t fit much on them. Between Melbourne and Singapore my legs kept cramping and I was very uncomfortable through the whole flight. Being an over night flight there was no where to move to as other passengers where laying across all empty seats.
label: neutral

text: Surprised to see such a poor service .I flew from Melbourne to Kathmandu in october.from Melbourne the service is okay ishhh.the drama starts from Singapore to Kathmandu flight vice versa.they don't have a proper blanket for my 3 years old daughter.when i asked for it they brought newborn blanket which was a joke.they didn't bring it to me I had to fight for it .what a shame. Forget about infotainment.kids food was such lame. Not going to fly again with them.
label: negative

text: Los Angeles to Tokyo. Poor food quality (Chef stuff pre-ordered-cold multiple times), aging aircraft interior, insincere flight attendants. Quirky check in (weighing a backpack?). Blow par flight info management (ticketing and gate notification).
label: negative

text: Frankfurt to Singapore, Business Class. I got an email early morning on 9 January to notify me that the flight was to be delayed by 2 hours. As I was connecting with Air New Zealand at Singapore onwards to Auckland with a short connection time, I thought the chance of catching the connecting flight to Auckland was going to be impossible. That proved correct. Prior to arriving at the airport, I rung both SQ and Air New Zealand. Both airlines claimed it was each other’s responsibility. In short, SQ was to blame for the disruption, so it was their responsibility to put things right. When we were due to board at Frankfurt, the A380 was not at the terminal, it was at a distant part of the airport so we were bussed to the plane which seemed to be miles away. When we finally arrived at the plane, we had to climb a set of steep stairs to enter the plane. Considering the delayed flight and the inconvenience we had been through, the greeting from the staff was very ho-hum. The crew seemed to be grumpy during this flight. The poor guy in front of me had a seat adjacent to the galley door way. He asked to be reseated somewhere else in the business section. The stewardess’s response was, sorry, we are fully booked. This wasn’t the case as there was a vacant seat behind me. The meals were very Asian, with a lot of seafood options, in some cases I chose to forego the course as there was just nothing I liked. I would recommend SQ’s “book the cook” option. There are far more options available using this than SQ offers on the flight. Come time to sleep, my bed was broken. It lay flat ok, its just that when I put my weight on the bed the feet end of the bed couldn’t sustain the weight and my feet would go right through to the floor. I slept, but it wasn’t great. I wasn’t the only one to complain of this problem. When the flight arrived in Singapore there were a team of SQ agents waiting for arriving passengers whose connecting flights were affected by the delay. In all fairness, SQ did handle this very well, they provided a 4 star airport hotel for 12 hours along with 3 meals. The journey on to New Zealand continued with SQ and I can basically say, I saw a repeat of the service issues I had on the Frankfurt/Singapore flight. I can’t recommend SQ and probably won’t chose to fly with them again.
label: negative

text: Adelaide to Tokyo via Singapore. Excellent dedicated check in for Premium Economy and Business Class and staff friendly and efficient. Boarding was efficient with lines for Elite Gold and Premium Economy Passengers. Seat was well cushioned and very comfortable. More then enough legroom with an extended footrest. Compartments on either side of the seats for mobile phones and other small devices. Compartment in the front of the seat large enough to fit a 15 inch laptop and an iPad. Smaller spaces in the console can easily fit 2 water bottles. Tray tables extend out of the centre console. Entertainment was standard with a 13 inch HD screen and a fantastic selection of movies and a less than desirable selection of TV Shows. Flight Attendants were attentive and friendly, doing checks of the cabin and there if you needed anything. Food was sufficient but I wouldn't say it was anything impressive. Beverage selection was fairly extensive even serving champagne before take off. WiFi was expensive and only came with 30MB but the ability to use roaming services on board was good.
label: positive

text: Great airline Brilliant experiences with this airline. Fantastic service from check in to landing. Friendly and caring staff. Delicious food too!!
label: positive

text: USE THE MOST EXPENSIVE AIRLINE BUT NEVER THIS THIEF OF AN AIRLINE I was heading to Bali for my honeymoon until I got stopped by one of Singapore agents. She stated that my wife cannot depart the plane because her passport expires in May 2023 which is less than 6 months based on Bali’s requirements. However, after many discussions with the agent and trying to find a solution, she said nothing can be done and gave us a ticket number to follow up. These guys took my money 4 or 5 months ago right after I booked my ticket! But when I requested a refund, I get the answer that I have to wait “1 to 2 weeks” which is very unacceptable as I am looking to book another flight with that money! Also, when I asked for a confirmation email! I kept getting the same answer which is "No" I am very very very displeased with the service I got from your agent which was super super rude! and even called the Police because I asked her the question few times! this is very unprofessional from the so called, "Singaporean Airline" which was once the best airline out there!! The agent kept blaming me and not even trying to take some responsibility for a fault the Singaporean airline website had caused! I booked my ticket with the same expiry date! their system never stopped me when reading my documents! How am I supposed to know that there’s such a requirement that would stop me from traveling. The agent was super super super rude and very unhelpful and very unprofessional! I really thought booking with the Singaporean airline would be the best option but it’s the worst decision I’ve ever done, and I travel a lot! The agent was not even trying to show some empathy and help two newly married couple who was heading to their honeymoon but on the contrary, she insisted to make the experience even more worse!
label: negative

text: Great Flight We have used this airline so many times. The crew are very friendly and the service is fantastic. We always have a great flight. I will keep flying with them.
label: positive

text: Efficient & Focused Crew = Good Service Was surprised for a short leg ,SQ is using A350..., didn't really check the plane category when I booked. Flight attendants were simply efficient , less mention is need on the A350 on its immaculate features, despite that its well maintained on cleanliness and comfort.
label: positive

text: Revamped business class seat in A380 It is worth to try out the the latest generation of Business Class seat with better arrangements on the meal table, storage and seat. Converting to flat bed is now just a button away. The meal table is now more controllable than before, and is much more easy to setup.
label: positive

text: Jetlag The first leg of the journey was quite good as we had an empty seat beside us that we could use to stretch out for comfort. The stewards were very good & plenty of food & beverage were served during the flight. The second leg we didn't have a spare seat to stretch out on but we watched the free movies which made the time go quicker. We did find for the first time in our travelling that we experienced jetlag & after a week & a half we are only getting back to a proper sleep regime
label: positive

text: Dealyed/lost luggage and no information from Singapore Airlines Singapore airlines deliberately decided not to load my vessel with my suitcase and gave me no heads up in regards to this. When I arrived at my final destination - after 2 other stops - , I didn't see it, went to the baggage claim desk and was told that the aircraft was too heavy to carry my suitcase - I never even conceived that an airline could actively simply decide that, without any communication or negotiation, they could just not load your luggage and leave you waiting for it, powerlessly, at the airport; and then have you go through all the stress of chasing it for days. They opened a ticket to track my suitcase and many emails have been sent saying that it hasn't been found yet. Their Brisbane office does not answer the only phone number provided to me. Sydney's office took literally one hour to answer my call and said it was able to find it and assign a flight to it, which should arrive tonight - 2 full days after my arrival -. I have WET clothes in there that are being damaged and damaging other goods while they don't send the suitcase, and other important articles for my everyday use, like clothes and leather shoes to go to work. I'm having to work from home as a result, against my company's policy. Although Sydney said there was a flight assigned to my suitcase, I kept receiving emails saying it wasn't located yet, and that they "were doing their best" to find it, so I also had contradictory information from their team. I wasn't given a final date to have this resolved, nor any sort of compensation offer from the airline. This is very poor customer handling and has ruined that entire Singapore Airlines experience, which already hadn't had any stand-outs. Solely for that reason, I would NEVER advise anyone to fly Singapore Airlines. Ever.
label: negative

text: Never again We had four flights with Singapore Airlines in our itinerary, what a disappointment. Having flown previously with Singapore standards have certainly dropped. Food just awful, bread frozen, fruit frozen, meals were inedible. How they have earned the status of best airline is beyond me. Squashed up against seats like sardines, no wonder some in our party needed to visit a doctor after the flight.
label: negative

text: Usual great service Why did I chose to fly to Singapore? It wasn't actually on my travel plans... However, it was cheaper to fly to singsore from karratha than it was to Perth. Thank you Singapore Airlines for being reasonable on pricing! Yes it was even the same flight I would have got to Perth anyway. Bonus, but now I get paid to take an international flight too!! Anyway, beyond price which was my driving factor, as well as many of the other passengers, the service was great, seats comfortable, good luggage allowance, and even the meals (Perth to Singapore leg) were even pretty nice for airline food. Definitely recommend them. They also code share with virgin, which ensures a reasonable level of service on the domestic leg.
label: positive

text: from first to last minute it was a 5-star experience There is nothing negativ I could say about the flight. The crew was extremely friendly and helpful, also during the night flight there where 2 stewardess taking care of every whish, and this not only because it was their job, but with empathy. Comfort and cleanlyness gave no reason for a complaint.
label: positive

text: Great experience always! Always a pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines. The plane is spacious and clean. Service provided is great and the crew are very polite and helpful. Will definitely recommend to choose Singapore Airline for the best flight experience.
label: positive

text: Never again We had a booking via traveloka and were bluffed that we are insured with Chubb. Few days before our departure we received mail that all our flights were cancelled. We lost 700€ because this foul business traveloka and Chubb did not refund us. So,the Singapore Airline. Comparing with Qatar Air we received info that we can change our dates, or get a refund.
label: negative

text: Flying High There are other airlines I put ahead of Singapore. On this particular flight I found the cabin crew were not as friendly as I would have expected. The food was ok, typical airline food I thought. The movies available were not what I normally watch but did manage to watch a couple and close down one which I thought was garbage, Once upon a time in Hollywood. I am only 160cm so legroom isn't a problem for me on any airline my knees do not touch the seat in front of me.
label: positive

text: Favorite airline First time traveling premium economy and it was amazing. Plenty of leg room, loved the recliner action of the seat, very comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and food good.
label: positive

text: Never Fly Singapore Airlines unless you are in First Clas . Economy is absolutely out of I took the Red eye that left for Beijing at 1:00 A.M. that got into Beijing at 6:30 A.M. My seat was in the middle . The service stunk and so did the food . It was the flight from hell. If you aren't in first class you don't exist .
label: negative

text: Great service and value for money We just flew from KL to Tokyo Haneda via Singapore and back. The flights were on time and even arrived earlier for the Changi - Tokyo leg and back. The seat and cabin environment was good with the cabin crew being very attentive and service orientated. For the outbound flight to Tokyo which was the late night flight, the crew regularly walked around and attend to passengers' needs. There are no complaints on the inflight meals and entertainment which had a wide choice in terms of movies, music and TV series. The cabin even had the Christmas feel. Overall was satisfied with the flights we were on.
label: positive

text: World Class Airline I have flow Singapore Airlines many times in the pass some for business some for pleasure. I have flown both business and economy and I have flown them from Boston MA USA to Singapore which is a very very long flight 30 hours and I have done it in both business and economy. Business class is excellent and lucky for me it was paid by my company. Just a little about the service in business class the seat you had reclined into a bed, the food was outstanding and the service was too I have flown other airlines also both business and economy class. Singapore is really outstanding. Now economy class not the same as business but it was also very good the service was very good the food also and the seats didn't go all the way back like business but I was still able to get my rest on the flight. They also had a small entertainment screen on the in front of you which was also very nice. That all being said you have to remember that they are not a budget airline so you will pay more so you need to do your shopping for price but for me they are one of my favorite airlines to travel on a really first class overall airlines.
label: positive

text: Excellent We have flown both Economy and Business Class, and both provide excellent food and service. This is our 7th flight using Singapore Airlines and we will always choose them when possible. Boarding at LAX was a nightmare, with a crowded terminal with no seating and tardy buses taking us out to our plane, which was mostly the fault of the airport, but the airline employees could have been better organized. The in-flight entertainment includes newly released movies as well as television shows from all over the world.
label: positive

text: Most helpful crew Had the pleasure of flying with Singapore Airlines again to Koh Samui, Thailand. Always excellent service with quick bag drop at counter and speedy boarding as per usual. Cabin crew were fantastic on outbound and return flight but have to give a huge thank you to the most attentive and caring crew on the way back from Singapore. My husband wasn't feeling too well and it seemed quite hot on the aircraft. Cabin crew were very prompt in providing him with cold compresses and ice water so that he was more comfortable. If not for this I'm not really sure how he would have coped on the long flight home. The crew manager also came to check on him during the flight...very kind and caring indeed.
label: positive

text: Try another airline instead Dirty and broken toilet parts. The same confusing signs from decades ago, encouraging illiterate passengers sticking rubbish into wrong holes. Yuck. Why not change them, they obviously don’t work! Seat pocket not cleaned before my flight, still someone else’s rubbish in there. Gross. Coeliac disease-no snacks for you on board at all. Dangerously ignorant staff-“why don’t you just have these nuts and crackers anyway?” Rude staff-most requests were be met with a loud explanation of how I must let them finish what they’re doing first, so that every other passenger who heard would think I was bossing them about.
label: negative

text: Super flight The timing of the flight is amazing. Absolutely no jet lag. We leave JNB at 2230 and reach Singapore at 3 pm. By the time we settle down, it’s bed time. The airlines is undisputedly the best in the air. Amazing seats and best service. So much food to choose. Love all my SQ flights.
label: positive

text: Staff are great, planes average and after service is poor We flew to London Via Sinapore and the plane to Brisbane was so uncomfortable, the seats hard and when reclined tilted forward making it hard to get comfortable. The staff were good offering refreshments at times although seemed to take a long time to get to serving. a special request meal was basically tomoato and pasta and no extra. The flight between Singapore and Heathrow was better the staff were great. the meals were better. The flight back to Singapore we upgraded at great cost to business class which was great. The facilities are getting a little dated now but it was good and the meals etc were good. The retrun to Brisbane was ok and seemed better than the way to Singapore. We felt dissapointed we did not receive a breakfast or something before arriving as we arrived early in the morning Brisbane time and had not had anything to eat for a while. To add to this, our luggage was damaged. we had it wrapped in Brisbane, but it looked like it had been crushed in something. I submitted a claim and no response and despite many attempts at responding to the online response and also calling, I have had no response and anyone on the phone is not able to assist. I also noticed we did not receive out miles for the Business Class upgrade and again it is still ongoing. I submitted a milage claim online and received it was rejected and now I have had to provide details to try and get it looked at. Woudnt it be in the system????? I used to think Singapore Airlines was a good airline but now do not think so unless you are willing to pay significantly more.
label: negative

text: Flight cancelled without previous notice SQ468 flight was cancelled on the 24th December 2022 without previous notice. As per the air ticket the transit time was only 50minutes. However, because of the cancellation the transit time was more than 24hours. I paid extra to get a less transit flight to my aged parents. No hotel was provided. My aged parents are stuck in the airport. I wouldn’t recommend Singapore airlines to anyone or will not go via Singapore airlines in the future.
label: negative

text: Memorable flying experience I am the tripadvisor member for quite sometime, but this is my first review and I wanna write for the helpful and friendly cabin crew Shahilah and Cheri who make my 13hrs flight from Singapore to London on 18 Oct SQ 318 comfort and smoothly, they are attention to detail, friendly and warm welcome. Even though I’m taking economic class but they still provide the professional service to all the passengers including myself. I really wanna thanks Shahilah, Cheri and her team (one of the short hair lady I forget to take her name) to make my long hours flight comfort and enjoyable. Well done and keep it on :)
label: positive

text: Disappointing food Boarding handled OK. Small champagne offered on being seated (seat 18F). Second glass equally small and really insufficiently chilled - nuts, also served, were warm and fine. Meals were less than hot and one, the lamb meatballs, were served with what was referred to as 'toasted crostata' which were large chunks of bread which were soggy and not crisp, as they should be. I realise that preparing food at 35,000 feet is no easy task but expected better. On a positive note, the seats are fine and well designed with plenty of storage room and quite comfortable. The crew was also attentive and helpful. A not unpleasant experience by any means but I expected a bit more. Now if we could combine Air New Zealand's food with Singapore Airlines seating we would have a winner!
label: positive

text: So far, only the best airline This flight was a returning to New Zealand after one month holidays in Portugal. My review will be based on my experience only and will share my personal opinion regarding the flight and wont consider the airport, lounges, etc for the results of this review as the airports are mainly managed by other companies than the airlines. Important to refer that we were flying with our two small girls, 2y and 4y at the time, and this can give support to other families. On the first leg, between Frankfurt and Singapore, we went on boar of the 777-300ER with the new interior. I love the A380 aircraft, but this one from Singapore is outstanding. As soon as we went on boar (late due to the "organization" of Frankfurt airport and ground staff support) we received a warm welcome on board. They were very concern about the comfort of the kids, something that several airlines forget about. - Drinks given before take-off they were ok ( I prefer Etihad Mocktails) - cabine is very well designed - seats very comfortable, even though I prefer the ones on other airlines where a wider space is provided for your feet's when on a lay down position. - food is really good. Very good quality of the products, mainly the cheese. Few variety but very good, - entertainment was good, very similar to the other airlines. - nice games, puzzles, colouring sets and others have been provided to the kids, - food and drink always available - Singapore opted for a type of seats that wont allow you to swap from seat to laydown position without leaving your seat (refer to several videos online). you will need to stand up and call for assistance if you don't know how to do it. It can be considered not the desirable but it provide definitely an higher comfort for a better sleep. Staff is very kind and always around to support, and even to pamper our little ones. The only negative point was the flight between Singapore and Christchurch, as the aircraft is a 777-200 with quit old interior. Screen very poor quality, and less entertainment (movies). rather than that, all the quality from Singapore. Will recommend anyone to consider Singapore on their next flights, as you can have much more for less money. Our coming trip will be through Singapore for sure.
label: positive

text: Premium economy downgrade nightmare We have been downgraded on SIN to MEL leg of our flight from Premium Economy to Economy. No explanation just an email. It turns out they have changed aircraft from Boeing 777 to Airbus A350 which only has no premium economy cabin Multiple calls to Australian contact centre based in Changi. Requested to change LHR > SIN> MEL to earlier flights but on the same day SQ 317/SQ217. SIA refused citing capacity block in UK until Sept 11 2022. This apparently prevents them from moving me from original flights to new flights despite no change in passenger numbers. I can of course if I want book 2 seats on Premium economy on line today on the dates I want despite the capacity block?? When pushed also said original flight was booked Premium Economy LITE and only FLEX is now available. Our only option is 1) Accept downgrade to economy for SIN>MEL leg with zero compensation on offer 2) obtain full refund for SIN>MEL leg leaving us stranded in Singapore on route to Melbourne 3) pay difference between premium economy lite and premium economy Flex I have escalated this twice but despite promising to call me back they do not or send an SMS for me to again call the SIA contact centre. Does any one have any suggestions. Should I contact ACCC in Australia or CCCS in Singapore?
label: negative

text: Terrible customer service 1. Customer service cannot handle simple itinerary changes. They are very polite but hardly trained. 2. Takes hours to correct the issue as they have to talk to supervisor for every simple thing and the supervisors are available depending on the call volume. I almost spent 5 hours. 3. I paid $1000 extra to prepone my start date and they cancelled my return ticket because my name was still left in original itinerary and marked as no show. 4. There is no tracking or notes for the calls, you have to start over with every call and explain the situation.
label: negative

text: Wonderful Would fly with Singapore anytime.They are great. The cabin crew are very helpful, attentive and do whatever they can to make the flight pleasant. And always smiling. They make you feel very welcome on their planes. I had my bag damaged on route, but I put in a complaint at the airport, which the staff helped me fill out, and was reimbursed the money 3 days later with no argument. The meals were nice, the alcohol was better! 10/10
label: positive

text: Family vacation.... Good service n comfortable travel....easy checkin n hassle free travel.....professional staff....great flight n onboard service.....thank you.
label: positive

text: Holliday return We had a poor flight from Manchester to Melbourne on 30th November 2022 Without going into details the flight back was worse The inflight tv screen was rubbish The food was poor , and considering the extra cost It was not much better than basic economy, I certainly won’t be flying with Singapore Airlines ever again
label: negative

text: Consistently great service from Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines has been my preferred airline for the last twenty years during which I have travelled in Business, Premium Economy and Economy. They achieve a balance of affordability with excellent service no matter which class you travel. The service is always courteous and respectful. I've given 4 stars because, when travelling in Premium Economy, I felt that there should have been just a little more leg room (I'm 175 cm) and a little more reclining angle for the seats. That said, they are still my preferred airline.
label: positive

text: best economy experience had a great flight for both sectors and after flying i can say that yes SQ is perhaps the best airlines in world, their economy class services were way better than any other say emirates, etihad, ethiopian, china southern etc. would always recommend SQ over any other airlines
label: positive

text: Excellent service Check-in, both online and at the airport was very easy and efficient. Cabin crew had excellent attitude. Attentive, friendly and efficient. The food tasted very good. Pretty good leg room in economy class, comfortable seat, very clean cabin and toilets. Very Good variety of inflight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Best company for economic Hi, I travelling with different companies around the world but this one is really good !! The crew Is very very Professional !! Is not just a Job ! Is listening , helping and giving all the time during the trip. Close your eyes and travelling with them !!
label: positive

text: Always a pleasure There’s something comforting about flying with Singapore Airlines. Sure, there are occasions when the service is not up to expectations. But that’s because expectations are sky-high all the time. It’s been a while since my last flight on SQ biz class and this trip was all the more pleasurable for it. Flight was on a Airbus380 with the upgraded cabin. Very nice! Cabin crew were fantastic. We pre-ordered Book a Chef meals which were great. One thing to take note though is the relatively small overhead luggage compartments on this aircraft type. Overall, a really great way to fly!
label: positive

text: Great flight This is probably the best international flight we go on. It leaves late morning, arrives just before dinner time and the last time it only took 20 minutes to get from our seat to the taxi outside. The plane was new, the staff were amazing, just about as good as it gets when flying. If you are heading out of NZ to Europe then I recommend this flight to Singapore as a stop over, you won't regret it.
label: positive

text: Gaura Travel Agency, Melbourne, Australia does not do justice to the the standard that Singapore Airlines upholds Scoot Airlines, partnered by SA is not a quality service Airliner, they make money off you on board.
label: negative

text: Colombo to Sydney via Singapore. I thought I loved Singapore airlines and it seemed okay (not great) when I flew from Sydney to Colombo. But then I had the rudest experience when I travelled back to Australia. The air hostess in my cabin were pretty rude. It's like they just want to get their job done and they don't care about the people. I've travelled a lot on different airlines and Ive never been treated so rudely. They barely offer water to people. I wanted the chicken as i do not eat beef and they wanted me to have the beef and when i said i can't. They took a long time (everyone else had finished eating) to find me some fish meal that wasn't on the menu. I was grateful. However, that nice gesture didn't last for long. I literally opened my food to eat and the air hostess just dumps an ice cream (magnum) on my tray. Everyone else was happy to get theirs, but I had only begun (not even) eating! I had to gobble my food and eat the melting ice cream! And on this very flight the air hostess serving me just took the cup in which there was apple juice remaining and poured me water. I also asked them for water when leaving the aircraft and they hesitated and made me stay the whole time until everyone left to get me the water (which was also a very small cup). On a good note, I must say the flight is comfortable and good. And the food is acceptably good. I'd ask everyone who loves staying hydrated on flights to make sure they fill up their own water bottles.
label: neutral

text: Great flight marred by a pathetic on-ground experience at Changi Lounge : SilverKris Lounge , Terminal 3 Our incoming flight arrived at T1 , forcing us to take the overcrowded Skytrain to T3 ( as the only functional SilverKris Lounge is located there ). What a nightmare !! Just 2 coaches per train , filling up with hundreds of passengers at once , and people sneezing / coughing right on your face. Strange that the "best airport in the world" violates Covid-19 protocols of its own country. The lounge was as overcrowded as seen during our previous time here. Not even a single seat available. What is the point of a multi-million dollar renovation , if they could not even plan the seating correctly. This is the least they could have done , considering that every premium passenger flying on any Star Alliance flight can access this lounge. Boarding / Security : Our flight was assigned a gate at T1 ( as T3 conveniently shuts shop at night ). We left the lounge 1 HOUR EARLY. Our flight at 02:35 was the last SQ flight for the night. But even then , the lounge staff did not feel that it's their duty to inform us about the shocker that lay ahead. THE SKYTRAIN STOPS OPERATING AT 01:30. And still this airport wins awards all the time. Absurd. We had no option but to walk / run as fast as we could. It still took us almost 20 minutes to reach our gate. Security Check happens at the gate , one of the biggest flaws of this airport. But what makes it worse is the overtly rude security staff. A lady in front of us was having some trouble , but rather than being patient they started shouting at her for no reason at all. Passports / Boarding Passes are snatched out of your hands and thrown back at you. Also , a so-called "5 star airline" like SQ does not deserve that status , considering that they're unable to provide Fast-Track Immigration / Security at their own hub. Boarding was via a dedicated aerobridge. Seat / Layout : Just like their A350 , the B787-10 too has a 1-2-1 staggered layout in Business Class , with seats either close to the aisle or away ( the latter being more private ). The footrest is right in front , not angulated as seen on the A380 , ensuring a much better sleep. Service : Fabulous. Very courteous crew. Food & Beverages : We availed the 'Book the Cook' service. Loved Song Fa's 'Bak Kut Teh' and 'Qui Lian Ban Mian' Arrival : A dedicated Immigration counter for First / Business Class passengers. Luggage arrived on the belt on a priority basis as well.
label: neutral

text: Discrimination at its best (stewardess) My wife and my daughter went on a trip, first time flying singapore airlines, they said its number 1, maybe to white people. I have never heard from my wife a bad review in the airlines, not until boarding a singapore airlines. I would never recommend singapore airlines, food is not that good too. Better flying turkey or japan airlines.
label: negative

text: Highly recommended Biggest priority, we are tall and were unable to get the exit seats, but even though our flight was sixteen hours plus, we were comfortable with enough leg space!! The staff was very friendly, professional and helpful to all passengers. The food was good and more than enough. Toilets always kept clean and stocked with supplies. They do however only provide on request a purse with eye patch, socks and toothbrush and paste. But the latter and combs were supplied in the toilets, watch out for that. Then I will recommend a long enough stop over in Singapore so that you can do the free city tour, or go on your own, everything is very user friendly, easy to draw money, buy Metro ticket etc.
label: positive

text: good experience even for economy passengers I would any day recommend Singapore Airlines for flights. The cabin crew are very courteous and services are good. This South east Asia hospitality beats any other airlines
label: positive

text: Just Wow Flew on SQ 423 from Mumbai to Singapore on business class. What an experience. The aircraft Airbus A380 was super cool. The very clean interior was beautifully decorated. Service as usual was excellent. Departure on time. Food could have been better but probably I made a wrong choice. The Indian meal I requested was not spicy enough. Immediately after my meal the cabin attendant converted my seat into a flat bed with bed cover a mattress and a warm blanket. Got to sleep for 3 hours. The extra money spent was worth every penny. Looking forward to my return journey on March 17 using the same aircraft from Singapore to Mumbai
label: positive

text: An old airplane It appears that airlines flying into places like Ahmedabad in India seem to take the passengers for granted and provide sub standard service. People dont complain. On a recent flight Singapore Air deployed a Airbus that seemed ready for the graveyard. The food was so so and the only scotch on the plane was Johnny Walker Red Label( not a particularly palatable one. Other airlines have done the same. For the fare they charge lt might be a good idea to take a low cost airline
label: negative

text: Manila to Munich via Singapore. Singapore Airlines has always lived up to its name and quest for excellence. The plane used for the Singapore to Munich leg of the flight has wider seats, wider TV monitor and wider aisle. The cabin crew service was excellent and attending to our needs. The inflight entertainment has more movie choices as compared to last month when I used this airline on return flight to India.
label: positive

text: Dubai-Singapore-Perth. Very disappointing. What has happened to Singapore Airlines? The standard of the aircraft was just not up to today's standards and that's not because I usually fly Emirates which is in another class altogether compared to this flight at the same price! The whole interior of the aircraft was that of the 1980's. The seats were old and didn't function properly entertainment screen was tiny dim (even on full brightness) and blurry. I flew economy but felt sorrier for business class where seats looked like they were out of the 1970’s. Yes there are some other airlines that are as bad but you pay for what you get and this flight was not cheap. Note: even low cost airlins these days have new fresh interiors albeit basic.
label: negative

text: Wonderful, Attentive Service Throughout Flight The crew was extremely attentive and friendly without being intrusive. The seats were brand new and could easily transform to a flatbed at the touch of a button. As usual an wonderful experience flying Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Superb in crisis I was taken ill and was very uncomfortable during the flight. The crew reassured me and arranged for me to be met by ground staff as soon as the flight landed. The staff then rushed me through immigration, helped with my baggage and took me quickly to the medical centre at the airport. They were willing to wait, but at that point, a friend who had been contacted came in and I insisted that they return to work. It was all very reassuring and just the kind of response one expects - and gets - from Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Delhi via Singapore. Check in fast and swift, and a good Lounge in Melbourne. A333 from MEL to SIN departed on time, and had plenty of room to spread around as flight was relatively empty. IFE good. Did not eat on this flight and cannot comment on food. Singapore lounge in Terminal 2 so so, and looks more like a canteen. SIN to DEL red eye operated by a Boeing 777-200 which was refitted. Packed flight and crew not as good. Food and IFE average. Not bad flights but won't say they were very good either.
label: neutral

text: Its a 5 star airline The crew is very attentive, good service, tasty food, latest in-flight entertainment systems. Additional perks if flying through Singapore is the free city tour and 20$ coupon to shop at Changi airport
label: positive

text: I need a REFUND!!!! Urgent horrible service, and I need my money back!! I would a zero if i could but I have to put at least a one star. I would put like a negative 100 if I could. Make sure you do not travel with this airline if your passport expiration date is near. I had 13 days left until passport expiration date ends and they not supposed to sell me the flight but they did. On top they did not check that I had less days left, and let me on the flight. Terribile check in service, what are they stupid enough to not check my passport and let me fly to Germany. I went to Germany and when I arrived, the federal police came and brought me to the police station because my passport date was going to end. Because of the airline not checking and warning me I waited at the police station for about 7 or 8 hours. And the trip got canceled and I had to pay for my flight back! This is unfair they were supposed to send me back not make me pay another $850 dollars! I want my money back! If you don't want to end up canceling your trip and ending up at a police station!
label: negative

text: Best Airline 2018 I flew round trip from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to Zurich, Switzerland because I got a good promo deal. I was so impressed that this year I decided to fly to Italy again on SIA. It was a bit pricey (compared with a few other airlines) because I went during peak and also it was a weekend flight. It was worth it! Flight schedule suited me. I flew to Milan first, then went to Florence and Venice by trains. Embarked on a cruise from Venice which ended in Rome. Flew out of Italy from Rome. Even though I flew economy class, the seats were wide enough and spacious leg room. Service was good. There is an "in between meals" snack menu so I was never hungry. Anytime throughout the flight, you can ask for sandwiches, biscuits, nuts, chips, apples or instant noodles.
label: positive

text: Relaxing trip All airlines should follow the customer service provided by Singapore Airlines, I enjoyed the whole flight service was impeccable.
label: positive

text: Comfy The flight from Singapore to Melbourne was very pleasant. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Probably the most friendliest and helpful airline staff I’ve ever travelled with (compared to our Australian airlines who don’t care about Customer service). The food was good and presentable. I wasn’t entirely impressed with the entertainment offered on the plane. The movies were old, not new releases. What happened to the airlines playing new releases like in the late 90s and 2000?
label: positive

text: Most uncomfortable flight experience My flight was terrible. To begin with my seat was broken and couldn’t be moved and the entertainment device was broken as well. My flight of nearly 8 hours was spent looking blankly into space, seated in the same position. I had severe back pain upon arrival as a result for the next couple of days. When I informed the crew, first the steward said I will be compensated with a voucher and asked me to choose what I like from the duty free catalog. When I did choose a product that would be useful for me, I was told by the air hostess that my voucher is only for $75 Singapore dollars and the rest will have to be paid by me! I informed them I don’t need their $75 voucher and that I will make a formal complaint about the plane’s defects.
