After my return I did make the complaint and they got back to me saying that another travel voucher of AU$200 will be issued to be used in my next flight with Singapore airlines. But the worst part was they lied and said I was offered another seat but I had declined saying I wanted to be seated next to my husband. This was an outrageous lie. At no point did they offer me another seat. This is very concerning. You can’t trust an airline company that lies like this. I would urge everyone flying in SQ next time, to either video any exchange with the crew in situations like this or get it in writing. After discussing with my husband, I informed them that I would not be flying with them in the near future so they can give me a cash voucher. But I still haven’t heard from them. Even a budget airline would have been more comfortable than this flight. But the greatest worry is their dishonesty.
label: negative

text: The best! We booked the tickets back from Koh Samui to Bali with Singapore airlines and it was amazing and convenient experiences ever. Super top friendly, attentive stewardess. The food was delicious. One of the best airlines
label: positive

text: Very good airline Flew London to Manila rerun as family of 4.All flights on time,food and drinks good,great entertainment options,free wifi which worked some of the time,staff give good service,leg room ok,Singapore good stopoff airport ,all in all a very good airline
label: positive

text: Once a great airlines, now its a pity to travel in Singapore Air I travelled from Bombay to Singapore on 16th June and then returned on 27th June. The standards of the Service and food are deteriorating day by day. What I observed that they are doing their 'allotted job' nicely but if you want them to come in-between, their Service becomes poor. They do their normal job well but are in so much hurry to 'complete' it that they forget special requests( like extra quilt/pillow/hot water to drink etc). One has to remind them repeatedly. This wasn't the case earlier. I have now decided to try other alternate airlines. Even my children staying in Singapore have same opinion. I will encourage others to try them for other than routine services and give their ratings/reviews.
label: neutral

text: Best airline Love this airline. Level of cleanisess is superb. Good quality food and service. Best thing they even serve snacks 😊 I would highly recommend Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: KIX-SIN-KIX. A333 in both cases. Star AllianceGold check-in perfect in KIX but rather cold no smiles in SIN. Sakura lounge in KIX (poor) so we went to ANA lounge much better. Excellent lounge in SIN. Very comfortable seats on both flights. Better on first leg (row 48 with extra cost exit row extra leg space). Food and drinks at a very nice standard. Service perfect full of smiles. IFE failing on both legs as for many other pax. A serious issue. Luggage quickly delivered. SQ is without any doubt an excellent airline for Economy class.
label: positive

text: Save for Business Class if you can. Absolute heaven. After flying Singapore to Paris in Economy, the sheer luxury of the extra space in Business Class was pronounced. After spending a few complimentary hours in the Singapore Kris Lounge at Heathrow, we were delivered to our boarding gate by buggy and ushered immediately to our seats (more like mini cabins). Champagne & orange juice were available, with drink order for after takeoff taken. Just playing with all of the buttons and gadgets was fun, finding noise-cancelling headphones, a pack of slippers, socks, eyeshades and toothbrush, and a larger screen for watching the inflight entertainment. The best bit, however, is the massive amount of room. No fighting with your neighbour for elbow room, no lack of room for your legs, and of course the whole 'pod' converts to a fully flat bed for a much better chance of sleep. Cushioning in the bed position is rather thin, but better than sitting up for 13 hours. Dinner was served on real plates with real cutlery and glasses and never seemed to stop coming, with each course served individually, not all at once on one tray as happens in economy. Service is provided quietly & competently, with ready assistance to set up the bed. The cabin staff even use your name! Longhaul flights are not fun, but business class makes the experience more enjoyable. We wer not looking forward to the next leg, Singapore to Brisbane, in economy.
label: positive

text: Great airline I have started flying with Singapore as a means for seeing my boyfriend. It is the only flight that gets me from england to Texas without layovers. The meals provided are good and movies, etc are available which is great for the long-haul flight of 10 hours. Makes the flight seem less boring. Theyre a great airline and I always enjoy flying with them!
label: positive

text: Heart warming to see how well they treat the Elderly SQ 222 Sydney to Singapore today. 16 Jan 2024. My elderly mother who is 84 is a bit anxious travelling alone. Linda Tran at check in was an Angel. She was very professional, helpful and reassuring. She made sure everything was taken cared of and even brought my mother to the business class lounge in the wheelchair. The MAAS, meet and assist service is top notch. I would like to congratulate the Singapore Airlines team and SYD Airport for having such an amazing team member. Please congratulate Linda and thank her for us. She definitely went Above and beyond for this elderly lady. You made her day. Singapore Airlines definitely delivered. World Class.
label: positive

text: My return trip Always and awesome experience and the most professional service ever experienced on an airline and the Changi Airport.
label: positive

text: Good experience Check in was fast and friendly. That left us some time to explore the shops at Narita airport. Cabin crew was attentive and polite, and the food quite good. There was a good selection of movies to keep us occupied, and pretty soon, after a six-hour flight we were collecting our luggage and clearing immigration.
label: positive

text: Best flying experience Excellent and friendly service. Paid for extra legroom for 6ft4 husband - worth it for long flight. Only problem on way out was that these seats were near the loos and entrance to staff rest area so disturbed by constant lights switching on and off. On return there was a curtain, which was better, and I requested a sleep mask, which did the trick.
label: positive

text: Makassar to Singapore. It took more time to Check-in since there’s Coronavirus concern in Singapore and they check our passport per pages because we are not allowed to visit or even transit In Singapore if you ever visit China in 14 Days, A little delay for boarding. The flight attendant is nice, the in-flight meal taste great. Singapore - Bangkok: First time using A350-900 and I like it, the aircraft still new and so fresh, The In-flight meal is good. Boarding time is great, on time.
label: positive

text: No meal choice Good service from check in to disembark. Food service not to usual standard. Experienced twice now on recent flights ,no choice of main meal due to running out of popular dish.
label: positive

text: Best of the best! I had an amazing flight from Frankfurt to NY City time with Singapore Airlines for the first time for me. I was so amazed! I have never seen such a big seat... not even in the first class in Emirates. I can fit 4x times in this seat! :-D About the service.... no words needed! 10 from 10. Also very tasty food ( I had prawns). Now I do understand why the Singapore Airlines are voted for the best airlines in the world.
label: positive

text: Courteous and helpful staff I was travelling with my wife who was on wheel chair assistance. The staff was very helpful and made us comfortable even with our cabin luggage. The cabin service was great.
label: positive

text: More Loos needed!!! Returning from Europe trip, so review actually applies to 4 flights. Premium economy isn't much of an upgrade on regular economy. Seats hardish, just a bit wider & noise cancelling earphones supplied [though mine was broken when I unwrapped it,] Armrests brick-hard [pins & needles in fingers after 10 mins.] Cabin staff very good and food excellent [apart from rotten apple on outward trip.] Toilet facilities very poor- only 1 toilet each side for Premium Economy & front cabin regular economy . Meant long queues all the time,esp after breakfast when some passengers, despite all the desperate folks behind, took an unreasonable time in there changing clothes & having a wash. Waste bins overflowing 2/3 of the way thru trip.
label: neutral

text: Very efficient and high touch experience We flew Singapore Airlines on SIN-HAN-SIN round-trip (SQ176 on Oct 25, 2019 and SQ175 on Nov 5, 2019). It was a pleasant experience. The whole process from check-in, to baggage transfers to final delivery of baggage were timely. The flights themselves were timely as well. We were given hot towels soon after boarding. Our pre-ordered special request vegetarian meals were served fresh and hot. The leg room was very good, and the seats were comfortable. In-flight service was top notch. Nothing else that we could ask for from an airline! Singapore Airlines has always been one of our preferred airline while booking our trips, and will continue to do so after our recent experience. Keep up the good work, team at Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Exemplary Singapore Airlines was a fabulous flight, as far as I am concerned. The service was excellent with attentive and professional staff unlike a well known British Airline - the last three flights on which left us all feeling like we had been shot down.
label: positive

text: A most enjoyable plane ride We are grateful we chose Singapore for our flights on this holiday as we found the staff to be fantastic and very accommodating to our needs. Our comfort on such a long journey was important and that is why we chose business class. Being able to lay down (in a fashion) was helpful to our trip.
label: positive

text: Pleasant Respite After A Work Week Away Always pleasant to be served by a caring crew and friendly faces after a tough work week. Food was fantastic and crew was always attentive
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Adelaide - June 2019 Exceptional attention from cabin crew. The Flight was not full so the extra row of seats made comfort 'squeezy'.
label: positive

text: great flight with Singapore Airlines Premium economy was a great pleasure. Very good seats, good drinks, nice personell, the food was delicious.
label: positive

text: Great flights with SIngapore! We were on an A380 and were seated up the top in economy which was great. Had a short stop over from Melbourne to Mumbai in Singapore and both flights departed on time and arrived early. Staff were great - would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Fly high in style A wonderful journey from Singapore to Brisbane. The inflight meals and entrainment was great. The staff was very friendly and also addressed our needs. The flight landed before time and the overall experience was delightful. The business class lounge had a selection of meals that ranged from various dietary requirements to various cuisines. The seating in the A350 was phenomenal and caters to some lounging time followed by a good nights sleep.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines consistently fantastic! Singapore airlines always seem to provide Fantastic service. And I love premium economy the food is always good and the legroom is great as I’m quite tall.
label: positive

text: Singapore to San Francisco. I have an email with my itinerary showing the flight is from Singapore to San Francisco. There are no words about a 1hr 30 mins stop in Hong Kong. Only today I realized the flight is through Hong Kong. If I had known that, I wouldn't choose this company at all. The agent was surprised to see my itinerary as it clearly shows this is a direct flight.
label: negative

text: Excellent services Had booked premium economy tickets on Singapore Airlines At the Delhi airport they upgraded me and my family to business class Excellent service Food can be improved Baggage claim was very fast no waste of time Overall a very good experience Highly recommended Wish my family and I get an upgrade tomorrow on our flight back home 😊😊 Gitanjali kapoor
label: positive

text: As always great new planes, friendly service, lots of legroom. On time every time, staff extremely helpful, and even in economy food very good. We will always where possible fly Singapore Airlines. Thank you you are a big part of our holidays.
label: positive

text: Top class flight Always use Singapore Airlines and Jet Star (affiliated to Singapore Airlines) The crew are so attentive, very pleasant and friendly. The choice of food first and plenty of snacks if required. I travel economy class but always pay the little bit extra to get the extra leg room we’ll worth the money.
label: positive

text: Best airline This flight and the return were easily the best I've ever had. I'm not even going to bother going into detail, because everything was pretty much perfect, right down to the quality of food/snacks and range of entertainment. I suppose I did go into a bit of detail in the end. Obviously couldn't help myself.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines is very good On February 22, 2020 we flew from Hanoi to Singapore and from Singapore to Amsterdam with Singapore airlines. Nothing great can be said on Singapore airlines. They fly with good equipment. Good pilots (4 flights). The staff is nice, very friendly and willing to help. The TV screen is, considering the economy class, fine, with a very extensive choice. The food is excellent. There is a disadvantage. At the back of the plane there is a chance that you cannot get the meal you were hoping for. With a lot of demand from the predecessors there is a considerable chance that you have to choose something else. The space between the front seats is considerable compared to other airlines. The width of the seats is reasonable for a normal posture.
label: positive

text: Journey to Southeast Asia I have heard a lot of positive things about Singapore Airlines, with regard to how highly rated the air carrier is, over the years. I can see why, and what all the praise is all about. Check-in was pretty quick, in spite of being a party of seven people. Service onboard was good, as was the in-flight entertainment. All-round, it was an enjoyable journey. My only criticisms would be that seat comfort was average and legroom was a bit tight, even for an aisle seat, but that's something I experience quite frequently, whenever I travel by air. I also found that the food wasn't all that appealing as far as flavor goes, but props to them, for recognizing how taste is affected by air travel, and crafting the food to seal in flavor, for when it's served mid-fight. In all, I like Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: An airlines that never dissapoint us Nice food served, air crew very accomodative, asked for extra coke and pepsi for collections. And thet gave me extra peanuts too.. i just love the peanuts, thanks guys
label: positive

text: Still the best Singapore Airline is still the best airline, although not quite as good as a year ago.. Using Premium Economy provides a much easier overall flight experience, from priority check-in and baggage handling, to slightly extra personal space in the seat (which makes all the difference) and priority meal service.On this particular flight we found the cabin crew service very slightly disjointed and it struck us the cabin crew had not yet melded into a top team. However, overall the experience was that Singapore Airlines still provides a relaxing flight so sit back and enjoy!
label: positive

text: Horrible, Never flying with Singapore Air Lines again When you pay extra to fly Business Class, you expect more than a horrible curry. I asked for some crackers/biscuits as I did not want to eat curry, They refused to provide anything other than the meal they said is available. I am a frequent traveler and no air line has ever refused to provide me a light snack/crackers in lieu of a main meal. Secondly the toilets were a mess. And to top it all, their baggage handlers ripped open my bag and helped themselves to some valuables. Compensation offered by Singapore Airlines does not even pay for a pair of socks! I now fly with Emirates - what a wonderful Airline Emirates is...... there's a variety of food, something for everyone. Service is wonderful and the toilets get cleaned on a regular basis. SINGAPORE AIRLINES...... WHAT A HORRIBLE WAY TO FLY.
label: negative

text: Excellent Excellent service all the way, picked up associate airline Silk in Singapore for onward carriage to Siem Reap. Quite a bit of rain so some minor, less than thirty minute, delays. I got to Siem Reap, but my luggage didn't. Filled in some forms and told should be delivered to my hotel by 11:00am maybe 2:00pm next day. 1:00pm, knock at the door: luggage. And the courier informed me that was entitled to $100US for my inconvenience. Paid in cash, on the spot. It was no big deal for me, but travelling with kids, moving on the next day? That all our corporate citizens took their responsibilities so seriously. Putting a set of clean jocks a tshirt and toothbrush in my hand luggage from now on.
label: positive

text: The best...as always 14 hours on a plane is not something to look forward to. Though rarely flying that way, Singapore Airlines has always been our only carrier. From stepping across the threshold into the plane, one is pampered..even in Economy. The attendants are so wonderful, always smiling and glide around like the Ballet Rambert. The meals were great..mild S Easter Asian food. Drinks are free with meals, and every 20 minutes ir so they came around with water/ orange juice. The video/ audio system is of a very high quality and 4 films later we were landing in Singapore. The return flight was equally pleasant.
label: positive

text: I miss the pre-pandemic Singapore Airlines. I have flown with them on a regular basis for decades and am disappointed at how bad the first flight I took with them since the pandemic was. My flight was purchased from Air Canada and AC is the first marketing carrier as per US DOT rules. AC is also the most significant carrier. I have clearly researched my baggage allocation prior to the trip and packed appropriately. Unfortunately, the SIA check in staff were clearly unaware of their own company's baggage policy (see pictures below) and refused to allow me to check my three bags. I had to repack my bags at the airport, which is both embarrassing and a complete hassle. I have never had to do this in my decades of leisure and business travel. I will definitely think twice before taking a flight with SIA again in the future.
label: negative

text: Wonderful Flight Experience My wife and I flew Singapore Airlines from the U.S.A. all the way to Thailand - a total of 19 hours of flying - and we couldn't have chosen better! The seats are comfortable, the attendants are excellent, the in-flight entertainment options are plentiful, and the baggage check was a breeze. During one part of our trip, we were running extremely late to the airport. Singapore Airlines helped us rush through security and check-in to make our flight in 20 minutes! They truly care about customer service and we look forward to flying with them again soon.
label: positive

text: SAID TO BE THE BEST? Pretty good all round but not the exceptional experience I was anticipating. Check in etc was superb, comfort was fine and food very good but I found the service provided by the aircraft service crew to be a bit impersonal.
label: positive

text: Long, dark and depressing flight Having flown in business class on the outbound trip, we returned but used Premium Economy. Seats were generally ok as was the general service. As we left Singapore at 2.30am it meant we were flying mostly at night. The flight was about 14 hours long, which we knew and had prepared for. What we did not prepare for was the depressing feeling of the flight as the cabin was ‘dark’ for 12 of those hours. I do not understand why, after 8 hours of fight, the cabin could not be illuminated. Yes, I know you have your own reading lights but it’s not the same. The flight attendants were very good and kept you supplied with water, juice and apples but you just kept looking at the time and thinking how much better it would be if it was lighter. No doubt Singapore Airlines are very good but I am glad we were not in Economy!
label: positive

text: Simply the best Only my second time with SA but they confirmed their position with me as the world's number one airline. Plane, seats, food, staff, entertainment. All perfect.
label: positive

text: Never let me down! Have always flew SQ, excellent service by the crew. Friendly and always smiling. Great in-flight entertainment with lots of choices. Keep it up!
label: positive

text: SQ495 18OCT Dubai Singapore Smooth flight, great cabin crews and high quality service. Wish there're more Asian cuisine option on the Book the Cook.
label: positive

text: Good comfortable flight. I chose a seat at the back of the plane where I had two empty seats next to me! So I was very comfortable and it made an enjoyable flight. My flight was at 11.30am which was also a good time to fly. The service was great, flight attendants were very friendly and hospitable.
label: positive

text: World Class Found a pieces of left over tissue stucked at cup holder and toilet is not well cleaned even before take off. Cabin crews should ensure their service standard horned to them. Overall a pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: San Francisco to Kolkata via Singapore. On my SFO-SIN flight I asked for an extra bread roll/butter at one of the meal times, was given the bread but told ‘sorry, it’s one butter per passenger/tray’!. Then I asked for Chinese tea (instead of what they were taking around) - and was told ‘we don’t have any’. At SFO check-in counter, I stood at the head of the Premium Economy line for 15min as passengers who had come after me were attended to before me. After 3 such times, when I expressed surprise, a lady said I was in the wrong queue for bag drop. I pointed out to her I was not standing for bag drop but check in, after which I was attended to. This was the first time ever that my SQ experience left a bad taste in my mouth, especially given how wonderful it always is, and how warmly I recommend it to everyone specifically for its customer service. It would be very unfortunate if the airline cannot keep up its usual standards.
label: negative

text: Nice singapore airlines SQ8122 We was on board singapore airlines flight SQ8122 from Sydney to Singapore on 12th June 2019. Flight departed smoothly on time with nice take off and landing with good and nice service on board. Very good cabin services staff providing frequent flow of drink and rendered service request promptly with a smile. We enjoyed the flight, thank you and regards.
label: positive

text: Disappointed Did the same flight with Singapore Airlines 12 mths ago and could not fault the service. This trip I was more than disappointed. Seat selection cost almost $200 over two flights. My partner is quite tall and there is no automatic allowances for people who NEED the leg room. Annoying to see short people in the extra spacious seating. The meals/snacks combinations were odd. For example: A bread roll,jam, muffin and some fruit for breakfast. Sleep was impossible as the seating room was squeezy, and I'm of average size. The person in the seat in front had their chair right back, even on take off, so my screen was in my face which forced me to put my chair back. Based on my previous flight I had highly recommended Singapore Airlines but will most likely not going forward.
label: neutral

text: Too cramped On the flight to Singapore from Adelaide we had more leg room. The return flight we felt like sardines. Even had to sit with legs in the aisle as they couldn't fit in the seating area. Very bad for everyone's health. Have travelled with Singapore for years but this was the worst flight ever. New seats in plane - terrible for an overnight flight. Rethinking our airline for next trip.
label: neutral

text: 737Max 8 is excellent The 737Max 8 was a excellent aircraft with very spacious legroom. It quite and stable. And is safe. Only that the food is served in a tub which looks very unrepresentable and like a junk food.
label: positive

text: Perth-Singapore-Rome and return. Have been flying with SQ on and off for the over 20 years. Still the best airline to travel with. A true 5 star performer which has withstood the test of time.
label: positive

text: UK/France trip All round great service and comfort. Slept well, flat beds comfortable with great bedding. Doona fresh pillow etc. Lounge in Singapore a little disappointing. Heathrow and Sydney lounges much better. Food, wine and drinks all very good. Movie selection not brilliant, but I am a fussy movie goer.
label: positive

text: Sydney - Singapore - Amsterdam Premium economy from Sydney to Singapore was well worth the extra money. The seats and leg room were very comfortable. The TV screens are larger and the offer headphones which alleviate plane noise. The food was OK and it was good to be able to order before hand. The change over at Singapore Changi airport is one of the easiest I have experienced. No need to go through a transfer station. I went economy from Singapore to Amsterdam and really wished I could be back in Premium. But on the whole I always enjoy travelling with Singapore airlines as the service is always great. Wish I could say the same about the food. But when is plane food exceptional anyway.
label: positive

text: Not sure if convenience beats timing With Canberra only served by Singapore and Qatar Airlines, we opted for the Canberra to Tokyo out and Osaka to Canberra back flights on Singapore. The latter meant flying out of Osaka close to midnight for a relatively short trip to Singapore where we arrived just after 4am. Then a long wait, albeit in the Business lounge, for our 10:30am flight to Canberra via Sydney and a hour transit in Sydney. Accordingly it took just on 22 hours from leaving Osaka till we arrived in Canberra and we started to question whether the benefits of 15 minutes to get through customs, luggage arrival and quarantine were worth the long trip. Singapore Business Class was delightful, the service was superb, the beds were great, the food and wine was excellent and we could not fault the flight except for the pretty ordinary selection of recent movies. Our outbound and inbound flights both occurred in September, further exacerbating the problem of minimal choice of movies to watch. We could have departed from and returned to Sydney and the timing would have been much more convenient but we're not sure after talking to fellowAustralian travellers we toured with whether we would have enjoyed the flights with other airlines. So in this case we think that we made the right choice.
label: positive

text: First class service Yet another first class service from SQ. The whole process from baggage drop off, check-in to alighting in BKK to baggage collection in BKK was smooth. The flight departed on time, arrived in BKK ahead of schedule. Crew were very good and all well looked after. One disappointment was that at the time of booking the aircraft was B787-900 which was later changed to A330-300. Except that everything else was pleasant.
label: positive

text: Great Service, Great food, Entertainment needs improvement Enjoyed the long flight of 17.5hrs from SF to SIN. Service was great, along with quality airline food. Only improvement is their inflight entertainment - there are not a lot of new movies and not many asian selection either.
label: positive

text: Service has gone down tremendously Singapore airlines used to have excellent services. However, recently after the pandemic, the service level has gone down tremendously and it is really frustrating to book a flight.
label: negative

text: Excellent Service in flight. Good Food. Seamless transfers to connecting flight to Borneo Singapore Airlines Airbus A 380 First time on this huge plane Seats good and decent legroom. Meals Good and service very good. Inflight entertainment excellent. We connected with out flight to Kota Kinabalu and return at Singapore Changi Airport and our bags were transfered seamlessly both ways . Our flight to kota Kinabalu borneeo was on A 320 wityh Silkair. Also decent
label: positive

text: Melbourne - Singapore, SQ218, 16 April 2016, 40K. Had a bit of trouble with check-in, I could not check in online due to age restrictions as I'm under 18. If they don't permit me to check in online they should do something to the app because I could check in on my phone's app. Onboard, supper was good, amenities were good and seats were fine. Breakfast was delicious and cabin crews friendly. The IFE in my seat didn't work very well especially for videos. Overall this was a great flight, arrived 1 hour early allowing more leisure time at Changi.
label: positive

text: Poor Service! I decided to fly with Singapore airlines on my return trip from Fiji to Singapore Via Sydney with Singapore Airlines, i had a business class reservation. I choose Singapore airlines as i had used this airline in the same route in the past and was very impressed with the service and the comfort level, however this time my experience was a bit disappointing. I boarded the flight on 9th November, it was a day time flight took off from Sydney at 9 am, when i got to my seat i felt the seat was not cleaned, no headphones, no amenity kit, overall the seat arrangement looked messy. This is not expected from a five star premium airline, I requested for a headphone and amenity bag and they informed me the amenity bag is on request on this flight which i felt very is very wired. even the worst business class airline would provide you with a amenity kit which is basic. they the attendant comes to me with pair of bathroom slippers which is apparently the Singapore airlines amenity kit!!!! i gave up and didn't bother to follow up, many of the flight attendants looked tired as if they had overworked and it just felt like they wanted to somehow finish the service and get it done with. Then came the duty free sales, i wanted to buy a miniature of Singapore airlines for my son, which i asked the attendant (First class cabin attendant) she said she don't have it with her , she will check with her colleague and come back to me. i didn't get any feedback for then next two hours of the flight, then she turns up and says she don't have it after two hours of the flight!! is this what you call an award winning service? OK i could also put up with that, the worst disappointment came when i used the wash rooms in the flight, it was disgustingly unclean!! i used the washroom almost three times during the flight it was the same condition on the entire flight....This was my overall experience on this flight. I wrote this review as its important for your airline to have quality checks to ensure you have a consistent service delivery in your aircraft's, i choose Singapore airlines over any other airline due to my past outstanding experiences with the airline. i really hope you take this review seriously and correct these negative customer experiences. Paul
label: neutral

text: The long haul from Heathrow to Sydney No one enjoys 24 hours flying from the UK to Sydney but the Singapore air crew made it as pleasant as possible with friendly service and regular cups of water. Food was reasonable and the new A380 has a bit more legroom which makes a noticeable difference. A few hours sleep does not prevent jet lag, but helps make you less grumpy.
label: positive

text: Good airline I always enjoy flying Singapore Airlines. Just after boarding you are offered a hot towel. The cabin crew are friendly and efficient. The service and flight is usually pretty smooth from take off to landing. The food, for an airplane meal, is actually pretty good.
label: positive

text: Good flight great service! Singapore Airlines is my airline of choice for long-haul flights to Asia. The service is unbeatable and is worth the occasional extra $$ when compared with other airlines. The stewards and stewardess are always friendly and accommodating. I have never had to ask anyone for help to put my bags up on the overhead compartment on SQ, but on an occasion have had to bear through grimace with some unnamed American airlines. Inflight entertainment is awesome but meals on this flight can be improved as I have had better quality food on long hauls from SF or LA to Asia. Must agree, a little expensive compared to other airlines I've tried, but I rather pay more for a little more comfort through a long journey.
label: positive

text: Business class review I have travelled many times to many countries in SQ flights business class and other airlines business class as well frequently but i dont understand why the route from singapore - india is so much neglected .. on this route specially the business class is so old and not at all comfortable seat .. very very old chairs .. not value for money for a long route flights specially singapore- india segment .. staff is really very good and service is very attentive.. food is good as well
label: neutral

text: One of the best airlines Pros: Modern Boeing aircraft. Comfortable seats. Nice meals. The head Steward even knew my wife’s and my surname as well as that of my two daughters. Clean toilets. Aircraft on time. Pilot communicative with passengers. Good in-flight entertainment with touch viewing screens. I was given an eye mask on request. Very modern terminal in Singapore with a great selection of food and drink. Online check-in available which makes check in at the airport smooth and relatively fast. Cons: The option of checking in online, in Phuket, Thailand (the beginning of our trip to Australia), was sent by email and the check in process was partly in the Thai language. On my phone I did not see an option to create all writing into the English language. – I may have missed this. Singapore airlines is one of the most comfortable and efficient airlines to travel with.
label: positive

text: SQ service SQ service is always more than one can expect. Its promptness, efficiency, consistency and the service level inside the cabin is unimaginable . What ever class one travels SQ service is hard to match . I fly SQ reasonably regularly and find it hard to find fault with the level of service .Its beyond expectation. With a excellent fleet of new aircraft SQ is ahead to its game and is an iconic institution in commercial passenger aviation.
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight on Singapore Airline from Singapore to Bangkok Excellent flight - on time departure, smooth check in and boarding, pleasant in flight service. Courteous and efficient in-flight service.
label: positive

text: Great way to Fly straight to Hokkaido! My family and I took the direct flight from Singapore to Hokkaido Chitose airport, the overnight flight was comfortable and the family was well rested after the flight! The one bug bear for us that the return flight was about an hour longer!
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight was changed from a Scoot to a SA charter. The service was fantastic and the attentiveness of the staff was excellent. Will definitely look closely at SA for ongoing flights if competitive.
label: positive

text: tiny seats noisy plane inedible food every time you leave aust. you have to fly the only direct flight from adel. to singapore is with SIA. Knowing this the plane is full most of the time & so the service, food,seating is not very good. Snearing Singapore Girls would rather be posing than doing their jobs seating is uncomfortable & food a dog could not eat of coarse all specially picked by experts.Thankfully we are only in the air for 6-7 hrs.
label: negative

text: Poor quality of food The service and food were both very average on both this flight and the return flight. Hard to get the attention of staff to get water to stay hydrated. However the seats were roomy and comfortable
label: neutral

text: Premium to Business we Paid for Premium, but as Singapore do not fly into Brisbane with Premium Seats, think that is the reason we where upgraded to Business,,,, loved it,, finally got some sleep
label: positive

text: The way to go Flying from Australia is always going to be a sleepless adventure. Singapore staff make flying as comfortable as possible. The plane an A380 is very comfortable and the flat beds made it possible to land into Paris feeling ok. The entertainment system is good but I always find the system on each plane slightly difficult. The attentive staff and the food are very well presented and tasty. Overall we enjoyed our time in the air.
label: positive

text: Brisbane to Singapore Flew Brisbane to Singapore on Monday 6th May on Airbus A350-900 in economy class. The flight was good, we left on time and arrived on time in Singapore. The staff were attentive and meals just average.
label: positive

text: Fantastic service Frim the time we got on the plane, the service was second to none. Amazing ! Nothing was too much trouble, food was great quality and there was no need to ask for anything - the flight attendants were constantly offering food/snacks/drinks etc. They were friendly, and very professional. Other airlines could learn a lot from Singapore Airlines. If I have a choice, will choose Singapore Airlines everytime.
label: positive

text: Service is unparalleled. Food is very good and served on proper plates with real cutlery. Wide selection of online shopping. Best thing about this flight was the sky bed. The chair unfolds into a flat bed, which gave my son and I some decent sleep. The plane leaves SG just before midnight and arrives in AMS around 6.15am - so even a 12 hour flight seems like no time is wasted. Wifi is available on board but requires payment. The complimentary allowance for business class members is only suited for text messages - runs out fast. Overall, a very comfortable flight. Will definitely fly again.
label: positive

text: Amsterdam to Singapore. Singapore Airlines has the best service. Wide selection of inflight shopping. Food is fantastic. We had satay before our appetizer and it was as close as you can get in a satay stall without charcoal. A good range of new movies with the new month. The best thing about AMS to SG is the skybed, which gave us some decent sleep ahead of arriving in SG. Unfortunately, there was limited stock of sake. I had one and there was none left!! Wifi was good when available - the 30MB gets chewed up very quickly! Nevertheless, this is a fantastic airline and we will definitely fly again as our airline of choice.
label: positive

text: an oK first time experience with Singapore Airlines It was our first time flying with Singapore airlines to Denpasar,Bali via Singapore. We used to fly with another airlines but decide to give The Singapore airlines a try. On the first leg of our flight we flew with SQ 0025 originaly from JFK to Sin via FRA. Our aircraft was A380 and as ussual when we flew A380 we choose to sit in the last row of economy classs we can board the aircraft first. We choose the 60-s row. Our flight was delayed for several minutes not sure for what reasons. The configuration of the A380 SQ is a bit different with other airliens that we ever flew with which was their toilet on back of economy class onlw 2 availables which I find a bit annoying as we always have to stay in line for toilet, compare to other airlines which have at least 4 toilets. The leg room was ok, the Entertainment options on board is ok, but for me personally I would rather have the A380 aircraft that has outside camera view and pilot view on flying routes as in other airlines, which in this SQ 25 A380 not available. The meals was ok, but could be better. The cabin crew friendlieness was not was we expected, knowing Singapore airlines in past years often got an awards for best cabin crew, unfortunately only one or two of the cabin crew esp. in our class that show that genuinely friendliness. However, the flight was smooth, we arrive a tiny bit late from schedule but we are be able to catch our SQ 938 flight to Bali. On our second leg flight to Bali with SQ 939, personally i found it much better, with A330 in economy class, the legroom quite big, we choose the 2 seater seat, which is I recomennded for couple, and hope that the longhaul flight has also the 2 seater seat. The cabin crew in SQ 938 was friendly and helpfull, not quite sure if its because it was only a short flight that affecting the mood of cabin crew but it was better than the our first leg flight. The meals was ok, we've got our brunch and coffee which can be ask to refill. Overall our first experience flying with Singapore Airlines was ok, tho we expecting it to be more than just ok.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable long-haul flight Another great flight with Singapore Airlines. Check-in at Heathrow was uneventful, the flight left on time. I find that the space (for my modest frame at least!) is fine even for long haul. The cabin crew are always smart, polite and attentive and on-board catering is very acceptable.
label: positive

text: On the top of my list. Impeccable service, good food and just a very comfortable flight on this long route and also for the connecting flight to Manila. I will definitely choose this airline again.
label: positive

text: SQ's Dreamliner and latest Economy cabin literally made me smile throughout the flight All along, my main gripe about SQ's Economy class cabin are the seats and even the tray height. For me, SQ's Economy class seats gave very little legroom space. A recent revised cabin design also ended up with dining trays mounted quite low such that it sat on my laps. Very uncomfortable. It was SQ's good services, cabin entertainment system and food that compensated for the uncomfortable seats. Well, good news! I took a return flight in November/December 2018 between Singapore and Nagoya. Both flights used Dreamliners with the new cabin design. They rectified my main grouses! Much more leg room now and dining tray is of the right height. If there could be one slight improvement, I would like a deeper seat to better support the undersides of the thighs. The entertainment system is also new and the food menu seemed to have improved too. On my return trip, although the number of meals served was reduced from two to one, that one meal was really tasty so much so that my son and I wished we could ask for a second serving. Overall, I really enjoyed this new cabin - I smiled throughout both flights. As a matter of fact, I'm itching to try the new cabins for Premium Economy and maybe Business.
label: positive

text: One of the best First time on Singapore airlines could not fault them.first class service good food great entertainment.Would definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Poor Customer Service. Pure awful and with no class. Huge disappointment I flew business class on the SQ23 from NYC to Singapore on Jan 4th. The flight was OK. Singapore air are cheap on wifi offering in business class. They need to learn from KLM/Delta/AirFrance classic hospitality. As for food options, not impressed. They don't offer salads and healthy snacks. They are too fixated on offering large variety of alcohol liquors. Again, they need to benchmark SKY TEAM for first class hospitality !!! The nightmare started when I landed in Singapore. Upon arrival, my luggage did not arrive with me. Upon checking with customer service at the airport, they indicated my luggage was not loaded on the plane in NYC. They said, my luggage was forwarded to LA for next day delivery to Singapore - RED FLAG1. WHY would sing air send it to LA when another flight from NYC will be departing the following day ??. For next 8 days, I daily called the airline to find out the status. Please note, I was calling. No one from sing air called me!. I kept getting the same scripted answer. We are searching for your luggage. Finally, on day #9 my luggage arrived. My suite case was filthy and destroyed. It is like someone dragged along the runway for a long time. The fabric was ripped in 5 spots. Arm handle was broken. When I opened it, beside spoiled goods, I discovered several stolen xmas gift items. I submitted a claim on Jan 14th for spoiled and stolen goods. Till now, March 5th, I am still chasing Singapore airline for compensation with no light at the end of the tunnel. To add insult to injury. Singapore airline, reached out to me regarding the damaged suite case. They said, my 27 inch Samsonite is a fake one - RED FLAG2. Please note, I bought it from Macy's in the USA 20 months ago and only used it 3 times. I replied to Singapore airline and indicated there must be miss understanding. This is genuine. But, they insisted it is a fake Samsonite. I finally gave up and asked them to replace it with identical Fake one - they can buy it from Macy's online. They said NO. They will either give me 180 SGD or American Tourister brand as a replacement. Key takeaway from all of this. Singapore Airline is a fake façade of customer focus and service. Next time I will go back to fly SKY Team (KLM/ Delta / Air France). They are first class airline with genuine customer service focus. BTW, I have never ever had this type of experience with them.
label: negative

text: What else but to travel in Singapore Airlines pleasant travel, food - best!, entertainment is little bit of a concern - they don't have updated latest movies. Airline need to work on that. Friendly cabin crews. We can trust Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Trip to China Smooth flights. Staff friendly and helpful. Food was good. Boarding and disembarking easy no problems.
label: positive

text: Direct Flight to Denspar Short flight with big plane ; service and facilities were excellent; food and entertainment available on flight.
label: positive

text: Jan 30 2015 SQ 517. From check in at Calcutta Airport staff were very professional and also assisted with your questions and as well as the immigration forms for your visit to Singapore. Once on board you experience Singapore Hospitality from the snack and drink service to meal service and also duty free service. The meal was hot and delicious. Wonderful staff seats and PTV. Staff professional and friendly to talk to these days you never get menus on the plane of the choices of what you have for breakfast lunch dinner as well as drinks wines beers etc. I will travel again with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Not like it used to be..... The seats have gotten smaller. Less leg room. I personally think that the choice of the food is very so so - everything seems to be very spicy these days. What happened to the nuts? They have turned into tooth-breaking cracker things! Still.... fares are cheaper and the friendly service has not changed a bit!
label: positive

text: customer service impossible to get in contact with them.I have been trying to call them for a day without success. and no answer to our mail...
label: negative

text: Bravo to SIA!!! My mum and I were on SQ851 from Guangzhou to Singapore on 04-Dec -2019 and although she was on wheelchair, we had no problem at all from the time we were at the boarding gate. She was well taken care of by the boarding gate staff and especially throughout the journey by the cabin crew. SIA is definitely my preferred airline!
label: positive

text: I like Singapore Airlines It's not a long flight and I like it a lot, specially when checking in, boarding and landing too. It was my first time and will fly again with Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: San Francisco to Singapore via Hong Kong. I was pleased with the smooth service of Singapore Airlines. Ground service in SFO was very friendly and tackled our problems efficiently. Aboard the plane, the flight attendants were very kind and cooperative. Cabin and seat features were very convenient and modern. The food was spectacular and movie choices were in a vast range. A blanket and pillow were provided even for a 3 hrs 50 min day flight from HKG to SIN. Overall, Singapore Airlines definitely brightened my trip to Singapore. (SIN airport was also grand and beautiful!)
label: positive

text: Long Q to check in Very bad expeirence for flight check in at baiyun airport! It took one hour plus to Q. Only 5 counters for economy class and 2 for business class. Lousy, no more SQ in my life!
label: negative

text: Excellent service The cabin crew was very customer oriented. Very convenient flight. A380. Food was excellent. We were very comfortable. But their boarding procedures at the gate was real messy. Always it is better to get a seat in the front zones.
label: positive

text: SQ 517 I travelled to Singapore by the latest A350-900. It was a pleasure travelling by that aircraft. The interactive screen for entertainment was something different from the ones one generally find in other aircraft. Food was as usual good with good variety of drinks. Being a late night flight supper was served which was filling. I had Continental.
label: positive

text: Feeling at home Over the last few months, I have been flying on the OneWorld Alliance network to Europe and East Asia purely on cost effectiveness basis. For this trip to London in the last week of September 2018, I decided to go with Singapore Airlines. There is a world of difference in the level of service. I take this down mainly to familiarity brought about by the highly personalised level of service and the quality of the food served. First - the crew were exceptional. They were very professional and yet very personalised in their service - attentive to our needs and ensuring that we were all well taken care of. In particular, the crew in our cabin, namely Syamsiah, Khai Lee, Eu Jia and Uma. They made us feel at home and comfortable. For a 13 hour flight - that makes a huge difference. Second - the quality of the food served was very high. I had a fave of mine - Nasi Lemak - as my Muslim meal choice. It was tasty and perhaps I dare to say even better than some I have tasted at the hawker stalls in Singapore. Overall, the experience was a very welcoming one. Although I had to pay almost the equivalent for a business class seat on a OneWorld alliance flight, the Premium Economy service and seats were excellent.
label: positive

text: Dissapointing Service Disappointed with SQ ground service. I accidently left my water bottle at SQ 956 seat number 17A on August 2. I have reported the case directly online with case number SQFP030823039727 after several attempts to contact the SQ customer service LA/SING/JKT. Today August 12th, 10 days after, no one following up my case, no email, no phone call, no nothing!! what ashamed
label: negative

text: Australia and back. 4 really comfortable flights to and from Australia , 2 X 13 hours and 2 X 5 hours. New Silkair from Singapore to Cairns route is good on a very new and comfortable plane. All you would expect service wise from Singapore airlines where nothing Is to much trouble . We did fly business class and would definitely do so again, as it was so worth the cost for the comfort and service we got. Sometimes spooling yourself on a very long haul flight is very worthwhile . Suziev
label: positive

text: Travel for a tradeshow business class has gargantuan bucket seats. service is impeccable, i'd have to say this is one of the top airlines for service/comfort and luxury.
label: positive

text: Nothing special When checking in for our flight the agent wanted us to check our hang-up bag. After some pleading they let us take it to the gate and said it might have to be gate checked. Never had this issue with United Airlines. There was no pre-ck line at the airport even though it’s marked on the boarding pass. The airline makes no effort to work with airport authorities on providing special handling of business class passengers. For the flight itself we were not impressed. Asked for 2 different wines that were on the menu and they said they did not have them. When we travel business class on other airlines I’ve never arrived hungry. We did with Singapore Airlines. You have to ask for any food or drinks on the second half of the 16 hr. flight. When we host a party our guess don’t have to ask for there needs. Didn’t feel like Singapore Airlines are good hosts. When using lavatories we had to wait. When we arrived in Singapore our bags were the last to come out even though our bags had priority tags. When we left the airport we looked at each other and both thought how could Singapore Airlines be voted the world’s best airline. 🤷 ♂️
label: negative

text: Rip Off Pay 3 times more for Less. We are in Rome organising to return shortly to Australia. We have 2 choices - to spend the remaining 2 of weeks in Rome or go to Germany for 2 weeks. So I did some research on airfares. Checked online with Singapore Airlines: Rome - Frankfurt - Singapore 945.00 Euro Frankfurt - Singapore 2700 Euro. That cannot be right!! 3 times more for less??!! The Frankfurt - Singapore was the same flight on the same day in both examples - 26 March flight SQ325, so I rang Singapore Airlines. After much discussion with the operator without a suitable explanation, other than "that is what is in the system", I asked to speak to a supervisor as it didn't make sense. The supervisor said the pricing was correct as they have different pricing schedules for different markets. Italians wont pay as much as the Germans. I said "Can I buy a Rome - Frankfurt - Singapore ticket and only use the Frankfurt - Singapore leg?" No! the ticket is void if I don't get on in Rome. Checked with Lufthansa (Germany's own airline) and the same result. Talk about ripping off your customers!! We have now booked with another carrier as we cannot trust Singapore or Lufthansa - how can we trust the other carrier?? - ignorance is bliss.
label: negative

text: SQ soars above the others. From Check in on 24 Jan 2019 to boarding and service on board the aircraft from Sydney Australia to Chennai via Singapore was great. Food and entertainment on board was really good. Our 2 and1/2hr stopover at Changi was smooth. The SQ529 from SIN to MAA was again spotless and on time. Our return flights on 06 Feb 2019 was again flawless and smooth. Its any wonder that Singapore airlines keep getting awarded the airline of the year and Changi airport for its eco friendly and spotless terminals. Keep going SQ, will travel again next year with you.
label: positive

text: Time to Fly Traveled back on Airbus A380- the legroom was great. Both husband and myself are near the 6 foot mark and the seats were not sitting on the knees. The staff were great and the service was fantastic.
label: positive

text: Brilliant airline - just need to get the temperature right on the planes Singapore is definitely the best airline we have travelled with, I just wish they could get the temperatures consistent. The first part of this flight from London was freezing - and I know planes are cold so had on several layers but this was uncomfortable. Then Singapore to Perth was so warm I had to strip down and was still not comfortable. But otherwise the flight was great (well as good as a long uncomfortable flight can be), service is always with a smile and everything went according to plan.
label: positive

text: Lounge in Brisbane had been "refreshed" since my last visit and looked more pleasant. Had booked a centre seat on 777 as travelling alone and had checked in on line but reallocated to an aisle next to another passenger at the window. It is difficult for a fellow passenger to get to the aisle without disturbing you if you are asleep. Cabin was full so could not move. My personal preference if for a herringbone layout when traveling alone. Crew on the leg Brisbane to Singapore were somewhat helpful and friendly, less so on the leg to Delhi but both were OK. I asked for a water on board when in the air after having left Brisbane but was told by the crew member that they were going to a "briefing" and I would need to wait. It arrived 20 minutes later. Sleeping on both legs was a bit challenging given that the beds are not flat and you do get used to them being so on other carriers. On the 777 the passenger beside me woke me twice trying to get to the bathroom. Asking for help with the A380 bed was met an explanation of how to do and that it was easy rather that actual help and I had to go back to ask again. Entertainment OK but had to rewind to get to the start of the movie and it "dropped out" twice on the 777. Sadly, food was not great, my special meal is almost always the same on SG and was overcooked this time. Coffee was good. Wine selection looked good and had a Tattinger and a Chablis with both being very enjoyable. No bubbly offered pre take off on either flight. A380 cabin a bit scuffed around my seat but otherwise interiors were fine. On time arrival and departures. On balance this was my choice to India as Qantas/ Emirates were via Dubai or on a 737 on Jet Airways via Singapore or Air India via Sydney. SG thus offer a good connection and better service than Air India but the flights were not anything special.
label: negative

text: Got sms notification of delayed flight time The flight was delayed due to hiccups of incoming flight. Got notified by SMS. Other than that, it has been satisfactory. Advice: Allow more time to connect flights as there are 3 terminals in Changi airport as it takes quite a while to get to the gate.
label: positive

text: outstanding everything about SQ is outstanding, service, smiles, attention, drinks on demand of any kind, meals are lovely too and the smiles of the crew are always wonderful
label: positive

text: Flight on SQ 212 The flight to Singapore was a pleasant experience. The food was good. The crew was very nice and extremely helpful, smiles all around. However, this good feeling was spoiled on arrival. We pre-booked a wheelchair for my wife to take us through transit, NO wheelchair. The guy who was in charge of this was more concerned serving a group and told us my wife was not on his list. Resulting in a very painful long walk for my wife.
label: positive

text: Checkin in Istanbul fast and efficient. Turkish Airlines lounge just amazing; something SQ could learn from looking at its „upgraded“ new Krisflyer Lounge in Terminal 3 in Singapore. Boarding in Istanbul was well organized. Seat spacious and comfortable. Food decent, but unfortunately no Book the Cook service ex Istanbul. The big negative point of this flight was the service. Painfully slow, but still hectic and robotic. The lunch service took almost 3 hours. It took an hour from the Satay serving till the appetizer was served. No dining on demand like the ME carrier. Out of the 10.5h flight, almost half of the time was spent with meals. What happened to the previously famous Singapore girl? SQ service does not have the perfection of Qatar, nor the efficiency of LH. Krisflyer lounge in Singapore was so crowded that I left after a while. Shorter flight from Singapore to BKK was uneventful, with a faster service, but still robotic impersonal service.
label: negative

text: The most professional and friendly staff from desk to flight attendants The most professional and friendly staff from desk to flight attendants. They go out of their way to make every passenger feel comfortable and happy. The airplane was spotlessly clean, the food was fantastic and the in-flight entertainment has plenty of options for everyone.
label: positive

text: Need to provide equal service The stewardess was giving all the attention to the westerner sitting next to me. I have to wave to get food and drink ...even my neighbour had to remind them that I was not serve.
label: neutral

text: very good good wide seats with the always exceptional signature singapore airline service. however the plane was very worn and in desperate need if updating.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines 787-10 economy the Singapore Airlines 787-10 economy is modern quiet comfortable aircraft with only 2 classes. Business and economy. On this trip I flew economy and the cabin is in a 3-3-3 layout 2 isle layout. Being a Gold member with an affiliate airline I was able to use the business check in and I had priority boarding. The economy seats are designed by RECARO and have a six-way adjustable headrest with adjustable wings to provide more neck support. However teh seats themselves are a tad narrower than the same design which you will find on the A350-900 and the newer A380's. Power sockets can also be found in-between the seats, and in the back of the seat in front of you there is also a folding table a new updated IFE system and a USB port and a cup holder for your drinks. The aircraft a modern and the Dreamliner offers a very quiet inflight experience and Singapore Airlines as usual offer very good in flight cabin service. I would recommend their economy product as its comfortable and clean and it was an enjoyable experience Singapore Airlines has switched to the earbuds instead of those crappy sounding over-ear headphones.
label: positive

text: Flight to Australia We took Singapore - Airlines to go to Perth in Australia via Singapore. On our way back (two months later in May 2019) we returned from Adelaide also via Singapore to Düsseldorf. We choose Singapore - Airlines as we had the same positive experience in 2018, when we travelled to New Zealand - also via Singapore. The service really is excellent. We didn't find anything better. Drinks are free. Most of the time the stewardesses and stewards are on the way, looking for passengers, which have any wishes.
label: positive

text: Short business trip with bad service I know it's short trip. However cold food with tasted awful - not fresh unacceptable. No headset be given by flight attendant. I feel disappointed with this service.
label: neutral

text: My wife and me were on our holiday trip to USA and taken SQ32 on 31/3 in SIA business Class seat 15D & F. We are happy with the check in and boarding. It was very smooth although there were COVID 19 documents to verify. Crew on board was cheerful and helpful. The soup does not taste peppery at all. This need to improve as Singaporeans will not like this. I had chicken rice and the rice was super nice with the chillie. The chicken could have been better with abit more flavour. The appetizers (salmons & prawns) were nice. Like the cheese and biscuits as well. When we were ask which red wine we would like to have, I’ve chosen the Barrosa red wine because I am familiar with it. At the initial stage suggest that the stewardess could have just recommend one of them since I was indecisive on which red wine to choose from. When I asked about any arrival and custom forms to fill in. A few of the steward and stewardess told us it is now done online but when we arrived the SFO ground staff told us there is no requirement for now to fill out any forms. SIA need to update their cabin crew about this as this was a bit of worry for me as I have not been to USA for 10 years. Not the cabin crew’s fault for this. Overall the cabin crew team on board were cheerful and helpful. We totally enjoy the flight in business class especially my wife as this is her first time in business class and she enjoy the new business class seat a lot as she was I totally worried that she could not sleep but the food down seat converted to bed was comfortable for her to sleep in.
label: positive

text: Best Airlines - Best Experience - Professional Crew. I never miss a chance of flying Singapore Airlines. I feel very safe and comfortable in the flight. The ambience is great. Food is fantastic and portion is sufficient. Broad choice of drinks and very helpful and alert staff. What else does someone ask for.
label: positive

text: Pretty gtood for Economy class Although "she whom must be obeyed" deemed only J class from now on it was agreed that as it was a day flight E would be OK, and, it was in fact part of a HoA package A busy flight full of kids which was dealt with by the crew with a je ne sais pas level of serenity. Seating, legroom, comfort level was excellent with a 3-3-3 config on the A350. I had booked 2 aisle seats online but they ended up as one aisle & one middle ? Very smooth flight except for bouts of turbulence when the trolleys appeared, as usual! Following comments, # starting in the airport itself; confirmed on line & T3 self check in was very smooth with gate C1 shown from T3 on the boarding pass. However, after several enquiries we were told to go to T1 where there is a Gate C1. Not knowing how many Gate C1s there are in this airtropolis we checked again to be told this C1 is in both T1 & T3 ?? # duty free promo requires actual goods invoice to participate when it is in the special bags you only receive at the gate ?? So much for a new Jag ! # meal service was excellent, tasty Nasi Goreng, described as fried rice ?, along with wine etc. # refreshment before landing was appalling, supposed to be a mini chicken & a mini tuna pie/puff. Definitely indigestion inducing, one was incredibly sweet ??, do not know which was which, just took one bite of each & left the rest. Packaging full of blurb about the design, no nutritional analysis, wisely as full of fat/carbs, no best by date, # on finals cabin lights dimmed but not the grating incessant piano "music" which was way too loud, shoot the piano player anyone? # finally, it never ceases to amaze me that after a 7-8 hour flight you have to stack over Warwick, did we just pop up on the radar over Gympie ? Such inefficient airports are exacerbating climate change not to mention losing time & costing $ for extra fuel. When will they get their act together. Immigration was empty & an EK followed us in so why not the slots available ??
label: positive

text: First Suites always good While not perhaps as good as pre Covid, Singapore First Suites remains pretty good! Service is good and of course there is plenty of room in the suite. Food is perhaps not as good as before. The First Class Lounge in SIN was closed so that made for a not so good stopover. These points aside though, it's hard to beat but of course at those prices so it should be!
label: positive

text: Great experience Flying with this airline offers you great choice and experience. The service is top rate and the food is divine.
label: positive

text: Very attentive service I was booked right in front of the toilet and up above is the toilet sign light. When I realised it, I was not very comfortable with it because it is a long flight and might disturb my sleep when guests are walking in and out of the toilet but I didn't say anything to the attendant. The flight attendant realised this and immediately suggested to me that there are some empty seats that I could make myself more comfortable. She showed me to the empty seats and ask if I wanted to change and would do all the arrangements for me. I made the change and was very pleased and thankful to the flight attendants, especially Ms Tseng who saw through all my needs throughout my flight.
label: positive

text: Sydney to Singapore on SQ242, began with very helpful and friendly ground staff in Sydney. The flight was 20 minutes late but flying time made up for the delay and got us in early. Similarly, the 777 was very well maintained and the entertainment was remarkable. Dinner was not up to it's expected standard however the refreshment that was provided prior to landing was excellent and sufficient. The cabin staff did an excellent job and I particularly observed how they take very good care of toddlers.
label: positive

text: 9 years of flying with Singapore Airlines We have an annual trip to Perth Australia and having in the early years tried other Airlines, we now only use Singapore Airlines. The seating in Economy is very generous and comfortable even after 12 hours. The plane is always kept tidy and clean thanks to the deligence of the cabin crew. The food is good with a selection of European and Asian dishes and of course you can choose a dietary need when booking your flight. Wine, beer and spirits is offered as well as soft drinks. This year we did notice that they were not quite so generous as previously. We felt this was a sign of Singapore’s financial situation, never the less if you asked for more it was given without hesitation. Water and juice is regularly bought around to keep you hydrated, which is very important. Checking in process is efficient and as with all of the Singapore Airlines staff are pleasant and helpful. For parents with babies the cabin crew do what they can to help make things easier. Staggered meal times so you both get a hot meal and the heating of bottle or food pouches or jars. The toilet facilities on the plane are spacious and well supplied and maintained. The in flight entertainment is the best that I have come across. Plenty of new release films as well as the old goodies. The music selection I felt was not so good as before, it seemed more limited. One thing that I felt was missing was audio books. These have been deleted from the package. The price structure of Singapore Airlines is good, they are in line with Emirates but cheaper than Virgin, BA and Quantus.
label: positive

text: Two excellent flights this time! My previous experience three weeks earlier was a little bit disappointing (BOM-SIN-BKK), however, there were two excellent flights this time: SQ707 BKK-SIN on 26 July and SIN-BOM 31 July. The crew on the SQ707 on 26 July were exceptional (IFM Geradine, LSS Jane, FSS Gift, FSS Moon & FS Arif), wanted to get their names since great and dedicated work must be recognized. As already said, superb crews on both flights, excellent lunch/dinner, and flights on-time. The only gripe is that I don't seem to get a comfortable position on the B777-300ER: the angled position is quite awkward and my back hurts after two hours - prefer the A350 over the B777-300ER. This, of course, is a matter of personal taste only.
label: positive

text: Flew economy on Singapore to Kuala Lumpur return this week. By chance, both flights used the new A350-900 fleet. For such short route, I guess it's partly to test the new planes. Not too bad an experience on the new planes. Smooth, steady and quiet in the air, a beautiful looking plane especially the signature long and curvy wings and rather cool batman-looking cockpit window. Leg space is larger than other economy class. Noisy wheel box and luggage compartment mechanisms (on both flights so it's not a coincidence). Insufficient aisle clearance as you pass through premium economy cabin so we had to literally hand carry our hand carry luggages at that stretch of the aisle. Noticed that cabin crew was struggling to find space to put hand carry bags into the overhead compartments. Other than the beautiful outlook and smooth cruise in the air, the interior comfort falls short of expectations.
label: positive

text: SQ 638 Private room service is good. They also serve Dom here. Food is below average. Almost every dish I ordered is prepared in advance and heat to serve. Suite on A380 although old configuration is still good. Service onboard the plane is excellent. Cabin crew are just great. They serve Dom and Krug on board, which is very good. Food is horrible. I had the Japanese selection and is worst than my USD 10 bento set from a supermarket in Tokyo.
label: negative

text: Great staff on board, good food and generous drinks Staff on board were friendly, efficient and absolutely professional on all four legs of our journey. The food was very good to exceptional (inflight meals as well as oriental vego and seafood options). Very generous with drinks. Inflight entertainment was okay and better than past experience. Economy seats are getting smaller (is that possible?). We were fortunate to be surrounded by very considerate passengers who only partially inclined their seats so the longest leg (5 1/2 hours) was comfortable enough. Check in and boarding at Hanoi end was a bit chaotic. Our only complaint is the ground staff when departing Perth who didn't know the rules for carrying liquids in hand luggage and insisted we check a bag in. She was adamant that she was right and refused to check for us. We didn't hold our ground because we didn't want to hold up other passengers. We checked with Singapore later and she was wrong!
label: positive

text: Excellent and professional service Took SIA in 25th November from SG to HAN. The flight was smooth and crews on boards were patient in serving and cater to all of our needs. The food and drinks served were good and satisfying enough to last our flight! Our huge appreciation and sincere thanks to all of crews!
label: positive

text: Great Service I’ve finally gotten the chance to try Singapore Airlines. Singapore Airlines use terminal 3 of the Ninoy Aquino International Airport. After checking in and passing through immigration, you can go to the lounge on the 3rd floor. It was quiet when I went there. Maybe because I had an early flight. The gate was close to the lounge. For this particular flight, we had a B787 “Dreamliner”. The business class seats were arranged in a 1-2-1 layout (aisle access for all seats). Seats were nice and spacious. Flat bed! Charging docks for your electronic devices. Big TV (touch) screen with a remote control. Food and service were good. The flight from Manila to Singapore was quick (3 hours).
label: positive

text: Singapore to San Francisco via Hong Kong. Worst flight ever. I paid for an extra legroom seat 41c. This seat is supposedly bulkhead but it isn't. This is an isle seat which has the isle for the cabin directly in front of it. This means that the food trolley has to make a 45 degree turn into your cabin thereby making you move or be hit by the trolley every time. In fact they slammed the trolley into the arm of my chair every pass. You can only sleep if you encroach into the middle seat and cross your legs which we all know is a health hazard. The crew just grinned each time I was jarred awake. Only once did they say sorry. I complained and the airline said sorry it hasn't been an issue before. Most airline these days have a good movie selection, not this one. Food was awful. Glad we had our own water as they hardly bring any around. I know this is a long flight but the crew were terrible.
label: negative

text: A very comfortable flight We flew premium economy for the first time and although pricy found the comfort on the long flight worth it. I am quite tall and found the extra leg room allowed me to sleep far longer than previously. We felt Singapore Airline staff were most attentive and helped us to enjoy our long flight . We were sorry that the chrisflyer points get cancelled after 3 years making it difficult for us to save enough points to make their use worthwhile.
label: positive

text: Flight from Singapore to Adelaide The cabin service is good with attentive cabin crew. The onboard entertainment was excellent. Food is reasonably good too.
label: positive

text: The worlds best The cabin staff are excellent, they constantly bring water,orange juice around, nothing is too much trouble. The seats are more spacious and you don’t feel cramped. The food is very good and the assortment on your tray, there is something for everyone. I had a very good diabetes meal, with plenty to eat. In all, we had an excellent return trip. The check ins are excellent too and very easy.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines has impressed me on the Singapore-Sydney route for the first time. It is evident that the morning flights are much better than the night time flights. As SQ 211 departed, a great lunch was served followed by multiple drink rounds before a mini pizza prior to landing, which compares well against the red eye SQ221 and 231. The staff were quite courteous with the exception of one cabin crew member, the rest were extremely pleasant. Specially the leading crew in charge was particularly friendly. Flight landed ahead of schedule and all in all, I couldn't fault the service.
label: positive

text: MEL-SIN return. Usually travel Business Class but tried Economy on this short trip. Overall impression was pretty good. Both flights were almost full but the crews were friendly and helpful and food service was quite slow but quality of the food was reasonable. Had a strange experience with the inflight entertainment system on both flights an English Language film suddenly lapsed into a version dubbed into some oriental language. Eventually reset by repeated switches out of the video system. Selection of films etc was OK but not comparable to Emirates product. One criticism is that the IFE was switched off 40 minutes before landing on the Singapore leg (A380). On the return trip it was switched off 20 minutes before landing. Seems ungenerous and not my experience on other airlines. A FA on the Melbourne flight also asked me to remove my noise-cancelling headphones for landing - also a new experience! Online check-in was difficult because of website problems but managed it in the end and subsequent check-in at Melbourne was very quick. Unable to check-in online for return trip due to more website problems but the standard check-in system at Changi was just excellent. Better than some Business Class check-in processes in fact.
label: positive

text: After spending a little more on the flight than intended after flying on this return journey with Singapore was happy I did as the overall experience was second to none. The check in at LHR was seamless even with the necessary Covid checks in place and being done efficiently by the check in staff. Boarding the plane I immediately became aware of the "Singapore girl" exceptional customer service the airline is known for. The food service was efficient and rapid and there was a wide selection of other snacks available with a fruit bowl also with crisps etc for during the flight. The flight to Manila was smooth, service was also great even in the smaller less crowded flight. The staff continued to deliver amazing professionalism and attention to detail. The attention to detail became very noticeable on the return flight from Singapore to London. After another comfortable and pro professional flight from Manila I boarded the flight to London and for reasons unknown, my booked seat hadn't been reserved. I was one of the first on, as I prefer to also sit at the back of the plane, and I mentioned it to the cabin crew who immediately took me off the plane, against the flow of oncoming passengers (I was that guy and felt very embarrassed) took me to the ground staff who radioed to the gate to change my boarding pass to an aisle seat which they did without any fuss or questions asked. As I had now moved seats and there are only so many meals in the trolley to cater for the expected number of passengers in each specific areas on the plane, my moving now had to be factored in and to my surprise I overheard once cabin crew day to the other "Mr Taylor has moved from seat 67f to 46h".
