When I left the plane the cabin crew by the door said "Thank you for flying, See you again soon Mr Taylor" Overall Singapore airlines for me is hands down the best and aside from the ground team at Singapore airport the experience was amazing and I will definitely be booking my flights with them again. Hopefully to try out their world class business class.
label: positive

text: Fantastic! Cabin crew were brilliant To start with the usual bits, nice comfy seats, decent leg room for economy, good entertainment (plenty to occupy you for weeks rather than hours) and the food was good. The real wow factor was from our cabin crew: (we got names) Luqman, Eonji, Johaniy, you were brilliant. Liq overheard me make a comment to my wife as we were seating about it being our honeymoon and that was it. We were treated like royalty the entire flight. Lee kept topping us up with complimentary champagne and gave us any extra freebee bits he could get his hands on. The entire crew were attentive the entire flight without being too much. Really friendly, polite and generally very nice people. And although we got the extra bits we saw them looking after every passenger the same way. Amazing airline and amazing service. Thank you, you got our amazing honeymoon off to the perfect start
label: positive

text: Absolutely Outstanding Service & Quality Generally, living in Dubai, I tend to fly Emirates a lot, this was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines and if I can I will not fly a different airline ever again! Granted, I was in Business class so of course that is generally good, but this was by far the best flight I have ever taken! The seats are spacious and comfy, the food was wonderful, the selection of tv entertainment, games and music was awesome but the most incredible thing I would like to mention is about the CREW MEMBERS! Oh they were so fantastic, friendly, attentive, smart, eloquent, polite, helpful, professional but also fun! I had such an amazing flight! We were just treated with such care and attention it was incredible. Amongst those I would like to personally thank from the bottom of my heart are; FSS Shanelle Lo (ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL WOW!) FSS Yong Wen Xin CSS Winnie Teng FS Ho Jin WAI FSS Tan Qui Li FSS Sheera I hope that by writing this they all get the recognition and praise that they deserve, absolutely 10/10. I can not wait to fly with Singapore airlines again in the very near future. On the way back from Japan, I would also like to like FSS Siti Nuraisyah and Binte Sukerman because they looked after us like no other also. ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL THANK YOU VERY VERY VERY MUCH
label: positive

text: A very comfortable and friendly airline I travelled SG airlines for a business trip to Cebu. I very much enjoyed the service, hospitality and inflight entertainment. The flight was on time and has no hassle boarding the flight. The food was also decent with option of vegetarian
label: positive

text: Not really premium Frankly the seat is premium and that is about all. Food is economy with plastic cutlery and cups and plain bad. Comments apply for both outward and inward flights. It is a competitive market out there and I think that SA are relying on their reputation past too much and need to up their game. The A380 is a great aircraft and a preferred choise for us but next year we will not be using SA.
label: negative

text: Not Worth the Price My friend and I had the chance to visit Singapore for the first time and what's best to go there than with Singapore Airlines, right? Well, it could have been very nice given the brand, but I did not have much pleasure aboard as it was very warm inside the plane. I had to use an improvised fan just to cool myself down during the flights from Manila to SG and SG to Manila. At first I thought it's just an isolated case, but to experience it twice could mean something else, right? Anyway, it was good to experience aboard SA.
label: positive

text: Excellent value for money We Hadd flight as you would expect it to be. On time, clean interior of the aircraft, friendly accommodating staff and good meals.
label: positive

text: Not what we were expecting. As this second leg of our trip coincided with my birthday my son treated my wife and I to a First class flight to Melbourne. He had previously flown to the UK in first. And wanted us to experience the high class service he had e perienced. Unfortunately it was not be be. Our seats were 1D and 1F and were spacious and comfortable enough for the 7 hour flight. The on board welcome was up to expectations for first class passenger of which there were only 4. The service was no more than OK, however my Lobster Thermidor book the cook meal was excellent. Not so my wife’s beef which was difficult to cut into. The amenity kit contained creams and lotions plus eye mask, socks and slippers. Value for money not really. We returned this week from Melbourne on Qatar Airways in business class which knocked the spots off Singapore Air’s First class service.
label: neutral

text: Very basic exprience Travelling in the A350-900 economy class was a very basic experience. The seating not that comfortable. The service standards were OK, meals passed the test. Costs not competitive.
label: neutral

text: Absolute failure of cabin crew No one could have anticipated what was going to happen when we came on board. This was SQ226, an afternoon flight from Perth to Singapore on 15 December 2018. Everything was normal, with the fake smiles and pleasantries. Getting to a destination unscathed is becoming less likely. Issue began about an hour or so into the flight. Yes, it had a lot of kids on board and yes, we understand the need to feed the kids first. However, we did not order any kids’ meals though we had an 11-yo and 9-yo travelling with us. We were seated in the middle, four abreast, and at no point did anyone approach us about kids’ meals. So it was a bit surprising when a stewardess came with a meal and stated (not asked if we had, stated) that we had ordered a kids’ meal. We said no, we did not. She then took it back to the galley. That should have been the end of it. Next came a steward. “You ordered a special meal.” “No, we did not”. This was getting weird. But more interesting was the next statement: “Are you in the right seats?” Hang on…….we are 1-1/2 hours into a flight and you ask if we are in the right seats? No, we are actually on the wrong freaking plane. What do you think? Meal was taken back again and this time the Leading Stewardess came out. Here is where it got corrected. The meal was for the family in front of us. Instead of apologising for the inconveniences, she threw us a stinky look. Seriously? If you cannot handle the heat, get out of the kitchen. Later on during the flight, I had to use the washroom. Same LSS bumped into me cause she was backing up with a trolley and once again, no apology. It’s my fault for getting in her way cause it was more important to count the alcohol bottles than service your guest. Service in Singapore Airlines is really going to the dogs and with this type of attitude from the LSS, one can see why. Promotions just because you have been in the job for a particular period of time is what drives down service excellence.
label: negative

text: SINGAPORE-KOLKATA: TOP CLASS SERVICE The flight was delayed by 1 hour 15 min. The airline provided free snacks and printed apology letter to all customers at the boarding gate. This is very rare to found and highly appreciable! Pro: 1. Great attitude of staffs 2. Excellent food quality and beverage options 3. Good timing 4. More than an average quality in-flight entertainment system 5. Check-in and boarding are of top quality due to Singapore Changi airport Con: Nothing really... However, the flight entertainment system could be better and LCD screen quality could be better
label: positive

text: Holiday to England The most amazing airline! Comfortable seats, DELICIOUS food!! But the entertainment system wasn’t very good, barely any shows mainly game shows. But otherwise definitely worth the time spent. Amazing destinations too all around the world!! Definitely 10/10
label: positive

text: Fantastic Service as Usual We have never been disappointed with Singapore Airlines & where possible will always fly with them. The crew were lovely friendly and efficient. The flight was on time, plane was very clean, food very good & up to date movies, They have the best airline lounge by far.
label: positive

text: Travel if you wanna know what is likely to fly with best airline in the World I would like to share my feedback on my recent & first trip With SQ. and why i choose to fly with SQ As per business need in my current organisation all "C" level need to travel frequently so with our corporate travel agent i book SQ as they "Preferred" & from my other team who has ever traveled with SQ they always says It's THE BEST! So I thought personally why not to feel it and see what’s make it best so i discovered promotion at SQ site and decided that's it’s the time where i need to experience, in-spite of long flight i thought i will have more time to explore so I flew. So I travel from Delhi to Bangkok via Singapore and vice versa. Amazing experience overall and what I have heard mostly "Great food" indeed it is and it exceeded my expectations Hindu meal- Non Veg- Best food I have ever had, best in class entertainment options ( i like specially Hindi movies collection from Asain part) although SQ 401 seems a bit outdated to me looking at entertainment options however even though all looks good to me, in lavatory all amenities were perfectly placed majorly i have seen everything and mostly i found clean and tidy too. SQ 978 which we boarded from Singapore to Bangkok was again perfect, cabin crew is happy to help you for everything that one need, i have to mentioned because economy class at times been treated secondary which i didnt felt while travelling with SQ. when I was travelling from Bangkok to Singapore- SQ 975 as seat was not getting adjusted I thought it’s non recliner but flight attended tried to adjust and informed its recliner seat and i was in forward seat zone not sure name Sarifash ( maybe) offered with great smile in case I would like to shift as it was short flight I didn’t wish to move but i could feel empathy! and that's what matter. what i love the most is Airbus 380- 800 SQ 406 while i travailed from Singapore to New Delhi, huge aircraft and i choose to be at upper Deck which was good idea. Meals were served hot all the time and if one has order any special meal they serve first to them then anyone. They kept us servicing water/Drinks so good in case one has long flight. Staff make sure that everyone get equal attention and they nailed it, if one starts travelling with Singapore Airlines would choose only to fly with SQ because it's The best!
label: positive

text: Good airline The service on the flight was amazing but the seats in economy were very small. The entertainment was good and the food was lovely. I would definitely fly with this airline again
label: positive

text: Comfortable airline Reasonable tidy airline with good service and generally friendly air hostesses, though we did provide them with some treats when we entered the aircraft so did expect some more smiles!
label: neutral

text: Anticipating a good experience on this well reputed airline I was not at all disappointed. Flying A380 on LAX- NRT-SIN route the service was consistently good attentive several menu items and literary numerous (more than 400 movies alone) entertainment options; the only discomfort was the temperature somehow SQ insisted on keeping the cabin quite cold. But overall great service and experience.
label: positive

text: how about singapore sling and movies Singapore airlines is the best! its not about the facilities but the service! the crew so helpful, talented,and give amazing hospitality. in my experience this is the best airlines i ever travel with. and don't forget to try Singapore sling to accompany your relaxing time.
label: positive

text: Severe drop in quality. My flight on February 18th shows how bad service has become since I flew with them in 2020. A flight of more than 14 hours. Two meals served of poor quality. One snack in between. I had to go back to the rear to get some water because no answer to the call and found the flight attendants eating. I hardly ever saw an attendant in between meals. Uncomfortable seats. Wi-Fi did not work for me. And this flying from their home base. The Singapore airport is amazing. It deserves a better home airline than what this has become.
label: negative

text: A great way to fly Check in/baggage handling was smooth and expedited as I was late. Seat comfortable but legroom could be better. Great variety of in-flight entertainment. Cabin service polite, professional and attentive. Long flight but cabin crew made us comfortable by walking up and down the aisle serving beverages and snacks multiple times. Turbulence encountered but pilot came on board the sound system to reassure us.
label: positive

text: Poor customer service zero responsibility SIA mischarged my Mileage on Oct 2022, the customer service initially told me will refund back the discharged amount in 3 working days. I have called 8 more times to follow up but every agent told me the same thing, it is still under investigation. Don't even know how to use simple math. 3 months + still under investigation. WHAT A GREAT AIRLINE!
label: negative

text: SQ flight SYD/SIN Flight departed on time but delayed in arriving due to head wind and turbulence. Service on board was good. Good selection of movies. Meals were just so so. On arrival bags came out quickly, as most of the passengers were continuing to Europe.
label: positive

text: A380 not as comfy as the 777-300 Great service again first leg Auckland - Singapore .plane was great layout in business class very good food staff amazing even managed to sleep for a couple of hours . 2nd leg Singapore - London in a Airbus 380 .They appear to have squeezed things the Seats are certainly not as comfy had a sore bum very soon into journey not the case with the 777,bed not as comfy the layout is different far less storage or places to put things .Definately prefer 777 ,having said that staff were great attentive food 1st class made a long journey much more variable a must I think for that distance.
label: positive

text: Singapore Contact Centre Completey usless I have never come across such incopemtent staff. I tried for half a day to change my flight deatils. The lady on the phone did not get I was going to Frankfurt not France and it took them 1 hours to get my payment done, only for them to do it incorrect.
label: negative

text: Ontime all the way, both ways 4 flight round trip from London to Christchurch New Zealand via Singapore. 3 flight with Singapore Airlines and one with Air New Zealand on a code share. All on time. All good service - first choice meals on all. All provided good cabin staff and inflight service with plenty of between meal service options. The entertainment options were extensive catering for all ages with plenty of films music games and TV. E travelled with children who had good food service as well – one child is a fussy eater and the staff made specific sandwiches to cater for his needs. The Air NZ flight was a new aircraft and provided an onscreen order facility between meal services which I suspect will become the norm as they update their fleet. Ground staff at check-in at all 3 airports were equally efficient and professional. I have travelled this route 6 times and the last 3 have been Singapore Airlines/Air New Zealand combinations via Singapore – I will be doing the same again as I consider it great VfM. Well done to both Airlines, your staff are a credit to your companies
label: positive

text: Excellent service unparalleled from saleha I was on April 12 7am flight from sin to bkk and the service was beyond excellent esp from saleha or saleya (sorry I can’t recall) She could anticipate what I wanted Like a mind reader ! Super service unparalleled! And I travel alot on many airlines in j class Thanks so much Pls keep up the great service and that’s what makes sq the world’s TOP airline I’m proud to be a singaporean :)
label: positive

text: Manchest to Davao Return This is a good flight to Davao. Cabin crew are efficient and friendly. The connection fro Frankfurt to Singapore and the return sector was not so comfortable. The seats are pretty uncomfortable. The Silk Air Flights are very comfortable. Overall, I recommend this flight and Singapore Air. I will use it again.
label: positive

text: Disappointed with our Experience We have just returned from our first flights with Singapore. We were very much looking forward to flying with them in view of their recent number 1 rating. However, the service did not meet our expectations. The food was very good, and the cabin crew were really nice, but on both flights we found them to be very disorganised. On our way from UK to Singapore, the first meal came around, and we were asked what we wanted to drink, and both nominated G&T, and the reply was "That will take some time", and she explained they only carried wine with the food and we could have a G&T after all the meals were served. To be fair, we didn't wait long as we were the last to be served. On the way back, the crew were really confused, we had two trolleys serving , and both missed us, they were withdrawing when I pointed out we had no meals. Then they got the drinks wrong, and then the other crew delivered some more, which were different, it was a bit shambolic. However, that was all a bit of human error, and as I said, they were very nice, but the real issue is the entertainment. They were THE most rubbish selection of films we have ever experienced. They had what I would describe as two or three quality films, and the rest were awful. When we fly with Virgin, I watch good film after good film, but on this 14 hour flight, I watched one new film, and another B or C list unknown, and that was it, the rest were unwatchable.
label: neutral

text: Wow. Amazing Experience and Staff First time flying with Singapore and will again given the chance. Business class as good or better than most long haul first class products. I had a special milestone birthday mid-air over the pacific at the international date line and the staff got word of it. They prepared and presented a custom card and cake with lights. I think every flight attendant and officer from the plane stopped by to wish me well. Amazing and unexpected. Kudos!
label: positive

text: Peace Of Mind Flying home to New Zealand from Croatia, via Singapore,we had to stopover in Frankfurt. Originally we were told we would have to collect our baggage and check in again at Frankfurt. When we arrived at Zagreb airport we were given great service and because we were flying to Frankfurt with Lufthansa (a Star Alliance Member) our baggage would be checked right through to Singapore Our journey was enjoyable and stress free. Great service, attentive crew and good food.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines. INDULGING on all!!! Service, food, entertainment, leaving and arriving on time. I can't imagine an airline better than SIA!
label: positive

text: The economy class is standard. No vegetarian meal is offered unless required in advance The economy class is very standardl. The space for each seat is very similar to any airline. Service is correct . Airline agents do their work but nothing else in comparison with other star alliance airline.
label: neutral

text: Moscow to Sydney via Singapore with Singapore Airlines. Our airplane had a technical issue on the Moscow to Singapore (A350 SQ361) leg. Passengers were kept inside of the airplane for 6 hours while the plane remained on the ground in Moscow airport. SQ did not arrange return of passengers back to the terminal. Neither hot meal was served onboard only a pack of chips within 6 hours. Crew provided little and infrequent information. Some passengers panicked and disembarked. We missed our connecting flight to Sydney and had to spend an extra 9 hours waiting for the next flight. As a result of the delay I was supposed to go to work straight from the airport after 38 hours of the prolonged journey. The airline asked me to write a detailed letter describing what happened. I spent my time and did that. In return I received a standard email with apologies.
label: negative

text: Your worst nite mare come true! I literally work up one morning and found out that I was locked out of the booking I made for my dad with my three kids (all under 15). I could not access my booking on the web, and when I called to enquire, was told amongst others, that the main reason was that the only adult's flight on that booking was changed. Without my permission! Without my knowledge! Without prior checks with me, the person who bought the tickets and who thus is the only party privy to the contract! The customer service officer had the cheek to tell me that they can't speak with me till they verified me. Did they not verify the person who changed the ticket booking? Did they not realise that the amended booking was sent to A completely different email address? Does that indicate that it is a totally Different person calling in to make unauthorised changes? And that the change left 3 underraged kids, one of whom is only 8, on that booking which by definition and policy are not allowed to travel alone? The amended booking removing the Adult ticket resulted in exactly that, yet SIA had the audacity to ask me to pay us$100 per child, per flight sector for each "unaccompanied cHild", ie us$600, when I have absolutely no intention of them being unaccompanied? SIA messed up BIG time. Your ticket purchase is not safe! The secretary you fired, the ex-Girlfriend, ex-hubby can mess up all your bookings without your knowledge, and all SIA will tell you, is that they have stuck to their procedures! Do they not realise that the procedures are outdated and do not protect their customers' interest. In fact, their procedures expose us to unbelievable risks and inconveniences!!! Imagine turning up at the gate only to be told your flight has been cancelled, you you are liable for the cancellation fee, when you did not even initiate the cancellation! FLY AT YOUR OWN RISK!
label: negative

text: Smooth flight with two kids Singapore airlines always makes it easy to travel with kids, this was my first without my partner so I was a little nervous. We were able to board early as travelling with kids (even though they are 7 & 9). We pre ordered kids meals, the best part about this is that they get them first so they are happily eating while the cart serves everyone else. The food was good, chicken lasagna and an assortment of snacks and juice, they even got a second meal of spaghetti bolognaise when we got afternoon tea and amazingly managed to eat it without spilling too much. I forgot to mention that the hosts also very nicely and efficiently request that the passengers travelling in front put their seats up when the kids meal arrived so we have room to move.
label: positive

text: Good service Check in was good, especially as we had golf clubs with us. Premium gave a little more room for stretching out, service was very good, couldn't complain about food or drinks. Had plenty of choice in entertainment.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines from Kansai to Changi Singapore. The seats were soft enough and there were blankets and pillows provided. There was turbulence and sleeping was difficult, and I gave up and watched the TV shows in the inflight entertainment system. Breakfast was served at about 3am in the morning and there were a few passengers who were annoyed at the prospect of dining in the wee hours. Stewardesses moved along the aisles to provide us with juices and water. Music was sufficient and there were loads of albums in the Entertainment system but there wasn't enough games. However, to those who read this review and might think that Singapore Airlines is not up to standard, I am being critical and to be honest, Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines I have ever flown.
label: positive

text: Disappointing Customer Service We were planning a holiday to Paris in Oct 2020 and booked the flights months ago. Now that COVID 19 is an issue and travel insurance wont cover us if we get sick while we are away, we decided to ask if the flight can be moved to 2021 to give this time to blow over and Singapore Airlines would not help. We have flown a few times with Singapore and always liked them but I find it a bit disappointing when you cant travel due to circumstances beyond our control and no one wants to give any assistance. Looks like that is $2500 we will never see again.
label: negative

text: No words to explain how awesome they are....... I watched so many youtube videos and read a lot about this airline. I already knew that this airline and their staff is master in their profession. Tremendous experience. Awesome service. This time I flew for a short trip but for sure next time I will choose them for my long trips as well. They are AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME…….. The staff were charming and never delayed in their services.
label: positive

text: Singapore and return I am 73 years of age and well travelled and the only airline I have never had any complaints about is Singapore Airlines,but let’s face it,Singapore do every thing well,If only the rest of world learned from them!,..!,.?(I have flown economy ,premium economy also)
label: positive

text: Best flight experience ever! I took the new long haul flight on Singapore Airlines from Los Angeles to Singapore then on to Bangkok and back. Check in meal service in-flight entertainment were all superb. The long flight time passed quickly. Singapore Airlines deserves its reputation as the best airline in the world!
label: positive

text: Always a Pleasure! Thank you Singapore Airlines for choosing to send your beautiful new A350-900 to the Adelaide to Singapore route. What a beautiful aircraft. As always, lovely service from your cabin crew. Nothing too much trouble. Seats very comfortable and ample leg room for me. Entertainment system amazing. Food tasty as always. And QUIET. The A350's just purr along. Our delight to fly with you again in all the legs we did around S.E. Asia for our holiday. A special shout out to all your staff who assisted our disabled daughter with advance boarding. Highly respectful and took away any stresses my wife and I had in unfamiliar airports. (Particularly your Hong Kong terminal crew!!!) We'll be back!
label: positive

text: My go-to airline This is the second time I've flown long haul with Singapore Airlines and there are a lot of reasons why I will choose it again over other providers; One: I trust the efficiency of the staff to deal with people with courtesy and good manners, even in economy. Two: they fly from Manchester, which is my closest international airport Three: Singapore Airport is the best airport in the world, no other comes close- it is clean, easy to get around, and offers a big variety of experiences and facilities that aren't all to do with shopping Four: flying from Manchester to Singapore means you get the longest bit of the journey first Five- the journey from Singapore to Melbourne is always the most relaxed and easy- going of any long haul trip I've been on. Six- it's just better than the rest- and I've flown a few!
label: positive

text: Welcome to Business-Class - MA Spoiled it for me! I was actually underwhelmed; the Araliya lounge was small and a bit crowded, on there way out, and on the way in, the Silver Kris lounge was a bit less special than roaming outside, outside where there where massage chairs. And so much more to do. The last Business Class lounge we were in even had rooms that we could have cat-naps in. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I would have expected more from SQ which is a very, very good airline - especially since we were at its home base!
label: positive

text: Review SQ service Most of the airlines serve the same food, similar seating, same layout, similar entertainment system etc etc. Some even better in each segment but It is the personal touch and personalise service you get from SQ that makes it stand out, makes the difference. Safety onboard their aircraft is strict which is what other airlines must learn from. I'm sure I'm safe in their hands from point A to point B. Kudos to Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Great customer service Clean cabin with service almost to full perfection. Staff very concerned of the comfort of the passengers. Meals served when younare ready not just at any time.
label: positive

text: Perth to Singapore in July 2019. Mid-night flight fmainly to see how the 787 compares with the A350. Check-in was smooth save for the issue with them not allowing us to take the travel stroller, which folds into something the size of a briefcase on board as it wasn't in a carry bag? Random thing is 2 previous legs and several other flights with SQ this wasn't an issue but we were told it was a new rule. Odd thing cabin crew never heard of it and 3 days later from SIN-MUC there were no issues with it being taken as hand luggage. Flight boarded late due to a late arrival but some of the time was made up with a near on time arrival. The 787 has a tighter configuration than the A350 regional configuration. This means less seat width and what I perceived as a little less leg room. Plane was spotless. Given the choice I would take the A350 over the 787 as it has it beat in all areas. Crew were more or less going through the motions and a bit robotic. Entertainment options still top, not even with 4 legs flow in the same month did you run out of things to watch. Breakfast served was good with all options available. Of the 4 legs this was probably the most disappointing from SQ, but still an enjoyable flight.
label: positive

text: Worst Service,Staff and 0 customer service Booked a flight from COK-SIN and SIN-LAX both under Singapore airline.COK-SIN flight got delayed by 20-30 minutes and still I reached before boarding time for next flight SIN-LAX.But baggage handling of SIN airline was so pathetic that they refused to shift my luggage to next flight due to insufficient time.I was not allowed to shift/hand carry it myself as well.These idiots gave me a flight after 14 hours later to SIN-LAX.Tried contacting customer care but no to response.Lost my whole day and never flying again on this piece of s—t. Pathetic service and hospitality.
label: negative

text: Travel in style We travelled to New Zealand & stopped over in Singapore for 2 nights. The flight was lovely; attentive stewards. Nothing was too much trouble. I am tall but Economy class was fine for legroom. It was a night flight and we did manage to get some sleep. There was a choice of menu, free drinks & a good choice of recent movies. In fact, the entertainment system was excellent, catering for all ages & genres. I would certainly recommend Singapore Airlines and travel with them again.
label: positive

text: Always the best Always the Best Airlines, good service , Nice and clean planes Staff is Alway Nice and service mindet The Best in the wold. 👍
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines SIA is always my preferred airlines traveling abroad, even though there are direct flights with cheaper fare, i will and always choose SIA. The crew and IFE are awesome. I also love the food on board. During stop over, i love going around changi airport which is the best airport in the world
label: positive

text: Brilliant flight We flew with Singapore Air all the way to Sydney from London. We had a short stop over in Singapore on the way out but flew all the way back with a 55 minute stop, the staff were very attentive, hot towels, food and drink all the way, we flew premium economy which gave us just a little more comfort and space, food choice and bigger screens with noise reduction headphones, we slept most of the way home so they were obviously comfortable, I would highly recommend Singapore Air and would definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Always great service Always well organised, attendants remember requests. On time! My only issue was the passenger next to me was served too many whisky drinks during the flight and was obviously intoxicated as he tried to leave in Melbourne. This didn’t interfere with me directly, but he fell over twice. Given that he probably ordered from different staff it may have been hard to keep track of his consumption but it is something that should be thought about.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy Lacklustre My partner and I were excited to be trying Singapore Airlines, has a good reputation for service. We were lucky to bid for an upgrade from economy to premium economy. Having flown with Virgin Australia and their award winning premium cabin, I assumed, wrongly, it would be similar. Not even close. The seat is bigger, yes. The recline is average. The leg rest and foot rest, offers no support. My foot got trapped between the metal bar foot rest and the leg rest. This was because it does not rise up, simply flops onto the floor. The seat is outdated and clunky. Old push buttons to recline. IFE screen is out of arms reach so you have to move out of the seat to reach it. I was in 31K emergency exit row hence the screen is a pull out version. Movies are limited for the box office western interest. I would have expected far more. The food was economy, you get first choice so no this was no.t worth the upgrade, nor the clunky old seat. Service was poor. I thought it was supposed to be award winning. No drinks offered until after the meal service. I pressed my call bell, watched up to 6 cabin crew walk past us whilst the light was on, until I flagged one down in desperation. Only then I could ask for a drink that wasn’t water or juice. I did complain and the response was to simply press the call bell if I want something. I thought the service was better in premium, it is not. This is what you expect in economy and is far from any premium service I have seen. SIA, look at Virgin Australia’s premium service, dedicated cabin crew, individualised service to each passenger. Not drinks on demand, crew are there to offer any time including a self serve snack area. Do not pay for premium economy until they have come up to the standard of other airlines. The crew were lacklustre on this flight and showed little interest in service for the guests. Disappointing. I had a slightly better experience returning Singapore to Sydney however on approach to landing, our cabin crew member sitting in front of us row 31 aircraft RHS fell asleep. This is the critical period for any emergency and the reason crew are there. Luckily nothing happened and she awoke when we hit the runway.
label: negative

text: Excellent service An early flight from Sydney started in the lounge managed to sleep most of the first leg excellent lounge in Singapore quiet second leg good food, good service, nice beds smallest of downsides was the movie selection but that is because I travel alot so I have seen most.
label: positive

text: Singapore A 380, business My wife and myself first business class from Europe, A380. upper deck. The service, the lounge seats and attention to detail exceeded our expectations. The access form the business lounges in Paris and Singapore to departure gates exceptional. Excellent !!!
label: positive

text: A long, long flight For a 16 hour flight, across the international date line, meals and sleep time was managed perfectly ( business class helped).
label: positive

text: Good service poor legroom Flight SQ235 Why has the airline industry become so cost focused it squeezes people into such small spaces? The estimated 22" seat spacing used for a 14hr flight is hideous. If such tight spacing is used the seats should fixed with no recline. With such tight spacing it is extremely difficult for a person of average western size BN to get in/out of the seat when the person in front reclines the seat. Food ok staff lovely
label: neutral

text: Flying Perth to Narita during covid Extremely unusual time to fly as we needed an exemption to fly out of Australia from the government. We obtained one as working in Tokyo for the year as teachers. The check in procedure does take a lot longer as more paperwork and phone calls are needed to check if you are allowed to travel. The staff were excellent in explaining the procedure as they are working with very few numbers. The flight had 40 people only, so lots of room and yes we had 3 seats each. The service of meals and beverages was done very quickly and efficiently. Changi airport was like a ghost town with most shops closed and all passengers are walked/transported to a transit zone until your next flight is ready. You are then walked in single file or transported to your next flight, so very strange as at times their seemed be more workers in PPE gear than passengers. The steps we went through at Narita were extensive, downloading apps, fill in paperwork and giving a saliva sample to test for covid 19. It took about 2 hours to get through the steps and we only sat down for maybe 10 minutes at the last stop to get back your covid results. The people involved were fantastic and we were lucky that we were numbers two and three in the initial first line up, but still over 2 hours it took so be aware. We knew we were quick as the people picking us up told us we were first out.
label: positive

text: Best airline The most comfortable flight, 13 hours and felt good at the end. In flight service excellent and the food very good.
label: positive

text: A380 Fligt from Singapore to Shanghai Travelled from Singapore to Shanghai on 8 Sep'19, on SQ830. Boarding was early and orderly. The A380 Economy Class was full. Flight was stable and smooth all the way. Service was good. Was entertained with in-flight movies all the way. Did not encounter any problems. Would recommend travellers to fly by A380.
label: positive

text: Awesome service - comfortable flight Great airline to travel with. The airbus 380 flew as smooth as silk with only a few bumps. The crew really do give the impression that they want you to travel well and in comfort and are very attentive.
label: positive

text: Bad booking system. They wanted us to pay alot. The planes ticket were oversold even when we paid for a reserved seat. Water leaked for the ceiling too. The worse thing is they told us they are gonna give us a free upgrade but we have to fly on a different day and we still had to pay the premium economy instead of not paying because we already payed.
label: negative

text: Shame about the new business class configuration I recently flew to Singapore from Zurich. I used to do this flight quite often in the A380. In this flight they have re configured the seats replacing the big manual seats for modern electric ones. Now here is a perfect example of changing something just for the sake of changing. The previous seats folded down into a spacious bed. Ok you had to do it manually but honestly nobody minded doing this and the crew was always very helpful to make the bed when needed. To my huge disappointment they have now put some standard seats. They are small and your feet don't fit. I am an average man, height 180, shoe size 44 EUR and weight 80 kgs. Neither big nor small. My feet fit but there is insufficient space to fit. What a shame SQ has made this change!
label: neutral

text: Unimpressed We followed their instructions and printed our check in and boarding passes but this was a complete waste of time and paper as we had to do self boarding passes when at Heathrow. Flight took off 40 minutes late. It was very hot but no drinks were offered until the meal. The air vent controls were well out of reach when sitting. I printed a copy of Singapore airport as the airline couldn't tell us what terminal we were landing at Singapore for transfer to Darwin. Breakfast was served, after the usual sleep period,at mid afternoon local time. The transfer at Singapore, only 2 hours, was ok. another meal was served almost immediately on our leg to Darwin-very similar to the one we had before. Both planes were very clean and the attendants quietly efficient.
label: positive

text: First time we flew Singapore Airlines Business Class from Singapore to Sydney and return. Outbound boarding was on time. But soon after pushed back, the aircraft returned to its parking position due to electrical problem, resulting in one hour delay. Upon took-off all passengers who sat in business class asked the cabin crew to convert our seats to bed mode because it was an after midnight flight. We slept for about 5 hours and were woken up by the FA for breakfast, whereas our daughter was left sleep until half an hour before landing in Sydney. The meals were tasty and glasses were filled up frequently. FA were friendly, except one stewardess looked not so interested in serving us. We landed in Sydney only 20 minutes behind schedule. Inbound flight : Check in process went very fast and served by a friendly ground staff. Boarding was also on time. The cabin crew were friendlier compared with their compatriots in our outbound flight. However, we couldn't sleep/rest due to turbulence weather which we experienced almost the entire journey. All in all we really enjoyed our business class experience with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: On Time This is the late flight from Colombo...12.45am. What a crazy time! Plane was on time and full, even with the current Corona virus scare. Plane was spotless, service of the expected high order but the supper did nothing for me. I chose not to eat.... it’s a short flight.
label: positive

text: Excellent service and flights on Singapore Airlines. Our flight with Singapore Airlines departed on time, arrived on time into Singapore with a 50 min transit, to change to flight SQ 306, to continue through to London. Every facet of our travel (check-in confirmation, baggage check-in, travel, all meals, flight x2, to picking up our 4 suitcases was without any issues arising) with the airline was smooth without any issues. All staff were excellent and dealt with full flights with the 1st flight on an Airbus A350, with the 2nd flight on a Boeing 777-300, that arrived about 30 min's early into Heathrow. Would we ever travel with another airline our of Australia. the easy answer is, 'NO'.
label: positive

text: Premium economy depends where seat is On a long overnight flight to London our premium economy seats were in the back row of the section. We were separated from economy by a flimsy partition wall and ineffectual curtain. Directly behind us were 2 crying babies. I felt very sorry for the parents and I know it can't be helped but I think the divider should be more solid sound barrier. Also when seats in front were reclined it was almost impossible for me to get out. I was very disappointed in this- my first experience in premium economy. And it was very expensive.
label: neutral

text: Gluten free meals My husband and I flew to Singapore and the GF meals were excellent. We have flown a lot and always received GF meals that were tasteless. Well done to Singapore Air for providing excellent meals
label: positive

text: Always same food without vegetarian option I do not find the business class service as good as I was expected. As a vegetarian, each time we are offered to start with satay meat and if duly requested for vegetarian option, then some other not good vegetarian meal (I am always said that I should ask in advance). in 2020, they should offer per default a vegetarian option. During the night, we can stay hours without service.
label: neutral

text: Scammers Copy Singapore Airlines @SingaporeAir We have been scammed by a website that has cloned Singapore Airlines website & inserted a scam number 02034816921 and taken payment for two flights LHR to CHANGI on the 22/12/2022 supposedly returning on the 9/1/2022 How can Singapore Airline security allow this ?
label: negative

text: 5 STAR CUSTOMER SERVICE, AWARD WINNING FLIGHTS Easy to contact Customer Services with queries, and received a phone call from them to organise extra leg room seats (amazing!). Check in for both flights quick, no queues and friendly staff. All on time, and landed earlier on both flights. On board staff were exceptional - attentive and welcoming, and nothing too much trouble. the best airline food we have ever had. Even arranged an anniversary cake with champagne for our return flight home. Entertainment on board was varied and easy to navigate. Toilets immaculate at all times. No wonder they won Airline of the Year. Virgin and BA could learn a lot. Awesome!
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Singapore. I have for the second time in 2 years lost my baggage. This time I arrived last night and my baggage never appeared on the carousel. I went to report it missing to be told that I didn't check in any baggage. I flew with two fellow workers who verified that I did (not sure why they didn't believe me) and I left my details. After numerous calls in the morning, I was told my baggage had turned up on another carousel at T3, and they would call me when it was being delivered. That was early this morning, it is now 4.30pm and I cannot get though to the "hot line" to check if they could give me an approximate time, no joy there either. Shocking service, for an airline that's talks up its service mantra. I travel constantly and if I wasn't coming home I would have been stranded..
label: negative

text: One of the best in the world !! We travelled after a long time with Singapore Airlines. We had great experience flying with them. The check-in was very smooth. The boarding was very orderly in spite of A380 aircraft. The seats were very comfortable. On board service was excellent. The staff was very courteous. I could not try any drinks or food as it was a mid night flight and I had already finished my dinner at airport. Worth flying.
label: positive

text: really good really good but the best one was the cleanliness. it was so good that i even asked a man that i did not know how many stars was it rated u should fly it.
label: positive

text: Very nice flight Pretty comfortable seats, decent food and wonderful service. The flight crew was great. It was my first time flying with this airline and I can see why it is rated well.
label: positive

text: LHR-SIN and return on A380. Flight from LHR was on time and all expected services on board. Economy seat in the main cabin on this leg of the flight was reasonable but a little cramped when compared to other airlines. Meal and beverage service was ok but ran out of choice for meal. Entertainment service was excellent. On the return leg with seat in upper deck felt slightly less cramped but seats not the most comfortable for long haul flight. Meal and beverage service was good. Entertainment system was ok programming constantly jerked and froze but was viewable. The disappointment with the flights was the baggage allowance which was small at 20kg when compared with other airlines which offer 32kg.
label: negative

text: Great food, great crew and spacious aircraft So far the best airline I've flown with. Great food, cabin crews really taking well of the passengers and the seats are not tight - it has more leg room compared to other airlines I have flown with.
label: positive

text: Very very poor customers service Land in Singapore for our connecting flight to Sydney. Told our flight was leaving from gate a10. Get there told no they have closed the flight. Need to go all the way back and rebook new tickets. So do that then have to head all the way back to do that. Get new boarding passes and have to go all the way back to A14. The. Sitting there for about 30 mins and thought I might check my app. Which actually said we were leaving from gate B10. The total opposite end of the airport. No announcements or anything. Zero stars from me if I could give it, and totally put the both of us ever using Singapore airlines, or even setting foot in Singapore ever again 😡😡
label: negative

text: Excellent I travelled withy family from Mumbai to Singapore, both ways through Singapore airlines. It turned out to be a great experience. We had smooth travel. Staff is very friendly, warm and approachable. They love their job and it's seen from their services. The carrier was very comfortable. Food was good and well presented. Felt pampered with few freebies and the jovial nature of the staff on our return journey to Mumbai. We also conveyed our appreciation for the staff on their official email.
label: positive

text: SQ469 Colombo to Singapore on Feb 10th. Back with them after almost 4 years I had again a positive experience despite the terrible schedule out of CMB (leaving at 1.30am): brand new A330-300 great and attentive crew and entertainment system displayed on a big PTV. During my previous experience with them I remember the seats were more comfortable and softer on their B777 but the legroom is still far above average for economy and service outstanding. Arrival to Changi on time and out of the terminal in less than half an hour really a fantastic airport in terms of facilities and organization.
label: positive

text: Awesome entertainment system and experience. It was a great experience flying with Singapore Airlines. It had a great entertaining system. I had watched Captain Marvel and Shazam! The crew members were kind and helpful. The food there in the flight was ok but not awesome. The boarding call was really fast so we did not have the time to be in the line before another pair of seat numbers were called.
label: positive

text: Bad service AND expensive Flight SQ860 6th June 2018, Flight Stewardess in Green uniform tended to the person next to me and then went on to tend to person behind me during lunch, completely left me out and I had to wait for the lunch cart to come and I could order via another Stewardess in blue. Racist because person next to me and behind me was white, RACIST AIRLINE AGAINST OWN NATIONALITY! Avoid like the plague
label: negative

text: Best long haul flight I was super impressed on my flight and would always choose Singapore airlines again if I can. On boarding everyone received a warm refreshing towel, a great start. The food service was straight after takeoff- tasty food and gold drink selection. Menu in seat pocket was nice to pre choose and service was efficient, the staff are so friendly and helpful. When the lights dimmed for evening staff walked around the cabin very regularly with water and juice, I was so grateful for this as I was super thirsty. The bathrooms are the nicest I’ve flown economy in, roomy, nice lighting around the mirror. Face masks, mouth wash, toothbrushes and toothpaste available. I hope to fly with them soon!
label: positive

text: Another excellent Singapore airlines flight An excellent flight both out and back. I had an accident whilst in Texas (total hip replacement) and the airline couldn't have been more accommodating by providing wheelchairs at both airports and finding me a seat with extra legroom for the flight home.
label: positive

text: In flight condition is getting poorer The boarding process is getting unbearable with poor coordination. certain boarding groups are extremely long while some are short. The in flight entertainment is not in good condition with certain movies having flickering screen. This is not happening in this flight but experienced the same in a couple of flights on singapore airlines already. However the flight is still on time which is very important. There is a need to tidy up on in flight entertainment before losing its reputable status. Other than this everything is good.
label: positive

text: Terrible Customer Service. Think twice. My boyfriend and I choose to fly with Singapore Airlines for a trip to Japan this year after having a great experience last year. We have encountered various issues in trying to acquire a refund since travel has been banned to Japan due to the pandemic. First, we spent over an hour on hold and we’re charged over $100 in international phone charges without having our issue resolved by customer service. Next, we tried using the online portal to request a refund and never hear back even though our trip was supposed to have started earlier in the month. Finally, we reached out to them on Facebook messenger. We needed update our payment information since we have been issued a new card since we originally booked our flight a year ago. We explained our issue to the representative and they said we needed to send messages in smaller question since they didn’t understand English. Next they told us we needed to get a letter from our bank and file and appeal in order to update the payment information for the refund. They also said it would take them a while to send me the form so I could not get started. This process has taken place over the course of three months and we have yet to receive a refund. While we enjoyed our flight last year, the atrocious customer service will definitely make us think twice before booking with Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: wonderful experience well i happen to travel business in their A380 plane and wow how well plannes they have made the seats far better than Lufthansa and also Emirates also where i have traveled in 380 also and far more luxurious and spacious > the service was good expected more as i had traveled earlier also and the service and food was better but still no complaints for this time > not a long flight but really comfortable
label: positive

text: A strategy to force paying for seats?? This review is to highlight a possibly planned strategy by SIA to force economy class travelers to pay for their seats. The rating given here in no way reflects the level of service provided by SIA which I consider to be excellent and by far superior to most other airlines. When I booked tickets for my wife and myself I opted out paying for 'preferred' seats as we were more than happy for the airline to allocate the seats for us assuming (which I consider not unreasonable) that both of us will be give adjacent seats. We were in fact allocated adjacent seats on all other sectors but on this flight where my wife was allocated 53E and I was allocated 55G. This allocation was done well ahead of our departure date and I noticed it when I tried to do an online check in. On the day of travel, at the check in counter I was told that since I did not pay for 'preferred' seating SIA cannot guarantee adjacent seats although it was a single booking. I was told that at the gate they will have to ask other travelers to see whether anyone can do a swap so that we can get adjacent seats. I told the duty manager that I assumed that airlines will try to allocate adjacent seats even though I had not requested and paid for 'preferred' seats. The duty manager was obviously not interested in offering any help. At the gate, I was told that they were able to get two seats on the same row but not adjacent ones and we were allocated 55C and 55G. The airline had 3x3x3 seat configuration thus, ABC EFG IJK which meant my wife was allocated seat C then two others and then myself. The gate staff also mentioned that AB and EF are allocated to one family and they would try to see whether they are willing to swap. The family of four was asked the question but they did not understand what the request was and they refused the request. However, once inside the aircraft, the lady understood the problem and kindly agreed to the swap - thanks, fellow traveler! This makes me believe that SIA makes no attempt at all to allocate adjacent seats for those who are on a single booking - not only we were allocated seats randomly, the family of four (one adult and three small children) were allocated disjointed seating. (I presume they would have been on a single booking as well). The aircraft was not 100% full. In fact, the seat initially allocated to my wife, 53C remained vacant and there were few other seats unoccupied during this flight. This makes me think that this is a calculated strategy by SIA to force those who do not pay for seats to reconsider paying for them when booking new flights specially after being bitten by such episodes. If that is the case, it is a very poor deal by SIA. If my assumption is wrong, then obviously, SIA's seat allocation algorithms are good for nothing. Either way, it reflects very poorly of SIA's claim to be able to listen and meet customers' needs.
label: negative

text: Superb experience First time on a 380 and was not disappointed there was lots of room and seats comfortable even had a foot rest which was a bonus. Staff greeted us with a smile which remained with them throughout a 14 hour flight. Food ok for airline food but on our return journey on 318 the food was not so good, selection appalling and very little choice as they ran out - I am not vegetarian but there were no vegetarian meals left so gather people went without food. Overall good service.
label: positive

text: One of the world's best airlines One of the very best economy class flights that I've been on. I flew from Balikpapan (BPN) to Beijing (PEK), with a 3.5 hour layover and change of planes in Singapore. The food was very good, and excellent by average economy class standards. The service was marvelous. Only good things to say about this trip experience.
label: positive

text: Truly service, elevated. Almost every step of the way, the customer and service were at the forefront. I won't comment much about the food, but it was acceptable. Cleanliness was also prioritised. The real gems are the well trained crew all around. From ticketing to ground to sky. For such a huge airline there are bound to be misses but most are above average and class leading, and this is something other airlines would struggle to achieve. Well done and they deserve all the accommodates for the work the management has put into making the airlines experience an elevated one.
label: positive

text: First experience on Premium Economy Interesting experience on premium economy. More space and definitely more comfortable with the extra leg rest that props up. The noise cancelling headphones were really good also to cancel out the constant noise on the plane. Food was alright, not extraordinary great. Service was normal too.
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Singapore. My first time flying with Singapore Airlines - check in on-time and no queue at all. The ground service I was satisfied with. The aircraft was nice and the seat very comfortable. The inflight entertaiment was not that good and the earphones were also poor. The food is standard, but compared to Garuda or Emirates it is not as good. The cabin crew not that nice - no smile, just a straight face.
label: positive

text: Mrs The best airline in the world . The cabin crew are so polite , helpful, nothing is to much trouble. 100% would recommend this airline
label: positive

text: Not as friendly Very disappointed with the check in service counter which are not being helpful especially the supervisor on that day 11-11-2019. He was not friendly at all, may be that's the way he supposed to perform in front of the other employees to show that he is the boss!
label: neutral

text: Brilliant Service The Airbus 350 was excellent and in economy I had plenty leg room with TV in the seat back, charging point for my phone, internet access if you paid. So much to watch. From the moment I boarded to leaving the service and attitude of staff was fantastic.
label: positive

text: Services were really below average, food was really not enough (starvation during the flight) and awful The flight attendants were average to bad. The flight was not seriously late. (half to an hour late) Food and drink are awful. The mashy stir fried chicken noodle breakfast was definitely the worst noodle I had. The dinner was chicken and pasta.OMG, the pasta was just boiled; not enough gravy for chicken & pasta.
label: negative

text: Flight attendants not always attentive to passengers I flew Singapore Airlines for several flights in December. Most of the time, the service was good, but on my flight from SIN to SFO, the flight attendants’ service went down over the course of the flight. I’m averse to seafood so I did not eat the smoked salmon or shrimp salad appetizers. The flight attendant serving me starting acting more judgy after that, saying, “I guess you’re not gonna eat this” while taking away the appetizer and giving me the main dish. Also, for the shrimp salad appetizer I was never given the bread supposed to come with it. After the main meal I wasn’t given the snack (grapes and cheese) or the dessert, until I asked for the dessert. My dishes also weren’t taken away within an hour unless I pressed the person button thing. That bothered me because I wanted to rest and I couldn’t clear my table and put the tray away unless I asked. The flight attendants on that trip, two of them didn’t provide the best service and did the bare minimum so that they could go back to talking with the other flight attendants. I’m sure other passengers needed service too, but instead of working, the flight attendants talked during most of the flight for an hour or more to each other. However, other cabin crews in my experience on Singapore Airlines were better and less gossipy and chit chatty during the flight.
label: neutral

text: Nice planes, bad customer service. Nice planes and staff. Travel from CPH to CEB. Our luggage was missing, and when we receive it after 2 days, 2 suitcases was destroyed. We complain, but still not hear anything. That was in December. Thats why I give it only 2 out of 5. Bad customer service.
label: negative

text: Singapore - Zurich and return. On the A380 with all business class seating on the upper deck. Overall a very good trip. Departure from SIN is scheduled very late (01.30) so I had no problem getting off to several hours sleep at that time of the morning. Coming back is a daytime flight which I personally find more tiring. Anyway the product remains a solid one. The service was very good. Food and drinks all fine. Still think the IFE system is showing its age compared to say Emirates but quite OK and had no problem finding a few movies to watch on the daytime return flight. My complaints remain the same as ever. The business class seat is plain weird and for taller types like me the diagonal sleeping position is only just long enough. In addition SQ start to look expensive compared to the Gulf carriers for the route I was travelling (SIN-ZRH-NCE) by a couple of thousand S$ which is substantial.
label: positive

text: This airline is truly the best This airline makes every flight a pleasant experience. Right from check-in through to boarding the whole process is smooth and no fuss. I have been travelling with Singapore Airlines for years, but do also use other airlines, however only this one makes me feel like I am home when I get on board. The crew are very attentive but not over bearing and my kids love the attention. There are simply no words to fully describe the vast quality gap between SIA service and that of other international airlines. Lots of reviews will say someone else got better seats, or better food or whatever, but SIA really is like being in your own home.
label: positive

text: Awesome I used to travel with Thai airways to BKK but now I choose Singapore Airline. I love this airline the cleanliness, the service and the food are the best. The hospitality of their cabin crew is outstanding. No wonder they win many award as the the best airline in the world. Will definitely use this airline in the future.
label: positive

text: Subpar I have been flying Singapore Airlines for more than two decades, and this airline has always performed leaps and bounds above other airlines in terms of its service and efficiency. Whether for business or personal travel, I've always looked forward to my SIA flights despite the long journey from the US to Southeast Asia. The last two times that I have flown on SIA however, I feel as though the service and the quality of its offering has not measured up to the accolades that they have received over the years. Perhaps complacency has set in and SIA is now resting on its laurels? On my last flight, I was traveling with my spouse. We were attending a wedding and therefore had to carry on formalwear. SIA did not accommodate our request to hang our garments, and instead, told us to stash our tuxedo and dress in an overhead bin. This resulted in a lot of headaches when we arrived at our destination. Furthermore, the meals that we were served throughout the flight were frankly atrocious. For an airline that has often been ranked "#1 in the world", we expected better, and had been served better food on other international long-haul flights. Additionally, the availability of meal options was extremely poor - they ran out of the meal selection that we wanted, and we were given cold sandwiches and chips instead. To be frank, the sandwiches were more palatable than the "gourmet" options that were presented to us rather stylishly on a fancy-looking menu. When the flight attendants noticed that we were not eating, they did try to address the situation, but aside from the sandwich and the bag of chips, we received instead a lecture about ordering our meal ahead of time, "next time”, which I’m not sure is a standard practice for travelers without special dietary requirements. It felt more like they were shifting the blame onto us. I'm not certain if there is going to be a “next time” either, because while Singapore Airlines used to be the carrier of choice for us while flying for business/leisure to Southeast Asia, there are other reputable, high-quality options available now. We have flown Eva before (had a wonderful experience) and we have heard rave reviews regarding Korean Air from our fellow travelers arriving in Southeast Asia. All in all, a rather disappointing experience for a usually-reliable airline. I would say that our most recent trip was an isolated case, but we've noticed a palpable decline in the quality that we have come to expect of SIA.
label: neutral

text: Unfortunately Low-Cost Behavior I bought a round-trip ticket with my family from Dubai to Japan via Singapore Airlines with Singapore Airlines. I have Elite Plus status in Star Alliance. He canceled flight SQ496, which would depart at 01:15AM on the return leg, and offered us flight SQ494, which would depart at 15:10. Our transit time in Singapore increased from 2 hours to 16 hours. We requested a hotel in our correspondence with Singapore Airlines regarding this matter. Our request was rejected and we were told that we could return the ticket or sleep in the lounge. It is not easy to cancel the ticket. Because we paid all the hotel fees in Japan. The suggestion that we could sleep in the Lounge with Star Alliance Elite Plus status was a very simple suggestion indeed.
label: negative

text: Excellent flying experience: CCU-SIN As usual, another very good flying experience. Pros: 1. Very good service by cabin crews 2. Good food quality and beverage options..special meals available and provided the earliest 3. Immigration and baggage collection is the fastest (maybe in the world) due to Changi airport...bag always comes before reaching to belt after immigration in Singapore Con: In-flight entertainment options could be better and LCD screen quality could be better. Otherwise no such cons..
label: positive

text: a great way to fly!!! the service & attention that was given to my wife & I, on this flight was absolutely the best, even though this flight was almost full in business class, on the a380, you would not know it, the service ran like clockwork, one on one, very personal & attentive, S A are a class airline & certainly value for money, with out doubt. a special mention to fss karnsita & fss raphaella , who went over & above to make sure we had the best of everything. 100% S A , you remain our choice of carriers.
label: positive

text: The excellence airline Singapore airline services are excellent, start from greetings, check in, at their lounge, during the flight until the baggage claim. Everything leaves you the great impression and experience.
label: positive

text: Lovely friendly staff It was a great flight. We were lucky to have the sears behind a bulk head so had lots of leg room. On our return trip not so fortunate & sandwiched like sardines. The crew were fantastic & nothing was an issue. Food & beverages were lovely.
label: positive

text: Excellent from Singapore Airlines Great flight on the new Airbus 380, very smooth and comfortable. Service is slick with a very efficient crew who make you feel welcome. On Board entertainment is good with a wide selection of entertainment to help pass the time away. Food is good and comprehensive enough to ensure you don't go either hungry or thirsty. Choice for both Asian or European dishes being served. Plenty of luggage allowance with options to pre book you seat should you wish to. All in all Singapore airlines are good and come recommended.
label: positive

text: Nice for family travel or with children Everything is recommendable, we travel with young children and got to board first. Kids meal and toys for them. Snacks and drinks to keep us hydrated. The only thing is their sounds system tend to have some problems we experienced only sound for 1 side of the headset instead of both for both ways of flight.
label: positive

text: everything in order but something missing large aircraft, great crew, decent enough food. Entertainment was not good and the controls were not comfrrtable. Seat too was ok but not really comfy. Its also upsetting when you are the first to check in online and you get only a small handful of middle seats to choose. Thats unfair.
label: positive

text: IFE not working The short trip of slightly over 2 hrs was marred by the IFE (In Flight Entertainment) not been able to work after a few minutes of flight duration. Every attempt by the staff to get it up and running by rebooting the system failed. Fortunately it was just a short trip. Imagine if this happened on longer duration flights. Also as this is an old plane model 777-200 and upgrading doesn’t make sense, the screen was a let down as compare to newer ones on new aircraft types. Hope SIA quickly replace this with the Boeing 787 or Airbus 350. Overall service crew of SIA are impeccable.
label: positive

text: Most Enjoyable flight Allways a great experience flying with Singapore airlines. The staff were extremely helpfull as upond looking for our seat my Husband and I discovered we had been separated for seating. A airhostest was unable to help us as the plane was fully booked, she came back to us after the plane and taken off and appoligised and the gave us special treatment with giving us first option for lunch service and other special help throught out the flight. The seating was very comfortable and the entertainment as well. I would certainly fly again with Singpore airlines.
label: positive

text: great experience friendly flight attendants, comfortable seating and plenty of room, great food, great film selection, would definitely fly again.
label: positive

text: Best to oz along with the mid east airlines I have flown 10 times back and forth from the uk to australia with singapore airlines and they are always the no 1 choice to go economy with. Especially on their newer A380 where the legroom in economy is good even for me at 186cm. Second choice is qatar or etihad via mid east. Prefer singapore airport though as so spacious and lots to do. Food and service always great with singapore too.
label: positive

text: Long haul tolerable This was a 13 hour flight and knowing what a reasonable flight we had coming out we were not looking forward to the home flight. Crew were lovely and the plane was clean, but the meals were awful. Semi- scrambled egg and ratatouille for breakfast??? Seats were usual economy cramped but that’s only to be expected. Entertainment was excellent with a lot of new films, tv shows and good music
label: positive

text: flights from Wellington to Perth We flew to Perth stopping over at Melbourne, both flights were great, meals lovely and staff were good. The seats were comfortable and the in house service was fine, no complaints at all. We booked on Webjet early in the year and got a fantastic fare to Perth from Wellington, NZ, $186 per person one way!!!!
label: positive

text: Good, could be better It seems a lot to pay for some extra legroom and further layback, some noise cancelling headphones and the chance to chose your meals, but when you walk through cattle class to use the toilet, it all seems worthwhile. On the negative side, you have to use the economy toilets, which means a bit of a trek down the aisle dodging flight crew; you also have pretty close proximity to crying littlies in the front row of economy, which can be only a metre or two away. The noise cancelling headphones are a boon though for cutting unwanted noise. Even though its a bit pricey, we won't be flying economy again - I think Singapore could do this better, but it is a definite improvement over being cramped into the tiny seats further aft.
label: positive

text: Dishonest and incompetant I had trouble right from the free online 48 hour check in phase. I selected seats and was rejected. So I rang and eventually spoke to someone who told me that I would have to pay to make these seat selections because I had already made selections. He would not accept that I had not made any previous selections and would not answer my question of why I would have to pay in the free 48 hour window. I told him that I did not want the seats that had somehow already been allocated to me - he then stated that the flight was full and no changes were possible. I asked to speak to his supervisor. She then stated that airline policy is to allocate seats 72 hours before departure. I then asked what was the point of the free 48 hour seat allocation process which is on the airline's website? No answer. She finally agreed to send an email to some other department asking whether my wife could be seated in the aisle seat in front of me rather than next to me, because we both wanted aisle seats on a long (15 hour) flight. No mention of the flight being full. She promised that I would receive a response that evening. Later, I received an email showing only me on the flight - my wife's booking had disappeared. I rang again, and was promised that she would be somewhere on the plane, but not necessarily near me. I stated that that was not good enough and that we wanted isle seats with her in front of me. Again later that night, I received an email stating that she was now seated in an isle seat in front of me which is what we had requested. All good finally? NO. We got to the airport next morning, got our seat allocation tickets and my wife's seat was back next to me, not on the isle as stated. We asked whether this could be changed and were told all seats had been filled, including the promised seat in front of me. So we had been lied to both verbally and by email. We then experienced the worst cabin service possible on the flight. We were second from the back and for some reason, were ignored when meals and liquid refreshments were issued. The cabin service seemed to start from in front of us. Eventually, we had to ask for the food and drinks that others had already received. The meals, once we had finally got them, were reasonable. That could not be said for the meals on the return flight from Vancouver to Singapore, then Singapore to Australia. They were almost inedible - mainly baked beans, some type of powdered egg and formed chicken which were barely even warm. We were told on both legs that they had run out of the popular meals, so we got what was left. If we had not been so hungry, we would have returned the meals. In addition, no drinks were served for the first 2 hours of the Singapore leg - again we had to ask for water. I also found food scraps on my fold up table, from the previous flight. There was also a food stain on the seat. It did raise questions about whether the area had been cleaned after the end of the previous flight - it was definitely a health regulation breach. So it seems to us that Singapore Airlines are trying to do things cheaply by reducing service and food quality levels, and quite prepared to mislead customers over seat allocation procedures when queried. They used to be our preferred airline, but given our experiences on this return flight, we will never fly with them again. We would urge anyone thinking of booking with them to try another airline. They were once a reliable and quality brand, but we could not say that about them now.
label: negative

text: Food not good Was not that impressed with Singapore airlines The crew were brilliant, Poor food quality, entertainment was a bit out of date, On the flight from Singapore to Brisbane we had no entertainment as the screen was not working. We would not fly with Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Fantastic 1st class The experience of flying 1st class with Singapore on their A380 suite exceeded my expectations. The suites are spacious,the champagne, wine and food fantastic. The staff were friendly and met our every need. It ticked all the boxes on my bucket list. It was well worth it.
label: positive

text: Friendly, professional - One of the best Dad flew by Singapore Airlines, he is 75+, the flight was comfortable, staff at the airline office, airport and in the aircraft were friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text: Once again a very good experience on Singapore Airlines I last wrote about Singapore Airlines in July 2017. The good experience continues. I am happy to note this consistency. The 2017 travel was for my company work, this one (today) was on my own. While they are still good but I could not see anything great. The aircraft was good and new. Food was good too.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines ranged from excellent to good. Syd-Sin-Cph (Oct 6, 2022) was excellent. Of course in Economy we were packed like sardines, but the tin was large enough (and neighbours small enough) that we weren't particularly uncomfortable. This is the third time we've flown post-Covid. The first time on Thai it seemed that Covid was the excuse to give no service at all but Singapore Airlines both at Xmas 2021 and last month provides excellent service. Food was very good and alcohol plentiful. The entertainment system provided enough to occupy us for this long haul. Flight attendants were very attentive. We stopped over in Singapore on our way home. Unfortunately Sin-Syd leaves shortly after midnight. The flight was delayed and it was after 1am before we left. This is a long time between meals and we were uncertain whether we'd be given a snack and night cap before going to sleep but no announcement was made and we stayed in limbo between sleeping and waking for most of this leg. Of the four legs of our journey this is our only complaint.
label: positive

text: The best airline Singapore airlines is the best - from checkin to the inflight service, the flat beds in business class, everything is always perfect. They have good vegetarian options and that is a relief on long haul flights.
label: positive

text: There is no way better to fly as with Singapore Airlines It was my 18th flight from Berlin-Zurich-Singapore-Melbourne/Sydney-Singapore-Munich-Berlin. And my first flights in Premium Economy from ZUR-SIN-MEL-/SYD-SIN and I was so happy and lucky with all my flights with Singapore Airlines. In Premium Eco. You have more legroom, bigger screens, 3 options for oder a meal for Lunch/Breakfast or Dinner. A bwater bottle on your suit. And the suits are most comfort for this premium eco. class for sleep on long flights. So was very happy to enjoy the flights. And of course the Crew Members are so helpful in every service on board and very friendly.
label: positive
